Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_Traveller28
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in March 2012. It was literally steps away from all of the buzz of Times Square and the theater district. We booked this hotel using a travel deal at the rate of $199 USD/night which I found to be a very good price for the area. When we arrived late (1 AM) they upgraded us to a suite on the Premier side of the hotel (nice bonus!). Despite the proximity to all of the noise, we found it quiet in our room and managed to get great nights of sleep. We took full advantage of their complimentary continental breakfast each morning (7-10AM) and free wifi in the hotel. I found the room a little on the small side, but given it's location, we barely spent any time in the room. After we checked out, the hotel was fine with us storing our luggage for nearly 7 hours. All in all - I thought this hotel was excellent value for your money and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “excllent location”
Reviews.Author: lizdavies
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I stayed here for 4 nights from 22nd - 26th March. Hotel was in a perfect location, we had a higher floor which had great views in all directions & that is impressive in New York! Rooms were a good size, really comfortable beds & although the furnishings & carpets etc. might benefit from refurbishment, I really have no complaints. Staff were very knowledegable & helpful & everywhere was easy to get to from here. It was quite quiet at night considering where you were. Check in was quick & uncomplicated. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. If you stay here try the Un Deux Trois restaurant down the road, it has fabulous food & is like being in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: dmgehring
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights in March for a conference. We arrived at noon and were immediately able to check into our room. The room itself was on the 51st floor and was very nice and quite large. Great views. We also had excellent service from the bellmen. They were very helpful and friendly. The only downside is that we sometimes had a long wait for the elevators. The location can't be beat if you want to be in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but . . .”
Reviews.Author: nagoyafrog
Reviews.Content: If you want a decent hotel with a great Times Square location at a reasonable price, this hotel is okay but you can probably do better. We liked the tremendous views of the Chrysler bldg (east) & Times Square (west) from a corner room. The room was roomy for mid-town with a good bed & bathroom. Elevators were speedy. I did not like the impersonal conference-style scale of the hotel but staff were always helpful. Tried to check-in at 3:30 but had to wait until 4pm before the room was ready (could not find the offical check-in time on the home page either). Breakfast & wi-fi are extras here. Overall, not bad but not so good either.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: GinneySue1
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here in February. The location, just steps away from Times Square, provided a perfect home base for our weekend in NYC. We had tickets to a Broadway show, and enjoyed many of the city's attractions, most within hearty walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Serviceable”
Reviews.Author: winnie a
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights in March. The hotel is in need of some repair. My room was good and quiet. Staff was helpful. It is a convention hotel and is very busy. Room was clean. Not a special place but definitely central.

Reviews.Title: “Right on times square”
Reviews.Author: s22urf
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, quiet comfortable rooms. Quick and easy check in and out. No complaints Other than the lack of beverage making facility in room

Reviews.Title: “Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: Kristofur
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this hotel. Originally was scheduled for a King room on a high floor, but when I arrived I asked for a lower floor and was given a 2nd floor Queen in The Premier section right next to the elevator. I never heard a sound outside my door for the 4 days I was there. The room and bath were done in an Art Deco decor that needed a bit of updating. But the bed and pillows (4) were comfortable. USA today was delivered on the weekdays. One storey below we had breakfast every morning consisting of hot and cold cereals, danish, yogurt, bagels, bread, cut up fruit, coffee, individual tea bags, whole milk, 1/2 and 1/2 and skim. Also free were hors d'ouvres between 5 and 7...roast beef, turkey, cheeses, nuts, pickles, soda and alcohol. We had a problem with Housekeeping in that no one came to redo our room one day. Thereafter, we called every day as we were going out to make sure someone came. Some of the TV movies had no sound, and were taken off my bill, when I asked for a refund. We also found the elevator key to be a bit of a problem. The hotel is located in Times Square, so there were plenty of restaurants nearby, but the hotel also had a restaurant with good food, and a bit pricey. All in all, I would return to this hotel the next time I'm in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Ick!”
Reviews.Author: Vivi28
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the choice of a conference I was attending and as soon as I walked into the room, I walked right back out again. The lobby was dark and dingy, the carpets throughout (including the elevators) were frayed and dirty, and the walls were scuffed. Very little care has been given to upkeep here. The room I was given had dirty pillows, a filthy mattress (think hair and STAINS) and the entire room smelled like someone had just recently been smoking in it. The bathroom walls were stained too. If you're looking to save money and you don't care about dirt, uh, this place would be fine. I went down the street to the Marriott Marquis. I paid about $60 more a night but it was well worth it! I will say that the staff was friendly and they didn't charge me for leaving or give me any trouble about it and I appreciated that very much. If they're cleaning staff was as good as their front desk staff, I might have stayed. Would never go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: kez066
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent you step out of the hotel and within in a minute you are in Times Square. The concierge and reception staff are very polite and helpful although the hotel itself needs updating. My room although very spacious and clean was on the 16th floor and the plumbing and air conditioning noise was so loud that without ear plugs I wouldnt have been able to sleep and although we had booked 3 non smoking rooms my brother was put in a smoking room on the 29th floor which smelled of stale cigarette smoke. I would stay in the hotel again but only if I was allocated a quiter room,

Reviews.Title: “What Millennium are you in? This hotel is a decade past due!”
Reviews.Author: QuakernJayhawk
Reviews.Content: Poorly lit and designed hotel lobby, dated decor. Walkway carpeting and room furniture all suggested the owner of this hotel has not spent $$ to update it for at least one decade. Other than very good location (2 blocks away from Time Square), can't think of other benefits this place has to offer. Stayed in standard room and it doesn't even offer you a coffee machine with a free cup of coffee or some tea bags. It turned out that one must 'request' it via housekeeping but found out it too late (at time of checkout). This hotel also has horrible, unreliable internet connection which they charged you $12.95 access fee/day. This is a type of place where they'll nickel/dime you to death for every little thing. Avoid if you can! Won't come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Trust me ... not worth the money!!”
Reviews.Author: WILLtheHAMMER
Reviews.Content: Before I post this review, I would like to tell you that I had the Millennium Hotel Broadway send me an email to ask about my stay during mid January 2012, and though I wrote back to them explaining in detail my experience there (and was quite generous in my statements)... I never ever heard back from them, which only goes to show... they don't give a $#)^ about their customers!!! --- Here is what I wrote: Dear Administrator at Millennium, Generally I would like to commend your hotel's overall quality & service. For the most part I had an enjoyable stay while visiting in January 2012. There were only a few things that I feel could have made my stay more enjoyable, however 1 of those things being totally out of your control. So let's start there... #1. Next to your hotel there is major construction being done on another building. They start their construction work very early 7am (VERY NOISY), and so the chance of sleeping in late peacefully was not an option. -- In addition to that noise was the hotel room's doors... basically as people were coming and going, and without thought or consideration to other guests, patrons would come and go, letting their doors "Slam" shut... which would of course noisily vibrate the walls of the corridors & disturb other people in their rooms. To remedy this, I would highly recommend putting some air pressured mechanical arms onto the top of the inside of the doors to stop the doors from slamming shut allowing the doors to close more quietly. #2. The bathtub/shower had serious DRAINAGE problems. The water would fill up 4-6in's in the tub during showers... and would only eventually drain 10-15 minutes after taking a shower. I would definitely highly recommend snaking all of the hotels drainage systems in the rooms periodically to keep the water running smoothly without clogging. #3. During my stay, I paid for wireless internet access... that was a huge waste of my money, as the internet connectivity in your hotel is very poor at best. Although I could connect from time to time, the ability to stay connected was extremely difficult. I talked to one of your staff about it, and asked about a hard line connection... but your hotel room doesn't seems to provide any hard line connections as I did look to see if I could jack in to a port somewhere in the room but couldn't find any. This was probably the most frustrating part of my stay, as it made it impossible for me to conduct business while I was there. --- All in all however, I was very pleased with your hotel's staffs that were very courteous, and actually very helpful in providing information when requested. Additionally, the hotel's location was perfect for my needs, as all of my business was centered in and around Time's Square, and the restaurants, delis, and Starbucks was right next door. Please also understand that the few things that I have mentioned are not going to stop me from staying at your hotel again, but it would be very good if a few of these issues could be addressed before I come back to N.Y. --- Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awesome staff and nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: lisacas1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millennium off 44th & Broadway in the Premier building in room 1922 for 4 nights in the 1st week of March. For a NYC room, I found it to be very roomy for 2. Queen bed, sitting area, desk, large bathroom, large closet and mini bar area. The location is steps from GMA and Virgil's BBQ. It's also close to Rockafeller center. There's a little deli/store across the street for any incidentals you need. Street vendors on the corner for snacks. The location cannot be beat! It's not loud at all. Some nights we slept with the windows open and the noise was almost non existant. I like that the hotel is on a side street with little traffic and walking distance from Times Square & the subway. The staff is very nice and helpful and the hotel was always clean. If you have a room in the Premier section, you get access to the Mezzanine that offers free continental breakfast and happy hour. I found the continental breakfast to be very good and not cheapy like most places. The bagels and croissants were delicious! I definitely recommend staying at the Millenium hotel! Great location, great price and staff!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hotel at a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: biogirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nothing special other than having a great location. We arrived early but were unable to get our room so we had our luggage stored - both times ours was put in a back room somewhere, although on numerous occasions there were bags left in the lobby with a lock through them. The staff at the front desk were not very helpful and at times rude (the concierge and doormen were always helpful though). We found the bed hard and uncomfortable, even with being exhausted after a long day of walking we did not sleep through the night. Security guards doing checks in the hallways at night were noisy - we could clearly hear them talking back and forth on their walkies. Noise from the street wasn't too bad, and we were in a corner room facing Time Square. The one issue we did have was being charged for beer and water from the minibar that we did not drink. Our of curiosity we had opened the minibar the first night just to see what was available and the fridge was not even turned on! When I brought the issue up to the woman at the front desk on checking out she did end up removing the charges, but the fact that they tried to charge us in the first place left a bad taste in my mouth. Also, there is no free wifi in the hotel. Perhaps its different in most places in Canada, but I haven't encountered a hotel in the past few years that does not offer free wifi. Although there are plenty of spots you can pick up fee wifi, its not as convenient as having it in your hotel room! I probably would not stay here again if I had another option in the same vicinity. Being that close to broadway led to us getting rush tickets for one of the shows because we happened to be in the right place at the right time. Unless you get a great deal on this hotel I wouldn't go out of your way to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisa1983
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from the 11th feb to 16th feb and couldnt fault anything about this hotel. We had room 4818 which overlooked times square, the views were amazing. It was great having a newsoaoer delivered to your room first thing every morning. The bed in this hotel was the most comfortable ive ever stayed in. We had queen room. Bathroom was spotless and tolitries and tea/coffee were refilled everyday and towels were changed. we didnt eat or drink in hotel so cant comment on that. but receptionst staff were very friendly and concierge erick was really nice and we also used the theatre booking desk to book a show and this gentleman was great in suggesting a show for us and got us a real good price. this is a hotel i would definetly return to, but just be aware if your going to shop in Macys, Old Navy etc it is bout 7 to 10min walk. but subway is 2 minutes from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, could not have been more convenient!”
Reviews.Author: dee_elle2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millennium Broadway in August of last year (2011) for 2 nights as part of a tour package. I am no stranger to New York city hotels, and the location for this one is really top notch. You are directly in Times Square, but the rooms were all relatively quiet (it IS New York afterall) and spacious. The bathrooms were comfortable and modern, with plenty of amenities. The front desk staff was helpful and pleasant. The only reason this hotel did not get 5 stars from me is that there was some confusion during check-in and the room assignments and the initial front desk agent we dealt with was abrupt and somewhat rude. **Please Note: This was only due to us travelling with a large group, and any other time I dealt with the staff they were polite, pleasant and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TML4Ever
Reviews.Content: stayed at the mil broadway for four nights and had a great time. minutes from times square and close to all amenities. stayed on the 34th floor and had an amazing view. wasn't too happy with the cleaning staff not changing the sheets everyday, but oh well. overall if you get a deal, like we did from travelzoo it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: evieryland
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for an overnight business trip and was super impressed with the whole experience. I had a little mix-up with my reservation in the beginning (not due to the hotel) and the front desk agent was super polite and helpful with my situation. After helping me sort out the problem for 20 minutes, she offered to give me a room upgrade for the trouble, and with the headache I had, I was looking forward to relaxing in a nice room. I will forever request a room like this, when I stay here! I was on an upper floor, with a view of the Empire state building, the Conde Nast building (4 Times Square,) The Paramount Building, and the shimmering, blinking taxis & lights of Times Square below. I have to say, I never once turned the TV on. I did order room service to request a coffee pot in my room, from which I made some excellent flavored tea before bed, and of course morning coffee. From the concierge, I ordered an in room massage, since my headache was getting out of control from that long flight and reservation mix up. Within a half hour of my request, I had an amazing masseuse set up her table in front of the windows where I could glance down at Times Square, in between the relaxing kneading of a deep tissue massage. After an hour, my headache was gone, and I felt completely refreshed and ready for a stroll to hunt down some good pizza. I had one King size bed which was so comfortable, I didn't wake up once until my alarm went off, and I woke up totally refreshed. The bathroom fixtures were all clean and working, which is a BIG deal to me. I can't stand a creepy hotel bathroom. The tub was big, and the shower head was high enough that a tall person could easily stand under it. The wi-fi location was good. There was no noisy maid service banging on all the doors like you hear sometimes, when they're trying to rush everyone out. There was just a newspaper at my door, and a polite maid in the hallway who chatted with me for a moment when I was on my way out. When I made my way downstairs, the Bellmen remembered me, said hello, opened the door for me and wished me a good day. And when I got to the studio that morning to work, people were talking about what fun they had the night before, going out all night, eating and drinking, but all I could think was- I wouldn't trade it for the refreshing and relaxing night I had!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Joebuyer
Reviews.Content: First time in NYC for my daughters 18th Bday. Room was small (but I believe on par for NYC). Location was excellent in Times Sqaure walking distance to a ton of stuff). Bed was comfortable, view was incredible (corner room overlooking times square). Did not use onsite facilities such as restaurant etc so no feedback. Overall rating average, nothing impressive besides location and view, but then again nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “A Sure Shot”
Reviews.Author: Phaser58
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from another weekend getaway to NYC. I do not travel often but when I do, NYC is the preferred destination. Why? NYC has never let me down. I can also say the same for the Millennium Hotel Broadway; it's a "Sure Shot." I have had the opportunity to stay at this hotel several times over the past few years and each time has been fantastic. What makes a hotel fantastic? Personally, it's a combination of cleanliness, service, and location. The location of the Millennium is tough to beat. Being at Times Square, there is so much at your doorstop. You can easily walk to many attractions, restaurants, and the theaters are just across the street. If you're looking to venture beyond Times Square, either the Times Square or Bryant Park Metro Stations will do the job, both a short walking distance from the hotel. However, when yore ready to call it a day, it's very easy to get a good night's rest inside the quiet, comfortable, and clean room. The service at the Millennium is also great. I have always been greeted with a smile. If youâ€™re looking for a great restaurant recommendation and/or reservation, just ask. The front desk will be sure to help you out. If you are looking for a quiet, comfortable, and clean place to stay, don't overlook the Millennium Hotel Broadway.

Reviews.Title: “Location. Location. Location.”
Reviews.Author: SafariFamily007
Reviews.Content: Not the fanciest or best appointed hotel in midtown, The Millennium's great location makes it a venue to which we return frequently when in NYC on theater weekends. Especially with NYC taxi availability and service so awful (not just this reviewer's opinion--ask the hotel employees who try to flag down cabs for their customers), being able to walk to every Broadway Theater in a matter of minutes and having decent restaurants just slightly farther away makes this location worth the stay. Also, you can get decent prices. They should get Wifi throughout the Hotel and some of the plumbing needs work, for example.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, bad service.”
Reviews.Author: Kps4415
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, quiet room, considering it's a noisy part of town. My rate included free wifi and breakfast. I was told I couldn't get a wifi signal in my location. The continental breakfast was mediocre, at best. No ice machine on floor, had to call twice for ice, waiting 40 minutes. Called concierge, no answer. Called back and was disconnected.

Reviews.Title: “20 years and counting.....”
Reviews.Author: Phyllis C
Reviews.Content: The Millennium Broadway Hotel is my second home! I've been staying here for 20 years and love my"second home"!. Melanie Turner always makes sure my accomendations are super comfortable and is always happy to see me. Her room controller Elena Metta is the absolute best I've ever seen! Monique Madison is the Concierge of NYC! Mark the bellman always makes sure there is everything i need at my fingertips! No need to ask twice for anything. I have been all of the world many times in 5 star hotels but this is the one I look forward to coming "home" to! Thank you Melanie and her staff!! Accolades!!! looking forard to another 20 years at the Millennium! Phyllis from Los Angeles

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place to stay in NY”
Reviews.Author: Julie R
Reviews.Content: My son and I come to NY every year for a short trip, usually to see a Broadway play. We have stayed at the Millennium Hotel Broadway each time, primarily because of the great location and the great rate that I have found on travelzoo (under $200). This time around we were upgraded to the Premier Tower (the travelzoo deal offered an upgrade for $15), which offers a complimentary breakfast until 10:00 a.m. and cocktails and appetizers between 5:00 and 7:00 on the mezzanine floor. The hotel seemed busier than usual - there were buses outside on 44th street and a lot of people standing in the lobby with a lot of luggage, and I heard there was a convention at the hotel as well. It was much quieter in the lobby of the Premier Tower. Monique checked us into our room and quickly addressed a problem with the connection to the internet later in the day. Monique also encountered a very obnoxious guest who checked in ahead of us and was much more pleasant to him than I would have been. The other employees that we encountered in the Premier, including the two gentlemen working in the mezzanine lounge, were very professional and friendly as well. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was larger and nicer than other hotels in NY (the shower is separate from the bathtub and the counter space was wide to place a lot of cosmetics and personal items). I actually prefer staying in this part of the hotel, although I have not been disappointed or encountered any problems staying in the main part of the hotel in the past - in short, it is worth the extra money for the upgrade if it is available. If you want to stay near Times Square and/or are seeing a play, I would highly recommend this hotel, either the Premier Tower or the main hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location and great value”
Reviews.Author: travelfan021
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights in this hotel for business purposes. There were 20 other people in my group, we all shared the same opinion. The location is Superb, a short walk to Times Square. The rooms are specious and clean. Carpeting shows some wear but otherwise nicely maintained .The bed is comfortable and the bathroom was clean and in good shape (hair dryer, soap, shampoo, conditioner, body lotion and such, were replenished daily). The rooms are quiet and the staff is friendly. There is a coffee maker in the room as well as tea/coffee, a nice feature to have in such an expensive location. The restaurant next to the lobby serves great meals in a very competitive price. All in all, a great hotel in a great location for the right price. No need to hesitate

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Betsy448
Reviews.Content: With as much as is heard about this hotel, we had high hopes but they fizzled ! Staff was curt and short when asking quesitons - almost annoyed - yes, I understand it is a busy place but "the customer pays your salary". We asked for a suggestion for a nearby restaurant one evening (from Concierge) - ended up leaving after no service between appetizer and main course (40 minutes), then went to hotel bar area to get a quick bite but one waiter had the entire place and had no time to take another order. Room service was prompt ! Elevators were a nightmare leaving - "service them every Sunday morning" ??? The room was clean and comfortable but it did not make up for the rest of the inhospitality. Difficult too getting transportation in this HIGH traffic area too.

Reviews.Title: “10 second walk and BAM you're on Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Ebonyb89
Reviews.Content: This hotel was literally a 10 second walk and BAM you are on Times Square. We payed $300 a night in early November which was the best deal we found for such a great location. There are two entrances to the hotel, the main entrance on 44th street and the back entrance on 45th street which is handy depending on which end of NYC your coming from. We stayed in a superior room which is just a standard room but bigger and on a higher floor, The hotel seem a little out dated but had been renovated so it looked nice but it was'nt all nice and shiny new like a new hotel. Over all we plan to go back to NYC and stay here again it was such a good location and nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit of Luxury at a Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: AlisaT63
Reviews.Content: I had an opportunity to go to NY for a business trip, and was pleasantly surprised at my accommodations. My travel agent had booked me in the Premier Tower of the Millennium, which is separate from the rest of the hotel. I had stayed at other hotels in the Times Square area, but none as nice as this!! What was my company thinking?!?! My room had a small seating area that could comfortably seat 4-5 people and a queen sized bed. The bathroom was spacious w/ a separate bath tub and shower, and with a lot of counter space. There was even a phone in the bathroom! Amenities included a fitness room, a keycard accessible elevator, free continental breakfast, and a free nightly happy hour that included hearty appetizers! And all for the price of $261 a night . . . very reasonable by New York standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, otherwise average.”
Reviews.Author: JDofDC
Reviews.Content: I purchased this hotel from Hotwire as a four-star hotel, and it is not really a four-star hotel.. The Milennium has a terrific location, just a half block off Broadway in the heart of Times Square. If you want the excitement and convenience of that location, you're in the right spot. Once you're inside, though, the rest of the hotel is generally average. The front desk was having computer issues when we arrived, so we were told it would be an hour wait while they checked manually whether rooms had been cleaned. We begged for a room so we could change for our dinner reservation, so they gave us one in under 20 minutes. The room was a standard size for NY and had decent appointments. The bed was firm, the sleep pillows fine, and decorative pillows lumpy and uncomfortably hard as props. The rug was stained in a few places, the toilet ran, and walls were very, very poorly insulated for noise. The lounge was fine but service and desert items we ordered were uninspired. All in all, I'd recommend the Milenium but would tell people not to pay a four-star price for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zeal2122
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this property over a long weekend and found the hotel to be a very good all around selection. Let me begin with the positives, and the top marks belong to its location to Time Square and the Broadway district. You can see and do anything with in an easy walk of 4 blocks. You have a variety of places to eat, shop, and be entertained, and you don't need a cab. The room appeared clean and after we asked for linens for the fold away couch they made effort to keep that area clean and neat each day. We got to the city at 1:30 and we were allowed to check into our rooms early which helped us get a jump start on our trip. The Concierge was very helpful and made excellent suggestions when we were planning our trips into different areas of town. There is a Starbucks right next door for your morning coffee! The suite that we stayed in was dated, and the wifi was terrible. The bedding was not the quality that you normally find for the price of the room, and the mattress felt like a rock. I was very disappointed in the sleep quality, but we did so much walking that we were worn out by the time we got back to the hotel and passed out it did not matter. They could certainly upgrade the bedding and the mattresses, but the location goes a long way to make this a very good option to see NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Are In Poor Condition and I Have The Pictures To Prove It.”
Reviews.Author: neil4top
Reviews.Content: Hotel's stuff doesn't really take care of the rooms when it comes to maintaining it properly. They're not very clean either. However, most of reception staff are very helpful and friendly, Especially Seljuk.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location !”
Reviews.Author: Etownnan
Reviews.Content: Hotel room needs redecorating BUT location is great for walking to near by activities and the hotel staff was accomodating and friendly. Restaurant on site was a little pricey but food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and amazing location.”
Reviews.Author: Jay8888
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed at the millenium broadway feb 2012. Got to be the best placed hotel in NY for seeing and doing the sights. Room was very clean and staff were great. One word of advice don't shake hands with the African American men if they have CDs on them. It will cost you 10 dollars for the cd you don't even want. Ignore them or say you already have some. Do not shake hands you won't get away. They are funny not scary though they are just trying to earn a living. Most CDs are blank. Trips you must do are open top bus ride you can get off and on all round NY and is the best way to see the city. You book this through men on times square with red or yellow coats it's 54 dollars each. Also you must do 9/11 memorial it's amazing. Book your theatre tickets through travel agent though they are 180 dollars when there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: Koho26
Reviews.Content: Location just off Times Square is great. Cost is VERY reasonable for NYC. Were there during a cold spell, but nothing we did cooled the room low enough for our preference - even with the thremostat set to 60 and the fan on high the room never cooled. Restaurant has decent food but is over-priced. Rooms were very clean and hotel staff were very helpful. Paid $150/night for a weekend. Would not hesitate to stay here again as long as I could get the room for $225 or less.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: oxlade-cooper
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights Dec 2011. Didn't have any problems throughout my stay, I had a standard double room which was a good size with a good size bathroom too. Check in & check out quick & easy, Everything clean, helpful staff & excellent location! Overall a very good stay here. Would definatly return & recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jphillips12
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Millennium Hotel Broadway with young son to see hockey game at Madison Square Garden. Room was clean ready before scheduled check in time of 4PM. Internet access was said to be free but turned out it was not. Beds comfortable but pillows hard as cement. Good location right in Times Square. No complaints but nothing overly exciting about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Clare S
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here in November last year. After booking and then reading the reviews from trip adviser visitors I was very nervous. How wrong I was. This hotel was Great and in a perfect position! Within a minute's walk from Times Square but far enough away to be away from the crowds. The entrance was impressive, the staff eager to help and most importantly the rooms were not the horror stories I had read about! Our bed was huge, incredibly comfortable, clean and freshly made each day (as one would expect). The bathroom does need updating but really was not a problem at all. We were on the 39th floor and had a superb view, large flat screen TV and plenty of cupboard space. The concierge staff were friendly and helpful and I enjoyed our chit chat each day about our days plans. You can check in online on the first floor for free and print off our boarding passes. We needed transport to the airport at silly o'clock in the morning for our return which was arranged without a hitch by the reception staff and we were then taken to the airport in the Hotel's smart black four wheel drive for a pre arranged sensible fee. I would happily recommend this hotel and on our return look forward to visiting again. Thank you all at the Millennium Broadway for making our holiday a pleasure and worry free experience.

Reviews.Title: “Many thanks to all the staff !”
Reviews.Author: JuliaCy
Reviews.Content: I want to thank all the Millenium broadway hotel staff for making our 10 days New York break so nice! Me and my 13 yo daughter stayed there for 9 nights from 15-25/01/2012 for vacation. We were pleasantly surprised because of all this negative reviews from other travellers. Personally we did not have any problems. Location is super, close to everywhere. The hotel building itself is real New York experience - you are on top of the sky-scraper (we were at 50th floor), and New York sky line is just in front of your window! We could see people working in the offices in the sky scrapers opposite, Times square was just down there,Chrysler on the left, East rever on the right. Our room was superior, had tea/coffee maker, nice bathroom, sitting area in front of huge window - actually glass wall. I am a medical doctor so I know about hygiene - and it was up to the standards in this hotel. If you are not in mood to to go out - you have big flat screen TV and free USA Today every morning just under your door. I want to give my special thanks to concierge staff - they all were very attended, polite and informative. Especially Erica, beautiful girl who spent a lot of time to arrange trips and entertainments for us. Check-in and out was no stressed, very fast. Reception staff helpful and polite. I have no comment on theire food as we did not eat there. Generally the hotel was real high light of our vacation, I can recommend it to the most demanding guest .Regarding the price - well, if you wish for hotel staff to "lick your feet", go to Trump and pay 10000USD per night. If you want comfortable stay for reasonable New York Mid town 4 stars hotel price ( I spent 2500 USD for 9 nights including deposites for our day-trips ) - go to Millenium Broadway. Thanks to Millenium Broadway and all staff!

Reviews.Title: “did the job...”
Reviews.Author: WassimEh
Reviews.Content: It's not the typical Millennium Hotel you'd experience in the Middle or Far East. They very well know that their location is superb and with that alone they have a solid edge to build on. With this in mind, they're definitely not interested in improving other aspects such as service, furniture and overall fittings.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facility, Staff needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: LUVS2TRAVELnTALK
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed at the mellenium in January as it was close to a conference he was attending mid-town, and he got a discounted rate. I joined him for a weekend excersion. Although the facility itself was beautiful, the room/bathroom clean/contemporary and spacious for NYC, we were dissapointed with the staff service. My husband needed to take an early morning conference call for work, and because he did not want to disturb me he asked someone at the front desk for a business center/conference room. He was told that unless a conference room was reserved by him, he could not go in one. He was then directed to a second floor lounge. A security guard saw him up there and told him he could not be there and refused to listen to his explanation that he was sent up there. He finally ended up taking his 1hr call on the stairs. Later when I called the concierge about wether or not I would be allowed to take my camera to the Lion king show, I was told that probably not, but they don't search me. I ended up not taking my camera, but found out that they allow camera's, but not allowed during the show. I missed out taking pictures in the lobby/next to the signs/upper floor displays (maybe next time).

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: kappa6379
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights here around the holidays. The hotel is in a great location, right in times square. The hotel was clean and the rooms themselves were a decent size for NY but in need of remodeling especially for the price they charge a night. The elevators are the slowest ive ever experienced and checkout was a nightmare. Valet is $50 a day and it took 2 hours to get our car back on the Sunday we checked out. Spent almost $1000 on 2 nights here just on the room and parking and was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “primeir room”
Reviews.Author: Oleg S
Reviews.Content: Had a primier / superior room in november so that was the best choice. Large room with closet, and huge bathroom which has separated bath and shower, corner window from floor to celling , free wired high speed internet and good continental breakfast + free alcohol drinks and snacks from 6 to 8 o'clock. the hotel is not new so its a little bit sharpy sometimes. like dusty grill in bathroom but i think its not that big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Mid-Winter break to New York City”
Reviews.Author: ghawk0423
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millenium Broadway Hotel this past weekend January 18 through January 22 because I got a great price from Travelzoo. We were on the 44th floor in a superior king room. The superior rooms are supposed to be recently rennovated, but I don't know what their definition of "recent" would be. The room was a little worn. That being said, we would stay there again if we return to NYC. All of the staff that we dealt with was friendly and helpful. The location was great! Right off Times Square. We had short walks to see Phantom of the Opera and Sister Act and many great restaurants nearby. We loved the Cranberry Cafe across the street from the hotel. My husband ordered a croissant sandwich with egg cheese and sausage every morning. He said everything was fresh. I enjoyed their fresh fruit bar; it did not taste like typical mid-winter fruit with no flavor. It was very good. The Cranberry Cafe is also where we stocked up on our bottled water.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but tired”
Reviews.Author: Famishedtraveler
Reviews.Content: I stay in NY a lot but this is my first time at this hotel. First the postive: It has a great location. Right off of TimesSquare and very near my office. The staff was fine and efficient and the price was very reasonable. It's bascially like most older NY hotels, the rooms are dated, there was water damage in the bathroom and peeling wallpaper. The room was clean and pretty good size for NY but I never understand why NY gets away with run down rooms (you'll find the same at the Waldorf, Plaza, Palace, etc.) Also, there is a bar but no restaurant open for dinner. They do serve room service and there are plenty of options steps away. Again, this is fine for tourists looking for a bargain, but just don't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “One night was enough”
Reviews.Author: Susan_from_PA
Reviews.Content: On a planned one night stay we chose this hotel based on location and price. We named our price and it was accepted. Check in was quick. We stayed in room 2502 which had one queen size bed and one window looking out to Times Square and a window wall looking out on 45th Street. The room was very clean but is much in need of a rehab. With the exception of the television the furnishings of the room were dated. The vent in the bathroom was rusted, The room did have a coffee maker with both regular & decaf coffee and an assortment of teas. The ice bucket and extra toilet paper was in the closet. There was a hairdryer on the bathroom sink. We stay in NYC about five or six times a year and this was one of the larger rooms we have stayed in. Unless you were right by the door, the room was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Penrumer
Reviews.Content: We loved it!!!! I was a little nervous after reading some if the reviews and seeing some of the pics, now I didn't get on my hands and knees and inspect every inch of the place..I had a city to see!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location; No issues with this property”
Reviews.Author: Dville_Dawg
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and comfortable. Very convient to Times Square and good views from the room. Fitness Room was very good. Nothing special with the bar and restuarant. You are so close to some great pubs and dining, why deal with the hotel! Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in great location”
Reviews.Author: DnDtravelers
Reviews.Content: The Millennium is one our favorites. Our stay in early January was extraordinary. The extremely friendly check in agent, the beautiful clean spacious room he gave us as a free upgrade, the free hors d'oeuvres during happy hour, the free breakfast, the unbeatable location at Times Square, the perfect temperature of the room (many in NY are overheated), the amenities in the room, even the speedy and efficient elevators all made for a wonderful and comfortable visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lskwara
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because my husband was attending a conference here which made it very convenient for him. After reading the reviews I wasn't sure what to expect. I called ahead and requested an early check in which didn't seem to be a problem. We got to the hotel around 1:30 and checked right in.....that was nice since check in is 4pm. The room was ok but every thing looked old and worn. The bathroom was clean but again was worn. The bed was ok to sleep on. I always check for bed bugs and was surprised when I looked at the mattress and it was a pillowtop which looked fairly new......there were no signs of bed bugs. There was only one additional pillow in the room and we could have used another one. The next morning my husband saw the maid in the hallway and asked for another pillow.....we never got it! There was NO coffee maker in the room! This is one of the reasons I am giving them a 3 star rating. We also didn't get much sleep. The hotel was very noisy! People slamming doors all night long and even though we were on the 42nd floor you could still hear the traffice from the street. I had breakfast at the hotel restaurant....it was good but very pricy! I found the concierge to be very friendly and helpful. She gave me a map and a lot of pointers for the places I wanted to go while my husband was at his conference. Since this is right in Times Square it is very conveniently located. You can get to any major place from here whether you walk or ride. Check out was very smooth and we left our suitcases with the bellman for the day which he put in the back room and not off to the side like some of the reviews I read. I can't complain too much because we only paid $159 per night which is very cheap for NYC. If you can't get a good rate then I would suggest staying somewhere else. I think this was a nice hotel at one point but definitely needs major updating to be the 4 star hotel it claims.

Reviews.Title: “NYC business trip”
Reviews.Author: Nick4734
Reviews.Content: The views are great. The restaurant is pricey and average.

Reviews.Title: “Location is awesome, our rooms fantastic but you pay for it!”
Reviews.Author: elawson
Reviews.Content: We weren't the typical clientele...its definitely a more couples centered hotel, probably because of its location and price but we came with our four kids (8, 6, 3, and 9 months) and my mom. We had a connected suite with 2 bedrooms and a living room with a pull-out couch. It was wonderful. The concierge was so helpful, the doorman was cheerful and great with our kids, the check-in and check-out was a breeze. Our room was on the 52nd floor (that's the top) and we had a corner. We could see the Chrysler building and where the ball drops on New Years from our room. My kids thought that was awesome. The beds were comfortable, the rooms were big, and the bathrooms clean. Our master bath was really huge and I'm glad I don't have to clean it! The location was so convenient to tons of restaurants and the hotel's recommendations were spot-on for kids...something that you don't assume in that area. It was only a few blocks from the Gershwin where we went to see Wicked. That was great considering it was a high of 21 degrees when we were there. I only took off half a star because there were no sheets for the pull-out couch. By the time my mom noticed (I was at Wicked), she just thought the heck with it because it was late and our kids were tired. So that was slightly annoying...especially since there were about 90 empty drawers where it would be easy to stash some sheets. The valet service is really convenient, especially it that freezing weather. But paying $70 for 17 hours of parking seems a little stiff.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: BlodwenLancz
Reviews.Content: I cannot understand the negativity expressed about this hotel. We stayed for 3 nights before moving on to Florida as part of our honeymoon. Check in was flawless..thank you Reuben I had emailed in advance and asked for a room with a view..........and what a view we were on the 50th floor with a superb view of Times Square below.the room was large and spacious and clean. Service through our stay was excellent and professional. Location is superb Many thanks to Melanie for arrangements Nig and Tray

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location! I love NY.”
Reviews.Author: TaylorVegas
Reviews.Content: I can not say one bad thing about this hotel. I've travelled all over the world and stayed at alot of hotels and this is one of my favourites. First off, The location is AMAZING. 20 steps from the front of the hotel and YOUR ON TIMES SQUARE!! The concierge staff were super helpful. We asked about a broadway show and she got us tickets within 5 minutes and also got them dropped off. The front desk staff were also very helpful giving us directions and maps on what to do, what times to go and how to get there. We were up on the 42nd floor and had an amazing view of Times Square. NY really is the city that never sleeps theres always people up and about no matter the time on times square. If you get hungry during the early hours of the morning like my friend and i did theres a subway right across the road along with a little convidence store and a walgreens chemist. I am returning to NY this december for christmas and new years and have already booked my stay with this hotel. I would reccomened it to EVERYONE who wants to be in the centre of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Happyhpk
Reviews.Content: Steps off Times Square, nice rooms, stayed 2 nights, great for a short visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, views and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JaneAnders0n
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and were extremely satisfied with all aspects of out stay. The desk staff could not have been more helpful, we had booked the premier tower with inclusive breakfast and bar 5pm-7pm and this was well worth the extra cost. Our flight from Scotland was delayed and we arrived at the hotel at 9pm,the premier tower had no king sized rooms left so we were given a king room on the 51st floor of the millenium building with AMAZING views of times square. Although we were no longer residing in the premier tower, the premier concierge ensured we were given access to the lounge for breakfast every morning and access to the bar in the evenings. The location is ideal for sightseeing, theatres, shopping and eating and we will certainly visit this hotel again. The only down side was that the bathroom was a bit 'scruffy' and could do with updating, however it was clean and spacious and met all of our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor”
Reviews.Author: Milliemicron
Reviews.Content: What a disappointing experience - paid a lot for the room but little value. Furnishings tired and worn but, worse, room pervaded by cooking smells. A/C very noisey. No coffee making facility - not even a cover on the duvet. Yuk. Milliemicron

Reviews.Title: “Millennium Broadway+New Years Eve in Times Square!”
Reviews.Author: LawPrime
Reviews.Content: The Millennium Broadway is just 1/2 block from Times Square. All of the Broadway theaters are just a short walk. (FYI: "A Broadway Show" = anything playing in a theater of 500 seats or more. "Off-Broadway" = less than 500 seats.) We saw 3 shows in the week straddling New Year's Eve 2011. As usual, I booked one really desirable show in advance and grabbed all the rest at the TKTS booth -- which saves a ton of money AND benefits the Theater Development Fund at the same time! There is a TKTS booth conveniently located in Times Square, but it does not open until the afternoon. A better choice is the TKTS booth at South Street Seaport (6 stops from TS on the 2/3 subway line), which opens in the AM and usually has better seats and show selections anyway. You can sometimes get discounted matinee tickets for the following day, but only at the South Street Seaport location. To help select a show, use the TKTS App on your smartphone, which updates available shows a few minutes before the booth opens and then as changes occur during the day. New Years Eve was an exciting time to be on Times Square, but I have to warn you that celebrating NYE on TS is a serious logistical challenge. It can be very CIVILIZED, however, if you upgrade to this hotel's Premier Tower, which has an entirely separate entrance, desk staff, bell staff, complimentary Happy Hour, Breakfast Buffet, etc. The Premier Tower shares a Concierge, a very fine bar, a gym, and that's about it! The beautiful lobbies are connected and there are entrances on both 44th and 45th streets -- which proved to be very helpful. I was told that the Premier Tower has several rooms with a view of the New Year's Eve ball drop, so you would not even need to go outside if the weather turned bad. ABC Studios (Dick Clark!) is right across the street. As with all hotels near Times Square, we were not allowed to check in on New Year's Eve. This is because the Police start closing the streets off in the area an putting people in "pens" beginning about 2PM. Warning: Once you are placed in a pen, there is no food nor rest room available until about 12:15AM. You cannot return to your assigned pen if you choose to leave it for any reason. On NYE, once the blockades were in place, our hotel room key proved to be quite powerful, since people are prevented from even navigating in the area unless they have actual business (Room key, Theater Tickets or Dinner Reservation). On NYE, we had the continental breakfast, saw a great show in the afternoon, returned to the hotel for the complimentary happy hour, and then had a lovingly-prepared, prix fixe Italian dinner on the West side of Broadway. From there, we planned to use our room keys to get as close to the action as possible to ring in the New Year. (The hotel is on the East side of Broadway, and it is not possible to cross Broadway late on NYE.) We certainly did not plan to get to Times Square, proper, but our son is a Naval Officer (on his first leave since deployment) and his Military ID was treated with great respect by the Police, who escorted us to THE prime location between the falling ball and Lady Gaga's stage at 11:15PM. In addition to the above mentioned, unexpected courtesy, all the Police we encountered did a fantastic job under difficult circumstances all that week. They were all very respectful - and especially so for New Yorkers! I asked why the periphery was manned mostly by very young officers, and they told us that senior officers get first dibs on the assignments closest to Times Square. Finally, the singing, ball drop, dancing in the streets, confetti, and fireworks ensued. And then Times Square was already being cleaned up by 12:30AM. The Millennium Broadway (Premier Tower) will definitely be our first choice on our next trip to NYC, and I would certainly recommend it for anyone attempting to celebrate a New Year's Eve in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: phoenixpride
Reviews.Content: I visited NYC with my sister and two cousins for a girl's weekend. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful, including the concierge who was helpful in choosing a Broadway Play. We had a great view from the 48th floor and I felt for the area and the hotel, we paid a reasonable price. It was clean, BUT did have a smoke smell to it that was not pleasant. Unfortunately, we could not switch to another room. The location of this hotel is great, especially for Broadway shows and 5th Avenue shopping. We were able to walk to Bryant Park to shop and ice skate. I would definitely consider staying there again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: ItchyFeetPortsmouth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is spot on if you want a central location. I'm not a great fan of walking, so being seconds away from Times Square and a 10 minute walk to the Rockerfeller Centre, Empire State, Maceys, Bryant Park, Grand Central Terminal, maybe 15 mins to Central Park was perfect. The only time we needed to get a cab was to the ferry to Statue of Liberty and also Ground Zero, but am sure some people would be happy to do the 45/50 mins or so walk. There had been some bad reviews about service and cleanliness that I'd read before we went. When we arrived it was peak check in/out time during a busy time of year and the foyer was mobbed. We were about 2 hours early for our check in time so wasn't expecting to get into our room, however, the receptionist found us a room so we could check in and was very helpful. For us, our floor (44) had what looked to be refurbished corridors (not scuffed and tired as reported), and no mould in our bathroom (I'm very fussy about bathrooms). In fact everything was pretty much up together, but only what you'd expect for $450 per night (it was the week between Christmas and New Year). As reported by others, it was a bit weird having a sheet under a duvet that had no cover, but am sure there's a reason for it. The duvet seemed clean enough! Very very firm bed. Our room was large (Superior King), flat screen TV, with a side view of Times Square. Black out curtains stopped us being kept awake by all the flashing signs and we couldn't hear any noise. You need to be prepared to wait for the lifts at peak times. The Bar area wasn't very welcoming and didn't offer a huge selection of food - snacks/burgers only. Our first night there it was torrential rain and blowing a gale, but we went out rather than eat there. We did find a great Indian restaurant a block away (ask Concierge), and an Irish bar opposite which meant not having to queue in Times Square for food in the pouring rain. The hotel doesn't run a shuttle to JFK, so we had them order us a car rather than risk a cab not turning up in the rush hour. Only cost us $30 more including and inclusive tip, so well worth it to have a quality, spacious car. I would stay there again as the location was so perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: NE20
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a one night stay here. Got to hotel at 11:00am. Room wasn't ready (I didn't expect it to be) so we dropped our bags and went off for the day. When we got back to hotel the front desk clerk gave me the keys (he was extremely rude and stand offish). The room was DISGUSTING. Dirty pistachio nut shells next to bed. Bed looked like it was just slept in, dirty pillows . . . . I called front desk, they said to come down. Front desk clerk (different from original) told me hotel was sold out. I could either wait and have room "re-cleaned" or accept a lower level room as it was all they could do. I asked to speak to a manager. No manager ever spoke to me. Clerk went in back room, came out and said they had one other room but they weren't sure if it was clean as it was not appearing in their system. I wanted to ask for a refund and go down the street to the Sheraton (where I had stayed before and knew it would be clean) but agreed to look at this room. The beds were at least "made up" and since I had my two nieces with me - we agreed to stay. Room was dirty - stains on rugs,walls,tub. There are so many better hotels in the area - DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY ON THIS PIT!

Reviews.Title: “very close to broadway”
Reviews.Author: expat_globe_trotter
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for two days. the location was perfect - less than a three minute walk to broadway. we arrived at 11 am and we were told check in time was at 4:00 pm. we were able to leave our luggages with the bellman so it wasn't much of a problem. by 3:30 pm, we were able to relax in our room. but for the amount of money we paid for the room, i was expecting a better view but we didn't want to stay longer in the lobby and the room was very clean so we stayed there. the room seemed a little bigger than in the other two hotels i stayed in before. staff was friendly and service was good. i like the hotel for its location but maybe next time i'll first check out other hotels within the same vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting.”
Reviews.Author: Amycha
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel in NYC. This place does not know what customer service should be. The front desk attendants are rude, we booked a room two months in advance and once we get there with all our luggage we find out they are sold out and can't find our reservation. One we waited 2 hours we finally went back up and they had a room but never told us. We get to the room it's in a different building and it has one bed when we had 4 people staying with us. We complained and asked to see the manager and the front desk attendants ganged up on us and refused to get the manager. Fine. We stayed in the room because it was new years day and there was no where else to go, we were going out and needed ice for our drinks but of course they didnt have ice machines the housekeeping had to bring it up. We called 4 times before they actually brought the ice up. We ran out of the one roll of toilet paper and called at 10pm when we were leaving so we had it when we got back, 3am and no toilet paper. We had to call three more times before we got it. I paid 210$ for this hotel and it was a piece of crap STAY AWAY.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotel experiences I've had”
Reviews.Author: MikeHK24
Reviews.Content: This has been an unbelievable experience. I would recommend people stay away from this hotel. Here's the problems I had in one day: 1) Checked in at the Premier Hotel side of the property (which I had booked). When I got the the room I found a room with problems. 1) Toilet didn't flush (the whole handle was hanging off the side of the toilet), 2) found crumbs and hair in and on the bed,3) the bar soap in the bathroom was unwrapped, used and dirty, and 4) the bottle shampoo was 1/3 used. Basically, the room clearly looked like it was "made up" like for an existing guest, but not cleaned for a new guest. 2) I asked to change rooms. Was told ok, but would need to give up the room and wait one hour for a new room. Said ok b/c we just felt gross about staying in that room. In retrospect, this makes no sense--why couldn't they just call me when a new room became ready? 3) Moved all my stuff out of the room, waited an hour then spoke to desk. Now, I am told that there's no other rooms available in the Premier but they could move me to the Millennium side. I was actually referred to the hotel manager which I thought would improve things, but she told me she'd like to give me an upgraded room but they're fully booked so they can only give me a standard room on a lower floor. 4) Get to the room and it smells like smoke. But at least it looks like it's been well cleaned. However, there's no comforter on the bed. Call housekeeping twice and after about 30 minutes they bring up a comforter. 5) Around 8pm when about to head to dinner I finally notice that there's no bath towels in the bathroom. Oh well, I figure I'll just call housekeeping. when we come back. 6) At 11pm we return to room and I call housekeeping. Front desk answers and replies to my request for towels by saying the laundry service was late today and they're delivering towels to all rooms now. 7) 20 minutes later I call front desk again and ask if I can just come down and get towels and they tell me the towels are not at the front desk. I ask if I can go to housekeeping and they say no, that's back of the house. Claim that they'll call housekeeping and ask them to come to my room. 8) 10 minutes later I walk down to the front desk and tell them this is ridiculous, its 11:30pm and we have no towels. Guy there says "how many do you need" and then grabs two for me from behind the front desk. So they basically lied when they told me earlier that the towels were not available at the front desk. I will say that the location of the property is great and the manager at least offered to allow me continued access to the Premier Hotel lounge as well as free internet (after I asked). But this has been such a bad experience that I decided to check out after one day and move to another hotel when I originally booked this hotel for three days.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: Harthall
Reviews.Content: Stayed 16th till 21st on the 38th floor,very impressed with the room, lovely comfy bed, lovely friendly staff would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Poor show! Should lose a star or two!”
Reviews.Author: CambuslangScott
Reviews.Content: Check in was fine at 10pm at night. Clerk was friendly but stand offish at same time. Told us we were in premier block that comes with free breakfast, Internet, cocktails etc and I immediately smelled a rat but gave it the benefit of the doubt. Room was tiny all be it clean however on entering the room and doing the usual checking out of the room I found a takeaway dinner, disgusting. Went to reception and was told they could do nothing until the morning. Next day they moved our room into main block but this does not come with breakfast, Internet etc. New room, stank o f cigar smoke on entry. Bell guy just barged right in without knocking and we found an out of date carton of sour milk in the mini bar! Again, back to reception. No manager available surprise surprise. All in all this could be a great hotel, rooms are nice, location is great but service is terrible. Oh and you cannot access the hotel from 45 st after 11pm so we had to walk all the way around the block. If only the told you this on arrival instead of telling you ere is a sign on the door when we walked all e way around the block! Doh, I can read that but it's to late when you are at the door. Staff are polite but it's the detail that is missing!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulm2886
Reviews.Content: Just got back from NYC having stayed at the Millenium Broadway over the Christmas period. What an excellent hotel and cannot praise the staff enough. I have to wonder what planet the people that give negative reviews come from as this place has got the lot. Its clean, has good sized rooms, is on the doorstep of Times Square, have very attentive and helpful staff and does have coffee and tea making facilities in the rooms. I'm going back there and I'm sure most would that have experienced its qualities.......Shame the internet costs $12.95 for 24 hours but then a lot do charge around that figure

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Leegns
Reviews.Content: We really liked the location of this hotel. It was no problem to get to major sights such as Madisson Square Garden, Times Square (like 30 ft away!), Rockefeller plaza, Museum of Natural History, etc. We were able to walk to LOTS of the places we wanted to see. The service was also really good. They even had no trouble accomodating us when we requested a room away from the in-laws. We got a great deal on the room at about $180/n. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to New York”
Reviews.Author: shirley a
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in sept 2011 , very Art Deco , Excellent view of Time Square, lovely friendly staff, would defo go back .

Reviews.Title: “Book it if you can get it cheap”
Reviews.Author: alam1
Reviews.Content: We got a hot deal from travelzoo for a superior room for $150/night plus tax. I was worried prior to checking in because of all the negative reviews from TA. It is true the hotel is a bit worn around the edges, but I think most of the negatives were exaggerated and maybe a bit unfair. The hallways looked very drab like a student dorm, but the rooms weren't bad. Our superior room at least had a great view into Times Sq. Ask for a corner room; it has more light. The carpet in our room has seen better days, but it was acceptable. The bed seemed new because it was very firm and comfy, and I was amazed how quiet the room was at night at the 32nd floor. Maybe we had quiet neighbours. I slept like a baby. Try to use the hotel gym. This is one place which isn't well used! Bring your lap top and use free wi fi at the Starbucks at the rear of the hotel. No free wi fi at the hotel. We saw a show everyday and I can't say more about the hotel's location which is brilliant. Not right on Times Sq so you can avoid the riff raff, but 1/2 block away. Try to book a superior room. I think these rooms are better on the higher floor. If you can get it for under $200, go for it! 3 1/2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot in the City”
Reviews.Author: mrbeco
Reviews.Content: Close to times square and walking distance to most sites! subway station is 1block south, easy to get around and enjoy the city that never sleeps!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location on Times square”
Reviews.Author: khlaw04
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and large for Times square. Our view was a sweeping view if Times square and was gorgeous at night. The front desk was a bit slow but overall service was good. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to Stay !!”
Reviews.Author: rick j
Reviews.Content: Great motel. Prices reasonable. One half block from Times Square. Walking distance to Broadway Shows. Property in great condition. Overall a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Meh.”
Reviews.Author: photobella
Reviews.Content: Well, we waited too long and all the rooms at the Hilton were booked so we settled for the Millenium. Rooms are average size for a Manhattan Hotel (small.) Beds are very hard. Pillows are hard. Even the chair is hard. No frills here. No coffee in room. Upside is that it is clean and the staff is pleasant enough. Decent location if you want to be in the heart of Midtown and close to Times Square. Decent value for the rates we got but not a luxury hotel by any means.

Reviews.Title: “It fit the need.”
Reviews.Author: katiejworkman
Reviews.Content: My family and I traveled to NYC to celebrate the end of my cancer treatments. Unfortunately from the time I booked the hotel until we traveled I was diagnosed again. I called the front desk to ask about an early check in as I was not feeling too well from my oral chemo. The gentleman I spoke with exclaimed that they do not offer early check ins but would place my name on the list for a possible early check in time. He told me check in is at 4. My family arrived at the hotel lobby at 12:30 and proceeded to the desk. I spoke with a young woman and she said my room was not ready. Ok, that's fine. We checked our luggage and trekked around the city. We came back at 3:00 PM proceeded to the desk to check in and our room..STILL NOT READY the young lady said again check in is at 4 pm. Okay, I get it! We come back at 4:15. I approach the desk and the gentleman apologizes and says our room asked for a late check out because their flight was later in the evening and it was not clean yet. Hmm....was there really an "early check-in list?" I guess not. We originally booked King size joining rooms but were unable to get them. He said we could wait awhile longer for them to be cleaned but at that time I was cranky and tired and not to mention had the chemo fatigue. Oh well....He did place us on the 43rd floor which had a good view. The rooms were fairly close but not connected. The hotel is in a good location. After that episode we did not interact much with the staff. The room was clean enough but the comforter was stained with black stuff. All in all, the hotel was just a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel near Broadway”
Reviews.Author: DLE E
Reviews.Content: I stay this hotel often. It is just a half of a block off of Broadway at 44th and 45th Streets. At the same time if you have mid-town business you can head East out of the hotel and avoid all of the crowds on in Times Square. The rooms are quite adequate and relatively modern. The only downside is that it is a big hotel (50+) floors and the lobby can be quite crowded with overseas airline crews coming and going. It is not a lobby where you would "hang out" like you would at many NY hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: NYCHotelLady
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the location, close to Times Square. When we checked in and the front desk said they were giving us an upgrade. It was not an upgrade, it was the room I booked through Expedia, the "Premier" queen corner room, which is what we paid for in advance. We did check in very early for hotel standards, 11:30am which was nice. However, I was awoken at 1:00am in the morning by the extremely loud club next to the hotel. I could actually look out our window and see people partying on a balcony next to our room...the 15th floor. Staying in a hotel can sometimes be a problem with sounds from the hallway, people talking, elevators dinging, doors slamming, kids or otherwise running down the halls and it is usually ok to deal with because the sounds are short lived. I have never heard such a loud disturbing sound in all my years of staying in hotels. We let the front desk know what a terrible night we had and all we got was a "sorry you had a bad night".

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Aliceeastmids
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for five nights with a friend from 26th Nov-1st Dec and we found the location unbelievable,we had a good sized room and bathroom on the 21st floor.The staff on reception were not particulary chatty but polite,concierge staff very helpful and friendly as were the doormen.It was clean,comfortable and quiet and barely a minuite away from Times Square.We used the subway to get to The World Trade Centre which only cost 9 dollars return for both of us and the hop on hop off bus to get to Battery Park to get the ferry to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island but we walked everywhere else although we did take a pedibike round Central Park and the person who took us was very informative and allowed us to stop off to get a closer look and take photos of many of the interesting landmarks in the park,we felt this was good value for money at 60 dollars + tip and would do it again.A visit to Radio City to see the Rocketts christmas show is a must,its an amazing show.We had a fantastic time and would love to do it all again and would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “check your invoice!”
Reviews.Author: Jml53
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in for one night last weekend. We liked the hotel very much, nice room, friendly staff....only complaint is we paid for the overnight stay in full back in Oct .....we did the hotel check-out etc. They said no additional charges, which we knew ,since we did not use the phone --or drink anything from fridge etc, or rent movies or we did not even bring anything electronic.... ....but we checked our visa 2 days later, and they charged an additional $100.00 on our card!!!!!!! called and complained and we are demanding they take these bogus charges off!!

Reviews.Title: “some poor service”
Reviews.Author: MyrtleBeachGolfer
Reviews.Content: this hotel is showing it's age but the rooms are still pretty good. the towels are not very soft, and the tub/shower had mold in the corners. The location is great. asked for a wake up call and got none, also went to the conseige to book a car to take us to the airport, and they failed to do that but the doormen was very helpful and found a us a car to take us. If you want a Times Square location this hotel is good for that, but by no means is it an upscale hotel. it could do with some facelifting and better service

Reviews.Title: “Great location Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janet P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights from 6-12 Dec 2011. We had been reading the trip advisor reviews up to arriving and were very dubious as they had not been very good. We were pleasantly surprised with the hotel and found the staff very helpful and friendly. The room was fine and clean and we had a part view of Times Square. The location is unbelievable walking out of your hotel into Times Square and walking distance to literally everything that is NYC was an amazing experience. if you are complaining about the rooms then you were not experiencing NYC as you should have as we were hardly ever there. We would definitely stay at the Millennium Broadway in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good location motel 6 feel”
Reviews.Author: rayd68
Reviews.Content: By far the most uncomfortable bed. Not what you would expect for $459 a night by NYc city prices a bargain. Will definitely stick to the Ritz next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the 4 star rating”
Reviews.Author: JL185
Reviews.Content: The hotel was disappointing. Location is great, but there are others in the area that are better for the price and just as great of a location. The lobby is impressing, but once you get upstairs that is where it ends. For the price of the hotel, the rooms could use a huge facelift. The wallpaper was stained, the carpet stained and fraying, bathroom bland, comforter stained and had hair on it, and lamp shade ripped. We requested a view and did not get one, though I can live with that as december is very busy. We called the front desk (would have gone down in person but the line was out the door for check in-also ridiculous, the wait was so long). The front desk staff said that there was nothing they could do. They sent us a new comforter, but it took a couple hours to get, as well as multiple calls. The bed was uncomfortable. The pillows were also tiny. For the money we paid, we expected at least a clean room that had better standards than a Motel 6. And even if we did not get a clean room, some help from the front desk would have been nice. We will not be staying here again. A much better hotel in the area is the Muse, just off time square, adorable spacious rooms, and VERY clean and courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: kitten50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the week Thanksgiving. The hotel is in the heart of the city and is walking distance to theaters, shopping and Times Square..we had a room on the 47th floor and had the New Years Eve ball as a night light. So Special!! I was worried about the 47th floor but with all the other buildings around it didn't seem to a problem for me.The elevator ride was quick and we didn't have a long wait to use it. The staff is very friendly and helpful.And it does have an on site restuauant and bar but didnt used them.The hotel is well maintained but is showing its age.The one thing that I noticed was the wall paper in the bathroom was peeling and "stained" by the toilet. Some of the rugs were fraid and worn.And the sheets actually had small wear hole in them.BUT that being said it was CLEAN and you really can't beat the location. OH! and another thing......Do Not remove anything from the fridge!!! It has sensors built in and automatically bills your room for the items..we took some stuff out to put some water and soda in and ran up a $75 bar bill in 5 minutes...The sign said it was charge "automatically" to the room....and it was!!! All in all Great location,staff and price....just look past the wear and tear.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location friendly helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: Gedcranny
Reviews.Content: Just had 4 days stay at this hotel from the moment we arrived to the moment we left, all staff were supportive and willing to offer advicee and help when needed. we had two rooms booked on two orders tthe hotel had seen this and ensured both rooms were together, the rooms are clean and large for New York views of Time Square are excellent. The location is excellent allowing you to explore New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a nice "big" hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Guy_76
Reviews.Content: The Millennium's not going to win any design awards or wow you with the personal service or "extras," but if you're looking for a clean, well-run hotel with almost all of the "normal" hotel services you could want, it's a great deal. I love design/boutique hotels, but in Manhattan they're pricey, but more than that they're hit-and-miss. Lately I've chosen bigger "branded" hotels that are geared more towards business travellers, because I know I'll get a clean room, A/C that works, reliable wifi, etc. - which isn't always the case, even with high end smaller "hot spots." This is exactly what I got with Millennium.
