Check-in was fast and easy; the agent was pleasant; the room was a good size, everything worked well and was comfortable (not beautiful or "fantastic" but perfectly fine); wifi was reasonably priced. The one downside was the menu in the restaurant/bar in the lobby; while waiting to go home I grabbed a drink and found the selection for non-meat eaters to be limited, and mostly fried and/or less than healthy dishes. Not huge, but I'd definitely look for something nearby next time.

Reviews.Title: “Unsurpassed service and attention: a wonderful pre-Christmas weekend”
Reviews.Author: AskingForHelp
Reviews.Content: We spent three wonderful nights at the Millennium Broadway in the first week of December. We made the reservation through a â€œblindâ€� third-party booking website in early May â€“ at the moment that we saw a very reasonable rate for a four-star hotel in December. When we found that we would be staying at the Millennium, we read lots of Tripadvisor reviews and were somewhat concerned. We are older travelers, and one of us has serious medical and mobility issues; travel is always a challenge, and we rely upon front-desk and other hotel staff to help us. We were impressed that Melanie Turner, Director of Front Office Operations, responds to Tripadvisor reviews and so, two weeks before our arrival, we contacted Melanie through Tripadvisor. We requested a coffee maker so that medication could be taken as required and, because we spend more time in our room than lots of people, we asked if a room with a Times Square view might be available. Before we arrived, Melanie responded with a lovely message confirming that we would have a coffee maker and a room with a view. But we were totally unprepared for our gorgeous corner room on the 49th floor that had an unbelievable view of Times Square, the Paramount Building, and the Hudson River skyline. We spent many hours sitting in the comfortable armchairs enjoying that unbelievable view. And we were thrilled to find a treat-laden welcome tray in our room after dinner on our first evening â€“ with a card welcoming us and enclosing a card for breakfast for one morning. We were so impressed with Melanieâ€™s thoughtfulness and her efforts to ensure that we had as wonderful a trip as possible, including finding that our room was available at 1:30 when we arrived and that we could stay past the usual checkout time of 12:00 noon on our day of departure. We have sometimes found it difficult to manage in large, big-city hotels, but Melanie made sure that we felt welcomed and cared-for. We canâ€™t thank her enough. In terms of the room itself, it was very large and extremely clean, with everything in good repair. We were very pleased to find two comfortable armchairs, as noted above. The bed was indeed firm, but we found it very comfortable; we thought that only the pillows could have been improved. There was lots of room in the bathroom for toiletries and to move around, and there was a full-size tub/shower. Front desk staff were friendly and responsive at check-in and throughout our stay, and every person we interacted with at the bellman/porter station and the concierge desk was friendly, helpful, and responsive. We left our luggage for a few hours after checking out, and the staff were friendly and efficient on a very busy Sunday. The buffet breakfast has something for everyone, and the quality of the food and coffee was outstanding. In every respect, we found that the hotelâ€™s service and amenities were four-star. We will be talking and reminiscing about our wonderful New York weekend for a very long time to come; it was our best trip to New York ever. As travel has become more difficult for us, we approach each trip with greater anxiety, but we neednâ€™t have worried about the Millennium Broadway. We hope that Tripadvisor members give the hotelâ€™s management and staff the chance to make their visits memorable, too. We canâ€™t recommend this hotel highly enough. Thank you, Melanie, and please give our thanks to your staff.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: tonybuck11
Reviews.Content: The other reviews of this hotel are very accurate. Service is slack, the lower rooms are dirty smelly and in need of maintenance. The others in our party were upgraded to the Premier rooms which are very good, clean fresh and spacious. We complained about the state of our room and were moved to a higher floor (48) it seems that those above 26 are rated higher and are in much better condotion. The location is absolutely great with easy access to Theatres, 5th Avenue and Subway.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service at hotel upon arrival will update at check out”
Reviews.Author: CapTraveltKirk
Reviews.Content: Checked in - no door man or bellman at door. Clerk did not offer bellman, went to shower to go to dinner and we had no wash rags, no floor mat/towel and only two towels. Called to get wash rags told none in hotel and that they had a break down but would send towels. I had to call a second time to get towels and wash clothes. I was transfered to housekeeping and was told the same thing. I spoke with the hotel manager and was told the same thing "we had a problem and we are awaiting the delivery. I told them it was not my problem was not paying $399 per night to get excuses. I was told there are other guests having the same problem and I told her she needs to let the general manager know this is unacceptable. She said she would check on it. She called me back within a couple minutes and said the could send a towel and wash clothes but had no hand towels and asked if there was anything else they could do. Frankly, she should not have to ask this and if they wanted to do something to make up for it they should have. Not easy to make the theater or dinner when they can not provide the basic items one expects from a motel let alone a hotel. From the was this was handlend it appears to be a typical experience at the hotel and did not seam to phase them at all. I almost had to resort to stripping the bed and useing the sheets as towes! I post an updated tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but ...”
Reviews.Author: MDNOTMD
Reviews.Content: Hotel definitely in need of some refurbishing. Our small room with two double beds, rather than queen beds, was dirty, with paper from previous guests on the floor. The bathroom floor needed to be mopped. In fact, everything needed to be wiped down. The location is great, right there overlooking Times Square, and near great little pubs and eateries, but since cleanliness is more important to me than anything else, I'm inclined to stay elsewhere next trip. Rate was pricey, but probably on par for NY. Except for one female concierge who was openly rude, and so, should not be in a customer service position, the Concierge was very, very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!! We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Splitty
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just enjoyed our first trip to NY and LOVED it! We cannot wait to go back...and when we do, we will be checking in at the Millennium again. Peoples reviews make me laugh. Our trip was broken in to 2 parts because of a 2 day cruise we were doing and we stayed on both sides of the hotel...first the regular side, then the preferred side. The rooms were fine on both sides. Yes there was a stain on the floor in our first room, but big deal...the rooms get used and things happen. Should the hotel change the carpet every time someone spills something on the floor? Do you have stains on the carpets at your house? I think we all do at some point. Anyways, we had a view of Times Square from the 6th floor on the preferred side which is funny that some guy said there was no view anywhere in the hotel of Times Square. I open my curtains and had a prefect view of the New Years ball and some of the big bright billboards. The hotel does not smell of sewage in the rooms nor in the lobby. It's clean and just fine. The staff at the front desk were great with us on both occasions. The one doorman, can't remember his name, was great as well. He entertained my wife and I while we waited for our transfer car to take us to the cruise port. The location of this hotel his perfect. Walk out the door few steps away is Times Square...what a great place to grab a hot chocolate and just sit and people watch! We went to the Jimmy Fallon show and did a NBC tour at Rockafellar CTR which we walked to from this hotel many many times. Central Park was a bit of a hike from this hotel but you just go down 5th ave and enjoy the scenery. Don't be afraid to book at this hotel if you are a tourist, looking to do touristy things. If you are hoity toity and need a butler and brand new plush carpet every second day, don't book here...nobody will really care. NYC is amazing and it's all my wife and I can think about now that we are home. We travel quite often but usually to tropical places....NY has just become one of the top places on our list we will return to. Can't wait till we meet again NY!!

Reviews.Title: “NY Trip”
Reviews.Author: Bostonian2
Reviews.Content: Lobby - Great Room - got an upgrade, was clean and had an air purifier in the room. Room Size - i had one bed queen size and room size was a standard NY style - just to fit in all. Location - Right on the Times square. Food - N/A

Reviews.Title: “Totally acceptable Times Square Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rcs249
Reviews.Content: I looked for last minute hotel options on Thursday for Friday and the Millennium was well located and relatively inexpensive at $650 with all taxes for a weekend stay for our family, so I booked it. The hotel is well located if you want to be in Times Square between 6th and Broadway/7th, and for several reasons we decided to be on this visit. The nice thing is that it is steps to Times Square on one side if you are heading to Broadway shows, and 6th Ave on the other. The pros are that the hotel lobby, elevators and room were clean, with friendly service, fast elevators, nice flat screen TVs in the room and steps to a Starbucks and two excellent Italian and French restaurants. The beds were a little firm but fine, as were the linens, and we all slept well. The bathroom was nice, a decent size with large marble sink and counter so plenty of space to lay out stuff for all four of us. Towels were of nice quality. We were able to open windows and let the breeze in. View was fine from our room on the 38th floor...not stellar but we had a bit of a view into Times Square and the area buildings and roof decks. Cons were lack of a coffee maker (although I found out later a friend's room had one so maybe it was being repaired or something) but with a Starbucks just outside the 45th St entrance, I wouldn't have made coffee in the room anyway. Also, there were 4 accessible electrical outlets, and we made it work, but 4 people charging cell phones and laptops had to coordinate times a bit. So, in summary, if you want to be in Times Square, and the room price is right at the time you book, then no reason not to stay at the Millennium, but no reason to race there either. Personally, I'll be back at one of my many preferred hotels (Algonquin and Iroquis, Hilton, Westin, Warwick, Omni) where I'm more comfortable on most of my trips, but good to know that this is an acceptable backup.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: Charlotty5k
Reviews.Content: Don't book this dump. Rooms stink like a tenement where people are cooking in unventilated rooms on hot plates. There are no Times Square views- don't be fooled. Really poor front desk service. Lobby smelled like sewer was backing up. Dirty bathroom complete with past guest pubic hair in sink, leaking toilet, missing light fixture covers in ceiling, TV with horrible, grainy reception. The air conditioning does not work. If you book this hotel, you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fabulous views, tired decor, surly staff”
Reviews.Author: CACatgrrrl
Reviews.Content: I remember when this hotel was built - it was chic and gorgeous. Now it is tired and poorly maintained. There is frayed carpet in the elevators, there was peeling wallpaper in my bathroom, one of the lights next to the bed did not work, and the bed linens were threadbare. The bottom sheet did not reach the end of the bed! Some of this could have been mitigated by the staff, but, it wasn't. I don't think the check-in clerk even looked me in the eye during our transaction. All this said, I had a great view and it is in a wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “In the hub of Times Square”
Reviews.Author: RapunzelPerth_WA
Reviews.Content: Great location for a vacation in New York City. Comfortable. Our room was very high up and we had a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel that has few redeeming features beyond location”
Reviews.Author: Xalec
Reviews.Content: A hotel that is very much in need of an update. Everything is old fashioned & dirty from lobby to the rooms which detracts from this hotel's great Times Sq location. Staff are surly & were at times rude which meant there really were no redeeming features. Avoid if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Girls long weekend - Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: jmwarner2
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to NYC for her 16th Birthday. We choose this location because my daughter's wish was to walk out the door of a hotel and be right in the middle of the action!! And that, I am glad to report, we were at this hotel!! Right next door to the Toys R Us (excellent cupcakes bottom floor.. to die for.) and steps from ABC news and the lights and action of Time Square. (If you dont like crowds this is not the place for you, I left my hubby at home because of this) We had a King room which was pretty enormous from what we were expecting. Plenty of room for the two of us and we could have easily roomed a 3rd person no problem. We only had a view of the building being built across the street, it was quite entertaining to watch (for a few minutes) the roof top crane operator work.. (dont know how those guys do it, hats off.) Hotel was spotless, elevators fast. My only issue was trying to call the front desk, conceirge desk or housekeeping from room , many times over 2 day period I never got an answer via phone. But walk down to lobby and they were always happy to help.... Would have been nice not to have to leave my room to ask for a few towels or classes etc.. Another slight problem that I did not enjoy was walking across the street to get coffee but I discovered an awesome deli (cant remember the name) they had great coffee, and bakery treats which I thoroughly enjoyed. No coffee maker in room and the lounge/ restaurant in hotel did not have any to go cups on my first morning... and pretty much told me I was out of luck in getting coffee and had to go across the street. Which I did with my loungers and slippers... not a pretty sight.... We saw all the sites, shows, tourist attractions , subways, double decker buses, and really feel this was a good location to be based out of. My daughter had a very memorable 16th birthday and is eager to go back to NYC and I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting the Big Apple experience!!!!!! Hope you all have the same or better experience. Joyce

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for seeing/getting to the sights”
Reviews.Author: trip-together
Reviews.Content: My son (who is 12) and I travelled to NYC for a sight-seeing adventure on Nov 11-14, 2011. We booked a stay through Hotels.ca for a king room at a rate of $296.00 per eve. We asked for a high floor....and not to be near an elevator. I also asked for two beds...on the website it offered either two twin or one king. We arrived with Dial 7 limo service from LaGuardia at approx. 4:30pm on a Friday. Dial 7 is the best way to go. $29.00 plus tip, and tolls...came to $43.00.(their cheapest car) We were greeted coolly at first, by the front desk, but the conversation warmed somewhat as it went on. I asked if we could have the two beds, and the gentleman came back to announce we could. Getting to our room, we were beside an elevator, and not on the higher floor....but at least we got the two beds. I have read here that the hotel is looking "tired"...and yes, the rooms need an update, but they are fairly clean. We had no bedspreads, but we didn't mind at all. One of the comforters needed replacing...no fill left...and same was replaced that evening. One light bar was out in the bathroom, and it was replaced shortly afterwards by maintenance. The room was a good size for New York City standards. The beds were either 3/4 or maybe double....at least not single, which was great. We had some storage...two drawers, and a closet. Our two suitcases were stored on the sides of the walls. There is no luggage rack. We found the rooms dark, but that was ok. If we peeked to the left, we could see the lights of Times Square, which my son loved. The bathroom was a fair size. Plenty big for one. Lots of counter-top storage area. There was a hair-blower...good power to it..shampoo, 2 soaps, conditioner, and 1 lotion. There is a fridge, but if you move items, you will be charged for these items. There is no complimentary bottled water offered, which I found to be chinzy...as the very small bottled water I had, and my son't tiny orange juice he had, came to $11.00. There is a deli accross the street on 44th...go there and get your water. You can put it on the window ledge at night this time of year...it will keep cold....they will bring in another fridge for you ...we read...but space is limited, so opted to use the window ledge. There is a good size flat screen T.V. in the room. We used it twice. The beds are hard...very hard...but, we were so exhausted from sight seeing each day, we slept fine. The maid service is wonderful and friendly here. The woman taking care of our room talked with my son each day near the elevator when we saw her. She went out of her way to smile and ask us how we were etc. Some of the door men were pushy...and some were very friendly and caring. One fellow at the concierge desk was a bit arrogant, but that did not put us off....as the door man was our next contact, and he was very nice. The first morning we brought items from the deli into our room. There is also a Starbucks on 45th...go out the back entrance to the hotel....I didn't see it until the last day there! Room Service: We did order room service our second morning. We had scrambled eggs, toast, hash browns, bacon, juice and coffee for $24.00 each....However, there is an 18% charge added and then a $3.00 service charge added on top of that. As we were getting ready for early mornings outings ..I just went ahead and ordered. The fellow who brought the tray in was friendly, but still lingered for a tip...nope! not with it added....so just beware. The second day we ordered...not good....the gal on the phone told us hash browns came with our eggs benedict. I ordered both meals with hard cooked eggs. I also asked for cream for my coffee and got a side of toast, and side of bacon....It came to $89.00!!! Eggs runny, toast cold, no cream., no hash browns...but, we were in a bit of a rush. I got my son to sign for the bill as I was in the shower when the food came. When I got out - I received a phone call from a the same very snooty woman who told me I could not sign for anything in the hotel as I did not have a CC on file. I told her there was one put there the first day. She said a few other things....that made me feel like a small child being scolded. I told her about our meal...I was at first not going to phone and complain...but now I was. She told me to go ahead and complain...WOW....anyhow...after talking with the manager,,,and then the room service manager, we did receive the meal for free. I thought they handled it very well, and quickly Now, I didn't get my coffee, nor have my eggs or toast or hash browns, but at least I did not have to pay for it as well. Be careful of the charges. Very expensive for what you receive here. We found that the room was a bit tired (carpet, walls, bath tiles etc) but fine, most of the employees were friendly, the hotel is situated well, and the amount per eve, was quite good off of Hotels.ca....so all in all a good stay. I would not pay more than $300.00 per night - all in though. We got one of their car services back to the airport (LaGuardia). We were charged $43.00 for it...with tip...$50.00. ...so Dial 7 was a better deal. The driver however, was just wonderful. The service is inconsistent...and would rather give 3.5 stars...but .5 is not an option:). I am bringing another son to NYC...possibly in the spring...may stay here...may not...depends on price I guess. .

Reviews.Title: “Not worth my money... but there was a positive side...”
Reviews.Author: Baker-Mayy
Reviews.Content: Positive side first.. Very Cool view from our 33rd Floor window! If you want Broadway, you really can't do much better.. With the curtains closed, we still saw just a hint of the flashing lights of Broadway. Also Positive.. the room size. For NYC, where i have had rooms where the only thing that fit in the room was the bed.. literally, nothing else but a bed.. this hotel definitely offered much more space.. Negatives.. Service. I am surprised to see other reviews where people highlighted the excellent service.. all of those employees were off this past weekend.. it was one sour face after another.. and coming from a Customer Service background, nothing annoys me more than receiving bad service. You spend quite a bit to go to NYC, even for just the weekend like my husband and I did.. to be treated like they were doing us a favor by having us there instead of grateful for having the customer.. very disappointing. Plus the Valet was terrible and incredibly over-priced, even by NY standards... There are a lot of choices for consumers in NYC, hundreds of hotels to choose from.. Millennium should step up their game and not rely solely on location to get their customers..

Reviews.Title: “Millenium Broadway was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Debhw
Reviews.Content: We were in NYC at the end of October - got out of there right before the snow! Our experience with the hotel was awesome! The staff was super friendly and the atmosphere was comfortable and elegant. The concierge was fantastic!! We loved every place he recommended to us because he took the time to listen to what we liked and wanted. AND...after reading many reviews, I expected the beds to be rock hard but they were not - we thought they were very comfy! The rooms weren't huge but they were just fine. My only disappointment was that I expected a good view of Times Square but instead got the view of a building and a tiny part of one of a sign. I'm going with a group of girls and our daughters in the spring and might stay at Millenium Broadway again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Great Service but...”
Reviews.Author: mickva
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights. The location is excellent, right on Times Square. Many local attractions are within easy walking distance and there is a subway stop a block away. All of the staff we encountered were pleasant and helpful. Check-in took less than 2 minutes. We called for extra pillows and 5 minutes later there they were. We were assigned a corner room on the 51st floor with magnificent views of Times Square and the Manhattan skyline. Unfortunately, the view was the only highlight in the room. The rooms are, quite frankly, tired and in dire need of renovation. I understand that's on the horizon but I suspect it will be several years before all of the rooms are updated. If you get a great rate and are willing to sacrifice some comfort/amenities in your room, stay here. But for $300 or $400 a night you can do better. It's unfortunate because if the rooms were in good shape, given the location and excellent staff, this could be a 5 start hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary K
Reviews.Content: This hotel was disappointing from the moment we had our cases carried in from the taxi and then unceremoniously dumped in reception, which meant that we were expected to tip two different people in order to have them taken upstairs. Very aggressive bellboys and reception staff not interested in customer service. On one occasion, we could not use bathroom for an hour as plumber was installed, mending a leaking toilet! We surprised him by returning too soon!

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: W T
Reviews.Content: While the location is good if you want to be in the middle of Times Square, the quality of the beds were not. As I was paying $400/night I asked the front desk to do something after the first night (stayed three). The gentleman. At the front desk agreed to call housekeeping to remedy the situation but they failed to do anything when I returned that evening (8 hours later). I again voiced my concern to the front desk manager on duty and found him to be extremely condescending, even telling me the beds were great. They finally made the bed slightly more comfortable. However I found the follow through and attitudes unacceptable. As a frequent business traveler I don't expect too much. However a clean, comfortable room is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected but urgently needs renovation!”
Reviews.Author: Jvdeede
Reviews.Content: 9nights (between 16th & 24th oct.2011) in the Millenium Broadway. Was worried after reading some opinions here. Much better than expected. Location WOW. Staff friendly (during my 9 days stay). Room lots of space (compared to Westin etc...) and clean but "worn out". Needs renovation. 47th floor and very quiet (better than Westin, Intercontinental etc). Don't agree with the negative reviews on TA except : time for renovation. A BIG thx to front office mngr M.Turner. Chapeau, as the French say. Chapeau.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable 1st time visit to NYC made possible by Millennium staff!”
Reviews.Author: stylishtrvler
Reviews.Content: After finding out this is the hotel we won from hotwire, I was disappointed and anxious at first cuz at the time the reviews are not pleasant. When the time to stay drew near, I tried contacting Ms. Melanie Turner thru email to voice my concern and send my requests. She assured me that we will all be well taken cared of and that all our 3 rooms will be to our liking. My worries are all for naught. From the time of check-in til the time that we have to leave, we felt very important to them. Terrance processed our check-in with warmth and enthusiasm. We were assigned 3 superior corner rooms. 5101,5104 and 5118. The views in the rooms are awesome. Some reviewers say that the bed is firm. Yes its true that the bed is firm but it is very good for aching backs after a long day of exploring NYC and we had the best sleep. Melanie even threw in some perks after she found out we were celebrating special events during our stay. We were not able to use all but the gesture was very much appreciated. Security was good, they even went up to check why our doors when we left it open. And when we had slight problem with the room key, they asked for identification before changing the keys. We had to leave our bags in their storage area and they don't let anybody in since there is also a camera for security to monitor the luggage room. Location is perfect, walking distance to food, shops, transpo and entertainment. If you want to be featured in Good Morning America, prepare in advance your banner and wake up early, its just around the corner. Walgreens,subway are open 24hours for a quick bite. Forever 21 is open til 2am,sephora til 12 midnight. If you don't mind the craziness of Times Square and would rather opt for convenience, Millennium is the place for you. A major subway line is also nearby which can bring you to Central Park and Battery park without changing lines. Radio City, Rockefeller Center, Fifth avenue,Restaurant row are within walking distance not to mention most of the broadway theaters. Elevators can be a bit busy during morning rush hour so just allot some time if you need to go somewhere on time. I left tips everyday for housekeeping to make sure our room is cleaned everyday. Thank you to all the staff esp to Ms Melanie and Terrance who made sure we have a wonderful Ist time experience in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: janeyToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: All the staff encountered (front desk, concierge, porter, doorman, restaurant staff, housekeeper) where very helpful and friendly. The rooms were a comfortable size (we were on the 18th and 47th floor) and the beds comfortable. The view from the 47th floor was great - Broadway (Time Square). Great location. Would definitely stay here again. Tip: The restaurant breakfast was good, but if you want a little more reasonable price, head down 44th towards 8th, a few blocks is The Red Flame. The Deli across the street also has breakfast & lunch food which was good; take out or eat in. O'Donoghue's across the street was very good also - Shepherd's Pie and Pulled Pork sandwich was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Heart of New York”
Reviews.Author: Laurabgone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millennium at the end of September. I was somewhat hesitant as some of the reviews on TA have not been flattering but I have to say our experience with the hotel was very positive. I had contacted Melanie Turner the operations manger previous to our stay and she assured me that she would look after our reservation and she did a fantastic job making sure our stay exceeded our expectations. We arrived about 11 Am and checked in.Our room wasn't ready so we left our bags at the front desk and spent a few hours wandering around and when we came back later in the afternoon we got into our room right away. We stayed in 4901, a corner room that was spacious and had a fantastic view of Times Square.It was very clean and the housekeeping staff was good with making sure we were well stocked with towels, shampoo etc. The concierge staff was helpful and friendly when we had questions.The hotel had no problem accommodating a late check out on our last day which was very helpful. The location of the hotel can't be beat if you're wanting to go to the theater. We went to a different musical each of the four nights we were there and it was no more than a few minutes walk to all of them. The subway was really convenient to, we had no problems getting around the city.As everyone says you are in the heart of it all as it's just a few steps to Times Square. We really enjoyed our stay at the Millennium and would not hesitate to recommend it to others. When we go back to New York we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Htown_10
Reviews.Content: paid too much for what we got. For about $400/night you would think they would include wireless! Not impressed and won't stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Staying In Times Square Is Not Always Fun...”
Reviews.Author: neil4top
Reviews.Content: As it gets really busy at time, in fact so busy that it makes it difficult to make your way from the subway station to the hotel. Finding a taxi takes quite a while as most taxi drivers try to avoid this super cluttered area. On the other hand, you're 2 minutes walk from almost every subway line in NYC. As for the rooms, not very clean! Some rooms are missing a duvet even in the middle of a cold winter - I should know: My company makes stay here on and off for the past two years. some rooms have coffee makers and bathrobes. All the rest - you need to call housekeeping. Hotel staff: mostly friendly and helpful, besides Tanya, the reception manager, who would do anything in her power NOT to assist you. To sum up: If I had a choice I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “NYC vacation”
Reviews.Author: dedmundson222
Reviews.Content: If you want to be where the action is in NYC, then you need to stay in a hotel in Time Square. We have been to NYC several times, but this is our first time staying in the heart of it all and it was great. The location of the hotel is perfect, although difficult to get to if you are using a car for transportation...lots of traffic...obviously, but also a ridiculous fee of $55.00 a day for parking the car in a garage.....and that is not with in and out privileges. Front desk, Concierge. Bell Hop (thank you Mark, you are the best), Front door attendants all gave excellent service. Housekeeping could have been better. I left notes everyday so items would not be overlooked when cleaning the room! The room was spacious by NYC standards, I had the king superior. The view was priceless looking out over time square every morning:) This is an older hotel, a bit on the pricey side but clean and presentable. I would recommend it to my friends and stay here again if the opportunity presents itself. All in all a very good experience and an awesome time in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “it's all about location ...”
Reviews.Author: Eva Z
Reviews.Content: Frist time I came to NYC I stayed here which was in 2006. Nothing special about this hotel other than its great location. Time square is right at the corner and it's located in the heart of all the actions. Room is clean and rather small but got everything you need. Staff are friendly and helpful. Giving how much it costs for one night I think it is a good place to stay when visiting the big apple. I mean you won't spend much time staying in the hotel anyway. THIS IS NEW YORK !!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: mkanddaniel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great if location is what you're looking for - not directly in the middle of the action but literally just a 15 second walk round the corner from hotel to Times Square. From what we saw of the staff they were very friendly although we didn't have to deal with them much as there were no problems with check-in, check-out or the room. We got our room upgraded where we stayed in a lovely 41st floor room which had an excellent view where we could see Times Square. The room was great, we got a king-sized bed which was huge and so comfy! Unless you are unbelievably picky or enjoy spending your entire holiday inside the room, don't listen to the negative reviews.. yes it is not perfect and yes there are bits of ripped wallpaper, worn carpets etc. but the great location so makes up for these small negatives! Definately reccomend this hotel. Oh and make sure you go to Bubba Gump restaurant on Times Square!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: KathleenSanDiego
Reviews.Content: The Millennium Hotel is situated about half a block from Times Square and smack-dab at the center of some mind-blowing NYC hustle and bustle. The hotel is sort of a grand place with a few signs of wear here and there due to its age, but nothing to complain about. Our rooms were nice, although relatavely small, with an outstanding view of the high-rises. We found the staff there to be extremely friendly and accommodating. Our one little teeny gripe is with the elevators. I think Mr. Otis installed these himself because their feel and function is definitely 1940s. These do need to be updated to today's standards, i.e., larger, faster, steadier and air-conditioned. Other than that, we all enjoyed our stay at the Millennium very much.

Reviews.Title: “Milennium Broadway Hotel review”
Reviews.Author: 7acrossthestates
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the thick of Times Square so highly accessible to all the tourist offerings in this area. The staff were lovely, our rooms were great and quite spacious. We had two rooms (large family) and we were given connecting rooms for convenience. Internet is not complimentary here so beware although there are literally 3 MacDonalds within walking distance that offer free connections.

Reviews.Title: “A lot better choices in Times Square.”
Reviews.Author: LawBah
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small. Paid for a superior king room and the only thing superior is that you get to look at the top of other buildings from higher up. The website photos are totally misleading. Front desk personell are rude and completely unmotivated. When housekeeping leaves in the afternoon I hope you don't need anything until they return in the morning. Heard more than once "that area is closed for the night". What a joke. Amenities. What amenities?? We usually stay at the Westin Times Square but wanted to try something different this time. You know what they say - if it ain't broke don't fix it. Next trip back to the Westin for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great for location”
Reviews.Author: KEITH TRAVEL AGENT
Reviews.Content: The location is the main stay in this hotel. The lobby is elegant, but the rooms are only 3 star. Fairly small with a filthy carpet. No tea or coffee in the room. Bed comfortable and bathroom average. Our room was let to someone else during our absence, so we got locked out of our room while they sorted out who it belonged to. (we had already occupied the room for about 6 hours!!). Everything was ok after the mess up, but it does seem strange that someone else has been in your room even for a couple of minutes. The bar is way too expensive with no atmosphere. I paid $11.97 for a beer!!! Ok stay, but won't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: iseestars
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Premier part of the Millennium Broadway, just next door. The lobby was modern, classy and clean, as was our suite. We had an amazing view, partially over Times Square, and our room was lovely and large. We had a separate bath and shower which were both a decent size, although we had a shower curtain (clean - but a glass door would have been more hygienic / in keeping with the decor) and the bath taps initially spurted out questionably coloured water - which did later clear after some running. Staff were helpful and polite throughout our stay. Breakfast was fairly basic - the usual fare for continental - bread, bagels, muffins, preserves, cereal, tea, coffee etc. It could have been improved by adding more space to prepare your buffet breakfast. When the breakfast room was busy, people were left hanging round for ages whilst people balanced their cereal bowls on the limited bar area to pour their milk etc. Overall, I enjoyed our stay in this hotel. It really is a fantastic base to explore NYC and the size of the rooms and facilities (high speed internet, iron and board in each room, sofas and large flat screen TV etc) make it great value for money too. I would be happy to return to the Millennium Broadway.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location 1 min from Time Square. Decent service.”
Reviews.Author: WilsonCh3n
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the hotel is definitely the location - only a minutes walk from Time Square. Being in the heart of New York means that there's plenty of people even in the night, so it's pretty safe. I was able to hang out at Time Square till 1 am and did not once feel unsafe. Room amenities are standard, just that there isn't a hot water boiler. Wireless Internet is available but comes at a price of USD 12.00 per 24 hrs and PER DEVICE. So u pretty much have to hang out at the Starbucks nearby - plenty by the way - if u don't want to pay for wireless Internet. Room size was big by Asian standards, so although the rates are high, the space and the location makes it worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Freddie1203
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the Millenium and our first time in New York. Check in was quick and the receptionist was extremely pleasant and helpful. We were given a corner room on the 28th floor. The room was clean and the view was good. The gentleman who brought our luggage was very friendly and give us some much appreciated advice on shopping, taxi's etc.The location of the hotel is excellent with Times Square just at the end of the street. Two very small niggles, c.8.30 to 9.00 morning be prepared to wait a good five minutes for the lifts, they arrive but are packed. Eventually, we boarded lifts going up just to get a place when it was going back down! Secondly we requested a late check out but the most we were given was an extra hour, when I asked the desk clerk if it was possible to check out mid afternoon he said that it would be classed as an extra day and cost $275! However, all in all the Millenium proved an excellent base for a fantastic week in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, awful service, a little musty.”
Reviews.Author: ninnyninny
Reviews.Content: The location is fabulous, but when we asked for a toothbrush and razor (both complimentary), they said they'd bring it to the room. Never did. Then when we left we asked for them again, waited 20 minutes for them, never came again, missed our train. The room looked nice, but smelled musty. It was more like a 3 star hotel. I'm not chimmin back prilly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jimabbe
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel for the first time and my experience was very positive. Check-in was a breeze. The staff was very friendly and efficient. We were given a room on the 50th floor with a great view and far removed from street noise. The room was nice and clean and the decor was pleasant. Some of the public areas are showing some age but that is a minor quibble. The location can't be beat. It is in the center of everything and there are several nice restaurants on the street. I recommend Cafe Un Deux Trois for pre-theatre dinner or breakfast. it is reasonably priced and has good food. The Millennium has a great location and it is a modern well priced hotel. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Bed and breakfast better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Jayhawk79
Reviews.Content: I booked the package with the view and free breakfast. The price was higher than the Hampton Inn Times Square North, but promised a better view. I stayed at the Hampton last year and was very pleased with it (see my previous review). The Millennium staff was very attentive and congenial. They provided excellent service. I especially liked that they check everyone coming in after 10pm to make sure they are a current guest of the hotel. The breakfast was advertised as a continental breakfast. It was much more. Served buffet-style, selections included cold cereals, yogurt, pastries, fresh fruit, scrambled eggs, omelets, sausage links and bacon, lox, bagels and cream cheese. The hotel location was excellent - just a few steps away from Times Square with entrances on both 44th and 45th Streets. Our room was on the 45th floor. Although we could see only a sliver of Times Square, the room was a nice size and the bathroom was large. I liked that the granite vanity counter could accommodate make-up and toiletries for 2 women with no problem. The photos of the room had me worried that the 2 beds were twin size, but they were actually full size ... and very comfortable. My only criticism is that they charged $12.95 per 24 hours for internet access. With a room rate averaging $500 a night, charging extra for internet access just seems greedy. Since nearly everyone these days needs internet access, the service should be included in the room rate (as it was at the aforementioned Hampton).

Reviews.Title: “Showing its age”
Reviews.Author: DonnPearlman
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Millennium Broadway a half dozen times in recent years. It is conveniently located to the Theater District/Times Square, and usually, the prices are competitive for the location. The staff is friendly and helpful. However, this time I noticed the property is showing its age, such as fraying and even dirty carpets in the elevators and hallways, caulking and chipping problems in the bathroom. I hope it doesn't slip from four-stars to three or even three-and-a-half.

Reviews.Title: “nice view on 46th floor!”
Reviews.Author: Lun100
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for those love just hanging around time square. From the window, I can see Chrysler Bldg, Empire State Bldg and Paramount Bldg and just right besides Toy R Us! Kids have so much fun looking down from the windows and all the people and taxis are look like LEGO. Also get a bird eyes view of July 4th Fire Work from the window as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Harjot Singh S
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through priceline and was worried as i saw some bad reviews. I was surprised at the size of the hotel rooms. We had 2 rooms and both had king size beds. One room had an amazing view of Time Square. The Gym was really good. The only issue i had was that the rooms were not very clean (especially behind the TV etc.. harder to reach areas). Kids really enjoyed the stay. Would definately stay here again. We needed to get to the Airport (Newark), as we were a large party (3 Adults, 3 Kids, 5 bags) the bell boy suggested we get a SUV which worked out much cheaper then 2 taxis. He also arranged it all and it was a good journey to the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy T
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were all very helpful and courteous, especially Miti and Terrance. The hotel is conveniently located near many major subway lines, right by Time Square, and is walking distance to all the broadway shows. The room was clean, had all amenities that we needed, and housekeeping staff were very kind as well. Not to mention we got a great deal by bidding on Priceline.com. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Millennium is the best”
Reviews.Author: Robin K
Reviews.Content: We loved our experience this past week end at this hotel! We were treated so well! The property is top notch, so clean and the location is beyond excellent! We will recommend this to all our friends and we will be back every chance we get! Thank you to a great staff! Well done! Steve and Robin

Reviews.Title: “3 night stay in New York Millenium Broadway”
Reviews.Author: DawnQuorn
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for us by a UK travel company and they did not let us down. The location was superb - right on the doorstep of Times Square and Broadway. The room we had was on the 45th floor and was clean and tidy with everything that we needed. The hotel was used as a base as there was so much to see and do. We did not eat in the hotel but had a drink in the bar. Expensive but what do you expect in this wonderful city. We stayed over the 10th anniversary of 9/11 and there were police everywhere which was good to see.

Reviews.Title: “Got us comfortably through our holiday, needs work though.”
Reviews.Author: DrOmnomlington
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing - no denying that. We were upgraded to a superior, as we informed the hotel staff that we were staying for our anniversary. We were on the 35th floor so had a decent view. The room was decorated to a reasonable standard and we loved our big, comfortable Queen-size bed and nice big flat-screen TV. The bath was stupidly small but adequate and the shower did the job. The main issue was the housekeeping. They didn't replace our shower gel for the whole stay, some days they gave us too many towels, some days we got a bathmat - others we didn't. Our tissue box ran out and rather than remove the old box and replace it, a new was was chucked unopened onto the counter and the empty one left in place in the holder. Our duvet had no cover on it for the entire stay and was covered in yellow stains. As a test, my girlfriend left an empty wrapper on our floor, which remained for the duration. The breakfast was good, and the evening bar service was relaxed, yet friendly and attentive. On entering the hotel, it initially looks grand, then rapidly you begin to realise that it is a bit tired and dull. The whole lobby area smells faintly of urine, the cause being the WCs in the lobby (certainly the mens' in any case) being pretty damn disgusting. We packed our trip and so every day, returned exhausted. We rose early and we were out every day by 8am so we weren't exactly living in our room - if you're doing this and need this location then go for it. If you require comfort, cleanliness and luxury, forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Millenium Broadway.”
Reviews.Author: pmbpmb
Reviews.Content: only reason to stay here is location, location, location. friendly enough staff but the hotel is tired and a cross between somewhere your kids would go for a prom or your exec buddies for a conference...not glamour. rooms not the cleanest, even after we complained...would not go back. sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Times Square!”
Reviews.Author: lilac77grl
Reviews.Content: My good friend stayed her for a conference with her job and invited me to tag along for a Girl's Getaway last May 10'. Being that it was both our first time alone in the city the location of the hotel was perfect. Just a few steps from Times Square and all the Broadway shows! The room was clean and staff was great. I enjoyed my stay so much that I brought my husband back in January 2011. He agreed that the location couldn't be beat! Both trips I took the train in from Albany and had an easy and quick walk (20 minutes) from Penn Station. There's also a nice deli across the street that made it easy to get breakfast in the morning or snacks for the room so you didn't get wacked with pricey hotel food!

Reviews.Title: “Most horrific disgusting hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: NYBusinessTraveler11
Reviews.Content: Room full of smoke smell (even though it was supposed to be a smoke-free room), blanket has hairs in it, towel has blood stain, multiple light bulbs out, staff and manager refuse to help with room switching even though there are multiple vacant rooms, nothing to speak of amenities (toiletries inferior to your road side Day's Inn). horrible service all around, never go there!!!! not in a millennium!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: JannysP
Reviews.Content: It was my first time staying at this hotel and it was good, specially for the location, you are just a couple steps from Times square. If you are looking for a nice place to go sleep afther a long day sight seeing, this one is clean, close to main attractions, have a nice staff and not is not to expensive. The only thing I dint like here was their bed, the matress was to hard, Iam very used to the heavinly beds that the Sheraton or Westin's has.... But out of this our stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: brownie06
Reviews.Content: We got a very good rate for this hotel on priceline.com. The rooms were clean, we had a great veiw of time square and it was minitues away from central park, 30 rock, empire state, central station, shops and restos!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location you could'nt get it better.”
Reviews.Author: Sagsafsar
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel when you just are going to spend the nights there. The location is excellent, I came with my niece from Mexico we felt always very safe. This is a huge hotel with 53 floors and 10 elevators you never have problem getting one. Breakfast is served with a wide variety of choices. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great value”
Reviews.Author: bravehead
Reviews.Content: This older hotel just off of Broadway is a perfect location for everything. Good Morning America is right on the corner and Time Square is just steps away. The hotel is immaculate, and the staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Am going back October 12 and will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: LENN38
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Millennium Broadway with two of my friends,,it was 100 steps to time square it was so local..5 minutes walk to Central park..the hotel was clean and the staff where friendly..would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in NY!!!”
Reviews.Author: blessed1nc
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best trips that our family has taken. The location is perfect. We could look out of our room window and see Ground Zero. It was amazing!!! We were at the entrance to the subways, a lot of eating places in the area and different places within walking distance. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms well kept (even though they were remodeling downstairs). I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is going to that area and I am looking forward to going back :-)

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: gameshow
Reviews.Content: Although New York is a large city, whenever I go I must see at least one show. Because of this and because most of my interests lie within the Times Square area, I looked for hotels within that location. For all the hotels that I researched, I kept coming back to the Millennium Broadway and I am glad I did. It is a beautiful hotel and right in the heart of Times Square. The room on the 46th floor faced 44th St. and I had a view of both Times Square and the Empire State Building. I found it to be very clean (both the room and the bathroom) Check in was quick and efficient. The area I felt was very safe and within walkng distance to everything I wanted to see. It was nice after seeing an evening show not to have to worry about transportation back to the hotel. The only thing I wasn't thrilled with was the price, but hey, this is New York and a first class hotel. It was more than I wanted to spend but found it well worth it. The next time I stay in NYC I won't have to look for any other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet, rooms large but dated and musty, food quality weak.”
Reviews.Author: combebelle
Reviews.Content: As the other reviews say it a great location by Times Square with many small bars ands eateries outside and close to Newark. Reasonable service and pleasant staff, hotel seemed secure and comfortable. Rooms large and good equipment level but room and bath in need of a refresh soon. Aircon is the older type noisy but not loud and the room was musty and soon warmed up if the aircon off. Food in Cahrolotte restaurant was edible when hungry, better in many places nearby. Overall not a bad choice but would look around at 370 a night for room and basic breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location; Beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: amd6551
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night at the hotel and the location was perfect. We were a half-block from the heart of Times Square and Broadway. We had a beautiful room on the 32nd floor with a great view. Very clean and beautifully appointed room. They have a "theatre desk" in the lobby with people who can help you out with tickets, etc. We were able to leave our luggage with the bellmen in locked storage during the day while we explored the city and when we returned; he called a car for us to take us to the airport. Very gracious service. The lobby is dark and a little outdated in my opinion but that doesn't really matter as the room was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than We Could Have Hoped!”
Reviews.Author: Empressw
Reviews.Content: We were dreading our stay based on previous reviews. Our impression of the hotel was quickly changed by Selcuk (sp?) during our checking. He could not have been any more friendly & helpful. We needed extra hangers & housekeeping had them to our room in minutes with a smile. He looked surprised when we gave him a tip. It was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location at Times Square”
Reviews.Author: jefjon1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while visiting NYC and were very pleased with the friendly, helpful staff, wonderful view from our 49th floor hotel room, and location so close to Times Square. We were quickly provided with a pack n' play for our infant son, and a replacement hair dryer when the one in the room was found to be non-functional. My only criticisms are those of superfluous charges to our bill. Though we didn't realize it at first, if you merely open the fridge of the mini-bar in the room you are automatically billed. We were using the fridge to store some baby food and milk and had several charges for items we had not used. Only after several times accessing the fridge did we notice the small sign mentioning the charges. I had also paid for 24hrs of internet service, however was billed not once but all three times I accessed the internet, ie: it was charging me each individual time I connected. These were errors in billing that were corrected at check-out without question, however it is the only reason I gave this hotel 4 stars instead of 5. Had we been in a hurry and not checked the charges, these erroneous charges would perhaps gone unnoticed. I feel these incidents stretch the boundaries of acceptable non-deceptive business practice. Otherwise, wonderful stay and would recommend. Make sure you check your bill!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: hangingout
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my birthday in February for the second time. The rooms are large and clean. The front desk is professional, if a little impersonal. No bother, we got a great rate. The lounge is very nice, just expect NYC prices. The location is awesome. Just steps away from Times Square. We would definately stay here again and probably will next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: JodyMichelle
Reviews.Content: Good location to times square. Not the cleanest hotel I have stayed in. A little tried could do with a good refresh. Though tidy. Staff very pleasant and friendly. No free wi fi . We ordered room service and the tray wasn't not removed from the room, we then placed it outside the room door (as we seen at others doors) the tray was never cleared away the duration of our stay 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel with Superior Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Brenda A
Reviews.Content: I am so pleased to have discovered the Millennium Broadway Hotel and look forward to staying there again where I return to New York. I highly recommend it. The location is right where the action is in Times Square, Theatres, near Central Park, etc. Our room had a beautiful view of Times Square, lovely furnishings, comfortable beds with nice linens, excellent TV and work desk, and was very clean and a spacious room for New York. I always felt safe . The customer service was the best I have ever experienced. After booking my reservation I called the hotel to let them know about my special needs. I spoke with Melanie Turner, Director of the Front Desk. She was delightful in every way and upon our arrival we were greeted with ultimate hospitality. My vacation had to be cut short due to Hurricane Irene evacuations and when I had difficulity getting transportation tickets out of the city, Ms. Turner stepped in and assurred me she and the Hotel would help me in whatever way I needed--she and her staff literally acted like my family away from home as I faced the crisis. When I finally got airline tickets at the last moment, she and her Bellman got us in a cab so we could race to the airport before all mass transit was shut down. Cheerfully, Ms. Turner gave me her card as we left the hotel and she said, "We will refund your other prepaid nights"--and she did! That IS SUPERIOR CUSTOMER SERVICE! Thank you, Melanie Turner and Millenium Broadway Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: madisondj
Reviews.Content: Just one block off of Time Square, this hotel is a bit overpriced for it's value and amenities. The hotel tries to come off as fashionable and hip, but when you take a closer look it's old and outdated. The guest services and staff were unsatisfactory as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: kakalina10
Reviews.Content: If you like the atmosphere of Times Square, this is a good place to stay. Not a 4 star hotel but a nice 3 star. Front desk was friendly and accomodating. Our first room was awful. the beds were old and very uncomfortable. The bedding was old and should never have been used. There was no down left in the down comforter! We asked to be moved the next day and were accomodated. Our next room was what a hotel room should be. Housekeeping should upgrade all the old bedding and beds, then it will be a 4 star hotel. Room service was not very good(food).

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in a central location”
Reviews.Author: GermanWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed there dozends of time, and when staying close to Times Square this is a convenient, clean hotel with a modern timeless look and design, good for business travelers and tourists. The checkin sometimes can be a zoo, and there was no turn-down service with fresh towels last time I stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: Passport-Kid
Reviews.Content: We traveled to NYC in Oct for a long weekend getaway. I have been to New York several times but this was my girls first time visiting. The location was the best I have ever stayed. It is located in the heart of Times Square (keep in mind I love being in the heart of the city). Central Park / broadway shows are all within walking steps of this hotel. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfy. The hotel is pricey but its New York City, everything is expensive!!

Reviews.Title: “great location, but....”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel00
Reviews.Content: We had a great 2 double bed room, comfy beds, & large bathroom. The room had wear and tear with stains on the rug, there were food crumbs which made me think it was not vacuumed. There was a stale, musty odor in the room. The location was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Brokov_Family
Reviews.Content: Stayed her with my husband and 2 kids. It started off a bit of a disaster but everything was quickly sorted. Upon arrival they had double booked our first night stay and had no rooms to check us into so they made arrangements with a nearby 5 star hotel "The Pierre" which was beautiful but completely inconvenient when your flying into New York at 11.30pm with a 6 and4 yo and just want them sleeping! When we returned the following day we were straight in our room and settled quickly to start enjoying our holiday! Hotel was always busy, staff helpful, separate elevators for lower and higher floors, room was small but that didn't matter in New York when there is so much to do. Location was fantastic easy access to everything and 1 minute walk to time square, broadway, cafes, shopping....everything!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location.”
Reviews.Author: BridgeMo
Reviews.Content: The hotel showed signs of age with spots on the walls and wear on the bed frame, but the room itself was comfortable, bathroom nice, features great. The mini-bar is on some sort of sensor so when you move things around (or try to cool off your own bottles) the hotel tries to charge you as if you drank them. They clear up the charges when you check out, but it can create frustration for you and the front desk. The location was everything. As close to the middle of Times Square without being in the thick of it. We were on the 29th floor, one above where the view steadily improves, and had a decent view. Couldn't really see much of Times Square as advertised but had more to look at than someone else's room or office across the street. Saw a show, had dinner, explored, did some touristy things, and all without needing public transportation. Easily within walking distance of Grand Central, a little farther if coming from Penn, entrances on two streets and affordable with a deal from Travelzoo. As someone who has stayed with friends in Queens or Long Island or Brooklyn, it was a welcome change to be in mid-town. I recommend this place especially if there is a deal going on.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Ciara01
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel with a lovely foyer and public area. Concierge service was very helpful with maps and directions. There were 2 great things about our hotel, the first was that we could see the crystler building from our room - amazing view! and the second was that we were right off time square! Locatrion couldn't be better for getting out and exploring the city on foot. Staff at the hotel were friendly and they had a left luggage facility so that we didn't have to drag our (multiple) shopping bags around with us on our final day. They even let us use the gym changing room to freshen up before our flight!

Reviews.Title: “horrible hotel will not be going back”
Reviews.Author: bally t
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for 7 days. excellent location on door step of times square. took over an hour for us to get checked in, they could not find our reservation on there system. reception staff not very helpful. after few phone calls we finally got key to our room. size wise room was ok. very dusty, had not been cleaned, the bathroom smelt of urine, the bath tub looked like it had never been cleaned. the shower head was all rusted, it was disgusting, this place is not a 4star hotel as advertised, more like 2 star. it was not worth the money we paid, will never go back, and never recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very "chic" hotel”
Reviews.Author: mirsini80
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Especially the rooms which have view to Crysler Building! Very cosy and big room, clean in the heart of Manhattan, two steps from Times Square and the broadway theaters! I would definitely stay there again, if i find again the offer with the better price.

Reviews.Title: “Big everything - but don't use their fridge !”
Reviews.Author: Raynboz
Reviews.Content: Room 3911 had a big comfortable bed. A big TV and great views as a corner room. No free wifi in the Hotel. Crazy. We put some chocolate in the room fridge. It is removed, and taken from our room. We were told that it was not allowed but for their products (very expensive) only. Weird. Good location right next to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: VS1711
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel three times so far this month. The location is perfect for tourists with excellent connections and a lot of the sights in easy walking distance. I had different rooms each time, one was great (4401 - King bed on the corner of the 44th floor), one was small and cramped (1701 - same corner on the 17th floor) and the other was not very memorable. It's right by Times Square, so it can be noisy, but the higher the room the less the noise. Service was good, friendly staff at the front desk (by the third trip they remembered me, which I found pretty impressive for such a big and busy hotel) and it was decent value for money. NYC hotels can be a bit of a lottery, I'm glad I know about this place now.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Jo6142
Reviews.Content: The location was amazing! The only problem i had with the hotel was when i checked in, the bathroom and mini bar weren't restocked. TIP* Don't take the bottles out of the mini fridge so that you can place your own items in there. All the items are censored and will be automatically charged! Many people complained about the bed being too hard, but i didn't have a problem with it and my bed at home is soft. I had a kind bedroom on the 29th floor and the room was huge for a NYC room. I'll definitely be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Another fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: MomOfTravellers
Reviews.Content: This is our tenth stay and it's definitely become our home away from home. Large, clean, comfortable rooms with incredible views (ask for a high floor). I can't say enough about this place. Steps from Times Square (but on a side street), the theatres, and a great subway station that has tons of lines. Kudos to Terence, Tim, Mark, Kelly and all the wonderful staff. We'll be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great front desk team”
Reviews.Author: Hansh1
Reviews.Content: Great stay in this perfect located hotel. This hotel has a great front desk team taking care of guests

Reviews.Title: “(almost) no complaints”
Reviews.Author: experimentaltraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a classy hotel in a perfect location. We got a great rate by naming it on Priceline. We definitely got our money's worth! (Wouldn't have felt like that if we had paid $350-400 per night). The front desk staff were pleasant. In fact all the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. The maid took some pictures for us, and the bellman was very helpful in arranging for car service and storing and retrieving our luggage. We were unable to get our requested king bed, but the queen was very comfortable. I was surprised to have no free internet without signing up for their loyalty program...it leaves a bad taste. As they say in realty, location, location, location...this one has it in spades!

Reviews.Title: “Decent place for New York City, some plusses, some minuses”
Reviews.Author: BFMcLaughlin
Reviews.Content: Well, to put it simply, if I'd paid 230 bucks (corporate rate) for this place ANYWHERE else in the country, I'd give it a 2 or a 3 at best, but I know that in NYC, things are different (i.e. -- expensive). To me, in my neck of the woods in Florida, this is an 80-90 dollar room -- but consider the positives. You're in a nice, safe place in Midtown Manhattan, right off Times Square. You're going to pay for that, obviously -- and we did. My room was small -- it was in the "premier" section. It was nice, just small. I faced 44th Street, right next to the famous theatre. The good stuff? Classy place downstairs, no doubt. Lots of options in the building -- food, shopping, you name it. My room was solid -- impressive bathroom, good sleeping bed. The business/desk was average and the chair was one of the most uncomfortable I've ever had to work from, that was one thing. It just didn't seem to be set up for anything somebody would need to work from, business wise -- but hey, it's probably more for tourists, so I'll give them the benefit of the doubt. The room service was expensive as hell, like everything is in NYC -- but I will say this, the food was OUTSTANDING and very, very fast. They say 30 minutes but they're there in 10-15 each time. Great food. Nice people too. I'm clueless about cabs and all of that, being from the south, so I called the concierge about 5 times the night before I left before I got a human being to give me some advice. Thought that was weird for a place this classy downstairs. Front desk always referred me to the concierge too, so it was a bit of a runaround. All things considered, the location of course is outstanding, the rooms are solid, you name it. I'd definitely go back if I come through that part of NYC -- since this IS NYC. ALSO, here's some important info --- do NOT pay more than 40ish for a cab to La Guardia. I got duped into 55. The clerk said he's seen non-locals get screwed over for as much as 250 (wow). Just keep in mind -- 40 from La Guardia and about 50-55 from JFK. Stand firm.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel & so handy for an NYC break”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MHB from 23rd July to 1st August and couldn't have been more impressed. The room was spacious, clean, had a big bathroom, everything was in good order, and the view over the city was pretty good too. The location can't be faulted as it's so close to so many attractions, and is also convenient to the Times Square subway station, Grand Central, 42 St Port Authority, so transport is very easy. Broadwat shows, Empire State, Rockefeller Centre etc are all within walking distance so taxis aren't required at the end of a night out. Also the streets (44th & 45th) on which the hotel is located are reasonably quiet, so sleeping wasn't a problem. I requested a quiet room and got one - on the 41st floor. We had very little interaction with the staff but on every occasion they couldn't have been more polite or helpful. Therefore, I honestly don't know where the negative comments are coming from! I can't wait to get back to NYC and if the MHB offers a similar rate that's where I'll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: virgo21
Reviews.Content: Location - as all the other reviews have said - is perfect. Its right off Times Square and its central manhatten to whether you are going north, south, east or west you are pretty much travelling the shortest distance to these places. The hotel itself is old but in my opinion they have been maintaining it. Things that give away the hotels age is the elevators and the bathroom fixtures. However the hotel is doing cosmetic upgrades so our room in terms of design looked modern. The TV was a flat screen so its not like you are watching a tube tv. The room was clean, the beds were comfy. Couple things about the room - 1. the lighting, I found the lighting in the room wasn't very adequete - not a biggie. 2. our tub was not draining properly. It got to the point where water was standing at a couple of inches and we called from desk. They sent someone up who unclogged it a BIT. Basically it went from being clogged to where water wasnt draining to the point where it was draining but still gathering a bit towards the first third of the tub. I just aimed the shower head towards the back of the shower and stood there. 3. no free wifi 4. we needed a wine opener - they charged us $3 to have one sent up to our room - that was a little random. In terms of staff - everyone was really nice and helpful - from the front desk to the bell boys. I have no complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “Had an absolutely wonderful stay!!”
Reviews.Author: TheWongClan
Reviews.Content: When I had received this hotel through Priceline I was worried from reading all the negative reviews. Since it was a trip to celebrate an anniversary I emailed Melanie Turner since I was quite impressed she actually sometimes responds to reviews (which all hotels should do!). Anyways, she replied to my email and assured me that we would be well taken care of and she really did follow through! We arrived early in the afternoon and understood we were too early for check in but the front desk was very helpful and stored our bags for us until our room was ready. When we finally checked in we were so happy to find out we were on the 50th floor with a beautifully appointed corner room (just like the ones pictured on their website) that overlooked Times Square. The room was a very good size especially for NYC standards. We were able to access the Wi Fi with little difficulty. BIG TIP: Ask to join the Loyalty program (for free) and have all your daily Wi Fi charges reversed!!! The bathroom was also a very good size, very clean and there was a coffee maker with a variety of coffee/teas. No trouble finding an ice bucket either in the room. The beds were actually quite comfortable and not too firm at all. We discovered that housekeeping makes rounds fairly early in the morning so we made sure we had our Do Not Disturb sign out to prevent them from knocking. I can't say enough about the PERFECT locaiton!!! Great for sight seeing and being close to all the conveniences. Overall, we found that every staff we came across always greeted us and everyone was very helpful and pleasant. We would definately stay here again in the future!!!! Thank you again to Melanie Turner for ensuring we had a wonderful room and stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Broadway Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scottsacto
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel every year for the past 5 years. The location is perfect for theatre goers. Rooms are super spacious and comfortable beds. Concierage staff is VERY helpful and knowledgable. Some rooms are a bit threadbare--but clean. Maintenance staff is very efficient--if you do have a problem---they are right there to see that it is handled.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: smilielyn
Reviews.Content: On 7/23/11 I checked in & although I requested a room with 2 double size beds. I was given a small room with a king size room. I contacted the front desk to inform them that I had booked my room way in advance & specifically requested 2 double beds in which the representative had said it would not be a problem that I will definitely have 2 double beds. Well at check in time, the gentleman who checked me in was not only rude & unpleasant with no social skills but told me I would have to settle for the room that was assigned since they did not have any rooms available with double beds. When I requested to speak to a facility manager, he said they were too busy and there was no one available to assist me. After 2 uncomfortable night sleep I contacted the front desk & requested a room with double beds. The lady who took care of me was much nicer & had me in a room within a short time. I was very disappointed in the customer service. service I received & feel that people who deal with the public should have better professional social skills. Especially when your paying a rather high price per night. This was my first time staying at this hotel & feel that the staff should have at least tried to do their best to make my stay a pleasant & comfortable one. One other thing, the rooms I was given didn't even have a comforter. A satin curtain like bedspread was available which wasnâ€™t warm or comfortable the fact that I was unable to even speak to a hotel mgr was absurd. I have never heard or exp a stay like this. Until this date i have yet to receive a return call from the front desk manager.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: LizinON
Reviews.Content: We booked the special travelzoo rate. Great deal for the location of this hotel. Rooms do need some maintenance as some wall paper was peeling off the bathroom wall and tub spout was coming off the wall. We did not use the valet parking as it is very expensive, We just parked down the street at a fraction of the price. Overall great stay!

Reviews.Title: “An Honest Assessment”
Reviews.Author: DeepBlueGoalie
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in July 2011. Got a special internet rate, much less than the quoted rate from the hotel itself. First and foremost, the location can't be beat. If you want to be close to Times Square, this is a great pick. It's also a short walk from Radio City Music Hall and Rockerfeller Center. The hotel itself was clean and we found the staff to be helpfull whenever we had a request. (ie: extra towels, directions etc) The one issue with our particular room was the lay-out. We had a corner room, and the space was designed in a way that there was no way to have the bathroom door open if you wanted to enter/exit the room. If one person is drying their hair in the bathroom, and the other wants to step out to get ice, the bathroom door had to be shut to get out, and remain shut until the person returned. Sounds minor, but got very annoying after awhile. The only other beef I would have was the bed. We didn't find them overly comfortable. Overall, this hotel was one that I would stay at again, but not unless I got it at a discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Home sweet home....with a little dust :)”
Reviews.Author: yumyumguy
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th or 5th visit to NY and an equal amount of returns to this hotel. I think my first stay was right after they had remodeled the hotel and they were looking for guests. We fell in love and continue to see each other each time I get back. The front manager, Melanie, made all the difference on this visit. I had my 80 year old in-laws up for their anniversary and she was amazing with her accommodations. They are still talking about how great the hotel was and how awesome it was to walk out and stroll right onto Times Square. My service gal on our floor was also great and very quick to help with anything we needed. Fair balance prompts me to at least mention a couple things. There are a few things warn down or broken that need some attention in the rooms.
