And although our rooms were very clean and tidy, there are small areas of the room that need special attention to remove dust and some weare and tear. AND NO BED BUGS!!!! Yippy. You can get some great room rates if you plan ahead and stay diligent. We're hoping to return in September or October and rest assured the Millennium Broadway is in the plans.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: YesWeDid
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the epicenter of all the action, try out the Millenium (or the Marriott across the street). Basically on Times Square but without the noise. As you know if you're in Times Square, the Theaters, Restaurants, and 5th Avenue are a few steps away. Use the Theater Desk to book tickets. We didn't and wished we had. The hotel staff was great but its a large hotel (600+ rooms) so patience is a virtue for some things. We 'timed' it perfectly for 100 degree July weather but the AC was dependable. While the room was pleasant and clean, don't expect opulence. We had a Superior Room and ignored the hard bed and pancake pillows. You can upgrade to a Club room which might be worth it. All in all, decent value for the money and great location which we all know (in NYC and everywhere else) matters!

Reviews.Title: “Eh...”
Reviews.Author: lilysdads
Reviews.Content: Here on business for two nights. Had stayed at this property in the past and liked it. Was placed in the Premiere section which is a separate building that you need cut through the Hudson Theatre lobby to access. Room was fine, nothing "premiere" about it though and the fact that this section of the building has no in room wi-fi access became a problem. I try to only travel with my iPad now and it was unusable (no stable cell reception either). Cocktail hour and free breakfast nice touches but this is 2011 - get some wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel, stay elsewhere, not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Glamanda
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel for business and agree with all the negative reviews on the site. Yes the location is good but the room was poor condition from the dirty bathroom to the very stained, worn out carpet. I struggle to see how it is 4 star, the room was more like a 2 star motel. The front desk service was equally poor as my room was booked by the company and they had no record of this. The next day, I re-checked with another person on reception got a different story - my booking was recorded and it was in the system that the room charges would be settled by the company. Upon check-out it was confirmed that room costs would be settled by the company so I was not given an invoice and did not sign anything. Upon my return home, I was very surprised to see USD700 of room charges on my personal credit card bill! It seems that their systems / reception people had no idea what was going on. I have since heard that the same thing has happened to other people. However, the bell desk staff were friendly and helpful when I needed to store my bag and ask directions but not enough to offset the generally bad experience of staying here. I travel frequently for business and this has to be one of the worst hotel experiences that I have ever had. If it weren't for the location, I am not sure how they maintain those prices and a 4 star rating!

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit as Good as the First”
Reviews.Author: rmatto
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days during one of the hottest periods in NY history. The hotel is right in the theater district, between 44th and 45th. There are exits to both streets which was a nice feature. Central Park is walking distance (about 8 blocks north) and of course all of Times Square, the theaters, and restaurants of Hell's Kitchen on 9th street are a short walk as well. There are Subway stations nearby, or taxis are easy to get right in front of the hotel if you prefer that. The rooms are nice and modern, with a flat screen tv and cable. The bed was very comfortable and had a nice fluffy comforter on it. Traffic noise was minimal and never kept us up at night. We were on the 32nd floor and had a nice view of the Chrysler building and the Times Square new year's ball. I think there are 52 floors total. The rooms aren't that big, but big rooms in NY are not that common. There was plenty of room for our 2 suitcases, a king sized bed, a dresser, a table, a chair, and a closet to hang up some clothes. The room was cleaned every day and fresh towels were left. The only negative was when we arrived there were ashes on the floor of the bathroom, like someone had been smoking in there earlier in the day. Not a big deal. No coffee machine in the room. The mini fridge was packed so no room for our bottled water. We used the ice bucket as our "cooler". There is also a 24 hour gym on premises if you didn't get enough walking in during the day. So if you are looking for quiet, clean, and safe in the theater district this is a great spot. It was about a 30 minute ride from La Guardia airport. We cabbed it to the hotel and took a sedan service back, both ran a little over $40. As a tip, the breakfast at the hotel restaurant (Charlotte) is expensive. You are better off going out the 45th street exit and hanging a right. A few doors down across the street are two really good delis that will make you french toast, egg sandwiches,etc as well as a fresh fruit bar. It's a 2 minute walk and will save you about 20 bucks every morning. There is a Starbucks on the street too.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: tracygardnerbeno
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the perfect location, only a block from Times Square. It is elegant and the customer service was excellent. The concierge was tireless in helping us with all of the different sight-seeing and subway navigation questions we had. The room was actually spacious by NYC standards, very clean and had all the amenities we needed. Only complaint was finding a couple very tiny ants in the bathroom, but we were so busy running around the city I don't think we ever even addressed it until we left.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Showing age a bit. Well worth 150/night”
Reviews.Author: mwfloral
Reviews.Content: Great location for this hotel if you get a GREAT rate via priceline or other discount website. We paid around 150.00 per night 7/12 - 7/16. Location cant be beat. You are steps from times square. Rooms are spacious by NY standards. Rooms are starting to show a bit of wear. Beds are extremely firm.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elliot16
Reviews.Content: Stayed during restaurant week. Employees very friendly. Location in Times Square is amazing. Great value too.

Reviews.Title: “4 Stars Too Many”
Reviews.Author: nmoustache
Reviews.Content: The only thing worth 4 stars about this hotel is it's location. I was greeted by "Sasha" at the front desk w/ a , "Ya?" as though how dare I interrupt his conversation with a cowoker. After giving me my room key without any form of welcome whatsoever, we went up to the room only to find it reeked of smoke. We had asked for non-smoking. Apparently this WAS a non-smoking floor. Fine, I understand they cannot control their patrons actions as times, but haven't they ever heard of Frebreeze? Additionally there were makeup stains on the bedsheet which looked as though they had not even been changed. They exchanged our room without hesitation. We didn't spend too much time in the room as we were only there for one night & by the time I had a chance to look over things, it was 12am. I used the restroom only to find there was a constant dripping on my back from above. There was a clear wet spot in the ceiling coming most likely from the bathroom above. Gross. When I called to speak with someone I was "transferred" to the Front Desk Manager, which apparently means I sit on hold for 5 min while the phone rings. It's was 12am. I can't imagine it was very busy down there. I called again and before I could explain I was again transferred to an endless number of rings. I gave up until about an hour later when I actually went downstairs. The manager sent up a plumber, after I tried explaining to him that the toilet was not the problem, and a plumber wouldn't help. I would've thought they would have at least offered to switch rooms. Instead, a plumber was sent up at 1am who was expecting a toilet issue and immediately realized there was nothing he could. To make matters worse this was the most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept in. My partner and I both woke up with back pains and we have both stayed in a variety of hotels. I will certainly not be staying here again. They also charge $12.99 for internet access?!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: buttercup1211
Reviews.Content: I was reading some mixed reviews about this hotel after I booked so and was getting a little scared and was expecting to be disappointed. Fortunately, I wasn't. Check in was a breeze. We got a standard king size room overlooking Times Square. This is probably the biggest hotel room I've ever been in. There are 2 chairs in the room, a study desk and a flat screen tv. The bathroom is huge! Lots of counter space. The amenities list show that there is a mini-fridge in the room but this is a little deceiving. The fridge is filled with drinks and is motion sensitive. Once you remove or even just move anything in the fridge, you get charged automatically. Which means you can't use the fridge to store personal things. It says to call housekeeping if you need a fridge but it doesn't say that they'll charge you a flat fee of $25 for it. Same for the snacks in the drawer, be careful to not move anything if you don't intend on buying them. The elevators were a little old but they were still fast. The location was awesome. There are two entrances to the hotel, one on 45th and one on 44th. The hotel was right next to a Starbucks, and this is where we went to get free wi-fi instead of paying for it at the hotel. The hotel is right next to Times Square, a few blocks away from Rockefeller Centre, Grand Central Terminal and Central Park. There are lots of subway stations and bus stops nearby as well. If you want to be near where all the action is, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job plus some!”
Reviews.Author: BrownLibra
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotwire. I didn't find out the name until it was booked. I was a little apprehensive after reading some of the reviews but it was bedbug free and that was all that mattered, so I was happy. We only needed one night after a cruise so I wasn't too concerned with much else. However, we were pleasantly surprised with how close this was to Times Square! Like, 1 minute walk close! Very impressed especially since I got the hotel for $129!! We were also impressed with the room (31.03) -- we happened to get a corner suite and out of one window we saw the Empire State Building and the other window looked down into Times Square -- doesn't get more New York than that! It was a good size as well. We arrived earlier than checkout time but they were more than willing to hold our luggage with no issue while we shopped! I found the hotel quite clean except for yes, there was some dust on the window ledge and around the lamps -- big whoop but I guess that really bothers some people. I for one would rather deal with a little dust in a great and otherwise clean location. The linens were clean, the towels were clean, and the bathroom was fairly clean, so I was good. Front desk was helpful when we needed a ride to Newark Airport in Jersey by booking us an air shuttle service that saved us quite a bit of money. All in all a great experience -- and the price just couldn't be beat! One thing I remember was that Internet access was ridiculously expensive, so I wasn't impressed with *that*.

Reviews.Title: “a blanket with blood stain”
Reviews.Author: brucebana
Reviews.Content: The morning after my arrival i discovered a blood stain on the blanket. Manager promised to change the blanket, but they just turned it over! It took 5 phone calls to get a clean blanket.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice amenities, shows wear and tear”
Reviews.Author: travelguyrpk448
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millennium 7-21-7-22-11, check in was cumbersome and slow, however I found the staff overall to be pleasant once we got to the front of the queue. The common areas, hallways, elevators, carpets, etc showed wear and tear, scuff etc. The hotel was otherwise clean. The room was acceptable with updated countertops, nice corner city view and a 40 inch flatscreen, The mattress (king) was firm but comfortable, the pillow was rock hard, there was no complementary water or coffee maker in the room, only an overpriced minbar with pressure sensors (watch out!). Problem: The bathroom had a sewage smell that seemed to seep out from the sink or toilet periodically. We had to close the bathroom door when we slept so we were not overrun. I complained about this at checkout and the they said they would send up housecleaning! I recommended a plumber-this was sewage gas! Other than the smell of sewage, the room was otherwise acceptable. The concierge was very friendly and made us dinner reservations at an excellent rest, the bellman and in hotel rest. staff were also very friendly, I would have given 4 stars if not for the smell-hopefully that was a fluke due to heatwave?-although I notice now some other reviews about it - beware 20th floor! Location was excellent and close to all in Times Square-one block from shopping, Starbucks, and Swatch Store. Got the rate on Hotwire for very cheap so overall good experience for city. FYI Parking $55 per 24 hours which is about par for the course in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel + super location + reasonably priced for NYC”
Reviews.Author: pujapp
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just a minute walk away from the madness of Times Square yet close enough to all the action. Though we had booked the Millenium, they put us up at their sister property: The Premier, which is the hotel adjacent to Millenium. Rooms were good sized for NYC, cleaniliness was good. Check in was a little slow as they was a huge group checking in at the same time, the front desk seemed surprisingly short staffed for the weekend The breakfast spread was questionable. Only juices, cereal and breads were served. That was a let down. So in my honest opinion don't pay extra for that non existant breakfast, there are tons of small eateries around the hotel so go out and eat! Over all the location kinda made up for everything :)

Reviews.Title: “Simply the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: mayellwood
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel ever!!!!! I have just returned back to Australia from my fifth trip to NYC. During each stay of two weeks I have stayed at the Millennium on Broadway. The hotel provides an extremely high level of accommodation by a group of staff who provide a high caliber of service. In particular, there is Philip, Gloria and Erica at the concierge desk who always welcome you with a smile and a cheery greeting.They go out of their way to help in whatever you may need or want. Nothing is ever too much. Arleen at the theatre desk who is a wealth of knowledge of the best things to see in NYC. She's a delight with her happy and fun disposition. Melanie,the front desk manager who organised a food platter to be delivered to my room upon arrival. This was a most appreciated added touch after a very long flight from Australia. Finally I'd like to make particular mention of Robert Bove, the first person one encounters when making a reservation. He provides such a high level of professionalism that within an instant you just know that an experience at the Millennium Hotel is guaranteed to be positive, smooth and happy. Nothing is ever too much for him to make a guest's stay as perfect as possible. If you're looking for location, service, cleanliness and an oustanding group of employees then there's no point in looking past the Millennium Hotel. Bravo Millennium!

Reviews.Title: “Would Def. Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Girly13662
Reviews.Content: I live on long island and had to travel into the city for a seminar. I decided to make a little weekend out of it so I need a cheap place to stay at for one night near Times Square. I got the deal on hotels.com and was pleased at the location and price. It is conveniently located right around the block from Times Square and my request for a high floor room was granted. Great view overlooking Times Square, and very nice staff. While I do agree that the room is very small (should be expected in NYC), and slightly dated (the bathroom needs a makeover), it was clean, and very nice. I would def. stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Like 100 other reviews of this Hotel, Rude and disrespectful staff”
Reviews.Author: gdmard
Reviews.Content: I would like to say that I travel to New York, Boston and New Jersey at least once per month, and this has been the worst staff/employees I could ever encounter. I checked in at the Hotel and the receptionist was rude, I am familiar with this type of service and I know when to expect it or not, in this case, I was blown away by the type of responses I was getting. We cannot help you, you can ask the doorman, it's up to the service guy, we don't help you in such and such... NO, we don't want you to ask for your car again, because we will charge you for an extra full day if you request it, you understand?.. we can't request your car right now, we have many customer in the reception line... you need to be on the 1st floor right now if you want your car... we don't have time to tell you the specials, read the menu on your room... didn't you have a Millenium breakfast? don't you know how much that is? look at the line!... In any event, I asked my wife to wait for me on the side so that she didn't hear any of this, this trip was for personal travel, not for business, so I felt sad, angry and like I was one of many guests, I never felt welcomed, or like I was treated with some type of importance, it seems the staff doesn't want to deal with you, and actually would like to speak to customer as least as possible. The room felt old, but it was clean, the only reason I think this would be a 4 star hotel would be 3 things: location, building layout (lobby, furniture, beds) and restaurant. The room felt like a 2.5 star hotel, the elevators were old, the location is the only good thing about the hotel, and probably the staff know this.

Reviews.Title: “This is a terrible hotel with extremely rude staff.”
Reviews.Author: Kajal361
Reviews.Content: The room is a hotwire mystery hotel and it is in a good location if your a first time tourist to NYC . Otherwise the service is horrible and the hotel is old and gross. The lights went out 5 times during our 4 night stay. The staff took about 30 minutes to fix it everytime because apparently it wasn't a big enough issue to them. We selected a room for 3 people and they gave us a room with 1 full size bed. We had to battle them for a roll away, because they weren't going to give us that. To top it off when were leaving the baggage guy was extremely rude and refused to give us our bags. Overall this is a great hotel for you if you don't care about service ,cleanness, and comfort!

Reviews.Title: “Location is not all they have, but they sure do have that!”
Reviews.Author: Familytraveling09
Reviews.Content: This is a huge (50 stories plus) magestic old style luxury hotel. If is not up to the highest fliers these days, it is still a great place to stay in New York City. We requested and received a Times Square View. Our room was only 30 stories up, but we had a spacious, corner king room with windows on two sides that aforded a view (not totally unobstructed, but still very exciting and definitely worthwhile) of Times Square and all its action and crowds. The room had good lighting, plenty of comfortable and solid furniture, big TV, great large and clean bath rooms, and our room was very quiet. It did smell like someone had been smoking in our supposedly non-smoking room, but we only noticed that when the AC had been off awhile, so it was not overpowering and quickly dissipated away once we turned that up a bit. The maid skipped cleaning our room the day the Do not Disturb sign was out past noon, (although we were out all afternoon after that) but at least she/he did not wake my sleeping daughter. The front desk was pleasant and efficient, bell service stored our bags without a hitch, concierge was not overly friendly but did help us out when asked, and the room was clean, functional and very comfortable...actually the bed, blankets and pillows could be improved, but they were usable. Very nice stay I would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Masha175
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 weeks traveling across the US and spending almost every night in a new hotel. So we have been in 11 hotels altogether. The Millennium Broadway was the worst: paid Internet (whereas in 90% of the other hotels it was free) which does not hold for more than 5-10 mins every hour. The rest of the time they put you to some out-of-the-country technical support which promises to fix it "soon". In the meantime there are cockroaches running across the desk. I called the front desk about it and got an answer "I will tell my manager". So if you need Internet and/or do not appreciate cockroaches in your room never go to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice, Clean and Spacioius Room Just Off Times Square”
Reviews.Author: NY_Guy_Traveling
Reviews.Content: My wife, baby son and I spent two nights in the Millennium during our trip to New York. I chose the hotel due to a really inexpensive rate via Travelzoo. It was a positive experience and, if the price was right, I'd definitely stay there again. The room (and the bathroom) was large, clean and nice. There are small instances of wear and tear, not enough to bother me (and I'm picky about cleanliness and newness), but enough that I could see someone be unhappy if they paid a lot for the room or were expecting a five-star hotel experience (the Millennium feels like a solid four-star-level hotel to me). The room included a standard size safe, a flat screen TV, and two leather easy chairs. There was plenty of room for my son's mini crib, with room left over. We never felt cramped. The front desk people were nice and helpful, including letting us check in early. We did have trouble getting the mini crib delivered to our room (it took three calls over three or four hours to get it done, even though I reserved the crib as part of the reservation and confirmed it upon check in), but the front desk clerk we spoke to last and the guy who eventually delivered the crib both apologized and seemed upset that it took so long. And it was the decisive action of the front desk clerk that eventually got the crib delivered. The hotel had several computers on the second floor on which you could buy Internet access, but it was free to print boarding passes, which was a nice amenity. I didn't eat or drink in the lobby bar, but it looked nice, and there was a little sundry/gift shop in the lobby that was nice to have (we bought some drinks there). The location of the hotel, 44th between Sixth and Seventh, is convenient for mass transportation, as there is virtually no subway line you can't easily access from there. But the hotel is in the heart of Times Square, as it is much closer to Seventh than Sixth, so that means hordes of tourists. There are some neighborhood delis on 45th between Fifth and Sixth, as well as a Duane Read drugstore (that had some food items) on Sixth between 44th and 45th, so you can avoid Times Square to some extent to find what you might need. But make no mistake: This hotel is in Times Square (some will like this fact, I'm sure, while others will not). The little snafu with the mini crib aside, we had a great experience at the Millennium, and we would be happy to stay there again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value & location”
Reviews.Author: richnbj
Reviews.Content: Could not have been happier with our recent stay. Everyone we had contact with exceeded our expatiations. The front desk staff were very efficient and helpful. The rooms, while not what you could call large, were very adequate and clean. Best of all was the location. Just 1/2 block from Times Square. It does not get any better. The next time we visit NYC, this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Excellent Service and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: thesupergoodlife
Reviews.Content: On arrival me and my friends were very tired after a good 8 hour flight so it was nice to see the door man enthusiastically take out bags and into the hotel we went. The lobby is clean and airy with a welcoming feel. The desk staff were extremely friendly and took our details and knew who we were with ease. Our rooms were perfect, very clean and everything worked perfectly. Lots of towels in the bathroom with a clean bath tub and sinks. Stayed for 5 nights with only 1 call to room service which was dealt with fast. Before staying I read some reviews on here talking about the beds. I am one who doesn't mind a hard bed but if you have prefer a soft bed then you might find this a problem. On this note the bed sheets were always clean and the pillows were perfect. My only problem was there was no free wi-fi, if this was included the hotel would be perfect! Overall highly recommended, thank you Millenium Broadway, I shall be staying again next time I'm in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, unprofessional, rude”
Reviews.Author: ryelex
Reviews.Content: We paid for a King Club room at the Premier Hotel (their newer hotel next door), but we were put in the older tower (Millennium Hotel), in a dirty room full of smoke ash on the desk and chair, carpet with water stains, walls with water stains and stained sheets. When we asked to be moved to the Premier, which is what we reserved and paid for, we were given an attitude and downgraded in a Queen room. We paid for a King, but they gave us something less. Front desk staff is rude and I can't believe for a hotel at this caliber, has the nerve to not honor what was paid for and staff are not willing to fix the problem. Shame.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: jennypenny12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend for a New York weekend. I'm giving this hotel a "very good" because of the location. Being in the heart of Times Square made it very easy to have access to the shows, restaurants, and the subway. We were on the 49th floor and had a great view of the city. Staff was friendly. Now onto the con's: The room was nicely appointed. We had 2 beds that I thought were going to be doubles when I reserved them, but they ended up being singles. The bathroom had no fan, so not only did it fog very easily, it had a constant faint mildewy smell. There were a lot of kids lounging in halls at all hours (it seemed they were with a tour group). Overall, I think I would stay there again because of the location and the value.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Masonpips
Reviews.Content: Won this via Hotwire at a decent price for the location. But there was hair in the bathroom behind the door, the room felt kind of gross (carpeting mainly) and the beds were TINY. How they were considered doubles was beyond me. At check-in, only one room of our booked 2 room stay was available. The clerk, when asked about bypassing the LONG line to check back for Room 2 later, replied "you'll have to wait, everything in life requires a wait". THIS was our check-in/first impression. Ummm, NOT customer-service friendly. Our TV went out and a lightbulb was burned out. This took 3 separate trips to have both fixed and when the TV was pulled out from the wall, the NASTY debris under the dresser was sickening. The room was VERY hot although we had the A/C at 60 for 4 days straight and kept the blinds closed. The hotel was overrun w/a tourist group and the last 2 days were horrible in getting elevators. Just be warned if you see a huge group milling in the non-existant lobby that you're in for a wait. There were 1,000 in town, we probably had 200+ of them at the hotel. All trying to visit each other in their rooms and meet in the Lobby at the same time. Although the location to Times Square is excellent, I really didn't feel this hotel had anything else going for it. In fact, if I would use Hotwire again, I would purposely NOT choose Times Square area just to avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not a 4 star, Hotwire price was not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: jbrams
Reviews.Content: The location is great for tourists hitting New York for a first or second time - particularly if you want to see some shows and Time Square. The room was relatively clean (expected better from a 4 star though) and the bed was large with elegant bedding. Our room was on the corner of the hotel with an incredible view (which was blocked out by thick curtains when we wanted which was necessary given the BRIGHT lights from the billboards). However, there were many minor to middling issues: The room was cleaned but there were stains on the bathroom wall, on the shower curtain, and on the wall just past he entry. I joked that they could be blood but my wife suggested red wine. The headboard to the bed was nice, but three of the buttons (little black square tiles sewn into the matting) were loose on their threads, two of them hanging sadly down. There were quite a bit of dust gathered around the bed legs where the vacuum clearly didn't reach ... clean enough to walk around on because my feet weren't going to touch their if the vacuum couldn't, but not exactly fresh. There were two pillows on each side of the bed, but the orange pillows were so hard as to be useless! The bathroom was the biggest disappointment. If it was a 2-3 star hotel it would have met me expectations: not terribly small but clean towels and bottles of soap, shampoo, and conditioner. However, the floor and toilet bowl had some caulking stuck to them that could've been removed with some elbow grease or a razor. The lighting grate over the sink was quite dusty and misaligned (I pushed it into place for them). Internet for $12.99/day? That's simply unreasonable these days, there were free wifi access points nearby but not accessible by all rooms. Rather than extending our stay there by a third night, we moved closer to Downtown at the Ace Hotel on 29th st. It was INCREDIBLE by contrast - hip and super clean, simply a night and day difference. While we would not recommend the Millennium Broadway for anything over $100/night, the Ace Hotel was fantastic and we got a very reasonable price for a room at the last minute. Also, the gym at the Ace was MUCH better equipped.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: afridi14
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days in this magnificent hotel. Its right on times square. Amazing place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary trip!”
Reviews.Author: jklon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 10 year anniversary at this hotel from 6/28-7/2. The front desk guy was great at check in. He hooked us up with a great view. The guy working at the concierge was decent. The lady at concierge was great and gave us directions. The room was great and the bed was ok. The location was awesome!! Overall had a great time and experience at this hotel. Try the Times deli across the street its awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: ladymom59
Reviews.Content: I would reccommend this hotel to anybody that asked me for a hotel in NY City, because it has a good service, friendly and helpful staff, everything is like new, and plus, the location, close to Times Square and yet far from the crowds and the noise. We had a wonderful vacation!

Reviews.Title: “We were nervous but pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: MariaShec
Reviews.Content: The morning we were to check in at this hotel, I read some horrible reviews and began to panic that this hotel would be a nightmare. We had the complete opposite experience and found the staff to be professionnal, welcoming and very willing to help when we requested it of them. The checking in and out was process was quick and efficient, the restaurant downstairs was clean and our morning coffee was served hot and plentiful. The rooms were clean, perhaps not the most updated but certainly comfortable. My friend checked the mattresses the minute we arrived and saw nothing so we became instantly comfortable. One minor missing item in the room was an ice bucket and a working ice machine on our floor. If it was a real problem, we would have brought it to their attention.but we didn't. When reviewing a charge placed on the room, I contacted the hotel through email and was responded to almost immediately. I am very pleased overall by this hotel. Yes, I have stayed in many hotels in Canada, the U.S. and Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Taf48
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here we were in the premium suites the room was very comfortable and tea making facilities a bonus, it was lovely to have breakfast and early evening drinks on the mezzanine floor, cant believe it was so near Tmes Square and all the hustle and bustle as it was quiet and away from it all in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, rooms ok”
Reviews.Author: JJ_Enjoying_Life
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great aspects, however the rooms are in serious need of updating. The bathroom needs some major refreshing and better cleaning. The view from my room was excellent. I have never (to my knowledge) had bed bug bites, but believe I have about 5 of them. Two on my hand, one on my arm and two on my left leg. I did not visibly see anything on the bed, but I had the bites in the am. Summary: The hotel is not 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: ana668
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a room at this hotel because my friend and I are spending a weekend in new york July 8th and 9th, 2011. I booked through expedia's 4 star rated surprise booking. The last time I stayed at this hotel, I did not think the rooms measured up to the 4 star rating and it was a bit drab. I hope we get a nicer room this time around. I was surprised to get this hotel when picking "4 star". My friend and I are hoping the rooms have been upgraded.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect a lot - not up to 4 star rating”
Reviews.Author: Purdy21
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our choice for my daughters' first visit to New York and was booked early in the year. A few weeks before the trip, reports on TripAdvisor were not complimentary and we expressed our concerns to our travel agent who contacted the hotel direct. We were reassured by e-mail (Robert Bove - Reservation Sales Associate) that everything would be done to ensure we had a great visit and advised that our room had been upgraded. We arrived on 22nd June and booked into room 3007. We have to agree that the room matched the description of some TripAdvisor reports in that it was 'tired', and not up to the standard of other 4 star hotels we have used. If this was an upgrade, I can only assume that the original room allocated would have been bordering shabby. Granted the room appeared to be clean, but there was a hairgrip (not ours!) on the floor of the bathroom, behind the door, which remained there during our 5 nights stay - along with another one by the door to the hotel room. We also had 20 minutes of telephone madness, around mid-night one evening, when we were all asleep. The telephone rang 4 times within 20 minutes. Twice I answered the phone to music and no-one on the other end, and twice I answered to find other hotel guests on the other end who had also answered their ringing phone! One poor fellow, who was also awoken by the telephone, was just as suprised as me when he realised that I had not called him and he had not called me! I then called the operator to ask what was going on to be told, quite curtly, that she had not put any calls through to our room; however she did then ensure we had a 'do not disturb' on the phone until the following morning. To summarise, the location was brilliant, service okay, but ask to stay in one of the rooms pictured on their website and hope that the reality matches the image, because room 3007 did not look anything like the pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Don't come back if you are looking for a hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: IndienBrazil
Reviews.Content: We would like our hotel stay experience to be better than home and that prompts us to select hotels while we travel. We had booked 2 rooms for our family. For all of you who are used to staying in 4 - 5 start hotels, please stay away from Millennium Broadway Hotel, at the Times Square. Like many well located hotels around the world, this hotel enjoys a good location of Timessquare with a very poor administrative set up. We were greeted by an extremely rude and upset manager -Terrence Brown at the reservations desk when we checked in at around 12.30 night after 18 hour flight from India. No one carries your luggage here and room services stop at night. Hotel desk manager Mr. Miti and his fellow colleagues turn out to be as arrogant and least concerned the next 4 days that we stayed. They over charge on the credit card and refuse to acknowledge and reverse it. The rooms are old and bathrooms are archaic with almost no facility for a so called upmarket hotel at TImes square. The standards of a good hotel and not so good is easily visible. Poor hygiene of towels in bathroom, no refrigerator, no coffee-tea maker, bedsheets torn and burnt, rooms 3001- downwards ( 2901 and below) and upwards 3101 and above make all night noise of lifts running up and down. You can easily see that people here are not trained or equipped to deal with requests - emergencies - issues and providing services. If you want to stay at Times square - stay at Westin or MArriot or Radison. For same money or less - The over all experience is that of a 5 star and you will not regret it. At Millennuim, we regretted every moment.

Reviews.Title: “Not value for money.”
Reviews.Author: TomR82
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights here. The good points. Attentive staff, concierge staff in particular were very helpful in giving directions, recommending excellent places to dine and shop, nothing was too much for them, even making reservations and explaining charges and such....fantastic!. The location, Bang on Times Square!....Fantastic! With many many MANY excellent places to shop, eat and be social with in a very short walking distance. Room was always clean and well presented. The bad. I paid...what I thought was quite a large sum of money for my room, However, i felt very enclosed and some how just shoe horned in to a small dingy room, while it was a pleasant room, with nice furnishings, comfy bed. I paid a good premium for a not so premium room, did not have a good view of Times Square or any part of NY from my room window. I would recommend this hotel, however I feel they should adjust their prices to reflect views and room. I would happily stay here again, but the room cost needs to be atleats 1/3 less of what I paid for the room I had.

Reviews.Title: “My Hotel of Choice in NYC”
Reviews.Author: cstemplehealth
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Millenium Hotel was wonderful. The room was spacious and comfortable. The view was spectacular! A special thanks to Ms. MelanieTurner who made sure the room had everything we needed. The font desk staff were attentive to our needs and responed to requests in a timely manner. This is my Hotel of choice whenever I visit New York for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Our 50th Wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: katie-cooper1
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 50th wedding anniversary and we stayed at this hotel.Great location.from when we arrived we were treated very well by all staff.They made our stay very welcomining.Our room was very clean and looked after.We met Stas Kandov (stan) in the resteraunt he was brilliant he looked after us very well.As did all staff. We would certainly stay again at this Hotel. John & Kath Cooper United Kingdom

Reviews.Title: “Great location and A-OK service”
Reviews.Author: carloalexi
Reviews.Content: We arrived from a red-eye flight from SFO on a Wednesday morning and stayed for three nights. After arriving from JFK via LIRR and subway, the front desk allowed for us to check-in early at 10am, even though official check-in is not until 4pm. Our room was located on the 29th floor. Immediately, we knew we weren't in a 4-star hotel, indicative by the interior design and general decor of hotel. But, we didn't care. Paying $250/night via Priceline.com and we were happy to stay 3 nights for less than $800. Front desk even waived the $12.95 daily internet wireless access if we signed up for their loyalty members club, which we gladly did. The hotel cleanliness felt decent. Floors seemed to be free of debris. A few problems, however: the TV remote had to be at least two feet from the sensor to even function properly. The right nightstand lamp's bulb was out. The bathroom didn't have a vent and the heat lamp was inoperable. What can I expect for a "bargain" 3-star hotel, right? One annoyance we had was that we had brought our own two personal pillows from home, which came with relatively expensive ($60 per pillow) pillowcases. We had forgotten to put the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door and when we came back from an afternoon of traveling the city, our pillows, albeit still there, was without our pillow cases. Instead, housekeeping replaced it with their own standard pillowcases. We called housekeeping and had them "try to search for it". I knew it was nearly impossible, since they were the same size AND color. But the person on the phone did say she'll check with the manager and call us back... which never happened. Fast forward 24-hrs later and nothing yet. We called again and housekeeping told us to call back after 10am to file a complaint. Our flight was at 1030am that same day so we left without a resolution. We flew back to SF and bought a new pair of pillowcases, which added an extra $100 to our $750 spent in this hotel. Overall I would rate it as 3 1/2 out of 5 stars. Pros: location, clean, comfortable Cons: inattentiveness of staff to stolen goods

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but not the best of Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Jn2jn2
Reviews.Content: Location is Great, room was dirty, needs a good cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Millennium Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Morency85
Reviews.Content: This was a pretty cool looking Hotel but it need a few new up dates like the TV. We are in the age of Flat Panel TVs. Also they should have Wifi. Other then that Awsome Hotel would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: billanddoyle
Reviews.Content: DON'T arrive before 10:30am because they will not check you in and you will not get a room until after check-in time of 4:00pm !!!I had to wait until almost 4:30pm because they said the room had not been 'made-up'. Don't depend on the rude desk clerks to help you in any way - - - if you have a problem about check-in - - ask for a Manager. It took me two-request-managers to finally get a room. Extremely small waiting area if you need to wait with only two sofas and two chairs in a very very small alcove.

Reviews.Title: “Hot ~ Very Hot”
Reviews.Author: Metaksams
Reviews.Content: I love staying in this hotel and have stayed 3 times. It's just off of Time Square so you do not have the noise normally affiliated being right on Time Square yet in the middle of everything. You are within walking distance of Grand Central Station and Rockafella Center to Fifth Street and so much more. Subway stations for all subways are within a few blocks taking you any where you want to go. LOVE the location!! The rooms were very clean and the service was great! My main problem is that NY City was having a heat wave of 100 degrees and we felt it in the room. The bathrooms do not have vents which does not take out the heat of the showers. When you have 4 woman taking a shower and no vent, wow was it hot. They did come up on 3 seperate occasions to see if they could get the air working more efficently and also changing the filter and such. I guess the room stayed at the most part at 78 degrees? except on a few nights where it cooled down then it was fine but a few nights were terribly hot but like I said NY was having record highs. If you wanted a taxi, they got you one like that. Or a towncar just like that and told them were you needed to go. Also there was no wait for a ride to the airport getting there an hour early. They are very consistant with this. We saw 3 plays that were within blocks of the hotel. SO convenient for Broadway plays.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and would reccommend to anyone mick and paula thompson uk”
Reviews.Author: mickt57
Reviews.Content: What a great spot this is.The location is superb,right on times sq.We were on 27 floor and slept like babies,no street noise.The staff were very attentive and helpful,the team on the concierge desk were very informative and willing.Our room was massive with a king size bed and 2 big easy chairs with a great view of times sq.Our room was clean and comfortable.The maids did a great job every day new towels and fresh beds everyday.42 in telly in room also.

Reviews.Title: “You only pay for the location, don't expect service..!”
Reviews.Author: Globaltrading
Reviews.Content: We came to the hotel at night, tired from a long trip. We got pleasant surprise from the front desk that we were upgraded to the premier at the next tower. We moved there and waited for our turn. Then when we met a man at the front desk we were told that we were wrong and supposed to go back to the tower before. I went back there with him and waited again. He argued with the person who told us to move to premier tower and went in to their backoffice. After a while, he came out and asked me to go with him again to the premier tower. We went to the premier tower again just to check us in with his computer and printed the card key. After that we had to move back AGAIN to the original tower to go to our room. We were tired and a little bit wet of raining. We just want to have our room and take a hot shower and rest. An upgrade would be nice but we did not expect this tiring and humiliating experience. Just check us in..period. The room was small and the bed was hard. However, the location was near to Times Square. But, I would rather to book another hotel next time we visit NYC

Reviews.Title: “Great service...great location...great city!!!”
Reviews.Author: maried004
Reviews.Content: People typically take the time to write when something goes wrong or when service was bad. It's important to comment when things are great...and this is one of those times! The location of the Millenium is perfect if you want a true New York experience. The service and staff were wonderful, professional, and courteous! We look forward to staying again for our next visit!!

Reviews.Title: “It was wonderful. We will definitely go back. Very friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: Metsr1
Reviews.Content: The Millennium Hotel Broadway was top notch. The service was excellent from the moment we checked in. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Housekeeping did a great job too. Our room was clean all weekend. Had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Blah”
Reviews.Author: islandhopper67
Reviews.Content: Great location in the middle of Times Sq. Rooms and general decor of hotel dated. Never ate at the hotel restaurant as it was not enticing one bit. Service mixed; concierge and check-in did not give the impression of professionalism but doorman had big smile and fast attentive service. No proper lobby area is a big no-no. Also, it was raining and they ran out of umbrellas for guests. Very old elevators that although function, did not reassure in terms of security. Overall, a very blah stay and next time in New York, will look elsewhere. Rooms although re-fitted, don't look great. Also, you have pay for wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for Times Sq and Broadway.”
Reviews.Author: Sundodger43
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights for a business and pleasure trip to New York. The rooms are clean and functional though a little dated. Our room was serviced daily but some of the bed linen was worn and torn plus there was no duvet cover provided. Be careful not to remove any beverages from the mini bar as they will be automatically be charged to the room, plus we had extra charges for drinks that we had not consumed. (These were deleted later at checkout). Distinct lack of restaurants within the hotel though there were plenty within the area catering for all tastes and budgets. We used The Red Flame Diner for breakfast which was around half the cost of prices at the hotel restaurant. We also used the Bond 45 bar and grill which is next door plus the irish bars, Connollys and Lunneys, across the street, all of which gave good value and service. There are no tea making facilities in the rooms, fortunately I'd read previous reviews and bought our own, sadly our kettle was 240V and took ages to boil! Don't forget your power adaptor if you're visiting from outside US, though they do sell them in the hotel shop. All in all we enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would recommend it for those wanting to stay in that busy hub of the city.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT! Highly recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: GSMOOTH
Reviews.Content: W0W-this is fantastic place close to Times Square-they provide breakfast and happy hour drinks!!!make use of happy hour as the prices in Times Sq are exhorbitant! Will stay there again! Great Value! Location in a very Gentrified Location!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: JustForFun401
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect location near all of the action of Times Sq and the theaters. We had a clean room that was ready when we needed it. Service was fast and friendly. This hotel really helped make our trip GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Location Great But Hotel Care Less About Their Guests”
Reviews.Author: whirlpool75
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights and thought I would never walk again after sleeping on a sheet of plywood that they called beds..Booked hotel 3 months ahead for a king bed and received 2 double beds ..Booked and paid for a package "City view and breakfast for 2"..Well the view was an office building across the street ...The breakfast couples read "American Breakfast" which on their menu is a sit down breafast with toast and eggs anyway you want them..Was told we could only have the buffet continental breakfast ..Ok that was acceptable as I am not hard to get along with ..The first 4 mornings the restaurant hostess (different ones every morning) were very nice as my wife was not feeling 100% so I asked if I could take our breakfast to go and have in our room..They gave ne to go containers and bags for each breakfast..The 5th morning I was told by the host that they don't allow that..I calmly explained how the previous 4 mornings has worked ...He again said it was not possible and called the restarant manager and she told me the same thing ..She also told me me that she was there the previous mornings ad I had not been there ..She outright called me a liar !!! I left without our breakfasts and went to me room and called the hotel manager..She said I was lucky the first 4 mornings to have it allowed..Said she would get back to us but am still waiting ....Pretty poor customer service for a $350 plus a night hotel..Will not be staying there again!!!!!!!!!!! .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lacks atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: dortis
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for 6 nights, and the hotel is even closer to Times Square than I had expected :) Very good location for newcomers to NYC, but next time I'm not staying this close to Times Square...but that's not the hotels fault :) I would stay at the Millennium again if this was the neighbourhood I wanted to be in. Nice hotel, we were upgraded to 43rd floor with view of Times Square. Fantastic! Kingsize bed was very comfortable. Bathroom was a bit worn...bathtub was leaking, so the floor was wet after every shower. Housekeeping wasn't very good, and the toilet wasn't cleaned for 2 days...They even woke us up before 9AM on our day of departure to ask when we vere going to check out... Did not try the restaurant or the gym. There's a super DELI across the street, and the hotel has an entrance at both 44th and 45th Street.. So, DELI at 44th and Starbucks next door if you went out on 45th. Perfect! You could rent a mini-fridge in the room if you want to store cold drinks or food, but it was quite expensive...

Reviews.Title: “Absaloutley Fantasic, Value for Money - amazing”
Reviews.Author: ksquires22
Reviews.Content: I have stopped in Manhattan a number of times and i have to say that this is by FAR the best hotel. Location - literally 30 seconds walk from times square. it is an absaloutly ideal location for tourists. and VERY suprisingly, not noisey. not once did we hear any noise in the night or in the day, even with the windows open. Price - again by FAR the bast value for money. I went with my best friend, we EACH had a HUGE double bed, the room was massive, even with all of our clothes spread around it still had plenty of space Service - 100% perfect. literally could not help enough

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: AndPancho
Reviews.Content: Typical large hotel. Average service on check-in and check-out: nothing outstanding. Rooms getting a bit tired. Standard of daily room service not really up to expected standards at hotel of this type. Location, location, location - top position for the short term visitor to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Typical city hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Cantylye
Reviews.Content: Very good value for money because of its location, Times Square! Typical of a city hotel. The staff were very helpful, kind and cheerful. Rooms rather tired and breakfast very expensive. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother expecting much from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kevin-Todd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel about 5 years ago and enjoyed it very much. However, this past stay we found the hotel is aging and hasn't had any serious renovations in years. There was mildew on the caulking of some tiles in the bathroom. The television remote inconsistently controlled the volume. The pillows were pathetic (and that isn't an overstatement). The floor lamp near the window was in such a position that the power plug had pulled loose from the outlet and it wouldn't reach to outlet to reconnect it. There was no coffee maker in the room (seriously, in a business hotel, no coffee maker?? This is a standard feature even in a Motel 6). There was a light bulb in the main lobby elevator area (outside the elevators in the hallway) that flickered - over three days and no one bothered to change the ballast or the bulb). I called down the concierge twice one morning and no one ever answered the phone and no voice mail or forwarding. Gave us and looked up what I needed on the internet. Would not stay at this hotel again until improvements are made.

Reviews.Title: “Gone downhill significantly in last two years”
Reviews.Author: Vickiinaz
Reviews.Content: The location is superb, but it is now very tired and needs refurbishing. Our bath had mildew, the bed was lumpy, cleaning marginal. We've enjoyed it in the past, but it must be under new management now.

Reviews.Title: “Millennium Hotel Broadway - Family unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: PelicanJoe
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to share my experience with Millennium Hotel Broadway. We are actually going to stay there in June. I've paid the hotel for a room and had in my reservation that I was traveling with my wife and kids. I sent them a note to ask if there was anything else I needed to do. They sent me the following note: Your room has one bed. If you need two beds, you will have to contact the hotel and check our availability. If we have two beds available, it will cost an additional $50 per night to guarantee that room. If you wish to call directly, our number is 800-622-5569 Is this normal for a New York City hotel? I've not called as of yet, because I'm afraid of the upcharges for things I would expect when traveling with my family such as a non-smoking with 2 double beds. But that would probably be because I never traveled to New York City (a trip my kids wanted to take). Just letting you know so that if you book this hotel (or any in New York City), you may be subject to extra charges. I will update with a full trip description after the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not a very welcoming hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AndrewCM2
Reviews.Content: Not a very welcoming hotel, the reception staff were unheplful and not very friendly, the room was ok but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon on high floor”
Reviews.Author: KatGemini
Reviews.Content: Overall a pleasant stay for the first stop on our honeymoon. The guy at reception put us on the 46th floor in honour of our recent nuptial so that was very nice! Apparently the rooms are much bigger than neighbouring hotels. But we found the overall hotel to be quite void of any character. Location is definitely the highlight of this hotel. Right on Times Square, and a couple blocks from the subway â€“ and you even had several subway lines to choose from. Cleaners were very rude and regularly would try and barge in without bothering to check if anyone was in. Also didnâ€™t do a very good job and most days it looked like hadnâ€™t even bothered to vacuum the place or do a proper clean! We got a really good deal, i think we paid around US$250/night which for the location in NYC was really great. But we did book 5 months ahead or something like that. Cranberry Deli on 46th was a great outlet for our daily breakfast and coffee was quite decent by NY standards... (Aussies will understand what i mean...) For a great dinner the concierge recommended DB Moderne couple of blocks away - fantastic French bistro cuisine by famous NY chef. And thank you to Concierge Philip for all your patient help and we loved your Italian recommendation on 48th. Be sure to get out of NYC and head to Woodbury Common outlet - buses leave from Port Authority on 8th and 42nd on the hour. We snapped up heaps of amazing bargains!!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms not as booked, dirty and poor service. Would never stay again.”
Reviews.Author: jalwishaw
Reviews.Content: When arriving late to our hotel (confirmed months in advance and staying as part of conference attendee), we were met with "we don't have a non smoking room", in spite of this being booked. My colleague was first given a room at the Premier, only to find it was full, then a room that was not cleaned, then a room he entered and discovered was occupied, and finally a non smoking room. The manager was rude to us, and the staff non responsive to our request for rooms as booked. Our smoking room was so dirty, poorly kept and foul smelling we did not sleep. I have stayed at this location several times as a conference attendee, but will NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CeeCee29
Reviews.Content: I'll echo the other reviews on here that the real reason you stay at the Millenium is for the location right off of Times Square. It's very convenient to most things in Manhattan, but still the actual streets its on are quieter because its not directly in Times Square. As for the hotel itself, it's decent, just make sure your expectations aren't too high. Rooms are mostly clean (though don't look at the dust under your bed or headboard!) And things are just a little worn, but nothing that really bothered me. Just regular wear and tear. Beds, pillows, and bedding are all in good shape, though the matress is a little hard. We were on the 38th floor, and things were quiet and we all slept great. There is also a nice flatscreen tv in your room. The bathroom was also quite nice. The granite countertop was long with plenty of room for all of our stuff, and the shower actually had a double shower curtain so you didn't end up slopping water all over the floor like you do at most hotels. Know that if you want a coffee maker, they aren't in your room, but you can request one. Service was quite friendly when we were there. They were able to accomodate us for a late checkout, but not an early check in. If your waiting around for them to call you to check in, don't. They said they'd call us but forgot. Luckily we asked again if our room was clean, after the allotted time had passed, and it was. The hotel restaurant was very empty most of the time, and seemed to have a limited and unimpressive menu. If you don't want to go far, there are some decent restaurants across the street. Times Square Deli, Virgil's Barbecue, and even a Starbucks. All in all, a very good option if you want to be close to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Laurs2011
Reviews.Content: Visited with my sister at the end of February. Fantastic location right behind the Toys r Us on Times Square. Room was large for NYC and had plenty of storage. Had to request a hairdryer on the first morning but this was in the room on our return after a bit of sightseeing. Great base to explore the city. Good nights sleep with very comfortable and large beds - bit of noise from the street but the hotel is in the heart of the city so this is to be expected really. Clean with fresh towels and maid service daily. Efficient check in and very friendly door staff. Breakfast is good but expensive and there are so many other options in the city that I would not stay for breakfast again.

Reviews.Title: “reception staff tried to scam me”
Reviews.Author: PATOOBRIEN
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel Apr 22-24 2011 The location is fantastic 30 meters from Times Square, but when I went to reception the Check in agent Ruben told me that they dont sell rooms for 4 people on Hotels.com (even though i had a prepaid confirmation for 2 adults and 2 children) and as the hotel was full he would have to charge me extra if I wanted to stay. Surprised/annoyed I asked to see the manager and then things got a little surreal, Ruben went into the back office for approx 30 seconds when he returned he said that a room for four people had suddenly become available because someone in California had just cancelled their booking and that he wouldn't have to charge me but to keep it quiet as he didn't want the agent near us to know that he wasn't going to charge me extra....what a SCAM....otherwise the hotel is fine and I didn't let that scumbag ruin my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice room !!!”
Reviews.Author: gu10tag
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is located directly in the heart of the everything!!! This location made it easy to WALK to most of the places we wanted to visit. We had an awesome view from our room, that was clean and spacious, at 36 floor!!! We will definitely stay here on our next visit to New York !!!! I would not recommend buying a New York Pass, or at least to buy it online (compare the prices, you can safe some $$)!! We decided to order it because of "Please remember, that as a New York Pass holder you are entitled to a privileged Fast Track Entry at the busiest attractions" and it WASNT really TRUE !!! We stayed the same time in the line as the people, who has to buy the ticket, or sometimes even longer, dont forget another line for the security check.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Luvnilfe
Reviews.Content: It is located in the heart of the threatre district. Parking was available directly across the street and half the price the hotel parking wanted us to pay. Directly across from the ticket booth on Times Square. The hotel was able to secure us front row tickets How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying. Did not eat in hotel restaurant. Room was very spacious and clean. Felt very safe. Staff was very curtious. We had a very easy checkout. Others complained their honor bar was not properly stocked and was charged for missing items. Did not happen to us. There was no fan in bathroom. Got stuffy quickly. There is no mini fridge unless requested. Will stay there again if price is competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Not so hot”
Reviews.Author: 01George
Reviews.Content: We arrived in NYC as a stop over after two weeks in Europe. We arrived late at night to find that our guaranteed late arrival non-smoking room was a filthy smoking room. The stench was overpowering from the moment we stepped off the elevator. After complaining to the front desk we were told there were no other rooms available and that we would need to speak to the manager in the morning to request a room change. So back to the room we went. Not only was this room incredibly smelly but the carpets and walls were dirty, every lampshade was askew. There was accumulated dirt and grime in the ledges in the bathroom and the furniture was scratched and marred, the sheer curtains were frayed and had small tears. Management did send someone to spray the carpet. As anyone knows, this only makes management feel better and does absolutely nothing to resolve the problem. After a short and incredibly miserable night we were able to get a room change the next day. The Millennium is a good bargain for the location evidenced by the number of tourist staying here. But signs of wear and tear are notable throughout the hotel from the front desk and public areas to the elevators and the rooms. There just doesn't seem to be the care in maintaining what is there and any pretense of updating or refreshing is strictly superficial. Both rooms had buttons hanging loose from the headboards, worn carpets and wallpaper that was stained and/or peeling. The corners and edges have accumulated dirt and and remains of repair putty. The tufted paneling behind the front desk is pulling away and dirty. There is just an overall sense of shabby without the chic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Nishjl1
Reviews.Content: I was a recent guest at the Millennium Hotel this week and I was very please with the helpfulness of the front desk staff and the 3rd shift engineer. I some minor trouble in the late night before i planned to check out and Maurice and Angel were very helpful. In a day when many choose not to go the extra mile these gentlemen did and I really appreciated their help. It was the cherry on top of a great time in the Big Apple. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, heart of Time Square, easy access to everything”
Reviews.Author: vplat1
Reviews.Content: Found great deal on TravelZoo, got an superior king. Nice rooms. Probably a 3.5 stars, but in NYC, this is considered very good, especially < $200/night. Across from Marriott Marquis, steps away from heart of Time Square. I recommed this hotel because of it's location. Make sure to get the recently renovated/upgraded rooms (not all rooms are upgraded yet). If you want ease of access to metro to get to anywhere in Manhatten, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a fan”
Reviews.Author: nedco1
Reviews.Content: Our stay was last April and I'm still angry.... I was with my 11 year old daughter for a fun filled few days. When we got to our room there were still clothing from the previous guests and food in the fridge as well. I let them know and no one came to remove them so we bagged them up ,set it aside and went on our way. The second night we came home after our shew and our door was open with no one around. I called and was told to call security (you'd think they would do that for you). We did, they did come up. Nothing was taken from our room so they left all alone. The more I thought about it I started to get angry. Called my husband and had him find us another room somewhere else. Since I did pay for Wifi and kept getting bumped off I needed him to find us another room. I eventually did get in touch with a manager ( I had to call them and keep calling) and all he could do was a couple $ off our stay and a free breakfast. Honestly, I just wanted some answers and to be treated like a guest! Instead I was told the because the Hotel was full capacity he could not give us the room for free which was not the answer I wanted. I didn't care about the other guests at that time, I cared about the safety of my daughter and I.....

Reviews.Title: “Large comfortable room with great location”
Reviews.Author: Tracey1375
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed in a deluxe room on the 36th floor. The room was large with plenty of room to relax, hang clothes and sleep. There were floor to ceiling windows so great views.There was no traffic noise at all and so we slept very well. Parts of the hotel are a little tired looking but still clean. We didn't realise just how close to time square the hotel is (500mtrs) and there is a Starbucks and 24hr deli serving breakfast just outside the main doors. I would certainly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: tafftwo55
Reviews.Content: This was our second attempt to get to this hotel after the ash stopped us the first time, 'And' we were not dissappointed. The hotel was in a very good position .You would not of thought that you were in NewYork Upon our arrival we were greeted by Terrence on reception who was very pleasant and friendly . He upgraded us to the premire section which was great. Rooms spacious with all the facilities .The Young tunisia gentleman was the most pleasant of staff too , always eager to help and nothing too much trouble. I hope he continues with his studies and goes far. Darren was also very obliging ,helpling us sort out our cab and making sure that our going home journey went smoothly. Our Trip to Newyork was well worth the wait.!!!

Reviews.Title: “After a few mishaps, I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Greenlaser86
Reviews.Content: I stayed here April 1st and 2nd of this year, 2011. Upon checking in, my toilet was broken. Called front desk, was advised someone would be right up to fix it. Waited 20 minutes, and nothing, called again, was advised again and someone came right up. Was told toilet was fixed so I tried using it again, and was still broken... I was late meeting some friends, so as I was leaving I told the front desk it was still broken. Got back that night it was still broken. Next day I asked for a room change and easily got it. Everything was good in the next room except a dirty glass. Please understand I probably just got the only room with a broken toilet, as this hotel IS NICE. The location is great, the staff is wonderful, and the hotel looks amazing and well kept. It's a quiet hotel, the elevators are speedy, and the beds are very comfortable. Even after what I delt with, I WOULD stay here again, as It was most likely a freak thing.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty so Dirty Too much money for the service!!!”
Reviews.Author: acostaeli
Reviews.Content: I arrived to the millenium broadway late at night and let them know in the afternoon so they would not cancel the reservation . The room they gave us was ockey small but we could not find the lights as soon as we turn them on I felt so uncomfortable because the bed was made but the blanket was like used all wrinled and with lipstick on it. Also the bathroom was with the floor terrible like if they didnt even clean it for the new visitors. So as the guy from reception was so mean when I asked if internet was included and in a very rude way he answered!!! I told him I was not sure the promotion with travelzoo had all that included I think he felt bad and suddenly called and asked me how was the room I said what I thougth and he turned very kind and told me to to come to see another room in other tower called premier. Supossely upgraded The room was still small but it loked clean and it had continental breakfast included. and a cable for internet. I stayed for 4 nigths and the second day we went out at 12:30 pm an told in reception to make our room even though we put the advise in the door When we arrived at 6 pm the y had not fix the room so I called. Then we went out and when we returned the only thing they did was to make the bed and glases and bathroom everything continued dirty but the worst of all was that I called the manager of the moment and told me that that was normal with a person that stays so long( 4 nigths) they dont make the rooms so clean because must of the people dont like they clean it . I told him I travel all around and I dont thing people that pay $ 800 dollasrs for a hotel 4 stars dont like cleanness. Terrible .

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: kmo4
Reviews.Content: Great location, near everything. Cleaning staff weren't great. Sheets were clean, rug was very dirty, water was warm but not hot, family in the next room had the same problem. Would probably stay some place else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: talkshowsonmute
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel couldnt have been any more perfect. The hotel is in a prime location with a two second walk from Times Square! The staff were extremely helpful and friendly (Antonio and Mike, just to name a couple) My room was spacious and comfortable and the view was spectacular! I most definitely would stay here again! Having stayed in hotels close to Times Square before this one tops them all!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: MaconMemories
Reviews.Content: This was my 6th stay at the Millennium Broadway. The hotel was very busy, but the staff got the job done! For NYC, I don't believe the value can be beat. The location is great. The rooms are a good size for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: James_Hunter86
Reviews.Content: It was my first time visiting NYC and after a long flight from the U.K, we were welcomed at reception and checkied in immediatley. The room was spacious and clean, and had everything we needed for our stay. The location is fantastic and only a 20 second walk from times sq. I enjoyed my experiance and have booked to stay at the hotel again in June 2011

Reviews.Title: “be aware of thieves”
Reviews.Author: avm000
Reviews.Content: My son got his ipad, charger, and headphones stolen while staying at the Millennium. The items were missing after just a few hours of his leaving the room (maid service had passed by during that time). The hotel security and management have yet to respond to the report he filed on the spot. And they do not even try to return his phone calls! This is not a comfortable place and don't rely on management for any help.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. I'd stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: KimberleeEtcetera
Reviews.Content: Just got back from New York vacation. We stayed at Milennium Hotel Broadway and it was just fine. The location is outstanding. Just a few steps off Times Square which is nice because you can get through the doors without having to fight through a crowd. But you are really right there where the action is. Hotel was clean, nothing too fancy or really anything special but definitely a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, My Friend is back in May!!”
Reviews.Author: Urbanwarrior1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on the 4th March 2011 with my friend. The hotel is right in the centre of Times square. So about 30 mins from the airport. The Bellman are there straight away to take your bags for you and point you in the right direction to check in. We arrived early at about 1pm and we able to check in straight away. We had room 4417, the room was really spacious and clean, the only thing I will say was the air con could do with fixing to the wall!! Apart from that the hotel was clean and had a great view of Times Square. I imagined the hotel to be really noisy, but was silent at night!! Every night! If you want breakfast, go accross the road to the little shop, they have upstaits seating and have really good food!! The conceige desk will point you in the right direction of good food places. They are really helpful and will book your table for you. Overall we had a really good time, my friend has already booked to come back in May.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Room, Bad Communication”
Reviews.Author: Gryffindorguy
Reviews.Content: We visit NYC once a year and I have to say that this is one of the best hotels we've stayed at. The location is perfect for theater goers, you right near enough to Times Square for quick access but just far enough away that when you exit the hotel you are not in the middle of huge crowds. The bed was very comfortable and the room was large for NYC standards. My only complaint is miscommunication between the front desk and housekeeping. We arrived around noon and was told the room was not ready yet, no big deal, so we checked our bags and headed out for lunch and sightseeing. Five hours later we return and the room was still not ready but the front desk said give us a half an hour and it would be. An hour later and they said it was good to go, we got the room key and headed up. We opened the door and surprise, it was still dirty. Long story short, housekeeping was not on the ball but the front desk moved us to another room and provided us with breakfast vouchers. They did a wonderful job at making us happy after a day of traveling. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jo-jocie
Reviews.Content: I expected alot more from this hotel, but it was in a great location. Next to shopping, food, and subway.

Reviews.Title: “Millennium Hotel, Broadway - Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Daydreming
Reviews.Content: Service and security are not important to the staff at this hotel. Incident one: We arrived Sunday evening around 7pm, and while there were people in the room behind the desk, no one came out to assist the one person checking in the people in line. After getting checked in, I did not go straight to my room. When I did go to the room, a little more than an hour later, I stepped in to find a man already installed in the room. I immediately went to the front desk, where the man at the desk listened and replied 'ah, sorry, you need just one bed, right? Here's room X"", as though this were an everyday occurrence. No concern, no interest, no security, poor property control system assigning more than one person to a room. I didn't sleep all night, even with the door bolted, not knowing whether some stranger would try to get in. I also worried that someone might be in the room upon my return on Monday after meetings. Incident two: Tuesday morning, checkout day, I left the room early, coming back at 9:15 to find that the housekeeper was in my room, cleaning up and readying my room for the next Guest. Checkout was NOT at 9:00am. I grabbed my bags and left. Not treatment I would expect from any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....”
Reviews.Author: gboynton
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is AMAZING - right in the middle of everything! Of course it cost around $300 a night, but that is to be expecting in Manhattan. I arrived at the hotel several hours before check in and was able to go ahead and get my room. They rooms, I thought, was very spacious - plenty of room for 2 or 3 people.
