We did have issues with the toilet continually running, but never reported it. The staff was friendly. Check out was easy - after checking out we were able to have out bags held in storage until we needed to leave for the airport. I had lunch on my last day there at the restaurant on site - it was good.....very over priced....and the wait staff took FOREVER! Only draw back was there was no mini-fridge or microwave in the room.....did not realize this until I brought some food back from a restaurant (The Rock Center Cafe)....which btw was amazing! We sat outside at the skating rink and the atmosphere was priceless.....the food was amazing!....but expect to pay a pretty penny for it :) I would most likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: KB2905
Reviews.Content: The checkin was fast and efficient with a view of times square from our 47th floor room. We got to watch the thanksgiving parade from the hallway outside our room and got a much better view that those who watched from the street! The service was unobtrusive, although there were no amenities like a turn down service. The linen was of good quality and the bathroom standard sufficed for our needs. A must stay if you are staying in New York for the first time- this really is at the hub of things!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location Great Hotel & No Bed Bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: JonnyBeGood
Reviews.Content: The room was great, with gorgeous views of Time Square. Got a Superior 1 King Bed room (350 sq ft) for $149 through Travel Zoo. The room was nice and clean, the bed luxuriously comfortable and no bed bugs!!! Customer service of all hotel staff was excellent. This was the 3rd time staying at the Millennium and each stay was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: jdm87
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say this hotel was great, the location was perfect, our room looked out straight on Time Square, we were on the 32nd Floor, there was no noise, the room was clean and tidy, a queen size bed, flat screen. The staff from both checking in and the bar were very friendly and always helpful. teven when there was a very annoying "Gentleman" in the bar being very loud, the barman quitely said that it would be best to sit in the Lounge Area so not to be harrassed, we even had a free drink the next night from him. The Doorman always said hello and good morning, would definetly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and super hotel for the right price.”
Reviews.Author: Charlieec07
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a five night stay at the Millennium. Overall the hotel is excellent. You will struggle to get a better location. 20 seconds walk from Time Square, between 44th and 45th. There are numerous really nice bars and restaurants close by. I managed to get a superior room on a high floor for $188 dollars a night. This made all the difference as the room was a good size for the two of us and for the location it's a struggle to find anything cheaper. All the staff were extremely helpful but not too in your face. They sorted us a lovely restsurant and then a shuttle back to the airport. We did have a problem our first night as we were locked out of our room, as the battery on the card reader to our door ran out apparently. This was dealt with by staff asking us to go and have a free drink at the bar and they then gave us a complementary breakfast each the next day. Over all a great hotel in a superb location, especially if you can get it at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: coronaman1978
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 9:30 am on a Saturday in hopes to check out bags and walk around the city. We were told our room was ready if we wanted to check in and they had upgraded us to premiere towers free of charge. Check in was smooth and the people very friendly. The room is nice, couch had a stain on it but I did not care. I got a deal of a price through Hotwire at 176.00 per night. Can't beat that. The location is great. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and adequate rooms.”
Reviews.Author: rmarquez99
Reviews.Content: The Millennium Broadway, such a great location for a good hotel. This hotel has the resemblance of the old luxury hotels of yesteryear. The reception area counter was cracked and chipped away. When we got to the room the shower was not in its most optimal condition. I would love to state that their service is excellent, but when we called housekeeping, they delivered the extra towels and some pathetic excuse for razors almost 40 minutes later. Our stay was two nights and we must say that our view, though none existent, had a gothic building across the way which made up for it. Because we went at the height of the NYC bed bug infestation our panic senses found no bedbugs in the room and we did not suffer any bug bites, so I do give them props for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: SGDinLA
Reviews.Content: I'm very surprised at the negative reviews for this hotel, since we had a wonderful time here. We had a great rate, and were upgraded to a room on a higher floor when the woman at check-in learned we were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary. We had flown on a red-eye and were expecting to just leave our bags, but we were checked in at 10am! Even better, when we checked out four days later, we were given a late check-out of 2pm. That allowed us to have an enjoyable last day in town, without having to rush back to check out. The room was clean, well-maintained, and very decent-sized for NY standards. The lobby is quite large for NY, too. And you just can't beat the location-- this was my first time staying near Times Square, and it's right in the midst of the action, yet was surprisingly quiet. If you can get a sub $240/night rate like we did, there's no reason to stay anyplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Booked through hotwire. Would not pay regular fees.”
Reviews.Author: TurismoRock
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through hotwire and felt it was worth it. I would not pay the hotel's regular fees though. The standard room has a good size for Manhattan, but for two adults with two cabin-size bags it can get a little crowded. The room is overall very clean, but the carpet was peeling off in some of the corners and some heavy dust was deposited there. The blanket was kind of thin and frayed, but the towels were in good shape. The bathroom was large and clean. I am really picky with cleeanliness and this room passed my test. The room is also fairly silent. Location is perfect, right in the middle of times square. Lots of attractions at walking distance and many subway stations in close reach. Overall this is a good hotel, but may be not worth your money if you pay full rates.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: micksals
Reviews.Content: Checked in a couple of hours early with no problems and was greeted by friendly staff at reception and concierge. Like most major city hotels, if you look hard enough you will find areas that could do with a lick of paint, but generally I found the hotel to be clean, tidy and welcoming. I had a king bed room on the 34th floor and heard absolutely no noise, so a good nights sleep. The bed was very firm which suits me, but may not be everyones preference. The room included what I see as essentials for a business stay - a very good shower, a safe, iron and ironing board. I only stayed for one night and did not eat in the hotel at all so cannot comment on the food. The restaurant certainly looked ok as passed by. There are plenty of other eating options close by. I did use the gym which had a very good selection of equipment.. All in all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best thing about it”
Reviews.Author: Jstan1
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice size, nice decor. Bathroom looked dated and not completely clean. Service was not the friendliest but not rude either. Location was great, litterally close to everything. The hotel is overpriced in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Better after the fact/ Very Rude check in”
Reviews.Author: Txbluj
Reviews.Content: had always wanted to see NY at x-mas time to enjoy lights & a few shows...so mid Oct I reserve room (for 5 days) to ensure a nice hotel, smoking rm's permitted & requested. We arrived 4:30 ck-in time & greeted @ the desk by a very rude gentleman, who very abruptly says there are NO (smoking) rooms avail - period. We're Not happy about this but couldn't do much at this point !! We ck-in & room was awful, dark, smelled of dirty feet w/ a view of nothing but the back of buildings !! We go to dinner right away, tired & hungry & return directly but my husb stops @ desk & explains room situation to (Jayme) who's very nice & polite, & bingo bingo finds & moves us to a nice corner (smoking)room w/ king sz bed, big flat screen tv & a great view of lights & TS : ) Go figure was exactly what we had reserved & requested !!! Our 5 day stay was looking awhole lot better...Thx's to Jayme aka Jimmy Rooms could use updating & be cleaner...I noticed really dirty, moldy shower curtain liner & sheets didn't stay on bed= bottom sheet wasn't fitted & to small

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Friendly Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaBrown1968
Reviews.Content: Tiffany was incredibly helpful after Virgin failed to book the room for us and soon sorted out the problem. The hotel was in a credible location close to Times Square, Broadway, Shopping, Central Park. Hells kitchen is a few blocks away and easily within walking distance. We were on 24th Floor and the room was quiet even though we close to Times Square. Clean rooms, Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, yards from time square, but tucked away from the madness!”
Reviews.Author: Stevo20
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel inside, although not that impressive from the outside, with extremely friendly and helpful staff. Just yards off Time Square, but far enough away that you can avoid the mad business of the square if you wish. Dedicated desk for Theatre tickets was very helpful, and taking in a show is a must when in NY. Rooms are a good size (for Manhatten) and the irish bar across the street from 45th Street entrance is great, both for food and friendliness. Would happily go back and stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern, with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Tarable
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Millennium Broadway January 28th-30th for a girls' weekend in the city. We received a $150/night deal for their superior grade room (Floors 28 and above) through Travel Zoo. We arrived at 1:30pm on a Friday and had no problem checking in early. They gave us a corner room on the 40th floor with a great view of the Chrysler Building (everyone else's reviews say the Empire State Building and I originally thought the same, but my girlfriend who is an NYC resident corrected me on this point) and the NYE 2011 ball. We had a nice view of a few Times Square flashy billboards, but the drapes had no problem blocking out the lights at night time. The room itself had a cute and clean modern decor. New-looking carpet and bedding, as well as a nice oversized leather chair and ottoman. Our room had two twin-sized beds, but they were much larger than any twin I'd seen before. Somewhere between a twin and a full. It was a perfect sleeping situation for my sister and myself. I found the duvet cover to be plenty warm during the night and had no problem adjusting the heater to fit our needs. The bathroom was clean with ample fresh towels. The tile around the sink is a little dated, but I can't see how that would interfere with anyone's use and enjoyment of the room. It's NYC and the hotel has been around for a couple decades; it's not unfathomable that the bathrooms might have old tile. For $150 a night, right in the heart of Times Square, I can handle old bathroom tile in a room that is otherwise perfect and well-maintained. Upon check-out, I noticed that our invoice had an incorrect $30 charge for a bottle of vodka from the mini bar. We'd been storing some Gatorades in the mini bar fridge, and I think it must have confused the maid as to its contents. I called down to the front desk, and they removed the charge without a moment's hesitation. They didn't argue with me for even a second; they just said that they would remove it immediately and were true to their word. I appreciated that. We left the hotel at 6:30am to get to JFK for an 8:30am flight. The doorman arranged for us to take a private SUV limo for an all-inclusive fee of $60, rather than have to hail a yellow cab (which wouldn't have been as clean or nice) and pay the same amount. I appreciated that they had this service available. Overall, it was a wonderful stay. If you're not terribly picky about bathroom tile, you'll really enjoy this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT a 4 Star!”
Reviews.Author: mtraveler_27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel through Hotwire. You don't get to see what hotel you're actually booking until you've already paid. We picked a 4 star hotel in Times Square area and got this hotel. This hotel is DEFINITELY NOT A 4 Star!! We would give it 3 Stars at best. The Room was large, but the decor was tacky and outdated. The sheets, towels, bath tub were not clean. There were spots on all of them. It was just gross. The location was convenient but buf we had known what this hotel was like, we would definitely not have stayed here. Do not book here if you expect it to be anywhere near a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Time For a Refit”
Reviews.Author: Plateglass
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a few Millenium Hotels and this is not a patch on the others. Was in town for a gig and stayed only one night. Arrived at noon and was told could not check in until 4pm which I know is policy at a lot of places, but no attempt was made to find a room, even though lots of people were checking out. I was too tired to argue after the flight so I went to the movies to kill time(seen all the sights of New York several times before, plus it was very cold). I returned at 4:15 to check in and was told I was being given a deluxe upgrade due to having to wait. The King Double was on the 41st floor and if this was an upgrade I dread to think what the original room was like. The room itself was larger than average for Manhattan, and the bed was very comfortable, but thats where it ends. The cable didnt work on the tv and when they sent maintenace he hadn't got a clue, so thats the way it stayed. There was no mimi bar and no coffee making facilities. Room service was extortionate as usual-eg-$14 for a pot of coffee(inc tax etc). The decor and furniture had definitely seen better days, and the closet and bathroom were particularly disappointing, being very dated and shabby(I've been in better Motel 6 establishments than this). I didn't use the bar or restaurant but the lounge area(outside the theatre entrance) was very worn and dirty, including the two couches and table. All in all very disappointing, even at the Hotwire rate of $185. The saving grace was the location....3 minute stroll to Times Square and 2 minutes to Avenue of the Americas. Also the deli over the road was excellent, and at taste of days gone bye. There are much much better hotels in Manhattan, do yourself a favour.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! A value experience.”
Reviews.Author: seantcollins
Reviews.Content: The Millenium Broadway is in a great location with wonderful amenities and came at a great price for us. We were able to book adjoining rooms with our teenage daughters which gave them and us some privacy while keeping us connected. The hotel is well appointed with tiger maple elevators, a lovely lobby, and is under 4 minutes on foot from Times Square. I was most impressed with the service and responsive and professional approach that the hotel staff take regarding any issues (we had a copious smoker on our non-smoking floor). I would stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jayne38
Reviews.Content: We have been travelling to New York every year since 2000 and have stayed at a different hotel each time. Some good, some just plain awful. This hotel was lovely. Despite some of the other comments we found the hotel staff friendly, informative and helpful. Housekeeping even used to fill our ice bucket for us each day. The room was very clean, the only problem we had was with the air con - we couldn't get the balance quite right and it was either too cold or too warm, but it didn't but a downer on our stay. We were very lucky with our room as it was on 23rd floor and on the corner over looking Times Sq. We had an excellent view of the Empire State Building, Times Sq and on 4 July celebrations we had the best view of the fireworks as the room faced straight down the Avenue towards the Hudson. The Reception staff were very helpful to us on our last day, as we had night flights back to the UK, they allowed us to stay in our room at no extra charge until we were ready to leave for the airport. All in all we couldn't fault this hotel and given what the foot fall must be in NY hotels this one was clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “quiet room in great location with a fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: theflipflopfamily
Reviews.Content: I was reluctant to stay at this hotel because of the mixed reviews I had read online. Overall we were very pleased. We booked this on Priceline and got it for only $140.00 a night which I thought was a good deal for NYC. When we checked in I asked Terrence at the front desk if we could get a nice room since it was my hubby's first trip to NYC. He was sooooo sweet! He gave us a corner room on the 31st floor over looking Times Square. Since it was the corner, it was pretty spacious for NY, plus it had windows on two sides that were huge. He also offered us a refrigerator for free because my sister was a vegan and needed to eat out of the room. Super sweet! I am a picky sleeper and the room was very dark and a/c was nice and quiet, plus it was not noisy due to Times Square. We did hear fire engines but overall, very quiet. Room was a little worn in some places, shower was dirty on the bottom of the tub, grout was dirty, floor was stained a little, carpet had a few stains but overall the cleanliness was satisfactory. If you want a reasonable room in Times Square I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “No frills hotel conviently located with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: jetset_p
Reviews.Content: I had a pleasant 3 night stay at Millennium Broadway (January 22-25, 2011). For the price I paid, I think I got a good value for my money. While I like to occasionally splurge & stay at top star hotels, but being that this was my first trip to New York my top priority was to splurge on Broadway, attractions and restaurants. I was in New York to enjoy everything outside the hotel! So for a place where I could rest comfortably and feel safe for the night, that was clean and close to major attractions, Millennium Broadway met my expectations. We booked out stay using Priceline's Negotiator and we would have been okay with the standard room assigned to us, but the front desk employee (I forget his name, but he is a big San Francisco 49er fan) who checked us in, offered us an upgrade to room with a better view on the 43rd floor. We arrived during a weekend that was NYC was experiencing frigid temperatures, so this was a warm surprise! He was very hospitable, and we had a nice conversation about where we were from and football. Check in was fast and easy. We stayed in room 4305, a corner room with a view of the Empire State to the left, Rockefeller Plaza straight ahead, and the Paramount building to the right. I would have to say the hotel has a masculine, Art Deco feel with its black marble all over the lobby and bathrooms. As for the room, it was nicely decorated in copper and orange color scheme. It was small for its size, but it fit 2 single beds, a leather chair, a desk, and a chest of drawers with a flat screen TV on top. Like the other reviewers have said, the bed consisted of a flat sheet, duvet cover, 2 standard pillows, and a decorative pillow (not high thread count quality). It was satisfactory, our Heater/AC worked fine, so we had no issues if we were too hot or cool in bed. The electronics were standard, flat screen TV, with a handful of cable channels. I think they should upgrade their alarm clocks to iPod/mp3 compatible docks. The bathroom was okay- good water temperature but it had a weak shower head. The bathroom in our room could really use an air vent! During my stay I didn't notice anything that screamed "GROSS!" For the most part, everything was kept clean and stain free. Most importantly, NO BED BUGS! I hate it when I'm at a hotel and the staff is either: too cold and unapproachable, or uncomfortably friendly for the sake of customer service. Service wise, hotel staff were accessible and hospitable when you needed them. We interacted with the Theater Tickets staff, Concierge, Bellmen and Housekeeping who we enjoyed having conversations with. They took a moment to see how we were doing, and if we were enjoying our stay. Other things worth mentioning- The hotel is centrally located in Times Square but on a less car/foot traffic street. Wifi is available for $12.95 for 24 hours. Good signal & high speed. If you have an evening flight, you can check out at 12pm & leave your luggage with the Bellhops at the lobby. They securely store it for you until you leave for the airport. The doorman can assist you to hail a cab or a car service for a ride to the airport. Our awesome doorman arranged for a Mercedes SUV to drive us to JFK for $62 all inclusive, on the spot! Nearby attractions: Toys R Us, Minksoff Theater (Lion King), National Debt Clock, MTA subway at 42nd Street, Walgreens & Duane Reed (1 block away), Starbucks (45th, 44th Broadway) If you donâ€™t want to go through the hassle of searching for â€œgoodâ€� Broadway seats, purchase with the Theater Ticket staff by the elevators. We paid $150+ for 3rd row Center Mezzanine Lion King tickets, when on the ticket it showed the Broker the hotel works with paid $99+. Great seats, but pricey. Check with the box office or purchased online.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a customer service hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jamesblawrence
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the Millenium Broadway hotel, I will never stay here again. 1. No blankets on the bed, only a sheet and duvet cover, very cols all night. 2. cold dark lobby, no place to sit down and relax. 3. they would not extend our check out time, they wanted another $175 to stay a couple hours. 4. The doormen were rude and not helpful, would not help getting a cab. Told us to walk to the corner and get your own cab 5. The thermostat did not work, room very cold. 6. Very hard and uncomfortable bed. Do not stay here, there must be better hotels on Time square.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, great time”
Reviews.Author: KimbaWP
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value for our family. It is located 1/2 block from Times Square, which was a fabulous home base with lots to do and see. Our room overlooked the famous 2011 ball, which really impressed my kids. Even though it was very cold out, we were able to walk almost everywhere we wanted to go. When we weren't, we were able to take a short cab ride. The only negative was that the room was small and we had two double beds, which were a bit small for our family of four. Service was excellent. Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: unclepat
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel and if it wasn't for the location, and the fact I got such a great deal, I'm not sure I would stay here again. There are very few facilites, staff are luke warm at best, and although clean, the hotel is outdated and in serious need of refurb and modernisation. Having said that, the location is fantastic and if you're just looking for a place to get your head down and explore this fantastic city from a central location, then you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and bad service. Very disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Moly99
Reviews.Content: Cost over $2500 for 2 nights in a suite with a crappy view. No restaurant. Room service only. Couldn't cancel due to snow storm but couldn't check in early either. Upon checkout, took 3 hours to get our car. Go to NYC often but will Never Again stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not the best!”
Reviews.Author: Jazzjerry
Reviews.Content: Most unfriendly greeting on arrival with the desk clerk not at all welcoming. Simply wanted my name and credit card and photo ID. Not the slightest sign of a smile! Room clean and bed comfortable if you like a very firm bed - which is okay for me! No tea or coffee making facilities but hopelessly over-priced mini bar. E.g small tube of Pringles for over Â£4 or can of Coke for Â£3 or maybe Â£16 for a half bottle of mundane Californian wine. All plus 8.875 percent tax of course! WiFi charged at 12.95 dollars plus tax per day. Starbucks is free next door! They don't want you yo lie in either with housekeeping coming into the room after a mild knock at 8.05am. Of the seven hotels I have stayed in whilst in New York this rates as no.6 and we don't like to think about no.7! If I had not paid up front I would have moved back to the Candlewood Suites where I had a night last week which was much better value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mikkie09
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, booked my reservation through travelzoo, no problems at all. Travel with my daughter and sister in law, we had a great time in Time Square !!! Hotel room was okay, it was clean, bed was firm. When checking into the hotel the front desk should let the guest know about the amenities in the hotel for example. if there is a pool, restaurant in the hotel what time it open and close. Everyone was great at the hotel from doorman, bellman, front desk everyone was nice When I return, I will stay @ your hotel again....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SLTraveler1958
Reviews.Content: I was responsible for finding accommodations for a trip with 2 friends to see a Broadway play, and this place turned out to be just perfect for us...2-3 blocks from the theatre, just a short block from Times Square, clean, roomy (for NYC), nice bathroom, very helpful concierge who pointed us to a good Italian restaurant and a great cabaret/piano place for drinks after dinner. Couldn't have asked for a better place at a great price--1 room with 2 double beds and 3 people was just under $225 a night including ALL taxes and fees. At that location and at that nice of a place, it was a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: roz3
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 2 o clock and were able to check in which was brilliant as we had spent all day travelling we found ALL the staff very helpful. The concierge very helpful. Our room was big clean and had a fantastic view. The Bell boy offered us a choice of yellow cab or black car went with the car we only payed about $7 more than we had payed in the yellow cab on the way in to the city worth paying for the extra comfort. We hope to go back to New York again in a year or two and will defiantly have this hotel as our first choice. I can't think of one think that we didn't like about our stay in this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience - Best Hospitality Staff”
Reviews.Author: Blessed45
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel stay. My experience began as soon as I stepped through the double doors of the hotel. I was warmly greeted by the doormen. The gentleman who checked me in was a consummate professional. I was completely checked in within minutes and upgraded (without request) to a corner room with a spectacular view. The best feature in the room - a soaker tub with whirlpool jets and a window view (shaded for privacy). The next best feature - the bed was fabulous. Finally, every employee I encountered made me feel welcome... including the concierge staff and the waitstaff in the Charlotte Lounge. I gave cleanliness a 3. I had to call housekeeping to report missed "pee" spots left on both sides of the base at the rear of the commode. Everything else was immaculate until a maintenance worker left grease stains on the carpet that were not cleaned up despite a call to housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: MommyDearest_13
Reviews.Content: Just got back from mother/daughter 3 day/2 night trip to NYC. We stayed at this hotel and were very happy with everything from check-in, to check-out. Absolutely no complaints other than the duvet was very thin and did not provide much warm, but we just turned up the thermostat and that helped. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, and hotel has complimentary use of a computer and printer to check-in for your flight 24 hours in advance. Being located in times square we thought it would be very noisy at night, but it wasn't. The location is fantastic, just a 2-3 minute walk to the TKTS booth for discount theatre tickets and only a 2-10 minute walk to majority of broadway theatres. There is a 24 hour cafe across the street on 45th (oatmeal, bagels, fresh fruit are among the many breakfast offerings) and a Starbucks right next door on 44th. Walgreens in conveniently located just 2-3 minute walk away. Found a great little Thai place on 46th - Bangkok House....good food and service. Will definitely stay here again...can hardly wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience---additional charge !!”
Reviews.Author: USArmy5678
Reviews.Content: You must be careful when you book this hotel !!! I bid this hotel for two nights via PRICELINE , and then I called this hotel to confirm my requirement is two beds room, and when we checked in, the clerk did not tell us we need to pay extra fee for changing room type. But when we checked out we got a additional charge 100 dollars (50 dollars per night ) due to changing the room type. I have never been charged due to changing the room type (just one bed room changed to two beds room) at any hotels , this was a very bad experience ! ! Also, I checked this hotel's website, actually one bed room and two beds are the same price !!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, nice hotel, TERRIBLE accounting/billing processes!”
Reviews.Author: Brent C
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling on business and being able to reconcile your expense accounts to your personal or corporate credit card statements is important to you, be sure to check your actual credit card statement carefully after staying at this hotel and match it to the receipts you receive on checkout. I recently hosted a small group of guests (room and tax only) and the bills I authorized and received did not match up to my actual credit card statement. It took me about an hour on the phone with someone in their accounting department (who was very helpful, by the way) to sort things out and get my account credited for the erroneous charges. Another annoying thing is that instead of charging your credit card once for the entire stay, it will be charged each day for each separate charge, and for each separate room if you are paying for multiple rooms. In my case, I had three rooms for two nights, and there were 8 separate charges posted to my credit card! Accounting issues aside, they also charged me for a "no show" for one of my guests because they had spelled the name wrong when taking the reservation - it was in the system with a "B" instead of a "V". So when my guest arrived, he was told there were no reservations in his name and he was almost walked. Then to add insult to that injury, my credit card was charged for a room night and tax for the no-show! Luckily my guest was able to get the front desk manager to scramble and find him a room, but it certainly made ME look bad. The lobby areas are busy but nice, and the restaurant/lounge area is a very nice place for an afternoon coffee of drink while gathering with a group for dinner. The location of the hotel is very convenient, as others have mentioned. Guest rooms were nice, but not impressively so, and typical NYC small. The value was good in light of the location, but if you don't mind being a few blocks away, there are better values for an equivalent room.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hidden Gem 1/2 block from Times Square”
Reviews.Author: RBSC
Reviews.Content: We were in NYC for 2 days before Christmas, traveling with 2 children, and were extremely happy with the Millennium Broadway. I have stayed in NYC countless times, but have been leary of staying near Times Square. This hotel is around the corner from Toys R Us on Broadway, and because it was on a relatively quiet sidestreet and has over 45 floors, it is extremely quiet! We had a beautiful room on the 48th floor, looking out at the Empire State Bldg, Times Square and other building tops, all decorated with Christmas lights--just beautiful! The bathroom was huge and the room was on the large size with cozy duvets. I had called ahead to request a view room, which they accommodated, but also had milk and cookies waiting for our children! I am sold on the Millenium chain, after staying in the Boston and 2 London locations--all have been fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Wish we could stay here every time we're in New York!”
Reviews.Author: LesNDC
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Millenium - stayed in July and again over the December 2010 blizzard. Some reviewers complain about the front desk but I'm not entirely convinced those users experience was based on their own behavior. We checked in during the blizzard and there were some very frustrated travelers and the front desk was very accommodating considering the circumstances. We got the room via a discount website and were not guaranteed anything other than 2 people accommodations but the front desk was able to give us 2 doubles for our family of 4. The kids loved the location (right behind Toys R Us) as did we. Room was beautiful, the view was amazing. For those complaining about noise - If you're staying in Times Square, you shouldn't expect quiet, although I slept very soundly and heard nothing outside of street noise. Stay on the Upper East Side if you're expecting quiet. Thanks for another amazing stay, Millennium.

Reviews.Title: “Great Times Square Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jrp7777
Reviews.Content: The Millennium staff was very helpful and accommodating with regard to the snowstorm which turned out to be worse than expected. Some of these really helpful people included Melissa, Tim, Rubin, Tonya. There were some people at the front desk on Christmas, 12/26 and 12/27 (and also before and after our stay there) who were especially helpful - I don't remember all their names. The people who cleaned the room were also very helpful and cleaned the room at a time to accommodate our schedule. The hotel concierge was also very helpful. Location was great! Besides the usual Times Square attractions, there was a deli across the street on 44th street that had all kinds of breakfast/lunch foods to purchase. Our room had a draft (it was very cold outside), and the heat sort of helped when we put the thermostat very high. Maybe in the winter, could there be some sort of extra insulation near the windows to help with this situation? Suggestion: It would be nice if they implement some kind of rewards program which could go towards future stays at the Millennium. This could motivate lots of people to return for future visits as well as get new people to stay here. Another suggestion: The internet charge seems to be pretty high. It's not fair that 2 different lap tops in the same room would get charged separately for internet. Couldn't there be a 1 time charge for the room? Could the very good customers get the internet charge waived? All in all, we really enjoyed the visit to your hotel and plan to come back some time!

Reviews.Title: “Very poor customer service; dishonest staff”
Reviews.Author: patti30067
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in this hotel; the first time being over 10 years ago. We booked this trip as a surprise for our young daughter who had heard so much about NYC from us as we used to live in the city. Her Christmas birthday provided a great excuse for our first family trip back to NY. I was excited to receive a wonderful deal through travelzoo for this hotel - which we had previously had a good experience with. The room we requested through travelzoo was with a king-sized bed. Upon checking in, the friendly clerk offered us a rollaway bed since he saw we were travelling with our daughter. We gladly accepted. He said nothing about a charge. Later that night when we returned to the room, the bed hadn't yet been delivered. We called the front desk and the front desk manager told us there would be $35 fee for the bed. We explained that we weren't told that when we checked in, and that the clerk just offered the bed. She wouldn't budge, which surprised me because for $35 you would think they would just send up the bed as a courtesy, but no. In fact while on the line she made a point of noting that we had booked through travelzoo, received a discounted rate, and had asked for a king room. At this point we just said, fine, please just send us the bed. When we checked out four nights later imagine our surprise when the invoice slipped under our door listed $35 for EACH NIGHT of our stay with a curt note under each line stating "guest was informed." We called the front desk and again received no help. The clerk even made snide comments to us such as "how many nights were you staying" (which he could tell from the invoice) so that when we responded "four" he said "hmmmm. well, that's $35 a night." It didn't matter that I tried to explain that initially we were told of no charge and later was just told $35. Anyone would have assumed that the $35 rate was flat - she definitely did not specify it was per night of stay. He put me on hold for over 10 minutes and then I was disconnected. We ended up stranded in NYC for another couple of days due to the blizzard and for convenience's sake we would have stayed at this hotel even with losing the travelzoo discount, but I was so unhappy with the customer service that we moved to another hotel - paying $150 per night more than we had at the Millennium, but enjoying superior service. Too bad the refusal to acknowledge our complaint over $140 cost the hotel over $500 in the extra nights we would have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: paul777
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel right off Times Square. Rooms are large and comfortable. Overall, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Littlesheep
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for three nights. Pros: location, location, location Cons: - poor quality of service (we couldn't even find a person to asssit us to find a cab. finally after 10 minutes of looking for assistance, a door boy suggested us to take an "unautorized cab".) - Heating system in the room was not functioning well. It was very cold at night and woke up several times at night. I would recommend this hotel if you would like to stay in Times Square area and do not care much about the quality of services.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: musicguy8
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place that is right in the middle of everything, then this is the place. We had just gotten off of an 8 day cruise and were at the hotel way before check in time(Check in was 3 and we were there at 9). We went and checked in and they said that they would try to give us the first room available, at that time he got a call saying that there was a room ready and he gave it to us! Talk about service. This was my wife and I's first trip to New York and any question that we had was answered very politely and promptly. They helped us find taxi cabs, subway stations, and eating places. The service was excellent and very friendly. The location of the hotel was perfect. We were no more than 100 feet from Good Morning America. We always felt safe about where we were. We also were only about a half block from West Side Story. GREAT SHOW! GREAT HOTEL AND WOULD RECOMMEND TO ANY LEISURE TRAVELER!!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD, NOT GREAT”
Reviews.Author: tobeginwith
Reviews.Content: The Millennium is right off Times Square, making it a fun place to stay (get a room high up to avoid street noise). The rooms are a good size (especially for NYC) and the elevators are fast but my room was not as clean as I would have liked it (coffee stains on bathroom door trim and wall, dirt behind night stand, dried blood stain on sheets), and my room had no pen or paper or "do not disturb" sign. The front desk often had long lines with one person working when there should have been 2-3. This place seems a bit mis-managed. All in all, good not great but if you can get a room here for under $250 I'd say go for it!

Reviews.Title: “You could not ask for a better hotel in NYC for the money.”
Reviews.Author: KarlaD123
Reviews.Content: I read through a lot of tripadvisor reviews before booking this property. We found a great rate on travelzoo ($200) that seemed too good to be true for a Times Square area property in December. I can't imagine there is a better value in this location during this time of year. The room was spacious and clean and we had a partial view of Time Square. Even being so close to the business of the area, the room was still fairly quiet. The hotel location was perfect. We easily walked to dinner, a show, and my husband was even able to walk to his business meeting. Our room was ready when we got there and they have a generous noon check-out time. Our bags were stored and retrieved quickly. The elevators were prompt. I enjoyed the exercise facility - treadmills were smooth! We were on the 30th floor. I assume we had a renovated room. Someone mentioned the bathroom didn't seem to have been renovated and I can understand the comment. The tile in the shower wasn't pristine. Someone else commented that the toilet seat was yellowed and ours was yellowed too. Maybe they are coming back to finish the renovations of the bathrooms? If I had to issue any complaint at all it would be that it seems the bathroom renovations weren't quite complete, but that would be so minor compared to all the positives of the room, hotel location and value for the money. Also, no free wi-fi, but I'd prefer to have the option of paying for it vs. having it added to the price of the room. Overall, we were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - only 1 complaint”
Reviews.Author: DeniDen
Reviews.Content: We booked the Millenium with a special through Travelzoo for $199 a night. We stayed over a Sunday night to see a show (Rain - which was amazing!), check out the tree, and visit with my significant other's sister. The hotel is located just off Times Square. Valet parking is about $50, which is steep, but not uncommon in the area. We were able to check in early and get to our room - 3301. We were in a corner room, which is larger than the regular rooms. It was very spacious with a side view of Times Square. It was very clean and had nice amenities. Literally, my only complaint about the hotel is the bed linens. There is no comforter, but rather a very thin duvet cover type of blanket with no duvet in it. I was freezing the entire night and it kept falling off the bed. We didn't eat in the hotel, and only utilized the gift shop to buy some Excedrin. We ate at John's Pizzeria, Dallas BBQ and the Evergreen Coffee Shop, which are all close by. The location is great and the hotel is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Old and dusty room”
Reviews.Author: MTL1221
Reviews.Content: Room was pretty outdated and could use a face lift. Very dusty room (dust on walls, tv , inside mini bar, very dusty behind furniture and corners) Safety deposit box in room was useless because it was hanging from wall. Toilet seat has seen its days and turned yellow in color. Water didn`t drain properly in bathtub. Carpet was soiled. Great location that`s about it! I`ll admit that staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the bad reviews, this hotel was great!”
Reviews.Author: Antnvik
Reviews.Content: We had read some negative reviews on this hotel, and were a little bit interested to see what our experience was. The check in staff was very friendly and accommodating. We received a complimentary upgrade to a higher floor upon check in. Elevators were smooth and quick. The room was great! :) Bed was comfortable, everything was very clean and well taken care of. The view was amazing! We had no issues with climate control. Some reveiws of other hotels in the area complained about small rooms, but this room was very spacious and we didn't feel the least bit cramped. You could not ask for a better location - just off Times Square behind the mega Toys R Us. We could walk easily to subway and to check out sights and Broadway shows. Really, I would totally recommend this hotel to anyone. Super convenient, very nice rooms, friendly staff. I couldn't have asked for much more. The only thing even vaguely negative I could say is that it doesn't offer compimentary WiFi access, but we walked outside to Times and they have free WiFi hot spots there so it wasn't really an issue and did not impact our stay nor impression.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large room, great service”
Reviews.Author: SFLMom
Reviews.Content: I booked the room on priceline for approx $200/nite and was unsure after the mixed reviews on this site as to what I was going to get! This hotel was exceptional for the price. The location could not be more perfect- I was able to walk to everything I had scheduled during my stay. The room was huge by NYC standards! Everything was spotless, very clean and the staff from front desk to concierge and doormen were very helpful. I got in at about 9 am and planned to leave my luggage and return for the 4 pm check in. I was told at the desk that my room was ready and was able to check in early. Upon leaving, I spoke to the doorman to request a cab to the airport and he arranged a Towncar for close to the same cost of a cab! My only gripe would be the bedding and the bed. The bed definitely lacked that luxe feel of finer quality sheets and pillows. There was no blanket, only the duvet cover which slipped off during the nite. I would recommend this hotel and be glad to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: tdsbu
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with this hotel. On the positive side, the location was good, right off times square. Negatives: worn rooms in need of a facelift; very poor service, especially from the manager; shower leaks; elevator noise from across the hall; lack of charm/atmosphere in lobby; old linens/curtains/blankets. I could see the property being used as a youth hostel or turned into small apartments, but it should certainly not be marketed as a 3 or 4 state hotel in new York.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it , complete high end”
Reviews.Author: magpie4ever
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a wonderful hotel in the heart of Times Square this is it. We did stay at the Premiere section of the hotel which was a significant upgrade, but well worth it. The staff was excellent and attentive. The room was very clean, and roomy as most hotel rooms in New York are on the small size compared to let's say Orlando. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. We stayed there specifically to see a run of shows at the Best Buy Theater, formerly known as The Nokia theater and it was a block away if that. We live upstate and usually stay at another hotel when going to the city for the weekends, but would definately tell all absolutely stay there without hesitation. The price , especially for the Premiere was a quite a bit higher but we felt worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Our favorite place to stay in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: MomOfTravellers
Reviews.Content: This was our 10th stay. I wrote a review in 2007, after our first visit and thought it was time to write another review. This hotel has everything we look for in a place to stay - beautiful rooms with a view to die for, a warm friendly staff (special kudos to Tim and Terrance), and a location that can't be beat. I have nothing negative to say and we'll keep coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Tourist and conference hotel getting old”
Reviews.Author: DCKB
Reviews.Content: Not even a tea or coffee maker on the room. But then it's NYC - overpriced hotels in general

Reviews.Title: “A good place for tourists to stay because of the price and unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: Tapnmel23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights in late-October. I lived in New York for awhile a few years back and chose this hotel for my return trip because of its great location. It is right in the heart of Times Square and yet, it doesn't have sky high Times Square prices. We paid $300/night for a room with two beds on the 30th floor. This is an older property, but it has been remodeled so it doesn't feel old. The rooms have flat screen TVs, duvets, a nice sitting area and was quite spacious, especially for NYC standards. While all of these features were very nice, the room still had old an old-fashioned alarm clock (an Ipod compatible alarm clock is standard these days) and the bathroom still felt older (which was a bit odd because the rest of the room seemed modern). However, the bathroom was large with a big mirror and lots of counter space (although only 1 sink) so that was nice. We wanted a fridge in our room to keep drinks cold so we had to pay a one time fee of $20 for a fridge to be delivered. Something to keep in mind ... Also something to keep in mind - the beds. They were relatively hard! I expect more from an alleged "4 star" hotel. Another perk: the room was very quiet. However, the long and the short of it is that this is a hotel in NYC - one of the most exciting cities in the world. So you aren't going to spend that much time in the room. Given this factor, all of these amenities aren't really that important. Which matters more is the location. And this hotel has a fabulous Times Square location and is very close to Bryant Park and the 42nd Street and 6th Avenue subway stops. So if you are a tourist and are going to be seeing all of the typical NYC sites while you are in town, this place will make a nice (and modern) home base for you.

Reviews.Title: “I actually liked a hotel in NYC! This was great”
Reviews.Author: HawkinDC
Reviews.Content: It's been a while since I stayed in what was billed as a very nice hotel and I agreed with the billing. Too many times in hotels the paint has been peeling, mold in the bathroom, etc., but this was not the case here. The hotel was very nice. It wasn't brand-spanking new but it was in good shape. My room looked nice and tasteful and I had a view of the water and the times square ball. It wasn't a perfect hotel but I would really recommend it to a friend... and I don't normally do that for hotels. Great location too. A really good breakfast if you get a free breakfast with the room - much, much better than most free breakfasts and the restaurant staff were very nice. I will remember this hotel and look to stay at their other hotels around the world

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there.”
Reviews.Author: JCS
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location, of course. On 44th St, just a minute from the noise of Times Square. Good restaurants right across the road. Very friendly and helpful concierge (the tall guy with dark hair). Cons: Smelly room. Ew. No blankets on beds, just sheets and duvet inserts with no duvet cover. I hated to think how many dirty sweaty bodies had used those duvets before us! No in-room coffee. Hard mattresses; small and uncomfortable pillows. Really skanky carpets that we didn't want to walk on barefoot. Housekeeping didn't bother cleaning toilets and bathtub. We got this on priceline for $215 a night, but I would have preferred to pay more for a better hotel. This was not nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Leki
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Priceline and got a great deal. The location was perfect for us for going to the Theater a few times, and we could get anywhere we needed by subway very easily. After reading some of the reviews before we went I was a bit hesitant to stay here. However, I will tell you that the service was top notch from start to finish. The concierge was incredibly helpful, the maids were friendly and did a great job, and the security guards were super as well! Every employee we encountered was extremely nice and helpful. The room we had was a corner room on the 19th floor. Not much of a view at all, but very spacious for NYC, with a very comfortable King bed. We had no issues with noise from the street. The hotel is just far enough from Times Square to not encounter all of the noise. We would definitely stay here again. This is not the Ritz Carlton (and is priced accordingly), but if you are looking for a hotel centrally located, near the Theather District with friendly staff, and spacious rooms, this is your hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in New York. Awful.”
Reviews.Author: iltsm
Reviews.Content: I dont understand how this hotel is considered a 3.5 or 4 star hotel. Front desk staff were rude and unhelpful. Room had the in room safe ripped out of the wall. Was forced to change rooms. next room was dirty. TV didnt work properly. No blanket on bed - just dirty bed cover. Hallways smelled. No in room coffee. I have stayed in many hotels in NYC and i'm very familiar with the hotels in the area. This was worst hotel - bar none. I've emailed head office to inform them. Of course, in conjuction with my entire experience, I havent heard back from anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great times sq location but bad customer service among other things”
Reviews.Author: BostonLindsay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights mid week in october thru travelzoo deal. In the middle of the times sq craziness but very standard hotel. gross blankets on the bed, no duvet covers. thermostat didn't work in room, and after paying extra for in room wi-fi, it didn't work half the time. tv had a lot of static. lots of noticeable defects in hallway wallpaper, closet mirror. front desk is VERY SLOW, and concierge didn't seem to have answers to simple questions. toilet broke and flooded bathroom in middle of night and we had to move rooms, hotel was quick to get someone upstairs to deal with it and move our bags but new room wasn't any better and we have not been compensated in any way for the disturbance. they weren't very understanding or quick to help.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous-the people put this review over the top!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cabellgirl
Reviews.Content: I don't typically stay on Broadeay but a conference at the Marriott made a broadway hotel a good idea. The Millenium had the best prices and, as I found out, really REALLY wonderful staff!

Reviews.Title: “IT WAS AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: barb2429
Reviews.Content: Took 8 teenage girls to New York City for come action packed fun, the millennium was awesome staff was very friendly and helpful, especially Eddie and Billy the doormen. Went to see Blue Man Group, ate at the Hard Rock Cafe and took in most of Time Square. The only negative thing I can say about the hotel, the beds were not that comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Feces on our sheets!”
Reviews.Author: SashaRiga
Reviews.Content: Quite a terrible experience, and we would not write about it if it were properly solved by the hotel management. We woke up the first morning to find dried-out (thankfully!) brown smudges on our sheets. Disgusted, we reported it to the front desk, who promised to tell the housekeeping. Trusting that our sheets were changed, we did not bother to check, but the next morning discovered that nothing was done about it! The second day we personally went with the housekeeping to make sure they change the sheets. The front desk lady just shrugged her shoulders and said "sorry" with a big smile. Unbelievable...

Reviews.Title: “Location Service Elegance In a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SouthMauiGuy
Reviews.Content: 1 Location is great 2 rooms are large for NYC 3 Great Views from higher floors 4 Fitness center was huge Only negatives were the bed base surrounds were bigger than bed and we kicked them or ran into them a few times and wifi is 13 dollars for 24 hours

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular stay! Extraordinary service!”
Reviews.Author: busitraveller_10
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Millenium Broadway was spectacular. We booked using a TravelZoo discounted rate, but the experience was nothing but first class. I had mentioned that we were in town for my daughter's birthday, when I made the reservation. The agent who booked us had a birthday cake and popcorn in the room when we arrived, along with a personal card wishing my daughter a happy birthday. Everyone from the frint desk staff, to the housekeeping crew, to the security staff in the lobby were helpful and kind. The room was spacious, even with a rollaway bed added. The view was amazing. I have travelled extensively, and am pleased to say that The Millenium Broadway is one of my all-time favorite hotels. Many thanks to the staff for giving us a memorable stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “best location”
Reviews.Author: Sem79
Reviews.Content: Excellent location adjacent to the time square Rooms a bit small and the rate is expensive (300$ night) but this is New York !!! We look forward to come back..

Reviews.Title: “TAKING THE EXTRA STEP”
Reviews.Author: Bill_Radio61
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful experience at this great hotel, with a great location. I booked it on priceline, and then checked out trip advisor. I was a little worried because of one review that mentioned bed bugs. My wife is going to kil me. I called the hotel, and they could have easily ignored me. I had prepaid and no refunds. Instead they had their Director of Operations return my call. What a nice lady, who gave me lots of reassurance. 1st they do not have bed bugs. 2nd they exterminate every room every week. 3rd they have completely wrapped every mattress in its own mattess cover. The mattress was so comfortable we had a hard time getting up in the morning. The conversation was reasurring, but the extra step made the difference. When we arrived they sent up a tray with fruit, nuts and water. They did not have to do this, but it created a memory we will share and not forget. I salute the Millennium on Broadway. Small world when I returned to work the next week our DOS was headed to NY on biz and i asked where she was staying. She said Millennium, on Broadway, and i told her she is in for a treat. A location that can not be beat, and a staff that cares about their customers. They are a 3 and a half stars in Priceline, but five stars in my mind. Thank you Millennium.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jmorris77
Reviews.Content: Beautiful art deco hotel, less than a block from Times Square. Called ahead and requested the highest room possible - quite worth it! We got the 51st floor facing the Empire State Building! Very clean and staff very helpful and accommodating. Would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Hoffy007
Reviews.Content: Not the most luxurious of hotels but spotlessly clean and a great location for exploring what is a wonderful city. Very friendly staff, swift and efficient check in process, 2nd floor has complimentary internet access so you can check in online with your airline. Very comfortable bed. Being that we only really used the room to sleep in as we were out the whole time it served a purpose. Overall a good standard 3 star hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: hkmilkteaa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend trip with 2 girlfriends. I highly recommend Millennium for its LOCATION. Because its right up the side street in the main Times Square area, there's plenty of people and very well lit. Even at 4-5am, its still very safe to walk. Plenty of cabs, shops (in case you spontaneously need a special outfit), and subway is walking distance. Rooms are moderate size. We had 2 twins (beds are small), but it was comfortable. Bathroom was old, but clean. Service is mediocre, but I didn't mind too much.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE- ONE OF THE WORST HOTELS IN AMERICA”
Reviews.Author: BenP80
Reviews.Content: I didn't even stay in this hotel and they still charged my credit card. My wife and I read a number of reviews about bed bugs being an issue and apparently all the hotel do to resolve the problem is deny it all. So we cancelled with 1 months notice despite there being no cancellation policy on the booking and booked in at St Giles Tuscany on E39th st. Despite cancelling they have still charged my credit card Â£200 and say they did not receive the cancellation. I booked through Booking.com and the lady who is dealing with this for me states this is not possible as they have an online service to check on bookings. STAY WELL CLEAR if you want to keep your money, sanity and skin in tact!

Reviews.Title: “We will stay again”
Reviews.Author: klim1
Reviews.Content: Millennium offered (through TravelZoo) $300/ night rate during Columbus Day weekend, which was the only hotel with 3+ star rating under $400/ night rate in NY for this weekend. We were cautious due to some negative rating and "Bed Bug" reviews but our stay was better then expected. Positives: - Location, location, location (if you are a tourist, this is the place to be, right on the time square) - Good rate (if you can say $300/ night is consider a good rate) - Staff was not rude (they didn't go out of their way to help you but was polite and answered all questions that we had) Negatives: - Hotel felt like more business setting then for family/tourist (not much for kids to do other then playing who's going to push the elevator buttom first, but world's largest Toys R Us is right next door so I guess you can't compete with that) - It's been 20 years since they opened this hotel and it shows. Time to redecorate/renovate and they will be back up in 4 to 4 1/2 star rating -Soap Nazi, we stayed for 3 nights with only one soap. Yes, one soap. First day I called housekeeping to get some more soap but never got more...no soap for you!!! We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant, there were just too much choices out near. Overall, we will stay again at this hotel. Lastly, we are family of 4. If you have similar size group, take the cab to where you are going, we tried subway, bus and not worth saving 2 to 4 dollars. Also, dial7 is best way to/from LaGuardia during rush hours.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: canuckglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: It is fair to say this hotel is 3.5*, not more, not less. The people at the reception were for the most part cordial , same goes for the concierge who was also very eager to help. Upon checking in we asked for a higher floor room and we were assigned a corner unit on the 35th floor, partially overlooking Times Square (which is less than a block away). One couldnâ€™t hear a noise in the room. Judging by the style It looks like the rooms were renovated probably 7-8 years ago (itâ€™s an European chain so the slightly atypical style of the rooms may be because of that) and ours was decent size, well maintained, had a large LDC screen, firm king-size bed and a mini bar. One thing that it did lack was complimentary coffee and tea at the room, something that in North is available in several hotel chains. Since I had read reports on this site of bed bugs in some rooms first thing I did was to inspect the bed. I neither find any nor were we bitten. The washroom was spotless but I did notice some dust behind the TV that more careful cleaning staff should have noticed. Parking at the hotel is a bit pricey (55$, no in-and-out privileges) but via bestparking.com I managed to find a spot two blocks away for half the price. Internet access is somewhat pricey as well (around 13$/day) but there are a few Starbucks in the area where you can navigate for free. I booked the room via Priceline so I could not comment whether their standard rates offer a fair benefit-cost ratio but the one I paid (around 180$) was somewhat within reason considering the star rating and location.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth Stay - Everything Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: MaconMemories
Reviews.Content: My fourth stay at Millennium Broadway. Three friends were with me. They were impressed with the hotel as well. The location can't be beat. Great value!!!!

Reviews.Title: “VERY TACKY HOTEL,”
Reviews.Author: RukmalS
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for us by a friend , so I did not check any reviews etc. prior to our stay. I on my own would have never booked this hotel. At check-in we were upgraded to a suite. Having stayed in many hotel suites in different countries, our expectations were high. However, the entire family was very disappointed on seeing the so called suite, as it was of very poor quality. Cleanliness was just ok. But all the furniture, fittings and the interiors had seen much better times, and needed a complete overhaul. Everything was of extremely basic quality. It had a bedroom, sitting section with a sofa bed (very old & uncomfortable), powder room and a very small, extremely dated toilet with bath. The Lobby has two entrances from 44th and 45th Avenues, and has the feeling of a train or bus station. As we were there only for 2 nights, for sightseeing, and for Harry Connick Jr. concert we just made do with the Hotel, as the location for us was convenient. However, the Hotel spoilt our experience of the trip to New York from being excellent to just average. What a shame!!

Reviews.Title: “Ewww but no bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: globalnomad63
Reviews.Content: Broadway weekend with the family! So disappointed with the hotel. I thought they had been remodeled recently? Rooms were just not clean (big! hairball on the bathroom floor) Beds weren't comfy and pillows stiff. 1 of 2 rooms not ready at check in or an hour later. Nice enough staff offered a room with an upgrade! Went up to upgraded room to find it as previous guest had left it. Finally moved into a room as the rest of our family was moving out of the first room. Really strange smell - maybe bedbug disinfectant? Booked through Priceline so the best the staff could do was offer free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Less than expected”
Reviews.Author: msgwenn
Reviews.Content: Hotel location was nice since we were there to see a play and Time Square but the hotel itself leaves a bit to be desired. We were given a room upon arrival only to find it occupied by one surprised gentleman when I opened the door with my keycard. Had to wait three hours for another. Room was okay but the tub drain was pulled out and laying in the bottom and there was a black substance on the wall of the tub which rinsed off. Cigarette burns on the carpet and nightstand. Bed was very hard. Had to go to another floor to get ice since the on on ours was broken. Most of the staff were friendly but a few were a bit rude. I think on our next trip we will try and stay some place else.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: SpivsUKOK
Reviews.Content: It's not clear to me how this hotel passes itself off as four star. The receptionist took four attempts to check me in - he found his inability quite funny: at 11 in the evening after nine hours of travel I didn't share his mirth. The"lobby" is a featureless corridor which sums up the hotel: soulless. It trades on its location, and doesn't have much else going for it. My room was shabby with a duvet on the bed which was grubby. The bathroom was ugly and in serious need of updating. Very, very overpriced rooms. I'm rating two stars on the basis of location only: right by Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice around Times Square”
Reviews.Author: charlie34567
Reviews.Content: The hotel entrance is dark and unwelcoming, but the rooms are huge (for the area), comfortable, clean and the hotel is almost litteraly on Times Square. What else to ask if you're a tourist in NY? Overall an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “No fancy frills but nice hotel and good restaurant”
Reviews.Author: aka_betty
Reviews.Content: The room was was and while could use an update it was clean and roomy for a NYC hotel. I've been in much smaller rooms that cost a lot more and we had room to move around. The staff was extremely friendly helping us navigate the subway and buses. I had breakfast in the restaurant and while prices were high (as all hotel restaurants prices are high) the food and service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location. but not value for money”
Reviews.Author: prakdora
Reviews.Content: I stayed for couple of nights in August, 2010. Please do not expect any service at all if you intend to stay. Only good thing is that it is right in the middle of Times Square. Looking to the cost and no service or rude manners of the staff it should be one's last choice. It took more than three hours to respond to attend a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views”
Reviews.Author: girltalk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location and our room had a fabulous view of Time Square. The hotel decor needs an update but it was generally clean. Our only problem was with room service. The towels and bed were not changed/made daily. Otherwise a decent hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again more than likely”
Reviews.Author: LissyL0u
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after booking thru wotif and getting a great deal thru it. The location is absolutely fabulous for young couples, however we are older and it was a bit busy for us (we have never been to New York before), however this is NOT the hotels fault and like I say absolutely perfect for younger people especially as it is right on Broadway. The room was spotless and very modern, quite tight fitting however in New York terms very good. The concerige was not too helpful for us, we had a bus trip for the next day asked how long to get to it, told 5 minutes it was nearly 25 minute walk and almost missed our bus. All the same would possibly stay again if not with young children.

Reviews.Title: “extremely disappointed by the ill treatment they had the hotel staff. not recommend to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: KAROLINEQUESADA
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disappointed with the treatment I had one of the guys who carry our bags at the exit of the Hotel. During the entire stay functionaI everything well, just thought the cleanliness of the rooms could be better since the Millennium is said to be a 4 star hotel. In my opinion, no more than 3 stars. Well, the last day we had lots of bags to carry as many did some shopping and ask the hotel clerk to help us. He was in the room and grabbed his bag, but had to wait our car to arrive, which should take about 15 minutes. In this interval, the same guy (a dark top - do not know the name of it) was to bring other baggage of other pros guests rooms. Our car comes and he is not in the lobby to help us, there ourselves (me and my mother) let's pushing the cart toward the door, there comes ANOTHER FACE SUPER Antipater and RUDE and pulls the CART OF PEOPLE AND PUTS BACK INTO PLACE THAT WAS. I explain that we have HURRY AND THAT CAN NOT WAIT, he pulls the WE STAND FOR AGAIN AND START TALKING harsh words. (DO NOT KNOW THE NAME OF THE SAME ALSO - BUT IT IS ALMOST BALD AND WHITE SKIN AND HEIGHT MEDIAN.) In this hour I am very angry and pull a cart to the direction of the exit door to get my bags. In short, we took our bags and we were alone EXTREMELY BADLY TREATED IN OUT OF HOTEL. NEVER go there anymore And I RECOMMEND THAT NO BRAZILIAN BACK. A DRUG TREATMENT TO CUSTOMER.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: karlgruns
Reviews.Content: Friendly and fast check in and room service. Spacius clean rooms - TV chanel selection could be better (only have standard cable TV chanels) but no i-pod holder. Great Location - Walking distance to any of 22 landmark Broadway theaters and several off-Broadway theaters. You can also take a short walk or taxi ride to the American Museum of Natural History, MOMA, the Metropolitan Museum of Art or the Guggenheim Museum. new to me was that some of the Museums have open air concerts in the summer afternnons or evenings. Great shopping area -not only the expensive Fifth Avenue but also the surrounding area for exclusive boutiques and expansive department stores.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - helpful staff - large (for NYC) rooms”
Reviews.Author: JeanetteKC
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, doors on both 44th and 45th btwn 6th and Broadway. We had a superior king room on the 32nd floor with a wall of windows looking out on 45th and down to Bdwy. The front desk is generally busy, but reasonably efficient and all the staff that we dealt with were pleasant and helpful. The room was big for NYC. In addition to the king bed, there was an easy chair, a desk with a chair, 2 bedside tables, and a dresser which also held the large flat screen TV. We also had a fridge and the room did not feel cramped at all.

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS”
Reviews.Author: businessasusual2
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a suite on the 52nd floor last week and woke up in the middle of the night to find itchy bumps on my neck and arms. Not knowing what the bumps were from, I went back to sleep after popping some allergy meds and putting on some Cortisone anti-itch cream. I woke in the morning to find bedbug bites (in a series of 3) under my neck, behind my ear, and on my right arm. Additionally, after I told the hotel about it, they ignored me and took no steps to fix the bedbug problem. Beware of the bedbugs!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kel22183
Reviews.Content: The room looked great and the location was awesome! Right around the corner from Times Square. Pricing was a little high, but I got a great deal through Priceline so that wasn't really an issue. They do parking for $55/day, but there's also a garage across the street where it's about $45/day (I believe). Not too much cheaper, but the hotel's parking is a few blocks away so it takes like 20 minutes for them to get it while across the street takes about 5. Either one is for 24 hours from when you park it. So even though check out is noon, if you don't put your car in there until 5 PM, you don't have to get it until 5 PM. You can also do less than 24 hrs if you want, but why not utilize the subway? The only issue that came up was we took items out of the mini-bar so we could store our own stuff, and we got charged. We put it all back though and they reversed the charges. Oh yeah and the other thing that sucked was the wi-fi was not free. We did not utilize it so I don't know how much it was. The sheets were a little weird because the bottom one was not a fitted sheet (it seem like just another top sheet tucked in), so by the morning we were kind of entangled up in them. But the bed itself was pretty comfortable. Was a little hard to find a happy temperature, but we brought a mini-fan so we were ok.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else to stay...”
Reviews.Author: dee2233
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a wedding that was at the Hudson Theater (attatched to hotel) and we were not satisfied. First we reserved 3 rooms for our party that one person paid for. When we got there we were required to give our credit card, which they charged for the room plus a 200 deposit for each room. We thought we were giving card for incidentals. The third party in our third room couldn't check in until we returned to the hotel. We had to then say that someone else had paid for it, to make a long story short, they were not very friendly or helpful at the front desk, nor was there any sort of apology for the confusion. Then, we were on a non-smoking floor, (two of our rooms anyway...even though we reserved three rooms at one time, one was on a different floor...) in my mother-in laws room there was a very strong odor of smoke. We called downstairs and was told that there was nothing they could do about it. the second time we complained, we were told we could move, not likely with the amount of stuff we had, the third time, they came to the room and sprayed some air freshner. The staff was rude and not helpful, the beds were hard as a rock and be very careful when walking around them as the frame sticks out and you will hit your knees! The best part of the visit was the wedding, it was beautiful and the bell hops were absolutely the best.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelsteve12
Reviews.Content: Only a half block 20 second walk to the HEART of Times Square. I think you get the point. This is the place to be if you want to be in Times Square. Walking distance from Central Park, Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center, Broadway, David Letterman, Empire State Building, and â€¦..well you get the point. Short 20 minute taxi to the Statue of Liberty and ground zero. The rooms are typical, but the breakfast here is not good at all. Itâ€™s only a continental breakfast, but every morning the food was not covered and there were tiny flies around the bread and fruit. I just avoided this by eating cereal. Thatâ€™s the only thing bad I can say. The staff was helpful. Other than that, itâ€™s worth the money if your looking to be in the middle of the hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Christmas”
Reviews.Author: DavidCarr404
Reviews.Content: i love this hotel so much!! at Christmas time the place is magic a true New York experience, ideally located on time square. every time i think of New york i remember the Christmas i had at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location if you want to be in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: spdot
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time staying at the Millennium Hotel Broadway. The location can't be beat if you are interested in being close to the action in Times Square. I have to admit that after the thrill of Times Square - the lights, the people, etc - begins to wear off, the appeal of this hotel also started to dim. The front desk staff were pleasant enough upon checking in. After that, we had no interaction with anyone at the hotel. The room was large enough, as was the bathroom. We had a nice flat-screen TV. Other than that, there wasn't anything special about the room. I got a great deal on Travelzoo so there's not much to complain about either - but I'm very happy I didn't pay the going rate. One thing worth noting - there is a notice on the door to the mini-refrigerator warning you not to move anything unless you want to be charged for it. You can't use the refrigerator to keep your own beverages cold. Apparently you can request the hotel to bring you another refrigerator. This seems ridiculous to me. We drank our water at room-temperature. I would recommend this hotel if you get a good rate and really want to be in the middle of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LilJetsettter
