Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend to NYC for a getaway as part of his holiday gift. Since he hadn't really seen much of NYC I thought I'd stick him in the middle of the action, Times Square. The hotel has a great location and in walking distance to many touristy attractions! The only downside was the room. The bed sheets were scratchy and the pillow cases/pillows were terrible. The room heat was up way too high (even though it was Winter and I appreciated it not matching the outside temperature, but it was like a steam room). When we attempted to turn down the heat in the room it didn't work. We went to open the window to find out that the window was already cracked and wouldn't close the next day (downside to sleeping with the window open you hear all the traffic on the streets)! The rooms were large and the bathroom a nice size. The decor was a bit 1980's and could use a face lift. I give this hotel a 3 merely based upon it's location and size of room for NYC. I wouldn't spend the money to stay here during Peak Season (Fall), but since I got a good deal for the Winter and with Advanced Purchase rate it did the trick. Probably wouldn't recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location allows me to overlook some shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: acidrain
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is absolutely perfect for theater goers(which we are) and anyone wishing to explore the wonder which is Times Square. Also we got a prepaid deal that made this hotel a lot more affordable than other comparable hotels in this prime area. The other thing this hotel has going for it is Erick at the concierge desk. Very professional, very courteous. he actually seems to care that your trip is as great as it can be. Now for the things that weren't so spectacular. We had 2 rooms. One room was available at 3:00 the other they said would be available at 4:00. No big deal. However, 4:00 rolled around, then 5:00, then 5:30 and still they could not seem to find out when this room would be ready. I finally walked to the room myself and discovered that whoever had checked out that morning had left a "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door therefore housekeeping did not clean it. When i called the front desk and informed them of this they sent housekeeping to it and had it cleaned so we did not get our second room until 6:00 and I am not sure that we ever would have if I had not gone myself to check on it. Secondly, the safe in our room did not work. And finally, the bed was way to hard for my liking. It really boils down to what you are looking for in a hotel. If you are looking for a perfect location at a decent price(for New York that is) and can overlook a few things then this is the place for you. If, on the other hand, you are looking for that ultimate luxury hotel experience you would probably be better off elsewhere. To the review that talks about being charged for things they did not use out of the mini bar in the room: at the front desk it plainly states on signs that you can't miss that the bars are equipped with sensors and if you move anything you will be charged for it. My suggestion is to not move anything in there if you do not plan on drinking it. We heeded the sign and did not move anything and were not charged a dime. Would I stay here again? Yes, because what really matters to me is location at a decent price and the Millenneum delivers on that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simplicity024
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. Hotel could do with some updating, but room was a good size, beds spotless and room cleaned every day, sheets towels etc. New York is a city which has so much going on, who wants to spend time in the hotel anyway ! No complaints would definately revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great room for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Jami_Brooks
Reviews.Content: We got a price of $169.00 from travelzoo and was upgraded to the 48th floor by just asking. We could see the corner of times square from our room. It was a small room but clean and comfortable. It was in an excellent location and enjoye our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - located at the epicenter of NYC!”
Reviews.Author: HausLife
Reviews.Content: Pretty pricey for the size of the room - but what else is to be expected in the Big Apple... The rooms are modern and security is pretty tight. The elevators are protected by room keys - so you cannot go up to any level unless you are a guest of the hotel. The location is fantastic - right off Times Square in the heart of Broadway. Countless things to do, places to eat, and of course the best shopping in the world on 5th Avenue nearby.. If you are lucky you can get a pretty good (somewhat obscured view) of Times Square... It's pretty loud all night, so may want to pack a sound machine if noise bothers you - or join in the party because you are in NY!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel-Great Location”
Reviews.Author: emismith
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Millennium Broadway Hotel. There were six of us and we had three rooms. The rooms were clean and updated and of a nice size. There were no frills at this hotel, but definitely comfortable. Had a decent but not grat view from our room. Had a direct view of the Chrysler Building. We were disappointed that there were no coffee pots in the rooms and no vent in the bathroom. Staff and bellmen were very helpful when called upon. Overall this hotel was a good value and in a great location: right in Times Square. We would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “They are only interested in your money.”
Reviews.Author: Supernova92
Reviews.Content: Just two warnings for the visitors: don't move anything in the bar on your room. The hotel will let you pay for all the drinks that are in it (about 140 usd), also when you didn't use anything of it. They take the money via your creditcard, from which they demanded the data when you arrive in the hotel. Don't trust the lady behind the receptiondesk when she promise you, she will undo this bill. When you come home again, the money is already picked from your account. It's a whole fight before you have your money back. Another warning: be carefull with the tv. One wrong push on a button and you activate a "cinema"-movie you don't want to see. Costs: about 12 dollar, also when you stop the movie immediate. Pretty disappointing, this service from a ****-hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Papaleadfoot
Reviews.Content: A great location at Broadway. Ample places to eat. Busy place. Nice staff. Smaller rooms. Expensive parking ($55 p/night)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: EuroTraveler52
Reviews.Content: I was in town for the weekend with friends. I selected this hotel because they offered one of the best rates from a room with 2 beds, and I am a frequent customer of the Millenium Brand in the UK. I have always been extremely satisfied with my stays at other locations, and this hotel did not disappoint. Upon check in, all of my requests were honored (pillows, room location, etc.). The room was spacious, clean, and the bed were the most comfortable hotel bed I've slept in for quite some time. Our room was on a high floor, but, the elevators were swift, and we never needed to wait long. The view from the room was impressive. The AC worked very well, and the bathroom was well stocked with the standard amenities. The location is great, just a few steps from Times Square, and only two short blocks to the nearly every subway line in Manhattan. And while the location is perfect for being in the middle of everything New York has to offer, I will admit that on our Saturday night stay, the noise from Times Square could be heard from our room, 46 stories up. Apparently, there was an event being held that had the crowd cheering! Every other evening however, it was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Decent choice near transportation, but not excellent”
Reviews.Author: DeBunny
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in "superior" room. It was supposed to have been renovated and on an upper floor. It was on 31st floor, but definately not renovated n the past 4 or 5 years. The sheets were spotless and huge tv. However the bath could have used a good scrub along with fixing peeling edges of wall paper. This is the second time I stayed here and this was not as nice of a room. I would conside staying again, assuming the price is in the $200 range due to location and overall it was OK. Just don't expect consistent quality even with paying more for "superior" rooms. They do hold luggage before and after, but the bus groups delayed retrieving luggage for almost 20 minutes. Good location to mid-town area and subway access at Times Square. Walkable to Penn Station and trains.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: borahorza
Reviews.Content: Theres not much more to say than I absolutely loved my stay at this hotel! First of all it is situated about 100 yards from the centre of Times Sqaure on West 44th St so you are very close to all forms of transport that NYC has to offer. We stayed in a superior room on the 50th floor of the hotel with a view overlooking Times Square itself. I think depending on which side of the hotel you are staying on and how high up you are, then you may be able to see either the Empire State Building, or the Rockefeller Centre (don't quote me on that though!). Our room had floor to ceiling windows and was a lot larger than other rooms I have stayed in when in NYC. Had a lovely huge bed, as well as nice sized bathroom. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and courteous with any request we had. If you are planning on getting a taxi to the airports I would recommend asking the hotel to order you a car. The one that took us was a lot more comfortable than a yellow taxi and cost exactly the same. I've put a few pictures up to help set give an idea of the room quality. This is one hotel I would go back to in a heart beat and I would strongly recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room, excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: Libs1414
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the two room suites. It was very modern and large. The hotel staff are all very helpful and the hotel was spotless. We loved the location and could walk everywhere. I would recommend this hotel for business or leisure travel. We had an amazing long weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: arvadamom
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 9 days, so we truly had a chance to test the service at the Millenium. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. We would stay again -- and would recommend to friends. We stayed on the 36th floor, renovated room, spacious for a NY hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbug”
Reviews.Author: cpadad
Reviews.Content: When I checked in they said a suit, 5218 was available. Went up to the room, checked it for bugs. Didn't see any, almost got in bed, and I checked under the comforter in the lower right corner of the bed and there it was. A single bug crawling between the sheets and comforter. Had to call the front desk four times before they moved me to another room in another part of the hotel. Told the people at the front desk, they didn't seem to act very disturbed. Put the bug under a glass and left it on the desk. Didn't sleep well that night. Took a video of the thing crawling around with my blackberry, still have it saved.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing really wrong but nothing really great, either.”
Reviews.Author: DoggyMommy
Reviews.Content: Our trip to New York was a combined business and pleasure trip. My husband attended a conference at the Millennium., so someone else chose the hotel. We stayed a total of five nights. I can't think of anything that was particularly special about the Millennium. On the other hand, I don't have any serious complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Cirz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while on a week long shopping trip to New York & I must say the hotel is perfect!! Right on Times Square so it was a perfect location to everything. It was my third time back to ~New York and if i was going again i would stay here. The rooms were spacious and very clean for a New York hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel...will def stay here again”
Reviews.Author: skinnymarie32
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic!! It took me gaes to decide on a hotel, all I kept reading about was how small the rooms were, but this was HUGE!! It was clean and tidy with a massive comfortable bed, sleep was no problem after a long day in the City. The location is fantastic, you are right in the thick of it. Times Square is a few steps away with Top of the Rock and Macys on a 5-10 min walk away! We didn't realise how close we were to everything until we took the bus tour then we were amazed with the value of the hotel just for the location. We took the yellow bus tour (you get more for your money). We were offered a complimentary breakfast but didn't use it as there are too many great places to eat. I would say get slightly out of timesquare for food and the prices drop slightly. We loved Stardust dinner which is just off Broadway! There sing the whole time which is great, and the food was lovely!! I will def recommend this hotel to anyone and would love to stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've been in since road trips with my friends when I was 16”
Reviews.Author: DeeDeeJms80
Reviews.Content: Who is giving this place 4 stars? I have never written a review before. I travel a lot, but I have never been more compelled to warn fellow travelers. Room DOES NOT look like any promotional photo I've seen anywhere. Where are the rooms in the pictures? I literally teared up when I saw the room and realized we wouldn't have time to change hotels before we had to get to an event we came to town for. I asked the bellman if there were some other rooms that had been renovated and maybe my room was one that had not? He said it had been renovated a year and a half ago? I asked if there were any nicer rooms or if they were all like mine with dirty carpet, walls, etc. and he said they all looked like mine, but some rooms on higher floors had new headboards. Um, the headboard was the least of my concerns. Out of fairness I would try to balance this review with the positives, but as far as the room is concerned, there were not any. I will post some pictures which pretty much speak for themselves. We wore socks the entire time, i used a dog blanket from the car instead of the duvet which had no cover on it (and i'm sure is not regularly washed), i took a shower standing on a towel! thank goodness i had some anti bacteria wipes in my purse so I could use the remote control and wipe down a few things. I don't drink, but i had a drink with dinner in the hopes i would pass out and not have to think about how grossed out i was sleeping there. Check-in was a pain too. We checked in at 5pm. i reserved 2 beds. Didn't want to share a bed with my mom, thanks. I reconfirmed the 2 beds a day or 2 prior. Get to the desk and they want to put me in a king. I ask how long the wait might be if we decide to wait for a double room to become available? She doesn't know. I ask if a room is expected to be available that night? don't know. then she says they are "low" on double rooms. They weren't even out of double rooms and shes giving me a hard time. So I asked if I could have one of these available rooms and she had to ask a manager. that takes a bit of time. the people behind me are annoyed. i think there was only one other person at the front desks. So finally we get the room but really, what are they holding on to the rooms for? Obviously this was no VIP room they needed to keep open. A little more about the room before i sign off-- no duvet covers on the very thin, beigh/tan comforters. At least with covers, you kind of feel like there's a chance they wash those every once in a while. But I doubt these comforters are washed regularly just because it isn't practical and especially in a place like this. Carpet spotted, stained and dingy. Dreary color scheme. brown, tan, off white and then there is the nightmarish abstract "art" on the walls. just black and white splatters. Very cheerful. Not. Really brightened up the room. not. I just looked at the promo pics again. they show rooms with duvet covers, throw blankets at the foot of the bed, reading lights in the headboards, desks, desk chairs. My room had NONE of these things. How's that for bait and switch. Somewhere in the written hotel description they use the word "tranquil". Um, no. The fact that there was some sort of band playing outside until 2am is not the hotels fault, but they also shouldn't imply that the noise from the city is magically blocked out. They do not have any special noise reducing windows, etc. I have no idea where the music was coming from, but from the 35th floor I could make out the lyrics word for word. It was that loud. I'm really sooo disappointed. I do not understand how a hotel gets away with such a bait and switch. I book a lot of travel for people at the financial company I work at. I'm so glad it was me that found out about this hotel. If I had sent my bosses to a hotel like this, there would be repercussions. The room really affected the quality of my trip to NYC. While we were away from the hotel, I was dreading going back. And even though I'm home in my nice clean house, writing about this is even giving me the creeps. 6/30 - It's 2 weeks later now and the experience still bothers me every time I think about the trip. I did my research before booking this hotel. I saw photos. My mother rarely travels and so I wanted her to have a nice time--not to have to worry that she forgot and almost got out of bed without putting socks on before her feet touched the floor. I emailed the concierge about 7-10 days ago to ask for an email address of someone in management that I could forward this review to. I have not received a response, but I'm not surprised. Just today someone asked me about that trip (FYI Millennium, she also books tons of corporate travel to NY) the first thing out of my mouth was how horrible the hotel was. Last week I booked travel for some of the people in my office. The hotel they normally stay at was booked and they wanted something close to our offices in NY and near enough to the park for jogging. If I had a good experience at this hotel, I would have booked it for my Team in a minute. So on top of leaving me with a bad memory, the hotel lost out on a 3 night stay for 7 people. 21 rooms. As well as any future business my office could have given them. Hope the money they save by not cleaning, getting rid of ripped sheets, changing ruined carpets, removing spider webs, etc. is worth the money, the loss of business, and their reputation. I will never stay at The Millennium Broadway New York or any affiliated hotels again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location right near Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Sable808
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is fantastic â€“ walk down half a block & youâ€™re in Times Square. Only stayed as managed to get a promotional rate over winter. Room was small but adequate for the stay. Didnâ€™t use any of the other facilities at the hotel except for internet which was reasonably priced. There was free wi-fi in Times Square when we were staying as well. Breakfast was cheaper at a diner a couple of blocks away as was laundry. I would recommend this hotel for the location but not paying full price. Very handy to Broadway shows.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding accommodations - but pricey”
Reviews.Author: riley4747
Reviews.Content: Outstanding accommodations, very clean and well kept -- pricey but what in NYC isn't -- close to Times Square and theatres.

Reviews.Title: “Really Like This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Delta767
Reviews.Content: I got a really good deal on Travelzoo for this hotel. You can't beat the location, and the room was nice. It's just off times square and 5th AVE is just 2 blocks away. Room was nice roomy and quiet... the staff was very helpful. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Location, NOT GREAT Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JupiterAnn53
Reviews.Content: Truthfully, got a $169 per night rate on Travelzoo so it was OK for the money considering NYC standards. Room was a "superior" ( on higher floor for views-I on the 37th floor with view of Chrysler Building, but that's all). The "views" were of other surrounding tall buildings and roof tops. The bathtub/shower had more than several black hairs in it when I went to use the shower. No shower cap, no coffee maker, and carpets were stained and need replacing. The blackout curtain pulls were broken, at least you could hand pull since facing East gets the "blast" of morning sun early. The large flat screen TV had "snow" on the local ABC (7) station and all channels had a "distorted/oversized" look. The quality of this particular TV was poor, but I wasn't in NYC to watch a lot of TV (thank goodness I wasn't trying to watch the US Open the day before)! Major problem with the elevator when leaving (I was shaking when the doors finally opened). I did immediately go to the desk and they got security on it right away and "shut it down for inspection". I was in town to see the King Tut exhibit, dine with friends and shop. Location is the one thing going for this hotel and IF you get a really good price, go for it. Anything over $200, shop around for another bargain, the neighborhood is full of hotels...as is the whole city!

Reviews.Title: “A little tired but not a bad value”
Reviews.Author: BertilleBun
Reviews.Content: Biggest problem was the check-in. It took twenty minutes just to get to a clerk. Once I got to a clerk there was no problem. The room was small, but clean and well equipped (new plasma tv), decent bathroom. Didn't notice noise from any other rooms, so it was quiet, except for the usual NYC sounds you would expect being a block from Times Square. Public areas seemed a little worn, and had to go to four floors before I could find a working ice machine. Only stayed here one night, and did not order any food from room service or the restaurant. If your looking for basic, clean accommodations near TS, at a reasonable price for a night or two, this should work.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a central location.”
Reviews.Author: dganem
Reviews.Content: Easy access from times square and great views from rooms. We always stay here when we visit the big apple. The rooms are always clean and quite, its a nice place to park your things and go explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: beckycHouston_TX
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millenium Broadway June 8 for 4 nights. We had 2 adults, 4 teenagers, 1 senior. All loved the hotel. The rooms are very large for NYC. The senior, who uses a walker, had a corner room with a huge new bathroom including a stand alone shower that made it easy for her to bathe. The hotel upgraded my husband and me to a suite upon our arrival which was perfect for all of us to gather in one place to plan our activities. Our bathroom tub was a bit dated, but functioned just fine. The rest of the bath seemed to have been updated. The location was perfect - half a block from Times Square - which made it easy for some of us to stay at the hotel while others wandered around seeing the sites. We had breakfast each morning from Starbucks next door. The concierge made fabulous recommendations for dining and transportation. Close to the theatre district and shopping. Easy to catch the subway to chinatown (Canal Street) and Central Park areas. Got reservations at the last minute through Booking.com. When I talked to the hotel, they were surprised I could get 4 rooms as they had been booked for months for several conferences. We paid a premium as a result of all the conferences going on, but ordinarily I think you can get some good rates. We were on the top floor and had no problem with noise. Our teenagers were on floor 34 and floor 38 and did not complain about noise.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: Shortstraw79
Reviews.Content: I found that this is the best hotel that I have ever been in, anywhere!! I went with my girlfriend for her 30th birthday, and I had mentioned to the staff beforehand that it was a special occasion and that I was planning to propose, and they bent over backwards making everything perfect for me. They put us on the 51st floor over looking Times Square - I couldn't have picked a better view to propose!!. All staff were brilliant, always smiling and being helpful. The location is perfect for anyone who hasn't been to New York before because it is near everything and only literally 10 steps from Times Square. The entire hotel was clean, comfy and worth the money. We never ate in the hotel but there are so many places to eat close by that you'll never get hungry. Would I come here again.......in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Great View”
Reviews.Author: joenronnie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights while I was on a business trip. We arrived around 12:30 and checked in. The room was not ready but the front desk tried to get us in a room. He assured us we would get the next available room. We went to lunch and when we came back and our room was ready. We actually got a better room on a higher floor. (40th floor corner room.) The room was pretty large and the views from the floor to ceiling windows was beautiful. The bathroom was large and the king size bed was very comfy. You couldn't beat the location either. One block from Times Square and walking distance to my class for business and there were plenty of restaurants and things to do at night. The only con was that the rug was pretty outdated and stained and they don't give you any extra pillows or blankets. It was basically sheets and the bed cover. I would stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: woolooloo
Reviews.Content: Got a decent price at the Millennium from Priceline - it was the weekend of the Tony Awards and the Puerto Rican Day Parade and deals were hard to come by. I got to the hotel around 2 and was told the room wouldn't be ready until 4, so I checked my luggage and came back after 4. Since I had a Priceline reservation, I wasn't expecting a good room and didn't get one. They put me on the 18th floor (the 3rd floor of rooms) and it was a handicapped room. Fine, that's the price I pay for the relatively low price (~$150/nt below their website price). The first night was fine although the bed was very hard, the hardest I have seen in a chain hotel. The next morning I tried to turn on the TV to watch the news while getting ready and it didn't work. I called the front desk after I got back from breakfast and they quickly sent up maintenance and the guy was able to reboot the system and get it working. I was still having problems with the remote so he said he would come back with fresh batteries. So far so good and I was pretty happy with my stay. I headed out at noon to meet a friend staying at another hotel. At 1:30 in the morning I came back after being gone for 13 hours and my room door was wide open. It wasn't like it just didn't quite latch tight, the door was visibly open. I was obviously freaked out and went in and made sure all my stuff was in there (fortunately my laptop was in the safe). Nothing was missing, but apparently the maintenance guy had left the door open after putting new batteries in the remote. You would think closing the room door behind them would be pretty high on their priority list, right? I called the front desk to complain, it took a couple calls before anyone answered and his basic attitude was "yeah, so?" They didn't seem particularly concerned, I guess it happens a lot there. Also greeting me in the room was EXTREMELY LOUD music, I may as well have had a jukebox with a big subwoofer in the room and the bass was bumping. It was coming from outside, and from what I can tell it was from a rooftop terrace about the level of my room, possibly from The Night Hotel on 45th St. By 3AM, I couldn't stand it anymore and called the front desk and the guy was like "this is Times Square, what do you expect". Well, I've stayed all over NYC, including twice in Times Square and never heard anything like this, not even in that same room the night before. I finally fell asleep around 4:30 even though the music was still playing. I don't know what time it finally stopped. Given that the two primary reasons you get a hotel room are to protect your belongings and to sleep, the Millennium Broadway was a major disappointment during this stay and I would not recommend them. One other minor quibble that I've encountered at other hotels too, they have a sign in the bathroom about "saving the planet" and saving water by not getting the towels laundered every day if you put the towel on the rack, so I did and they gave me a clean towel (and removed my used one) anyways. Why bother having the sign if they aren't going to honor your choice?

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel For $'s.”
Reviews.Author: birdsongmiss
Reviews.Content: A girl friend and I stayed one week at the Millenium Broadway Hotel/Times Square. We had a room on the 39th floor, two queen beds. The room was clean, housekeeping was excellent, and staff was helpful. This hotel is very conveniently located to attractions and subways. The restaurant is pricey, and not worth the extra cost, but there are many places surrounding the hotel to eat. By NYC standards the room was a large size with plenty of closet and storage space. The bathroom had tub/shower.

Reviews.Title: “Their best price guarantee is utter garbage”
Reviews.Author: scottm_1981
Reviews.Content: Firstly I should confirm that I have not stayed at this hotel. I didn't get that far... The hotel's website provides customers with comfort that if you book through the website, they guarantee that you are getting the best rate. The terms and conditions of their Best Price Guarantee are relatively straight forward - find a competitor who is offering a cheaper price and provided that what is being offered by the competitor is the same as that being offered on the hotel's website (ie the same room type, meals package, etc), then you can proceed to book through the hotel's website with the comfort that they will refund you the difference plus further 15%. I researched prices online and for the same room, I found that expedia.com and hotels.com were $700AUD cheaper for the 6 nights stay. I sent screenshots of the expedia.com and hotels.com offers to the hotel and asked for confirmation that this would be acceptable evidence for the purpose of their Guarantee. After 7 days I had not received a response. When I followed this up I was told (by Jackie Soberal on behalf of the hotel) that despite the terms and conditions of the hotel's Best Price Guarantee, they do not consider expedia.com and hotels.com (amongst others) as "competitors" for the purposes of the Best Price Guarantee. Instead, they consider them as wholesalers. This means that for the purpose of the Best Price Guarantee, there is effectively no such thing as a competitor, which renders the Best Price Guarantee useless (not to mention extremely misleading and deceptive in my honest opinion). I understand from the many reviews before mine that this is a lovely hotel in a great location (which of course is why I began researching prices to stay there myself!) However, for what it's worth, I would not stay here purely on the basis that their Guarantee is misleading and their service in replying to emails and explaining their position was unsatisfactory. I cannot believe that the Millenium brand name would put forward such a misleading Guarantee.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: KitchenerShari
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel is amazing - right in Times Square, couldn't ask for better. We were one block from the Lion King theatre, and close to the subway. We were impressed at the police presence in Times Square. We arrived late in the day so no waiting for our room, and we mentioned that we were first time visitors to NYC so they were good about making sure we had a nice view (47th floor), which I believe was an upgrade from what we paid for (booked on Priceline months ago). The room was decent - minor things like some stains on the carpet, and the hair dryer didn't blow heat. The bed was very comfortable for us, and the room was quiet - no outside street noise (just the occasional siren), and didn't hear hallway noise much either. The only major inconvenience we found was hot water - 2 out of 4 mornings, there was no hot water when we wanted to shower. The first day, it was around 8:30 am - called the front desk and they said there was a water main break and would be about 20 minutes. Waited until 9:30 am, and it was still cold. The next morning, it was very lukewarm, almost cold, at 8 am. But my husband went in 20 minutes later and it was hot, so the timing was not consistent (2 other mornings, around 8 am, it was hot). We would definitely stay in this hotel again in future.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and great location”
Reviews.Author: margins
Reviews.Content: this modern hotel is one block from Times Square. the staff was friendly and nice. the room which we were supposed to have was not made up so they gave us a better room which means higher and nicer. there was no pool or hot tub but I think this is typical of NY hotels. We didn't eat there so I don't know about the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “It's about the location”
Reviews.Author: Throbbert
Reviews.Content: The best aspect of this hotel is its location--close to the subways, Theater District, and within walking of most tourist attractions. The rest is average. When we arrived at 1 p.m., they would not let us check in until 4 p.m. That's getting late for a check-in, and there wasn't any place to sit as there really isn't a defined lobby. Alas, we left our luggage with the bell captain. When I approached the Theater Ticket/Concierge Booth, I asked the location of our theater. She did not know but looked it up, replying only with the name of the theater. For someone not from NY, this didn't help. When I asked the address, she had to look that up again---and the theater is only one block away from the hotel. Yet, she didn't know the name of local theaters or addresses? This is sort of her job. When we did check into our room, we unpacked and were going to relax for awhile. Then, my spouse came out of the bathroom and asked if I had seen it. The blood. There was blood throughout the bathroom--on the floor, in the toilet, on the edges of the tub and sink. Someone had done some damage to themselves and while there had been a minor attempt by housekeeping to clean it up, the evidence was still visible and still present. We went down to the front desk, who did apologize (and called security) and said they would give us an "upgrade" for the inconvenience. This resulted in a room on a higher floor, but a smaller room and one closer to the elevator. This was not an upgrade. The bed was firm, the blanket in the closet covered in a man's black body hair, and the TV remote didn't work that well (clearly needed new batteries). But each time you left, you were reminded that you were in a great location. The staff was friendly enough, the room was adequate, and the space relatively quiet. For New York, this was a decent, average hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quite room, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: jerzee2maytoe
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Milennium to see The Addams Family (great show by the way!). Great location so you can walk to the theatre, great restaurants nearby, Times Square, and walking distance to many of the famous streets and sites. When we got to the hotel after walking several blocks from Penn Station the front desk agent was very friendly and said he had to send us to their other tower to check in because that would be where our room was located. He assured us the rooms were very nice. We schlepped over to the other tower (not a long walk but a drag when we were already hot and tired) and the front desk agent there was not nearly as friendly. We were the only people there and he barely spoke to us. When he did speak he was a major low talker and we could barely understand him. Then we finally get a room and he sends us BACK to the tower we were at! Frustrating. But when we got to the room it was fantastic. He had said they were upgrading us to a suite because of the invconvenience of waiting and it was very nice. Even the bedroom was bigger than others we've stayed in in Manhattan. Never saw or heard from housekeeping but since there was just the two of us it wasn't a problem. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was ok. This room had the perfect view of Time Square. If you want to go for New Year's Eve I suggest asking for this room since the ball was within plain site of the room. Also, the room was very quite...no traffic noise woke us up, no hallway or other room noise. All in all a great trip. Will definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Jigme at the Front Desk gave us a wonderful room”
Reviews.Author: janeinsyracuse
Reviews.Content: I had the great pleasure of staying at the Millennium Broadway on a Saturday night April 3, 2100. They had a deal on Travelzoo for $199 a night so we booked it on their website. This hotel is and ideal location being close to Times square and Penn station. we were able to walk from the train station. At check in, we were greeting by a really great guy named Jigme who was most pleasant. I asked him if it would be possible to have a room on a high floor with a view of Times Square... he said if they had one available he would be happy to give it to me. He gave us a beautiful room on the 46th floor with an amazing view of times square. we couldn't have been happier. The hotel is beautiful, it is a fantastic location, and the hotel staff is extremely nice, especially Jigme!

Reviews.Title: “Parking is a Rip Off!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GSSAlex
Reviews.Content: I am a business traveler and was traveling to NYC on business and will be doing so every week since I got a new job. I chose the hotel because I got a great rate. I am not a cheap person nor do I ever complain about anything at hotels considering I used to be a manager at a hotel and know how frustrating guests can be. However, when I checked in they told me that it was going to be $55.00 for valet parking which is completely reasonable for NYC. However, when I gave them my car I let them know that I was going to need again in 2 hours to go to my next meeting and they said, "no problem just make sure you call down 20 minutes before you need it." When I went to get my car they told me I was going to have to pay ANOTHER $55.00 to retrieve my car. That was NEVER explained to me when I checked in and that is my issue. When I tried explaining to one of the people standing out there all he said to me was, "I'M NOT CHARING YOU...the hotel is charging you." That comment, of course, ticked me off even more. Of course, coming from the hotel industry I know that once a guest gets upset over something they will find everything else with the room. So as far as the room goes: there was blood/coffee/soda stains splashed on the wall by the trashcan and there was hair all over the bathroom floor which doesn't make you feel like the room was very clean. I would have had an overall pleasant stay if it wasn't for the parking. However, since the hotel is not up front with you from the get go I will NEVER stay at this hotel, nor will anyone from my company ever stay here, nor will I or anyone that I acquainted with recommed this hotel to anyone of our friends or family members. When I checked out I asked for the managers business card so that I would share with him or her my concerns about that issue and they told me that they would be contacting me and I checked out five days ago and have YET to be contacted which is unacceptable in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Location & price are the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: fredsbabe
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for a long weekend to celebrate our anniversary. Took advantage of 35% off deal, and the price was great compared to similar hotels. Had requested a room in a quiet location with a great view, if possible, and they more than honored our request!! Great spacious, quiet room on the 45th floor with an amazing view of the Chrysler Bldg. Very fast check-in despite a tour group that just arrived (thanks to an attentive doorman). SOOOO close to everything--1/2 block from the heart of Times Square and an easy walk to Rock. Ctr., Empire St. Bldg., Macy's, Central Park, Grand Central Station, etc., and there was a Starbuck's next door (and on just about every other corner). Discovered Cranberry Cafe across the street a little too late--great little deli/cafe! Junior's has great cheesecake--a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location to enjoy all that New York City offers.”
Reviews.Author: CatskillMountains
Reviews.Content: From booking to check out this hotel exceeded my expectations. The views from our room were over the top. One of the best nights sleep away from home in years. I can not say enough good things about this facility.

Reviews.Title: “The smallest hotel room in North America”
Reviews.Author: bobstarama
Reviews.Content: My wife and travelled to New York in Early May 2010 and after extensive reseach I picked this hotel. It seem to get good reviews from many different sites including this one, but even this process is not fool proof. The hotel foyer etc is great and what an excellent loaction, but the room was pretty shabby. In fact the room was without doubt the smallest hotel room i've visited in the US and Canada. The bed was also what seemed like a standard double rather than a queen or king size, so not ideal. The room had no view and was tired and dark and the overall feeling was not helped by what seemed like ink or bloodstains on the carpet and on our last day my wife spotted lots of streaks down one wall. These looked suspciously like vomit marks, but obviously I can't be sure. I should have obviously asked to see the room before actually unpacking etc. And yes we should have asked to be moved to another room, but in typical Brit style we just kept quiet. My warning to others is don't trust the reivews, always do a full room inspection. And don't be fobbed off. The room should be as sold.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: DavidT
Reviews.Content: My buddy was travelling on business and invited me along, so I got a free room in NYC for 4 days - Awesome!! He had no problem trading the King for a double-double (room 2905). Largest room I've stayed at in New York, almost as big as any suburban chain hotel. Had two very firm and comfortable (slightly smaller than double) beds, comfy leather easy chair, small table, small desk w/ extra outlets in lamp, closet w/ full mirror and a big flat TV. First time in ages I had a room with door that doesn't close by itself! A/C was silent and efficient. View wasn't much, office bldgs across the street, which reflected lots of Times Square lights. Blackout drapes if that's a problem for you. Almost no street noise at all - occasional muffled siren, it IS NY after all. Big standard tub, marble floor & vanity, lots of counter space, plenty of towels, tons of fast hot water, pressure good. Room was clean throughout. Lobby has convenient dual entrance/walk-thru from 44-45th Sts (beware: 45th St door locked after 11pm). No real "grand" lobby or sitting area to speak of. Speed and number of elevators good. Starbucks 2 doors down on 45th. Beautiful, Long Room Pub across 44th has good food, relaxed atmosphere if you're worn-out and don't want to stray too far. Fantastic location literally a few steps off Times Square. Subway to anywhere 1.5 blocks (42nd Street). Felt very safe. Lots of police after truck-bomb failure. Something to keep in mind: Times Square is great and a novelty at first, but crowded sidewalks get tiresome after a few days - especially when theaters ALL let out at 10:15 or so and it starts to feel like New Year's Eve!!! I had a blast but it could be annoying to some. Overall a really good hotel. Would stay again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Location isn't everything”
Reviews.Author: NorgeGuy
Reviews.Content: While a graet location near Times Square, the service was terrible. The prime incident was after having no housekeeping service by noon, a call assured us they would be right up. Two more calls in the late afternoon and every evening yielded the same results..nothing. After returning from dinner, and being assured by the manager that it would be handled, nothing was done. Finally after another call at 11pm, a housekeeping person brought towels and shhets, and ecpected us to make up the room. No accountability, no responsibility. To top it off, a tick was in the room when we checked in, and we were told that we brought it in from outside.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: RichieCMontreal
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is the location with and entrance on both 44th and 45th streets a half a block down from Broadway. Like most mid price level hotels in Manhattan the rooms are not luxurious or very large. I was fortunate enough to be given a corner room which I understand from the group I was travelling with are a bit larger than an average room. The room although basic was nicely decorated and is quite up to date. I particularly appreciated the 40" flat screen TV. I found the room to be clean and the bed to be quite comfortable. The lack of a duvet cover that is changed daily is not a particular favourite of mine but can be easily remedied by asking for a sheet to cover it. I found the service to be prompt and friendly which is exactly what one can expect from most hotels in midtown Manhattan. This is not a luxury hotel but certainly is good value by New York standards.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Style, Steps From Broadway”
Reviews.Author: MarkBearSF
Reviews.Content: Priceline bidding got us a room at the Millennium Broadway. The hotel was perfect for our needs. Nice room and amenities, great service. Location is unbeatable. Priceline rates the hotel as 3.5 stars - likely due to limitations in conference or spa facilities (I dunno' - I used neither of 'em) but to my experience it was more of a 4 star experience (or 5* using the inflated TripAdvisor scale). For what it's worth, we stayed April 16-18, which was the start of the European volcano flight delays. It appeared that the hotel was accommodating the stranded travelers. Considering what we paid on Priceline, I'd happily do it again and again for that price!

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: Julian90
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just as the volcano exploded. Realising we were stranded, I asked reception if we could extend our stay. Yes we could, room rate 220 Dollars per night. By the next day, when the hotel realised that New York was full of stranded tourists, the room rate had gone up to 469 dollars per night and a take it or leave it attitude. On the basis of this I would not recommend this hotel. Otherwise, the hotel was OK ish, bathroom a bit scruffy, room not cleaned very well if at all, no tea/coffee in rooms and over 6 dollars a cup from the bar/restaurant, and with internet access at 12.95 dollars per hour, it all added up to poor value in my oppinion. Refusing to have the pi-- taken, we moved hotel to the Comfort Inn in China Town, excellent value, comfortable and clean, albeit a little noisy, tea/coffee in room, free internet and breakfast included. Staff very helpful and friendly. This is an excellent base to explore New York and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CtPaddler
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel for a romantic getaway to see a show and Time Square. Best part is that you a few feet from Time Square and the theaters. My room did not have a view of anything except an alley, but I got a discounted internet rate.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice...3.5 stars overall...”
Reviews.Author: StrictView
Reviews.Content: Booking: I won a bid on Priceline. Give this option a try...if you know how to use the "Negotiator" tool, this could save you money. We got a "King Room", corner room, on a higher floor, away from the elevators. Area: Right in the middle of Times Square...can't get any better than that. Facilities: The hotel has no lobby...basically just a large front desk. Room: The room is very spacious. The bathroom is clean...though on the dated side. The gold curtains slightly bothered me, the huge, floor to ceiling windows were nice though...and the bed is firm w/ no pillow top...frankly said, the sheets, though somewhat attractive, are not cozy and/or plush - slightly itchy even. Good Surprises: The Junior's Cheesecake across the street delivers right to your room! Try the fried seafood platter...yummy!!! Strangely Missing: Rooms have everything except for the most important - TOOTHPASTE! Overall: We only stayed for 1 night...it was a good overall experience, not the best though. Tip: Order delivery from Junior's :-) Have fun, be safe, and order room service for breakfast - it's nice to wake up to!

Reviews.Title: “Engagement”
Reviews.Author: JimKCornerBrook
Reviews.Content: we went for a 3 night weekend and it was great, hotel is 100ft of Times Square, nice cafe across the street, you can see the Ball they drop for New Years across the street, room was very nice but did not spend much time in it. Statue of Libery, Rockerfellar Place, shopping, dinning, Macy's, 911 memorial,Central Park at night for engagemnt- great time, you will not regret staying here

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: VooVoo26
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very good. I've got an upgrade to the Permier room...which does not come across as premier in any significant way. The door of the room is a tad smaller than the main frame. When your neighbours slam their doors, your own door "moves" too. Pretty comfortable bed otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - great location!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaElaineW
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed 6 nights at The Millennium. Location was fabulous - step outside the hotel into Times Square. Room was more than adequate - very clean and modern bathroom. Maid service was excellent and other hotel staff were courteous and helpful. King size bed was very comfortable! We will definitely stay at this hotel on our next visit to New York.

Reviews.Title: “great stay, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: roadtripjunkie38
Reviews.Content: -Millenium is located in the heart of times square, toys r us is just a few feet away, not to mention steps to Broadway. The central location cannot be more favorable for a wonderful trip. The hotel was quiet, safe and service was great. The rooms were clean, and spacious for NYC hotels. The checking in and out process was seamless. We never had to wait for the elevators to the 26th floor. Just to let you know, please check the hotel rates first, as the promotion offered by the hotel was in fact cheaper than what Priceline (name your price) charged!! You have the advantage of cancelling not to mention probably a better room. We unfortunately found that out later! Needless to say, we are looking forward to our next trip to NYC and will be staying at the Millenium.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, crap service”
Reviews.Author: sydcarnie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the number one spot in the city for sightseeing and walking to other parts of the city. The service at the hotel was very bad... our TV did not work for two days, the hair dryer did not work, the shower flooded, the maid came to clean our room at 6:30pm when we were getting ready to go to a show and were using the bathroom, we asked could she come back a bit later and were told no she couldn't so our bathroom was not cleaned. As with another review, we were charged for using water out of the mini bar that was not used. I also had a phone messgae left for me on the Wednesday which was only given to me on checking out on Sunday, fortunately it was not urgent. I am glad I paid a discounted price for the hotel on expedia as I would have been very disappointed if I had paid full price for my 8 night stay

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel right in the heart of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: DwianaO
Reviews.Content: It's easy to stroll on Broadway any time from this hotel... You don't need a taxi to go around ..A step from all you need from New York...

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bobo_lobo
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights in this hotel over the September 11th period when most hotels were fully booked. I'm so glad I stayed here! Ideal location right next to Times Square, clean, very comfortable, friendly service and a fab view! They did make a mistake upon arrival we required a twin room, not a double, but they upgraded us to a room in the 42nd floor - which I highly recommend. It was exactly what I wanted to see from a New York hotel room! Nice and high up with a sea of sky scrapers! The only thing is I never read the small print which meant I never knew about the $100 deposit on arrival. It wasn't a problem though and I do believe in a lot of good quality hotels you have to pay a deposit. Overall I would do anything to go back to New York and stay in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best spot in NYC”
Reviews.Author: ladyiered
Reviews.Content: The Millennium Brodway Hotel is in the most excellent spot. You are smack in the middle of Time Square with everything at your fingertips. The hotel check in process was easy and quick, valet was friendly and very helpful. We had no complaints and when we asked for an extra pillow to be brought up to our room it was there in minutes. Your choice of food and pubs are too many to mention. Bubba Gump Shrimp Resturant in accross the street, so is an excellent spanish/mexican resturant that serves awesome sangrias also,Starbucks is located down in the lobby of the hotel just to name a few. I can't imagine staying anywhere else again.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: april28dc
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment! Especially for the money we paid. Toilet was clogged when we arrived, lobby always crowded and with people actually sitting on the floor right inside the door. Ordered a movie and was unable to watch it because there was no volume. We were assured we would not be charged, but we were. Then had to stand in a long line at the desk to be reimbursed. Not enough staff at front desk. Concierge rude. Had to pay to use the internet.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate, but watch the pre-authorization”
Reviews.Author: kyuupi
Reviews.Content: We found a great deal on the Millennium and decided to stay there over the summer. Check-in was quite a shock to us when we were presented with a charge that was $300 more than expected! It turns out that this hotel has a very high incidental pre-authorization of $100 per night. We're used to $0 or $50, so that was off-putting, but it was refunded as promised and wasn't much of an issue - just be sure you bring a card with a high limit. The room was bright and comfortable. My mom had some trouble with the temperature controls, and the TV wasn't working when we arrived, but the hotel sent a repairman along immediately and had it working by the time we returned. The beds were comfortable, but the silky bedspread kept slipping off and that was a bit annoying. There is a restaurant on the ground floor, Charlotte, which is only open for breakfast. All things considered, we had an enjoyable stay, but we'll try a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel the best location”
Reviews.Author: hugbear
Reviews.Content: I dont know why anyone would write a negative review of this hotel. We stayed there for 7 nights and could not be more impressed by it. The only negative thing and its nothing much but the staff are not that great. Also dont move anything in the mini bar as its electronic and soon as its moved you are charged for it. I moved something to put a drink I bought and was charged but there was no problem getting the charge reversed. Also had a problem with the toilet and the person who was sent up could not speak english. Apart from those minor hiccups we loved this hotel and it will now be the only hotel we ever stay in New York. The location is fantastic, the views were amazing (37th floor)

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother, old, out-dated everything!”
Reviews.Author: MiLulu
Reviews.Content: This hotel is dark and old, and not in a quaint way! There is no security-at all. Elevators are creepy and it didn't feel like a safe place for 2 women traveling together--or a man either for that matter. No place to print boarding pass, no fast check-out. No restaurant. It just seemed to be out-dated in every way. Location is good, but so are the other hotels in that area--we just found it depressing w/ stained carpet, etc--did have a big t.v. tho! Big deal. Would NEVER recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, next to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: ml77
Reviews.Content: We liked: - central location, steps away from Times Square - nice, modern bedroom and bathroom (we stayed in a standard room) - quiet Overall there isn't anything we disliked about this hotel. Unlike what other people experienced, we found the staff was nice. The view is very good, especially the higher you get. The price isn't cheap but it's understandable given the location and the absence of real drawbacks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Essexeric
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect location close to all subway trains and in the middle of Time Square .Its extremely clean security is excellent and all the staff were very friendly.The rooms were a good size avoid drinking or eating here as its very expensive . There are so many places close by take your pick but avoid the chains like fridays ,Olive garden planet hollywood hard rock etc Look to the off streets between broad and 8ave or 8ave 9 ave 10 ave where the real people live and hang out and its alot cheaper ..

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: KennethKenneth
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel based on it's location and some very good reviews on here. We also got a very good deal through Expedia. The hotel is located just off Times Square so is ideally situated for pretty much everything you want to do in New York. You only have to walk a few blocks to get to the Rockefeller Centre or Empire State Building & if you want to go downtown, there's the subway in Times Square. It's that easy. The hotel itself was very nice and the staff very helpful. When we checked in we were told our room, which was somewhere between the 16th & 24th floor would not be available for another few hours. We were then offered an upgrade to the 47th floor with a view of Times Square and the Chrysler Building at a discounted price of $40 per night rather than the normal $80-100 per night rate. We took this option and were not disappointed. The room was huge, clean and comfortable with a view well worth the upgrade money! We had no problems whatsoever with this hotel and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone who wants to stay in the Times Square area.

Reviews.Title: “There is no better hotel for your New York City Stay”
Reviews.Author: dotaway
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best; it cannot be beat; you won't be disappointed. I am a travel agent and stayed there last month while attending the New York Times Travel Show and I will now send ALL my clients to this hotel. The hotel is lovely and looks and feels very regal. The staff could not be nicer. We arrived in a snow storm and although everything was a mess outside, once we walked through the front door of the Millennium we were in a state of order and control and our every need was met. Everyone (from the doorman, to the front desk, the theater desk and the concierge) did a fabulous job. The room was beautifully decorated, quite cozy and allowed us lots of room (more than normal size hotel rooms). We had a view of the front of the hotel and enjoyed watching all the action on the street below. Our room was spotless and extra blankets and pillows were in the closet if needed. We walked out the door and up 1 1/2 blocks and were able to purchase discount theatre tickets one hour before the Friday night shows started. There is a Starbucks 1/2 block away and TGI Friday's one block away. We thought the hotel restaurant was a bit pricey, especially for breakfast, so we walked up to 46th Street and found a great little cafe that fixed us a made-to-order breakfast for $4.95 that included very good coffee and the coffee was free. It is a short walk to the bus from the Millennium and we were able to get around all over the city since we were in a prime location. Please feel free to email me if you have any other questions and I will be happy to answer them for you. Don't take a chance by staying elsewhere; the Millennium is fabulous and you will love the hotel itself, the staff, the location and the rooms. Trust me on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Franbrasilia
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal for this hotel in hotel.com and everything was just perfect. It looks more like a bussiness hotel, but I don't see anything wrong about it. Just don't expect a romantic small place. Everything was perfect: the view, the cleaness, the tv, the bed, the size of the room... We asked for a view and they put us on the 50 floor! We wold defenitelly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the Hotel, service and overall condition”
Reviews.Author: AASura
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel since we had stayed here 10 years ago with the Pharmaceutical company conference. I chose this hotel at a higher price over Sheraton, W, Crowne Plaza and Helmsley ! As I walked in the hotel I felt this was a old and run down product. At check in the staff was tired and showed an attitude of wanting not to be bothered. It was a day of 4" snow and my flight was postponed for hours. Carpets in t he hallway on 31st floor was old and worn out Room was in bad condition. bathroom was though not dirty it was unkempt. Paint was over the wallpaper, wallpaper had stains of something, door did not have a lock, robe hook was broken and the sharp part had made a hole in the sheet rock. Towels were small and old. Gave only 2 towels " thats what we are told, not to give any more" Called the front desk and asked to talk and was transferred to the manager who never picked up and never called us back ! No coffee maker in the room. No added any accessories in the bathroom except for a shampoo and a conditioner Room was also in the similar condition. I think Days Inn might be a better product.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Melbamoose
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed considering the many positive reviews I read. While the location was amazing and the staff lovely, the hotel seemed run down. The room smelled like stale cigarettes and the place could use a paint job and new carpets. The most surprising thing was that the beds don't have comforters or blankets - just a sheet and a bedspread. A thin blanket was provided in the closet - but who wants to use a bedspread as a cover? The room was big though and fairly clean. It was fun being in the heart of Time Square, but next time, I will opt for a cleaner, hotel off the beaten track.

Reviews.Title: “The Dream's over”
Reviews.Author: Adaleme
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Millennium Broadway twice before and looking forward to our return we were spectacularly disappointed! The guy on reception when we checked in, Terrance, was rude beyond compare. Not just NYC attitude he was downright awful. The room was very shabby, dirty and the bathroom full of hair. I tried to speak to hotel staff but nobody was interested so gave up and tried to make the best of a bad job. Perhaps the hotels strategy is to save money by not responding to complaints as the location will ensure people continue to flock to this Times Square hotel despite complaints. Really gutted actually because previous visits were very special, the hotel has gone down hill rapidly and with it's current managent and staff not likely to improve. I think it may need to lose at least half a star. If you are due to stay here soon you will be fine and have plenty of fun in NYC as you'll hardly spend anytime in the hotel and perhaps our expectation was too high due to previous visits. Have fun in NYC, it's still the greatest place on Earth and if you're planning a special meal try the Landmarc in Tribeca, pricey but truly fantastic food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: baldvol54
Reviews.Content: Was searching for a "deal" and found a reasonably priced hotel just half a block off Time Square. Nice, clean rooms, but most of all a great location! Good breakfast in hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: wwrrkd
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Millenium 5 times. It is in a excellent location, close to the subway, Times Square, Central Park, Broadway. The staff is eager to help, and the rooms are clean. I would reccommend it to all my friends, and have referenced it many times to people. It isn't anything special, but if you stay at the Premier side, which is right next door and owned by Millenium you will have a five star stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: manseal
Reviews.Content: We travel to NYC a couple of times a year. We usually book a 4/5 star hotel. This was the first time to stay at the Millenium.and we will certainly book it again. The price/quality ratio is outstanding. The beds are very firm but we slept great! The concierge dest is exceptional, as is the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: claire277
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millennium Broadway in February and really enjoyed our stay. We upgraded to a deluxe room which was on the 48th floor with great views over Times Square. The room was clean and very big for New York rooms. The bathroom was large with a shower over the bath and the room included a coffe maker, hairdryer and iron and ironing board. The bed was fanfastic and so comfortable, we were sad to leave it behind when we left. The staff were very helpful and all requests were taken care of straight away. I'd recommend the Millennium Broadway to anyone. For breakfast the Cranberry Deli over the road from the hotel on 45th St was great with a wide range of food and seating upstairs. O'Lunneys Irish bar also over from the hotel on 45th is great for a pint. Blue Fin on 47th and Broadway is a fantastic restaurant (and there aren't many nice ones in Times Sq area) with great seafood and they do a lovely cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location - In the heart of everything!”
Reviews.Author: MeridaGal
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a spacious, corner room with sweeping views of Times Square. The hotel's staff was excellent, and the hotel exceed our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Location and great price”
Reviews.Author: CanViking
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed staying at the Millenium Broadway. The location could not have been better. Reasonable price for Manhattan. Everything was in waalking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bulieb
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel. We were busy and didn't really get to enjoy many of the amenities but everyone was friendly. The hotel was clean, linens nice. Location can't be beat! They seriously jack up the price for the New Year but that is to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: green_turtle_13
Reviews.Content: I along with a friend of mine went to NYC for a Girl's Weekend to celebrate her birthday. We had a blast! We stayed at the Millennium Broadway for two nights with a deal that I found on travelzoo, so for the Times Square area the price was good. Don't get me wrong we have stayed in NYC for cheaper, but not right in Times Square. The location can't be beat...close to everything! The room that we had was very nice and modern in design. It had two beds in it, and each bed was a little bigger than a twin size bed. Perfect for two people traveling together who don't share a bed. The room was clean and nicely laid out. We had a view of Times Square from our window and the drapes pulled together nicely to keep the early morning sun out. Some thing that we think (or should I say wish) were different are/were: 1. There should be a fan in the bathroom. Taking a hot shower in there just fills the bathroom with steam and it gets so hot in there that you can't even keep the door shut. The mirror gets all foggy and it's uncomfortable to stand in there and get ready since it is so hot. 2. There should be a light in the shower area. Seriously who designs bathrooms without any light in the shower area. You can't see what you are doing in there! 3. We wish the staff would of been more friendly. Upon check in the person at the front check in desk wasn't much help at all. He didn't even tell us our room number when we checked in....thankfully it was written on our card packet. Nothing was told to us about the hotel or anything. This kind of put us off. Then upon check out we had them hold our bags while we enjoyed the city for one last afternoon. We went to pick them back up the person who was in charge of placing them in the back room was rude and seemed annoyed at the fact that they had to retrieve the bags. That was.....until I gave him a tip and then he was more than willing to help out or carry the bags to the taxi. I look back and think I should not of tipped him. People should not be rewarded for bad behavior. If you can look past the staff and enjoy the location and the hotel itself then I definitely suggest staying here. Happy and Safe Travels!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Old, smelly hotel - we are NEVER coming back”
Reviews.Author: yhAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We've arrived on Friday morning 10-10-09 for 2 nights with a 2.5 and a 5 years old. We had another reservation for the Hilton which we've canceled 24 hours before because at the Millennium reservation center, they convinced us to do so ("great location... right next to toys R us...you wont be sorry...") so when we arrived, after a 40 minuets wait, the receptionist said the room wasn't ready and that we should get back at 4:00PM. We got back at 4:00 and after a short wait got the keys to the room, when the elevator door opened to our floor I took 3 steps back because of the smell... apparently they put a family of 4 (with 2 small ASTHMATIC kids) in a smokers floor!!! because we forgot to mention we would like a non-smoking room!!!! ( and this is after the reservation center convinced us to stick to this "kids -friendly hotel"!!! and remember this is not a pricline/hotwire reservation, it cost us almost 600$ for those 2 miserable nights) Make a long story short, after 4 (!!!!) times we called to the manager and bagged to move, she finally agreed to move us to the non-smoking floor but not before 11:30 pm, and again, we are with 2 asthmatic toddlers (which I've mentioned over and over to the manager but besides saying "I'm sorry I can't help you" she didn't do anything) The smokers room was so dirty, carpet was old, disgusting and had 2 Hugh burned holes in it, a big brown stain on the wall next to the bath, some of the bath tiles were cracked and grout was dirty, it was so smelly that my 2.5 years old son started to cough almost right away, we couldn't stay there for a minute and had to drag the kids until 11:00PM out in the streets. at 11:20PM we moved into a king room (they promised to bring a folding sofa but of course it took 3 calls and 40 more min. until somebody bothered to bring it). The next day we couldn't wait to get out of the room (which was much better than the smokers jail but still far far away from even getting close to a 4* hotel - again, a hole in the old carpet, dirty grout, cracked toilet..but at least no cigarettes smell), basically, even the taught of getting back to the hotel in the evening, ruined our whole day, the only good thing in this hotel was the very nice and helpful concierge who recommended on 2 good restaurants. After we got home I had to wash everything twice in order to get rid of the cigarettes smell... On Oct. 15 the "Senior Vice President Operations" had the nerve to send us a guest comment card to fill, regarding our hotel experience, I wrote the most horrible review, as expected, nobody bothered to got back... typical...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: raphaTrip
Reviews.Content: Very well located! Nice and beautiful hotel. Extremely clean the room, housekeeping friendly all the time. Front desk service poor. Nice room facilities. Missed a Nespresso machine in the room. I have been there twice already.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and spacious”
Reviews.Author: Sawellin07
Reviews.Content: I stayed from January 15-18th. I spent $609.00 (including taxes and fees) for all three nights in premier room (non smoking) my room was 4508 on the 45th floor. I didn't order room service, movies or interent. I also didnt touch the mini bar. B/c i knew all of that was extra fees. the room was nice but it wasnt as cozy or as nice as i would have liked. Everything in new york is expensive especially the food so if i could do it again i would have taken a 12 pack of soda some bottles of water and some snacks. Also i think next time i'm going to stay in the financial district b/c time square is to hectic. The nice part is that even in January I walked to central park and I walked to 34th street and did not waste money on a taxi or subway b/c everything was so close. TKTS opens usally 3:00 pm everyday so if you go to broadway shows go there to buy your tickets b/c its 50% off. The cleaning lady was great she did a great job. The view in my room was amazing especially at night. The bathroom was nice I loved taking a bath. There was a wierd ..old carpet smell which I didn't like. The elevator was fast hardly ever stopped but if you have a sensitive stomach then stay on a low floor b/c going up 45 floors in a matter of seconds can make you quesy. Also what was nice is that i arrived at the hotel around 1:30 pm and was able to go straight to my room and when i checked out they held my bags so i could shop a little before my flight. The subway was 2 blocks away which was convienent. As a woman I felt comfortable in time square alone at all hours b/c there is always people around and police and every store is open to usally 11pm or 12am. This hotel is perfect for familes b/c its right next to toys R us and M&M world also the hotel is pretty kid friendly being that there isn't anything sharp or glass. and in my room the mini fridge was hidden so in a cabinet so i wasn't tempted to look in there. Lastly i loved that there were extra blanket and pillows in the closet as well as an ironing board and iron in there. There was also a coffee machine and tea bags for those who drink. it....Hope my comment helps i tried to be as detailed as possible only b/c its what i wanted to know before I went there!

Reviews.Title: “the hotel was great”
Reviews.Author: NBWB
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right off times square near Toy's R Us. we got upgraded to the premier bit which was excellent. the room was spacious, modern, clean and tidy. we got free contiental breakfast and in the evening they do complimentary cheese and ham and free drinks (only in the premier bit) we paid around $299 dollars a night as we booked way in advance but throught it was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location Only”
Reviews.Author: brybread
Reviews.Content: ROOMS: Large for NY standards. Oriental themed with little asian finishings here and there. Bath room was standard, nothing spesh about it. Had a King size bed, huge, but rather hard. Took some time to adjust. Lovely bath robes and a nice big flat screen TV. CLEANLINESS: Rooms kept very well everyday. Towels are replaced everyday. LOCATION: Basically, this Hotel is riding on the location. W/O it, I'm sure the stars would dramatically drop on its ratings. Best Location ever! Right in the heart of Times Square. Able to see all the action and drama of it all, but at the same time, it was still quiet, therefore I managed to get some sleep without noise interruptions. SERVICE: Nill. Apart from check in, and bell boys loading and off loading our luggages, nothing really spesh about this Hotel that stands out! OVERALL: Would only stay back here if I need to be in Times Sq the next time I'm in NY-highly doubt it though, as it doesn't take long to travel anyone in manhattan to Times Sq.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - 2 seconds from times square”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Trav3l_Alot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millennium Broadway in September 2009, it was our first trip to NYC and we could not have picked a better location! The hotel is located in a quiet side street just off times square, close to public transport, restuarants and the Broadway Theatres. Emipre State, Rockafeller Center, Madison Square Garden and Central Park are all within walking distance of this hotel. Staff were friendly, Rooms were clean and quiet and quite spacious (not what you would expect in such a big city!) great value for money for the location its in, also fantasic deli's nearby. Definately will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great New York hotel”
Reviews.Author: zink920
Reviews.Content: I was amazed at the spacious room I had - superior king room. The bathroom was huge. Not at all like a typical NY hotel room. I have stayed at the Waldorf Astoria and the room was half the size at twice the price. The hotel is located right in the middle of Times Square so if you're heading out to the theater it's a great spot to stay in. Also, the subway is only a few blocks walk from the hotel. I park and take the subway around town so that was very convenient. The staff was polite, professional and helpful. I had room service breakfast the morning I left and it was delicious and the service was prompt. It is a bit overpriced so thrifty travelers will want to pass but for me having breakfast delivered to my room is always something I treat myself to whenever I travel. Wifi is $12.95 per 24 hours which I wasn't crazy about but I can't live without my computer so I paid it. Should be free, though. There are plenty of low-budget hotels which offer wifi for free so the Millenium should get on board.

Reviews.Title: “Helped Us in a Jam”
Reviews.Author: jayster
Reviews.Content: After experiencing some major problems with a hotel down the street, I called Millennium at midnight. A room with a competitive rate was available, so we left the first place. The service provided by the check-in clerk at Millennium was wonderful. After receiving no apologies for problems at the last place, he actually expressed sorrow we were having a rough travel experience. He gave us a great room with a great view for the night. The room was spacious -- especially for New York. We did have one issue: a towel from a previous hotel guest was hanging on the back of the bathroom door. Check-out was very busy. Both the bell desk and front desk were a little understaffed. We would stay here again.
