The view was nice too from the room, we could see the heart of the action from the room. The bed in this room was by far the BEST bed I have ever slept on in a hotel. Clean, comfortable - and the room looked like it had been recently renovated to a more updated style. Very pleased with the room in general. They have sensored minibar and snack drawer - so I was worried when my kid started moving things around. But there was no problem when I called the front desk, they took care of it right away. Summary: All in all , a nice place to stay. It gets really crowded in Times Square on the weekend, so be ready. For a first trip into the city - the location was great. I would say that the regular rates are pretty steep, and that staying one or two blocks off the main drag are well worth it, and we'll probably do that next time. But the hotel was clean, convenient, and the staff was pleasant. We never heard a peep from our neighbors either which is a sign of thick walls!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room size”
Reviews.Author: McCuaigScotland
Reviews.Content: As the reviews say fantastic location so central to everything. We were very lucky we contacted hotel before arriving to say a special occasion and the Concierge lady called Gloria was fantastic .We stayed on 49th Floor Executive room great size and great room ammenites, we never had breakfast as wanted to eat out so cannot comment but for the Travelzoo rate the room was excellent no complaints large room and certainley very clean. All staff were lovely, would definatley stay there again if we went back to New York. Got cheaper Theatre tickets from Theatre desk in Hotel and better seats than we did booking before we went Found great restaurant Wolfganges Park Avenue best steak we have ever had (need to book) Elios Italian again need to book.

Reviews.Title: “Just an average hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoCali
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are in our late 20's, early 30's from Southern California and just got back from our trip. The Millenium is in a great location for a first timer to NY or if you plan to watch Broadway shows. The hotel staff and concierge are very nice and knowledgeable. However, the hotel is a little dated. I liked our bedroom decor but the comforter slid off of us every night and the bathroom belongs in a two star hotel at best. The bathtub had stains and cracks throughout. The carpet in our room was also stained. It's a good thing we hardly stayed in the room and enjoyed everything NY had to offer. I am glad that I read the reviews on this board and knew what to expect in regards to the hotel. My expectations were not high for the price I paid. Overall, I felt that it was worth it and I would stay here again if I got the same deal.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great; rooms need a deep cleaning”
Reviews.Author: Camdenyards
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millennium Broadway Saturday night. You definitely can't beat the location. As mentioned in other reviews, you are 1/2 block from 7th Ave and Times Square. Even if you aren't looking for the Times Square experience, you are walking distance to the theaters, Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue shopping, and many other NYC attractions. If I hadn't found a deal through Travelzoo we wouldn't have stayed there. And unless I find a similiar deal, I won't in the future. A couple of issues we found: * There wasn't a valet to be found. We ended up parking in the lot just down 44th St. for $44 - which is a good price for midtown. * We had a corner room on the 33rd floor overlooking Times Square, which had a great view and surprisingly wasn't noisy. * The room was in need of a deep scrub. I won't disgust you with the details, but from the bathroom to the comforter to candy wrappers on the floor, it could have used some serious cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed thoughts”
Reviews.Author: bigfootlondon
Reviews.Content: Rooms are comfortable, position is good if you want to be just by Times Square, if you are on a lower floor it can be noisy. But what lets this place down is the more than useless reception staff. Very unhelpful and miserable (I got treated 100 times better in Holiday Inn Express by JFK) for a top NY hotel a disgrace. The door staff and bell boys where very pleaseant and helpful. I would not stay at the hotel again due to the reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jas044
Reviews.Content: You can't ask for a better location...you're literally steps from Times Square...and the room itself (a two bed superior room on the 36th floor) was sizeable and comfortable, with a nice, big bathroom. Got a great rate, considering the holiday weekend, through TravelZoo, as have apparently many people on here. Check-in, or, more accurately, getting to the room, was a bit of a pain. We were allowed to check in when we got there at just before noon, but the room wasn't available then...or at 1:30...or at 4. We eventually got in about 4:30. Not a huge deal, since between 2 and 4 we were at a Broadway show, but a little annoying nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more - Disappointed with the Millennium”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Dragon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Friday night, and the hotel was in the perfect location, right on 44th street in Times Square, its just behind (down the street) from ToysRUs. No complaints about the location at all. We arrived at the hotel around midnight and my husband had to go inside and locate a valet. The hotel charges $44 for 24 hours of parking, which is comparable to other NYC hotels. So no problems there, although you would expect the valet to have been readily available when we arrived at the door. When we made our reservation we requested a king non-smoking room, we were first put into a room with 2 over-sized twin beds (I was shocked - I've never seen this size bed in any hotel), in addition the room smelled of smoke. The front desk sent up a machine to clear the air while we were out walking about in Time Square, we arrived back in the room the smell was still bad. We called down again and they arranged to move us to another room, a bellman brought us a new key, but when we got to the room the key didn't work......finally a security guy came and opened our room with a key, he told us we could go to the front desk in the morning and obtain a new key (not the service I would have expected from this level of hotel). Anyway, we were tired and just wanted to get into bed at this time. This room had 2 double beds and no wash cloths (random I know), but there were no blankets on the beds. Again I was shocked; the bedding consisted of a sheet with a bedspread on top. I don't know about you but I always remove the bedspread, because we all know they don't wash them with each change of guest (EW!). Anyway, I did location a raggy blanket in the closet but it looked clean. The bright spot was in the morning, we went to the theater desk and a very helpful gentleman helped us secure decent tickets at a fair price for a show that night; (BTW see Spam-A-Lot it was fantastic). Overall, we were disapponted with the Millennium Broadway we expected more from this hotel. Next time in NYC, we'll go back to the Marriott Marquis.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location is Everything”
Reviews.Author: Sisyphus_55
Reviews.Content: As others have noted, location is everything. Millennium Broadway would be way overpriced if not for its location. We had a so-called "superior" small corner room on the 40th floor and paid nearly $500 per night. The view was good but the windows were filthy. The room was clean otherwise. Hidden ice bucket (look in the closet behind the iron). The air conditioning was rather inadequate. Front desk was efficient, concierge was quite helpful. Funky and expensive internet access in the conference center with a cheapo printer that charges for copies not printed. Despite the nitpicks, we had an okay stay in this three and a half star hotel. And as I say, location is everything.

Reviews.Title: “NB. The Premier, not main hotel - but would return for location and room size”
Reviews.Author: Moglai
Reviews.Content: Two night stay, 21&22 Sept 07. Had booked main hotel but on arrival was directed towards Premier lobby next door - a recent extension to the main hotel. Reception area & mezzanine for breakfast/complimentary evening drink & hors d'oeuvres is sparse and much less sumptuous than the main hotel. Thought initially we were being fobbed off with downmarket sister hotel with fewer stars, but the room was great. However, we tried, but never got to see a room in the main hotel for comparison. I have been unable to find any reviews for the Premier in it's own right. We started on the 12th floor but overlooked the building work on the roof of the property across 44th St, so when the concierge rang us to ask if all was OK (nice touch and unexpected in NY but maybe it was because he was also a Man Utd fan) we mentioned the poor view, and he found us another room on the 21st. Still not quite high enough to get the full Manhattan skyline but we could see down into a corner of Times Square and almost the Rock. Main hotel has 20+ floors more than the Premier. Plug was wedged in bath, taps loose and the mastic around the shower base was a bit sketchy but otherwise the room was fantastic - bed very comfortable. Continental breakfast only but it's a buffet so a couple of platefuls made it adequate. Complimentary Evening Reception was welcome but only one red and one white house of wine, and choice of bottled beers. You have to go next door for full restaurant and bar facilities. Location is excellent - 100 yards off Times Square, so very close to everything in Midtown. A great base for exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: SwissG
Reviews.Content: When I first got to this hotel, I was really blown away by the friendly staff. The bellhop was very friendly, as were the people at the front desk. When I got to my room, it turned out it was already occupied. No problem, they switched my room very quickly and all was well. But the room was a bit disappointing. It was small, a picture was missing from above the bed (with the hanging material still on the wall), I had to dust the lamps myself, a lightbulb in one of the lamps was burnt out, the TV remote didn't work properly, the bathtub stopper didn't work, and the sheets didn't fit the bed. THAT IS THE WORST! Instead of a proper fitted bottom sheet, they had laid out a top sheet that didn't fit the bed. So the bottom of the sheet didn't cover the mattress pad. Very weird, and I found myself trying to remake the bed the best I could or think about all the other feet that may have touched that same mattress pad. Not a pleasant thought. But the hotel in all was clean and nice and the location was great and the people friendly (of all the people I encountered during my three night stay, only one was rude), and I liked the hotel despite its faults. It may have been that I was in New York city, the bright lights of Times Square were steps away, and it was easier to turn a blind eye this time than others. But imagine how great it would be if they would get the details right!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: GoWolfpack
Reviews.Content: Lets face it. The best attrribute of this hotel is the location. Literally steps away from the heart of Times Square and all the Broadway theatres, The room was comfortable and clean. TV was flaky (could not mute it) and the staff was NYC gruff. But overall, a nice stay at a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: katarinaNY
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great locaton, however, the room was not clean! The bathroom light fixtures were broken, and the hair dryer did not work. We needed to call to the front desk twice for a replacement since we were trying to make it to a Broadway show. Front desk staff and bell staff were very rude! Not impressed and way too expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and stay”
Reviews.Author: Scarlet46
Reviews.Content: This hotel is more of a boutique one and very nicely located within Times Square, a close subway stop and Broadway. The staff couldn't have been nicer and more helpful. We enjoyed drinks here but never a meal so I can't comment on the food. The only thing I wish they had in the rooms was a coffee/tea service for those times when you just wanted to stay in your room and relax in the morning. We had a Superior Room with an incredible view of the Paramount. Nice twin beds with comfy sheets. The bedspread was beautiful but with it's satin lining, I had a heck of a time keeping it on the bed during the night. An extra blanket would have been nice on the bed instead (with the spread folded back). The room wasn't large but suitable for what we needed. The bathroom could have used a bit of bleach on the tile but otherwise everything was clean and shiny. Thanks for a wonderful stay in an incredible city!

Reviews.Title: “New York here we come!”
Reviews.Author: iluveddie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a weekend in New York City. The Millennium Broadway Hotel was incredible. It is in the heart of Time Square and within walking distance to many of New York's other great attractions. The hotel's lobby has the elegance of a old Broadway theatre and the room's decor is bright and tastefully done. The room's construction does not allow any of the outside noise to sneak in. We had a corner room which gave us two windows, with two different views of Time Square. The only problem we occurred was, too little time to take advantage of everything the hotel has to offer. My husband and I have now found our New York hideaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: driving_in_LA
Reviews.Content: For a hotel located in the middle of Times Square, the room was large and a good value through travelzoo for our three day stay in April. Most of the other hotels were more expensive and had smaller rooms. We stayed in the main tower on the 46th(?) floor. The furnishings seemed new and modern. The bathroom was clean and in good condition. Really fast elevators! The staff was accomodating to our request for a higher room with a nice view of Times Square. They also helped us find tickets to see Chorus Line. Had a bit of trouble with ordering pay per view movies. The ordering system was too complicated for me, but it's a minor issue. Overall, a great experience and when I return to NYC, I'll go back to the Millenium Broadway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough - but great location”
Reviews.Author: yoursuzanne
Reviews.Content: First of all let me say that the perks of this hotel are all about the location. Locationâ€¦locationâ€¦location! Times Square is steps away. Bryant Park is within a couple of blocks. We had a view of the Empire State Building from our room. Broadway with its ocean of tourists and every theater show in town is at your doorstep. This hotel is huge - thousands of rooms and hundreds of people passing through the lobby and through the elevators. Very busy front desk with a not-too-friendly but not quite rude demeanor upon check in. Upon check out â€“ very friendly concierge to help print out etickets and give directions. Great bell staff. Never ate in the hotel, so I canâ€™t comment on the food quality. Our room was nice. Nothing too exciting. King sized bed with nice linens. Very large bathroom with lots of marble. There were some little things that bothered me: not enough towels, only one glass in the room instead of two, too few pillows, television seemed a little dated. Overall, though, it was fine â€“ nice even. But nothing special â€“ except that you are in the heart of it all and a cab ride away from everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Room at the Millennium Broadway”
Reviews.Author: 510sherman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room at the Millennium Broaway for my father's 70Th birthday. We were greated at check-in by a wondeful employee named Enrique who, upon hearing that my father was a fan of the Chrysler building, granted my father an upgrade to a room on the 50Th floor with a fabulous view. The room itself was modern, spacious, and clean. Overall the Millennium is a beautiful hotel with stunning views, comfortable rooms, a convenient location, and a courteous and professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff & good views”
Reviews.Author: laurad1980
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Hotwire and was a bit concerned by some of the reviews I read. However I had no problems, the hotel was fine, room was clean and when we asked for a view they put us in a corner room on the 30th floor (room 3018 - see pictures). At nightime the view was like a postcard. Bathroom was clean, newly refurbished & no problems with shower pressure. Lobby is a bit dark and depressing. Phillip on the information desk is v helpful & informative. The bell captain also v helpful. The tv automatically turns off after a certain time, missed the end of a movie we ordered (they took it off the bill). We also ordered a mini refridgerator which never arrived, so we could not keep stuff cold (when we tried to keep some stuff including milk in the minibar it was removed by housekeeping) Fine if you are looking for a hotel in the middle of everything, I personally would stay somewhere else next time as you do get a bit fed up fighting your way through Times Square and it loses its appeal a bit when you are staying in the middle of it. Going to try the Omni Berkshire next time, or possibly go back to the Barclay Intercontinental which I would also reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice room, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: vlad_dc
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Millenium Broadway in late August. It was a last-minute business decision to stay in NYC overnight and I picked the Millenium primarily becuase it was half a block from the office. I stayed in a Superior room on the 42nd floor, I think it was 4201 so it was on the corner facing Times Square and the view, including a nice sunset (when was the last time you saw a sunset from a Manhattan hotel room?), was stunning. I loved that you could open up a little window and here the sounds. The room was spacious, very modernly appointed, had a (smallish) flat screen, funky night lights, and a nice firm mattress. On the down side: - I paid $500 for the room - I know Manhattan prices are insane, but still this was shockingly expensive - I had trouble with my room key and security had to come and help out - There is not a single place to sit down in the lobby, so meeting up with people there is needlesly laborious.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased Overall”
Reviews.Author: samsdadOrlando_FL
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with the overall experience. In town for US Open Tennis. Excellent location. Very convenient to subway at Times Square(#7 train to US Tennis Center in Queens). Booked through TravelZoo with good rate on sold out Labor Day weekend. Hotel did not have the room type which was confirmed. We were offered a discount for the standard room which turned out to be better than expected. Room was clean, beds comfortable, bathrooms and toiletries above average, though small. Concierge(s) were very helpful with dinner reservations and directions. I am a seasoned traveler who can be very critical and I have to say I was pleased overall with my stay. Would definitely stay here again due to location, if prices remain competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! An amazing hotel experience - We'll definitely Return!”
Reviews.Author: gehrignblondie
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from an awesome trip to New York City, where we celebrated our one year wedding anniversary in conjunction with my husband's birthday. We took a two day trip (all our work schedules will allow), and stayed at the Millennium Broadway. From the moment we walked in, the elegance astounded us. The black marble lobby, outfitted in contemporary style, was much more spectacular in person than in photos. We were greeted warmly, and check in was very quick. We had requested a room facing Times Square, and upon check in, were assured of a great room. We rode the elevator up to room 4501 and quickly entered for some respite from the busy city. The room was immaculate. Nothing was out of place, and everything was very clean. The room was beautifully decorated with a king-size bed and LCD television. The room was VERY spacious, and there was a writing desk and armchairs available for relaxing. Our view was the most spectacular part of our trip. Our corner room overlooked Times Square and faced the Paramount Building. How amazing the view was after dark! The beds were comfortable and the room was cool enough to sleep in the hot summer air. City noise was minimal. Checkout was just as quick and easy. We were even told we could stay up to an hour past checkout, if we needed to. The trip was amazing and this hotel is definitely the only one for us in the City that Never Sleeps.

Reviews.Title: “What a Location !”
Reviews.Author: nomar5955
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the middle of the action, this is the place for you! We had a wonderful room on the 45th floor right over Time Square. We could look down at any time day or night and see the activities on the street. The staff was friendly, and the room was clean and modern. Good Morning America is broadcast from the Times Square Sudios a half a block away. Truly a great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “I used to be a fan of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulwoehrle
Reviews.Content: It's time for the owners/management of the Millennium Broadway to reinvest in their property. What once was lovely is now just plain tired and worn. The furnishings are scarred, the mattresses sag. Twice in my recent stay, the maintenance men came in to try to get the box springs on my kingsized bed to sit properly on the bedframe .. they were not successful. The lighting in the room and bath is awful ... the only light bright enough to read by is the desk lamp .. unfortunately the desk chair is a small wooden dining room chair totally uncomfortable for use when working on one's laptop. The location is fine, as long as one is prepared to deal with the madness of the Times Square crowds. The staff is by and large responsive if never especially warm or effective. Trip Advisor adn Priceline call this a four star property; Biddingfortravel calls it a 3 star and I'm inclined to go with their rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Millenium Broadway”
Reviews.Author: Northern_Neighbour
Reviews.Content: I was at the Millenium Broadway Hotel for 5 days and must say that it was one of the best hotels that I stayed at. The room was clean and the noise was minimal (we were on the 27th floor). The staff were helpful and the location was awesome. Everything was in walking distance. We'd definitely stay at the Millenium Broadway the next time we're in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: quackerstoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Millennium Broadway during our first trip ever to the great NYC, and had a fantastic stay. Booked directly using a promotion code from a travel site, $199/night; stayed 8/18 to 8/21. Staff was attentive all around, from the doorman to the bellhop to the front desk. We got a superior room on the 49th floor and loved the small touches, such as the lighted panels by the headboard, individual reading lights, great mattress, super bedcover. Only complaints were that the sink was very slow to drain (solved that by pulling out the stopper!), and the coffee on offer was not too great. Had no problems with street noise. Times Square is literally right around the corner, with the fun crowds and dazzling light displays, but the hotel street itself is so low-key it's hard to believe that it's in the same crazy area (and I mean 'crazy' in a good way; I'm real city person!). We walked almost everywhere while sightseeing, and found the hotel very centrally located. We flew out via JFK and made use of one of their chauffered town cars. $59, super ride, very friendly driver. Plan to come back for sure, this time with our grown kids. They'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Positively surprised!”
Reviews.Author: NYCfanFinland
Reviews.Content: I had pretty mixed feelings about Millenium Broadway after having read reviews in Tripadvisor. However, all my favourite hotels were sold out and I needed to find a place for 3 nights somewhere close to Porth Authority. I got a 199USD deal from Travelzoo which I considered a real bargain. Upon arrival I requested to have a quiet room and I was given a corner room on the 48th floor (superior room). The room was the biggest one I've stayed in NYC - even the bathroom was very spacious. The decor was quite stylish to my standards (I like Scandinavian simple, yet elegant style). My king-sized bed was very comfortable. There were no problems what so ever considering noise (I am very sensitive to noise:)) or the cleaness of the room, even the shower pressure was excellent. IAs my room was in a corner the view in the night was just impressive! There were some minor stains on the walls but I've seen these kind of "faults" in Sofitel and Marriott hotels as well. Regarding the staff I think they were very neutral - all my requests were followed promptly and professionally. I did not experience overwhelming friendliness but I was only looking for something nice, safe and comfortable to spend the little time I had over from sightseeing and shopping. Next time I'll visit NYC I will definately check Millenium Broadway for special promotions!

Reviews.Title: “Millennium New York- Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Portlk
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a 4night stay at the Millennium Broadway. We booked using the Travelzoo promotion at a rate of $199 (8/16-8/20/07). This was our first trip to New York and we read allot of mixed reviews but overall made our choice because of the price, location and from the positive reviews. The staff was exremely friendlly and helpful. Check in and out with no problems. Received a superior room as promised. We had a view of times square and the Chrysler building on the 30th floor. The room was of adequate size and clean. Air worked fine and the shower (over tub) had more than enough pressure. Location was perfect, we walked to Central Park, Broadway shows, 5th avenue shopping. Took the subway (3 blocks away-from 42nd st.) to Yankee stadium and Empire state building with no problems. We were offered a town car at check out (rather than a cab), well worth the few ($5) extra dollars. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for a better hotel”
Reviews.Author: RedheadMustTravel
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 day trip from NYC Aug. 18-22. Stayed at the Millennium Broadway Hotel in Times Square. I had a really hard time choosing a hotel with so many options. Found a great deal on [--] for $199 per night. Great deal for this hotel!!! We had a superior king room. Room was very large for NY (so I hear most rooms in NY are extremely small) and was in the perfect location. A few steps and you are in the middle of Times Square. We were on the 51st floor with a great view of the Chrysler Building. Staff was very nice and helpful with questions. I highly reccomend buying a Metro Card and taking the Subway. Hotel is close to Subway Station taking you everywhere you want to go. Visit [--] for great walking tours for only $3.00. We could not have made it as great without them. Eat at Gigino's at Wagner Park near Battery Park. Excellent Food!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: Mbwlewis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millenium Broadway from 17th - 19th August 2007. I booked through Priceline "Name your Own Price" - got a great deal @ Â£90 per night. The hotel is in a spectacular location and is an easy walk to almost every tourist spot in NYC. I walked from the hotel to Central Park, 5th Avenue, Times Square and a few theatres. It is also a 2 min walk from the very central Times Square subway. The hotel itself is clean and comfortable and although my room was fairly small, it had everything i needed. . I found the hotel check-in very easy and was pleasantly surprised to be offered a corner room. The views were excellent from 2911 (29th floor). My room attendant was excellent and left additional towels for me. The hotel concierge was also very helpful with directions, maps and local knowledge. I would reccommend this hotel to tourists as you will just need a good "base" for your trips. I found it to be absolutely perfect for a weekend in the Big Apple!

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel made poor by its staff”
Reviews.Author: Deir
Reviews.Content: If you took the people out of the equation, this hotel wouldn't be too shabby for Manhattan. But, even without the bad experience that the staff guarantees, the hotel is not nice enough to rate 4 stars. Period. However, the staff really seem to go the extra mile to make sure that nothing goes smoothly. We'd booked our room through a TravelZoo promotion - $199/night for a Superior room (renovated, 26th fl and above) and were visting from DC for my son's 9th birthday. When I made the reservation, I called ahead and spoke with the concierge, asking if he could do something special - even a balloon - to make my son feel special. I'd also confirmed that we'd be booked in a Superior room, as I'd read on TripAdvisor that the Standard rooms were not nice at all. We arrived last Saturday afternoon, and were greeted by a dour-faced guy named Chad who assured us that we would not be getting a Superior room because the hotel was overbooked. I said, I'm sure you are because of the promotion. Nevertheless, I booked a Superior room and expect to stay in one. He argued that there were no guarantees of room type and that I should have "read the fine print." I handed him my screenshot showing my booking and assured him there was no fine print. He told me to come back in an hour when the check-ins started but that I shouldn't hold my breath. I used that hour to duck into Sephora around the corner and call the number on the confirmation. The woman at the hotel told me that Chad was mistaken and that I was already booked into a Superior room. Basically, it appears they try to bully as many people as they can into taking something substandard. Our room was on the 49th fl. Nothing had been done for my son based on my concierge request. The hair dryer didn't work. They put a $375 pending charge on the day of check-in on my card for a $230 room with tax. And then breakfast - ordered pancakes for 7:40am. Got nothing. Called room service. They were nice and sent something up quickly, but it was a muffin. Went back downstairs and came back in a few minutes with pancakes. They were nice enough, but 4 stars? 3 stars? I guess there are no bugs...And on the day we were there, there was no problem with water pressure. Just be prepared to be disappointed with the staff, and be pleasantly surprised if you're not. Also, consider something off Times Sq. if you're not used to sirens. The police station is very close by. I had thought I'd be fine with windows shut on such a high floor, but it woke me up. Next time, I think we'll spend the extra money and try the Elysee or Sofitel. There was clearly a reason these guys needed to run a promotion.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and service - great value”
Reviews.Author: mrhappy99
Reviews.Content: After a condo reservation fell though, I needed a place on short notice. Some of the reviews here led me to the Millennium Times Square. When I called (I work in government) they gave me a rate that, frankly, I thought didn't exist in New York. Then, when I arrived (late, around 10:30pm) the experience went from good to remarkably good. 1) Pulled my car up, was greeted promptly by a very helpful staff member who took my bags and checked my car with ease and with good cheer. 2) I was walked directly to the check-in desk. 3) At check-in, they upgraded my room without me even having to ask. 4) Another gentleman took my bags up, again with a pleasant and easy manner. 5) The room, well, rather impressive. 47th floor, corner, fantastic view. The room itself was small (folks, it's New York), but brilliantly laid out so that I didn't once feel cramped, even though I have felt cramped in other, bigger rooms. The decor was also better than I had expected from a big hotel, and it was frankly nicer and more tasteful than at least half of the so-called "boutique" hotels at which I've stayed. 6) The stay: zero problems, I noticed nothing done poorly, nothing missing, everything was as it should have been. 7) Checkout: zero surprises, zero hassle, quick, my car was pulled around sooner than promised, and I was on my way. Frankly, I would not normally stay at a place like this (I'm fond of the so-called "cooler" hotels) but I'm re-thinking that, and putting the Millennium Times Square up at the top of my list for New York visits.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MomOfTravellers
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned home after a wonderful stay at the Millenium Broadway. The location is awesome (steps away from Times Square), the room was beautiful and the staff was incredible. We were on the 50th floor, in a corner room with a kingsize bed. It was the most comfortable bed Iâ€™ve ever slept in. There was a nice flatscreen tv, a desk with a very comfortable chair, a lounge chair by the window, spacious bathroom (weak hairdryer, though!), and a roomy closet with a small safe, iron and ironing board, and full length mirrored doors. The view was breathtaking. The room was clean and nicely decorated. Elevators were prompt and the lobby was huge, with doors on both sides, one to 44th street and the other to 45th. Our stay was very enjoyable, due to the comfort, security, and the friendly, helpful staff. Terrance, Adrian, Antonio, and Tim made us feel right at home. Thanks guys, weâ€™ll be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “One Word: YUCK!”
Reviews.Author: hip_hotels_4_me
Reviews.Content: How much did I hate Millennium Hotel Broadway? Let's put it this way: I didn't even pay for the room, yet I created an account here on tripadvisor.com largely so I could share my experience. Before I tell you the bad, let me tell you the good things. It is a very short list. The bellmen were friendly and helpful. The lamps in the room have rheostats on them. The hotel is located near the theater district...but then so are a raft of other hotels. Yep, that's about it. And now for the bad: The worst thing about Millennium Hotel is what you can't experience on the website. On the website you'll never hear the phone in the next room ringing and ringing and ringing as I did in my corner room at Millennium Broadway. You'll never taste the vaguely chemical taste of the scrambled eggs that room service brought to my room twice (my family and I decided the eggs must be powdered eggs as nothing else can account for their awful taste). You can't see the horrible flourescent lighting because the photos on the website are professionally lit. You won't see the battered and dated vacuum cleaner that housekeeping left in the hallway just outside my room for at least an hour one morning. And you won't get a feel for the lack of cleanliness. So, I'm here to tell you all about it. The worst part of the stay was the bathroom. The hotel has installed low-flow showerheads and low-flow faucets in the sink. I live in Southern California and we virtually pioneered water saving devices. I have encountered all manner of low-flow showerhead and faucets, but I have never met a low-flow showerhead as bad as the one in my bathroom at Millennium Hotel. I had to stand under the shower for about ten minutes just to get my hair wet. Of course, I'm exaggerating, but the water flow was really, really bad. Once you do get shampoo in your hair or soap on your body it is a struggle just to rinse it off of you. Same story with the sink. Washing your hands in the sink was a ten minute affair. I finally took to bypassing the sink and washing my hands under the faucet of the bathtub...which, unlike the sink faucet or the showerhead, had completely unrestricted water flow. The shower backed up one evening as I showered just before going to bed. Water pooled around my feet and ankles and refused to drain which cut short my shower. By morning, the backup had cleared and it worked fine again. I concentrated on washing my feet that next morning. Yuck. The lighting in the bathroom was awful. I've met airplane lavatories that had more flattering lighting than the bathroom in my room at Millennium Hotel. I looked so awful in the mirror that I toyed with the idea of booking an emergency botox/facelift appointment. Thank goodness the lamps next to the bed, at the desk and at the sitting area came equipped with dimmers. My room was not exactly clean. The carpet was heavily soiled. There was a large, black stain just inside the door. It looked as though about a quart of oil had been spilled on the light-colored carpet. There was a stain on the wall that looked as though someone had tossed a meatball basketball-style into the trash can, using the wall as the backboard. During a three day stay it never was cleaned off the wall. Every time I ordered room service, they screwed something up. Usually it was something small such a forgetting to place salt and pepper on the tray. Once, they failed to include the Diet Coke I ordered as my beverage. When I called down to tell them I wanted the Diet Coke, the woman who took my order said, "You didn't tell me you wanted a Diet Coke." I sweetly said, "No, I ordered a Diet Coke." She put me on hold and then came back online and said "Okay, I'm sending a Diet Coke up, and I'm not going to charge you, but next time make sure you say that clearly." And I thought saying 'I'll have a Diet Coke and a glass of ice water' was clear enough. Silly me. Room service stops (if I remember correctly) at 10:00 PM. After that hour the hotel will order for you from restaurants in the area and have it delivered to your room. While I admit the food I ordered at that hour did arrive quickly, my selections were limited to things like pizza and burgers...nothing even remotely healthy was offerred as a choice. The worst thing about room service (and the restaurant downstairs) was the eggs. They had a vaguely chemical aftertaste. After twice ordering them for breakfast and twice having to choke them down because they were so awful, I mentioned it to my familly. We all agreed the eggs must be powdered eggs. Avoid them. In fact, avoid the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: woblynne
Reviews.Content: We booked the Millenium Broadway after seeing a Travelzoo offer at $199 a night plus taxes. As we had stayed there before we were happy to go back again (we were in the Premier section last time) The offer was for a standard room with an upgrade to a superior room upon arrival. However, on arrival (at 11.30pm) following a long flight from the UK and a horrendous immigration line, we checked in. We were told our room would be on the 9th floor in the Premier section. I said we had stayed in that section before and thanked him for the upgrade. This was greatas it was something we hadn't expected. With Premier rooms, as mentioned by others, you get continental breakfast and beer/wine/canapes from 5-7pm too. The lounge can be accessed throughout the day for cookies, tea/coffee and soft drinks. The room was slightly smaller this time (not much though) and overlooked the main street where the Scottish bar is (St Andrews I think). It had a large flat screen TV, king bed, 2 seater sofa and chair, tea/coffee making facilities, smallish wardrobe incorporate ironing board. The bathroom had a single sink, bath and separate shower (of course WC too). There was plenty of room for the two of us as we were only there for 3 nights. The concierge's in the Premier section were extremely helpful and assisted us with confirming reservations for the River Cafe and booked a car for our return airport transfer ($86) - after having a couple of nasty taxi rides, we thought it best to have a bit of luxury back to JFK! Overall a great place to stay - just around the corner from Times Square and accessible very easily to 5th Avenue and most attractions by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: bfacekapsi
Reviews.Content: I wanted to surprise my wife for our anniversary and take her to a Broadway play. I was committed to staying at The Shoreham Hotel but the day before I left I changed to The Millennium because it was in Times Square, close to all the Broadway plays and I got the Travelzoo discount for $199.00 for a superior room. The was the best move I ever made. We arrived late (11:00 at night) and we were given a standard room. I told the receptionist that I would not except a standard room and pay superior room price. He found me a superior room but once we got to the room it was not too our liking so I decided I would inquire about another room the next morning. I went to the front desk and spoke with the front desk manager. She IMMEDIATELY personally took me over to the club room side of the hotel and upgraded us free of charge. These rooms don't have a view but they are much nicer and you get free drinks and heavy h'ordeuves each afternoon. The room was a nice size, had a sofa aadn desk and the bed was excellent. The location of the hotel is right off of Times Square and it is close to everything. Hotels in N.Y are very expensive and to get the room we had at the travelzoo discount was an unbelievable deal. I recommended the hotel to a co-worker and she and her husband loved the hotel also. This is now my hotel of choice when I travel to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - wonderful location and staff”
Reviews.Author: TCF261
Reviews.Content: Just back from six nights in the Millenium Broadway NYC. We stayed in the Premier Club section of the hotel - it was great. The room was lovely, perfect for our requirements. It was on the 14th floor - if you are looking for a higher level room, then you will have to stay in the main part of the hotel instead. We were able to have breakfast every morning before we headed off to the shops. This proved very handy as we could just go down to the Mez floor, and have a lovely breakfast - croissants, bagels, strawberries, blueberries, melon, muffins, yoghurts, cereals, eggs - all tastes are catered for. What stood out for us was the fact that on the day we were leaving (Wednesday) there was no issue with checking out and leaving our luggage in the luggage room in reception (of premier club). Our flight wasn't until 9:20pm so we headed off for the afternoon in Manhattan, and then when we came back we were able to shower and change in the bathroom on the mez floor, before heading to the airport. This was a fantastic facility! We didn't really have the coctails and canapes that are also part of the premier club package - we partook in them one night, and that was great. All in all our stay in the hotel was great. The bed was without doubt, one of the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in!! I would definately stay here again - and would highly recommend it. Also, if you are going to NYC and staying here (you lucky thing!) be sure and check out the Toys R Us store down the road in the middle of Times Square. It is unbelievable!!! There is a huge dinosaur in the middle of the shop and kids of all ages would love it! Hope this review is of some help - go for it! Stay in the Millenium Broadway, you won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice close to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: IrishDawn
Reviews.Content: Ihave been to NYC several times, but this trip I was taking my mother with me. I wanted a hotel close to Times Square and the Subway that was clean, modern, and quiet. We got all that plus an exceptionally friendly and helpful staff and an incredibly cheap rate booked off a special I found on Travel Zoo. This hotel isn't as splashy as the Westin or the Marriott Marquis, but it did the job nicely for us. There was nothing about our stay I could complain about and much that I can compliment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Guis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is almost in Times Square, about 50 yards away! We were lucky to stay on a high floor, the 46th, so all traffic noise was left far behind. As with most NY hotels, the rooms were not very big, but were more than adequate. On arrival, the room was a little stuffy with a humid atmosphere from the bathroom. As we were on a high floor, opening a window soon cleared the air. We were high enough not to smell the traffic! The room was very clean and nicely decorated. Prices in the mini-bar were also not excessive. The hotel lobby was very dark, with dark wood paneling. This first impression may put some people off, but don't let it. The staff were very helpful and polite, offering good advice when needed to us first time visitors to New York. I would most definitely return to this hotel, I have recommended it to some close family who plan to stay on their next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel yes, but staff even better!”
Reviews.Author: albeeee
Reviews.Content: This place is perfect for family looking for Times Square location. Rooms are large and clean, but the bellhops and luggage guys were the best in NYC, two thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: “Wanna-be luxury hotel that can't pull it off”
Reviews.Author: Pianoborgan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a convention taking place in New York City. I was told my room was in the "newly remodeled" section of the hotel. The room was clean, but about half the light bulbs were blown out and the light in my shower didn't work. Plus, the shower was merely a section of the bathroom partitioned off with a curtain, as opposed to a real "shower." So, when you shower, you get water all over the bathroom floor. Two of the four mornings I was there, the maid service barged into my room while I was in the bathroom, scaring me half to death. It wasn't like I was sleeping late. They seemed very eager to take care of my room. I had brought my laptop computer with me, but if you want internet access, you have to pay an extra $11 a day. I think that's preposterous, especially when in any Hampton Inn, you get free internet access and a nicer room for half the price. Plus, I had asked at the front desk about holding my laptop during the day when I was out. (I was somewhat leery of thefts) They told me they wouldn't take responsibility for it. There's a safe in the room, but it wasn't nearly big enough to hold a laptop. I've been at hotels before (ones less "classy" than this one) where the front desk will hold valuables. I didn't think, for the price I was paying to stay there, that this service would have been too much to ask. On the upside, it was a quiet place with a good location off Times Square, and if you stay there, you DEFINITELY have to eat at Virgil's BBQ, right across the street. On the whole, the vibe I got from the place was that they want to have the image of a high-class hotel, when in reality I've been treated better at the likes of Holiday Inns and Hampton Inns. I mean, there's a mini-bar in the room, but so what? Don't give me a Snickers bar that costs six dollars; give me some real service and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: CricketersArms
Reviews.Content: Duration of stay: June 29 - July 2, 2007 Booked: via Priceline at $160 per night We were travelling through DFW and during this time, many flights were canceled and/or delayed due to weather and we were concerned as to whether we would make our reservation. I spoke with Yvonne of the Millennium and even though we booked through Priceline, she held our reservation until the next day, which most hotels can not do due to their agreements with Priceline. The room itself was pretty average. We have stayed at the Grand Hyatt and the Hilton on 6th Ave (both booked via Priceline) and I feel these to be of better quality. Our room was on the 19th floor overlooking Times Square. It was a nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: MEGATRAVELER
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive about the place since it's pretty large -but the location just off of Times Square was perfect. When we checked in - after two canceled flights - somewhat haggard from the trip, we were greeted by Enrique at the front desk who could not have been nicer or more welcoming. I had booked the room on TravelZoo and got a really good rate for a high demand weekend so was expecting the worst. However, we were offered a room in the Premier - the sort of mini-hotel within the Millenium. It has it's own entrance across from the main lobby and feels like you're leaving all the chaos of Times Square behind. Somewhat oddly shaped room, but very comfortable with large bathroom, flat panel TV, fax machine, robe, etc. The fitness center is in the main Millenium tower, so if you're in workout gear, you have to cross through the main lobby and take the elevator up. But it's a very nice facility and was immaculate. Housekeeping was great, friendly and unobtrusive. I'd stay here again in a second if I could be guaranteed a room in the Premiere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: connieh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, just around the corner from Times Square. Easy walk to all major sites. Busses and subway very near hotel. Staff helpful. Room was good size, clean and quiet. Beds were comfortable. Shower pressure is poor, more like a fine mist. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate and Nice. Location, Location & Location”
Reviews.Author: KAIZEN0196
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Millennium Hotel Broadway on a Saturday and upon my arrival I was greeted by the valet staff. The workers of the hotels were pleasant and ready to meet our needs of seeking some good eats. Waiting in line to be issued our room and per my request, the hotel room provided overlooked Time Square. The interior of the room was updated and refreshed, however; there were minor elements that deducted the overall experience from being truly 4-star quality. For example, there were black marks, probably from one's luggage on the wall of the room. Most of the lack lusting elements were cosmetic but overall the rooms were clean with updated bed linens. I stayed at Millennium Hotel Broadway for the weekend and overall my wife and I enjoyed our stay. The hotel is within walking distance of many NYC attractions, including the fashion district, Broadway and off -b-way plays and great eats. I would recommend the hotel to people looking for a nice place to lay their heads while touring the Big Apple. The valet parking fee was $45 per day, however; the price is not bad for ensuring security of one's vehicle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, so-so accomodations”
Reviews.Author: BFFMaryland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a weekend stay at the Millennium Hotel on Broadway. Needless to say I wasn't too impressed, but neither was I too depressed. First let me start with the negative. At first glance our room appeared to be sleek and updated, but upon further inspection little "imperfections" were noticed. Things like, mold in the bathtub (which had a broken stopper for the drain), old nightstands with new marble tops which were mis-cut, no pen in, on, or around the desk (or anywhere else), and instead of drip caffeinated coffee for the coffee pot they supplied Folgers One Cup brew (like a tea bag). (The decaffeinated coffee was automatic drip). Eventhough the "imperfections" are all minor (ok, maybe not the mold) I feel that for the amount of money they charge, these "imperfections" are significant. Now for the positive. Location, location, location!!!! Right in Time's Square. Can't beat that with a stick! Also, ask for a corner room. We had one & had a great view (from the 25th floor) of Broadway and 45th! Awesome! Bottom line, I would stay there again if my main purpose was going to a show. Otherwise, I would stay somewhere in a quieter, less busy neighborhood (probably closer to 5th Ave.).

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and high quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulHarris
Reviews.Content: Journey We flew into Newark with Continental (from the Bahamas) on 13th June 2007. The flight took two and a half hours. The taxi from the airport took about an hour and cost $57 plus motorway and tunnel tolls ($8) and a 15% tip. The total was $76. Check in Very smooth and efficient â€“ we were allocated room 5018 (on the 50th floor). There are five rapid lifts from reception and they are very quick. Room Our room was very nice and located in the corner with dual aspect windows overlooking Times Square (Paramount building etc) and north to the Rockefeller Centre buildings. The bathroom was also good and spacious, albeit the shower was not hugely powerful. Nice toiletries are supplied daily. The TV has 40+ channels including HBO and BBC America. Pay per view films are also available. Food We stayed room only and ate out for every meal! There is a good Deli across the road that has reasonably priced Pain au Chocolate, fruit and Orange juice etc. They also do eggs and omelettes. At night we ate at Viva Panchos â€“ the Mexican across the road that was inexpensive and tasty, Trattoria Dopa Teatro â€“ the Italian place down the road left out the front door, and at â€œBubba Gumpsâ€� on Time Square which is a great Gump themed restaurant. Things to do in the vicinity Obviously, there is loads to do and this hotel has a great location to see the sights of New York. We did Liberty and Ellis islands, The Empire State building, Central Park, and the famous shops, all of which are in easy reach. We also went to â€œMary Poppinsâ€� (two blocks away) â€“ but I had booked tickets for this in advance via Ticketmaster. Having said that, there was late availability for some shows when we were there â€“ even Tarzan was offering $45 off top tickets at the theatre box office meaning the most expensive seats were available for $75 (about Â£40) which is a lot less than the West End. We caught the subway once a day and also walked 20 miles in total in the three and a half days we were in the city. Weather The first day we were there it was cool (low 60â€™s) and a jumper was definitely required. The following two days it really warmed up and it was in the 90â€™s when we left. The weather suggested a 40% probability of rain, but we didnâ€™t get any. Return journey We flew out of JFK (back to Heathrow with BA) and it was very easy to get to the airport on public transport. A standard $2 subway ticket for line E gets you all the way from 42nd Street to Jamaica in Queens, from where you can change onto the â€œAir Trainâ€� (a further $5) to your terminal. The total journey to Terminal 7 took an hour. The flight back to Heathrow was 6 hours 20, plus a 1.5 hour delay waiting for our runway slot! Overall A high quality hotel in a great location. Ask for an upper floor room for great views.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: TravelFrank
Reviews.Content: This trip was a last-minute idea to celebrate my fiancee's birthday. Looking around a little bit we found a great deal on Travelzoo for the Millenium @ $199/night for our 2 night stay. Since it was a special trip I called the Millenium the night before and asked if they could put us in a corner room with a nice view. Upon our arrival at the hotel the agent at the desk wished my fiancee a happy birthday and sent us up to the 45th floor. Upon entering the room I was very excited to see the room was in fact a corner room and was overlooking times square! The room itself was very nice with a nice flat panel LCD, desk, dresser, numerous comfortable chairs which helped when we had guests over and a nice bathroom with marble counters. The overall style of the hotel was relatively modern and at times has a nice Asian-inspired feel which can be seen partly in the bed linens/style. The one key point for the hotel for our trip was its location. The hotel is right in Times Square making it walking distance to all of the key New York attractions we were interested in like the broadway theaters, rockefeller center and central park as well as grand central station. I should also note that although we were right near times square the noise was never a problem and we had no problem sleeping on the comfortable beds. Overall we had a very pleasant stay at the Millenium and I would definately recommend the hotel to a friend especially at the great rate that we received.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfeul experience”
Reviews.Author: SherryT
Reviews.Content: After a horrendous stay at the Milford Plaza last winter (we would NEVER stay there again), we were quite pleased when the Millennium Broadway Hotel more than exceeded our expectations. The rooms were clean and spacious. The bed was a full king (not the double they called a king at the Milford). They were even able to give me an adjoining room for my daughter and her friend. The hotel is conveniently located near theaters and many great restaurants. I would highly recommend this hotel and look forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Decently Reliable”
Reviews.Author: CarlNova
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends travel to NYC several times a year, and the Millennium is one of the "regular" properties at which we stay. Overall, it's a solid choice in a great location. Honestly, I prefer the beds in the main hotel over those in the Tower, and the lobby bar is a bit expensive (even for NYC), but overall you can't be the location, price, and amenities offered by the Millennium. The rooms are clean, decent size, and the staff is usually friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: jwgmi
Reviews.Content: Booked on Hotwire. Was hoping for The Westin or Marriot Marquis but got the Millenium for $259 + tax. Fri and Sat nites June 2nd and 3rd. Was very satisfied with the hotel. Friendly staff, easy check-in. Perfect location for shows, sightseeing, shopping, subway, etc. Room was fine. Not too small with queen bed on 35th floor. Comfortable bed, no real view to speak of but very quiet. Bathroom was quite large, marble floors, granite countertops. Great water pressure in shower. Large full size tub. TV was adequate, but an older CRT. Hotel is listed as four star, probably because of the amenities offered (business center, gym, restaurant,) however in terms of its ambiance I'd rate it 3.5 at best.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel by Times Square”
Reviews.Author: carameliz
Reviews.Content: Although I prefer lower Manhatten, my husband and I decided to take a spontaneous trip to NYC over memorial day weekend, and found the location of this hotel and the price somewhat affordable. When we arrived, they told us we were to check-in down the hall in the Premier section of the hotel. We didn't book anything special, so I'm not sure what was going on there. Maybe the other side was full. Either way, our room was great! It was very clean with modern style. My only complaints were that we reserved a king and got a double, and there was only a view of a brick wall. Otherwise, it had nice furniture, and a nice sized bathroom. It was the nicest room I've stayed in in NYC. If you haven't been to NYC or simply enjoy being near the hustle and bustle, as well as good shooping at Macy's, this hotel is ideal. It literally took maybe 2-3 minutes to reach time square, less than a block. Macy's was probably 2 blocks. The nearest subways were 2-3 blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay ”
Reviews.Author: northnash
Reviews.Content: We spent May 18-20 at the Millennium Hotel Broadway. The room was large by NYC standards and was nice. The bathroom was fantastic in regards to counter space. The shower head needs to be replaced as the water was more of a trickle than a shower. We had a corner room with large windows affording us a great view of Times Square. The room was smartly furnished and the bed was comfortable. I would definitely recommend the Millennium to those who want to be in the Times Square area.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fivestarr68
Reviews.Content: I called this hotel two weeks before arriving and confirmed with the customer service rep that I could get a room with two double beds. I was told after being put on hold for 5-10 mins that I would be given this room, but not to expect it in the future as there are few dbl dbl rooms. I took the name of the rep and felt confident that all would be OK. When I arrived at the hotel (paid 45/night for parking, plus service fees, tips) I was told that they could not provide the room requested. I argued with the manager for 45 minutes before getting a room that I was told they did not have and would be bumping someone else out (trying to make me take responsibility for their mistake). This whole time I was treated as if I had lied about the confirmed call weeks prior...there was no record of my request. The hotel looked a tired, poor water pressure, terrible sheets. Staff were less than helpful to say the least, the exception being the room attendent. Even though I paid only $290/night...I would not stay again if it were offered free. I have stayed at dozens of NYC hotels and have had better experiences at all...this is one to skip!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but rooms are a bit run down”
Reviews.Author: like2travelWa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a GREAT location! I booked it through Expedia for $300/night. My room was a bit run down. A few comments - 1. The bed was extremely hard/flat, but after a day of running around town, you won't care. 2. The bathroom did have granite countertop ... maybe the best part of the room?? 3. Internet cost money. What am I thinking??? It is NYC afterall. 4. Make sure that you call in advance to "request" a room with a view and then make sure you call again the day before just to make sure that the request went through. 5. Don't use the ticket people in the hotel for shows/plays. They charge you at least 2x if not 3x as much for tickets. 6. Do use the concierge for restaurant recommendations. 7. The show 'Altar Boyz' was comedic & worth seeing. There are a bunch of restaurants. The two that I ate at were exceptional (and not too pricey either). 1. Triomphe (try the scallop in truffle sauce, garden salad, and lamb - very delicious). 2. Balthazar (lamb dish is AMAZING! bread is delicious too).

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: evvtraveler
Reviews.Content: The Millennium Broadway Hotel, towering 52 floors is centrally located in Times Square, just steps away from many Broadway theaters, tourist attractions, great shopping and dining options. I stayed in a superior room on the 50th floor which offered superb views of Times Square. The room was quite large, decorated in modern dÃ©cor, with a king size bed and nice bathroom. The hotel was kept very clean and the staff was very helpful. The lobby was a lot smaller than the lobby at the Marriott Marquis just across the street and was quite dark. The hotel restaurant was very nice but expensive and the room service menu did not offer a lot of options at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic holiday helped by great hotel facilities”
Reviews.Author: jaxx11
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 38th floor in a superior room and it was fantastic. Fair enough the hotel may not be the 'coolest' - not like Dream or Night (try the Ava Lounge at Dream for great cocktails and views down to Time Square) - but it had everything we needed. We were apprehensive about the room size as we had heard that NYC hotel rooms were tight but when we opened the door to the room we were bowled over - it was huge, had a great view of Time Square, the bathtroom was nice, lots of storage and the mattress was sooooo comfy (wanted to take it home with me!). Room was kept clean and the staff we talked to were all very friendly. The hotel may be a bit more business than tourist and I think the facilities reflect that in a good way - the gym was fantastic. I am always apprehensive when a hotel says it has a 'fully equipt' gym and you turn up to find just a bike and one treadmill, the Millennium's had four treadmills, four cross trainers, a stepper, seperate weights room, showers/changing facilities and lockers. Two things to remember - make sure the air con is on as the place heats up quickly and don't expect to get on a machine at 6.30 a.m. without a queue. Americans like to do their workouts before heading to work. Didn't eat in the hotel restaurant but did have room service one morning while the other half went to watch the Celitc Rangers game at a stupidly early hour and the food was great, not that much more expensive than the menu downstairs. There is a good diner however just a street back from the hotel called the Brooklyn Dinner. Time Square is a great place to be located as you are slam bam in the middle of everything, however, there was a couple of occassions when I wished I had stayed downtown as, after a day pounding the streets, the last thing I wanted to do was fight against the throngs of tourists in the square to get to my hotel. If you like running I would recommend taking a jog in Central Park - just 10 minutes run away from the hotel. We thought 'do as New Yorkers do' and did a loop of the park and it was great, you don't run out of things to look at. We never had any problems while staying in the hotel. It was clean, comfortable and we felt good value for what you got. Just don't expect DJs to be spinning the top tunes at the weekend like you might find in other hotels in the city. I would however recommend trying to ensure you get a renovated room in the tower so that you don't encounter any of the problems other guests have said they have faced in the hotel. Would definately recommend this hotel if you are looking for something that isn't 'hip' but that ticks all the right boxes like comfort, cleanliness, proximity to attractions etc ...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel except for two small irritations”
Reviews.Author: TexasandMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: Great location!! Near Broadway shows and all the tourist spots up and down Broadway. Only two little irritations: The bedframe sticks out more than the mattress, so be careful you don't run into it with your feet and toes when you first walk into the room. The showerhead and water pressure is horrible!!! It is very hard to get the body entirely wet at one time, just above a trickle is all you will get from this shower, and removing the showerhead is useless. Otherwise, great location, great staff, and great price for the heart of Time Square. Would go back again and again!! Anyone who loves home cooking and BBQ MUST eat at Virgil's BBQ just across the street from the hotel. Awesome BBQ (and we are Texans, home of some of the best BBQ in America!) where we get the best BBQ Brisket in America) anyone who loves BBQ needs to eat at Virgils Home Cooking and BBQ, great service, great portions and not a bad price for NYC! Overall, the hotel is great and the location is the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Good midtown option”
Reviews.Author: ACFToronto
Reviews.Content: As a frequent visitor to NYC, I would recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a safe, clean hotel in midtown. The hotel is quite large (52 floors), so checking in-out/ retrieving your car can take some time, especially on weekends. Parking is on the pricing side - $45 per night. Most hotels, eg. Sofitel, charge around $30 per 24 hrs. Tip: one can request a room on a higher floor with views of Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MariaTheresa
Reviews.Content: It is so rare that a hotel room, even the most expensive one, is actually quiet, but my room at the Millenium was blissfully quiet. No sounds of elevators, slamming doors, the tv next door -- nothing. On the 26th floor, behind double-glass windows, even the sounds of Times Square traffic were almost inaudible. The beds were firm, but I love that so I slept beautifully. And the staff was friendly and immensely helpful. I loved this place. By the way, the Airlink Shuttle serves this hotel, and it's a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “We Enjoyed a Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: celusnek
Reviews.Content: On our way to Europe, we planned a quick one-night stay in Manhattan. We booked through a special on Travel Zoo for $200/night. We arrived about 3pm on Saturday, March 31, 2007. The lobby is impressive and there are doors to both 44th and 45th Streets. The front desk staff promptly greeted us and gave us a corner room on the 45th floor. The dÃ©cor is contemporary and chic. The bed was pilled with fluffy and down pillows, and made up with good quality sheets and a very soft, warm blanket. The bathroom is updated, had nice shampoo, lotion, etc., and average towels and provided very complete coffee/ tea supplies. We hated to leave the room but also wanted to hit the streets. There are several good Irish Pub/Restaurants on 44th Street; also the Cranberry Deli is a good place to get bagels for breakfast. The hotel is steps from the chaos of Time Square, Half Price TKT Office and most theaters. Our flight on Sunday was not until 9pm, so we asked about late check-out. They offered until 1pm for free and until 5pm for $100. However, they kept our bags and were nice enough to offer the restroom in the gym to freshen up before going to the airport. There was a shower (but no hairdryer). It worked out fine for us and was free of charge. We walked over to the Times Square station to catch the E train to JFK, it costs $7 each and takes about an hour. There must be a better way then the route we took, ask a local for advice because we had to walk at least a mile underground to the E train platform. The Millennium Hotel was a great place to stay during our 24-hour visit to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: SALAMI1
Reviews.Content: We (mother and teenage daughter) have just returned from a five night stay at the Millenium Broadway. We booked thru' Travelzoo and as requested got a twin bedded superior room on a non smoking floor. We were on the 46th floor! Elevators were efficient except on the day prior to leaving their was a faulty alarm somewhere and the elevators were not working so we walked down (only took 10 minutes!). Staff very helpful, check in and check out were quick and they allowed us to keep our room for 2 hours without charge AND offered us the free use of a fitness room for showering, freshening up. Beds were very comfortable, shower was 'so so' but everything worked ok. No fridge in room, only a minibar, that could be annoying in the summer. Really good deli across the road and lots of restaurants to choose from. Didnt need to eat in the hotel.A big bonus about its location is that it is right in Times Square so you can go down to watch Good Morning America being filmed live in a minute from your room! The theatres are also very close by as is the TKTS booth.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: icechik74
Reviews.Content: There's not much more to add that hasn't been covered. I just wanted to chime in and say that I love this hotel. I've stayed here a few times when I've travelled up to NYC. The location is perfect, staff is top-notch and the comfy rooms are clean, with great modern decor. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK but great location”
Reviews.Author: Mrs Carr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millennium Broadway for 3 nights in March 07. The hotel has a fantastic location just off Times Square and the connections to the rest of the city are good. The hotel staff was friendly and always joking but the decor was a let down. They have been refurbishing the rooms for some time and I was unlucky enough to get one of the older rooms. The furniture (desperately) needs updating, the carpet is old and even our toiled didn't flush properly. All in all OK but nothing great.

Reviews.Title: “A Holiday Inn with a great looking lobby”
Reviews.Author: Cheledonna
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here with my niece for her 14th birthday. Was told it's a luxury hotel - the only thing of luxury is the lobby. The rooms are TINY, the beds are ROCK HARD, no blankets, only a scratchy burlap bedspread. The first room they sent us to had a sink that was mildewed and filthy. Turn down service at request was never honored. Snappy and curt check-ins.... no orientation to the hotel. business center is dated as is the room decor. Concierge was wonderful and helpful - highlight and location for theatre is the best. But the service was below average and ditto the rooms....and the staff couldn't care less about guest satisfaction.. And we paid $319 a night for two twin beds... UGH!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: shbaker
Reviews.Content: Just completed a stay at the Millennium. I have stayed there about 3 or 4 times in the past year and have had a great time on every trip. The rooms are large (via NYC standards), the hotel is clean, and you can't beat the location. I found the hotel staff to be very friendly and helpful. The rooms that I have had are clean and everything was in working order (seems to be more a rarity these days at other hotels). I love to walk the city and this hotel fits that perfectly. It's right in Times Square, near the theaters, subway, etc... I've stayed in several other places but I return to here every time.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: cj_minneapolis
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel for work, which is the only reason I have to return there. It is way overpriced for what you get, and the rooms rae becoming more worn and outdated all the time. The lobby is non-existent, and the restaurant is overpriced and average. The staff are typically not helpful. There can also be very long check-in lines, as the check-in desk only has one or two people working at a time. If you arrive late, they try to stick you in a room with two single beds - very lame. The only redeeming thing is it is centrally located. But there are lots of other hotels in the area that are both less expensive, more modern, and much nicer. Go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, Clean & GREAT Location”
Reviews.Author: Zelphiakat
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel March 16- March 19. This is my second stay at this hotel. Location, Location, Location! This place has it in spades. You could even see part of time square from our room on the 48th floor. It is so close and in such a great spot it is easy to pop in during the day and get right back out to activities. Also, there is a drug store less than a block away, and a deli across the street for quick eats, or bottles of water and soda. Check In: Although I see someone stayed there the exact same time as I did, we didn't have any trouble. I had made the booking in my name, but my friend who was staying with me, was going to be there hours before me. I had put her name on the reservation, and she had no trouble what so ever checking us in. When I arrived (many hours later due to the snow storm blanketing the northeast that night) I was able to get my key and head up to the room. The Room: The room was nice. A bit more posh that the last time. I believe the difference between a regular room on my last visit and this visit was a flat screen tv and designer floor to ceiling headboard for the 2 beds. We were on the 48th floor, and you could see part of times square ( The Hard Rock Cafe & Bubba Gump restaurant) as well as the river! The beds were quite comfortable. The sheets were fine. There are a number of pillows to choose from when sleeping. The bed does come made just with a sheet and coverlet, but there was another actual blanket in the closet I used. The room had a leather lounge chair which was nice. The rooms are very quiet, the only noise we heard much of was some wind rushing around the building. The curtains are blackout curtains, so it can be completely dark, or you can have the times square lights flashing you to sleep if you like. The bathrooms are large, with the rounded shower bar to allow more room in the shower. The shower did drain slow and the toilet seemed to not like to flush. Although not backing up really, although we didn't complain, so clearly it wasn't that bad. We did ask for more towels as it comes with just 3 large towels, we asked at the front desk to send up 1 more while we went out for the evening, and they brought us a whole set including wash clothes and hand towels. Safety: In the evening, they had someone checking to make sure you were a guest to get into the hotel. They didn't do this in September 2006 when I was there, so it was a nice added measure of security. Check Out: My friend and I split the bill half way and they gave us no trouble with that. We left our bags with the bell hop with no problems. When we came back to get our bags, they were very helpful. My friend was flying out of JFK, and when they went to get her a cab, they offered her a hired car, for $59 including taxes and tolls. The website quotes a taxi rate of the same to go for "JFK International Airport $45-$60 (metered rate) plus tolls and tip." So, she had an upgraded ride for the cost of the taxi. Overall impressions were excellent. I got an excellent rate with Travelzoo. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, Good Location, Clean Room, Uncomrfotable Bedding”
Reviews.Author: sgw511
Reviews.Content: My wife and I jsut returned from an overnight on St. Patricks Day, 2007. We are frequent visitors to New York City, and this was our first (and probably last) stay at hte Millennium Broadway. When we arrived at 2:00 pm Saturday, the line to check was long, and the staff was in no means rushing to get through the line. The employee took our credit card, and then informaed us our room was not ready, and to see the bell hop to check our bags. I explained we jsut waited for 30 minutes to check in, and asked if we would have to wait again when we returned after their check in time at 4:00 pm. Rudely, he answered Yes, but now we know you;re here. (Who cares?) So then we waited in another 15 or 20 minute line jsut to give our bags to a bell hop, who moved like a snail. Returning at 4:00 pm to get our room, we found the check in line to be 40 or 50 deep, and another 45 minutes of our 24 hour weekend waisted. Follow that with another 30 minutes to get our bags from the slow bell hops, well you get the picture. We finially made it to our room with a view of a brick building. The room was overall clean. The bed was rock hard, and the sheets felt like burlap. No blanket, jsut a sheet and the burlap comforter. The next day upon checkout, calling for a bell-hop to come retirve our bags and store them for a few hours proved fruitless, as the phone was never answered by the bell hop. The staff really made the checkin/out process a hassle when it did not need to be. Also, in our waiting in line for the checkin, their was quite the scene when the clerk in the giftshop chased down a shoplifter, and they have a four letter word infested screaming match in front of all of us. (Nice job by the manager, to let the guests watch his staff scream the f-bomb to a shop lifter in front of a lobby full of guests (with children). The NYPD showed up and had the class to take the screaming shoplifters and clerk to a private area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; no complaints”
Reviews.Author: omh88
