Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriends to this hotel for two nights for his birthday and we loved it. I got a Travelzoo deal for $179 per night--the hotel was worth far more than that. To begin, the side-street locaion off of Times Square is ideal. It put us close to everything we wanted to see, including the Broadways show I planned, but left the sidewalk in front of the door to the hotel quiet. We arrived before checkin, and the man storing baggage rushed as fast as he could to wait on the long line of people storing and picking up luggage. Checkin was simple and the counter staff pleasant. I ended up getting sick during our stay (unrelated) and really appreciated the quiet room, the comfortable bed, and the impeccably clean toilet, which I hugged for one full night. The concierge was helpful, directing us to our theater and to drugstores for Pepto Bismol. Room service was extremely expensive for two poor college students, so we did not partake. The bathroom and the tub itself were both large, the room good-sized, and our 51st floor view amazing. This hotel was definitely a value for $179.

Reviews.Title: “There are so many choices in NY, pass on this one if you expect the best.”
Reviews.Author: JanetinVancouver
Reviews.Content: I spent four days at the Millenium - solely for the pleasure of the location to Times Square and Toys R Us for my children. I would never return to this hotel. The bathrooms in both suites were horrible. Black stuff around the tub, hair on the floor from previous guests and the flourescent lights only made it worse. One shower would not drain the water...gross! Obviously it made me question the cleanliness in the room (which I didn't notice anything offside). The breakfast was not good, however dinner was enjoyed. There are so many choices in NY, pass on this one if you expect the best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence!”
Reviews.Author: JAXGATOR
Reviews.Content: I do not understand the 3 * or even 4 * reviews, some people are impossibel to please. We also got the $179 via travelzoo, for that price the hotel alone is a perfect 5. The hotel itself is beautiful, as well as the rooms. Plasma TV, leather chairs, marble bathroom, huge comfortable bed. What else do you need? Hotel is very clean and cozy. The only negative I can think of is the hotel staff does not go out of their way to please you, but so what? Are you really that needy? The location is excellent if you want to be close to Times Square. Didnt try the restaraunt, bc it was a bit pricey. But do you reall come to NYC to eat at your hotel? It is really just mind-boggling that one of the latest reviewers said he liked the hotel and only gave it 3*. If you want a nice hotel, with huge rooms by NYC standards, that is clean with newer furniture, you have found your place. I will be posting picutres of the room in the NYC forum if anyone wants to see what they look like.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Eggie84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with 3 of my cousins and found the hotel to be ideal for several reasons: the location is great, the check-in/out was quick and easy and the room was clean and well-appointed. I read another review about a discount at [----] and we used that. The rooms (with 2 twin beds each) were only $179--unheard of for NYC. It's a good choice

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: KittyCat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millennium Broadway Hotel February 4 - 7th for a business event. I loved every bit of it! From the in-room fax machine to the miniature sand garden, everything about the hotel was top-notch. There is an older part of the hotel, and then there is the Millennium Tower, which is where I stayed. With only six rooms on each floor, I felt as if I had my own private area of the hotel. The concierge is helpful and polite, and check-in was a breeze. Above all, the view was amazing; I could see the Times Square screen from my room. Loved the flat-panel television set and the sleek furnishings. Around 5PM, a staff person came to my room asking if I'd like turn-down service. Although I didn't use the gym, it was very clean and not crowded. The location is central to theaters, Rockefeller Center, Times Square and the subway. Although you are in the middle of NYC, my room was very quiet and cozy. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Skeptical of Unfavorable Reviews”
Reviews.Author: NYCfanatic
Reviews.Content: As a frequent visitor to New York City, The Millenium Broadway has become my hotel of choice. One incentive is that you can frequently get the travelzoo.com discount here (usually $179/$199 per night for an upgrade to a superior room) even when this rate isn`t posted at the travelzoo website. Either enter "zoo" in the promotion box when booking at milleniumhotels.com or ask for the travelzoo rate when calling Millenium hotels at 866-866-8086. At times when those rates aren`t available, rates are still usually lower than at other 4-star hotels in midtown. I have never experienced anything less than excellent service from the amiable staff, a beautifully appointed spacious, well maintained, contemporary room and bath, and frequently a spectacular view. On my most recent visit, I had reserved a room at the $179 travelzoo rate. I arrived around 10:am and was informed that no superior rooms were available at that time. I opted to take a standard room. The only difference I could find in room quality was that there was no flat screened television or coffee maker. Otherwise it was the same beautiful, immaculate, well appointed room that I`ve always experienced here. A quick phone call and I had a coffee maker (no extra charge) and plush bathrobes (also no extra charge) delivered to my room within 10 minutes. As others have said, the location is superlative. It`s a great mystery to me how others can find fault at this hotel, especially at the amazing rates that can frequently be had here.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid - shabby, terrible service.”
Reviews.Author: ray210
Reviews.Content: I asked for a non-smoking room; all they had when I arrived was a dark and dingy smoking room - I had to wait until the next day to change rooms. On my last night, slipped under my door was a statement saying that I'd charged $16.00 to my room at the hotel's lounge. Turned out it was a mistake on the transcriber's part. No apologist from the front desk, however. The bathroom amenities are horrible; the shampoo and conditioner are low-grade -- make sure to bring your own if you stay here. Also, housekeeping doesn't replace washcloths or bathtub mats. There are no comforters - just this thin maroon blanket that doesn't look very clean. The room was chilly and the thermostat primitive and disfunctional - it turns off late at night. This is a disgusting hotel and I've learned my lesson; there's a certain new (2005 I believe) chain hotel nearby with comparable rates, free food in the evening, and warm staff (it's in the TripAdvisor top 10 for NYC) from which I'll never stray again. Ugh.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Tyma
Reviews.Content: Large bland hotel but spacious rooms and friendly staff. Quiet and in an excellent location. Good conference facilities and excellent rates. All in all excellent value and a safe choice without being a memorable experience

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Staff Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: camelhaircoat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, and the hotel was perfect. The Front Desk was helpful and assisted us with everything. They worked hard to make our visit special and I couldn't thank them enough. They were quick to respond to any request and very polite at all times. We got engaged while we were there and the hotel sent up wine and wrote us cards.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NickJB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights and would highly recommend it. The location was great and the room was comfortable and very clean. While the room was not huge it was bigger than I was expecting after reading other reviews (more than enough for us to lay our cases on the floor and for them to not get in the way). Next time I go back to New York I will definitely be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Away with the Myth!!!”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte_Sigma
Reviews.Content: Away with the myth that you have to pay out of the nose for a great room in Time Square area of Manhattan. As well as the myth that a great room, great service at a great rate does not exist. As for my concern, I thought that these myths were true. This is until I found the Millenniun Hotel Broadway. My stay there was excellent from start to finish. My wife and I arrived via plane at 8am but, as is the case with most hotels in New York, check in isn't until 3pm. So when we arrived at the hotel at 10am we were looking to simply store our bags til check in. To our surprise, we were offered early check in at no additional charge. Furthermore, we were given a choice of rooms. We selected a room on the 46th floor (we knew before hand that certain rooms were newley renovated) that had the most beautiful view of Time Square. The room itself was very modern and of good size for NY. The icing on the cake is that we got this great from for only $158 plus tax (Travelzoo.com). As for the service...GREAT. The staff gladly answered questions, gave direction, made dinning recommendations, arranged transportation and stored our luggage after we check out because we had a afternoon play to attend and an out bound flight at 10pm (did not want to pay for an additional night being that we were leaving at 10pm. Again, we got all that in the heart of Time Square for $158.

Reviews.Title: “Location is only Redeeming Feature”
Reviews.Author: audrocks
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4-night stay. From the outside the hotel is attractive and well-maintained. There was almost always a doorman to obtain a cab. Inside the lobby is nicely appointed in dark marble; it has a very high ceiling but is narrow and, when there are more than a handful of people inside, becomes cramped. We arrived before the 4:00 standard check-in time. There was a line with several guests so we waited about 10 minutes (there was one desk clerk working). One of our rooms was ready and they allowed us to take our bags up and leave them. There was a bellman working but he appeared to be swamped with other guests. Later encounters with the front-desk staff were varied - at times there was no wait and the staff member very courteous and accomodating. At others there were long lines (sometimes with only one or two clerks working) and the staff member curt and dismissive. We found long lines stretching thru the lobby in the mornings and afternoons every day - this seems to be a persistent condition. On our second and third days into our stay my wife left voice messages for the front-desk manager who never acknowledged or returned them (issue described below). The same is true of the concierge staff which is across the lobby. One gentleman was very helpful in restaurant advice yet another ignored us for a few minutes then gave us reluctant, brief directions to the subway station. We'd requested interconnecting rooms (travelling with 2 children) and the hotel was able to accomodate that. I was pleasantly surprised as I've found it rare this request is honored. We only visited the hotel restaurant, Charlotte, once. I found the food to be very expensive and ordinary. As has been written elsewhere, venture a couple of blocks away from Times Square and you can find much better food at a reasonable price. Our rooms themselves were in the "premium" price-class. They were nicely decorated and we did not see any of the cleanliness issues cited in other reviews. They were a little small but about average for NYC. There weren't allot of extra's - a small bottle of shampoo & conditioner and a bar of soap, 2 small glasses, working television with cable, a phone book, etc. - the basics. The room was to include a coffee maker; there was not one in the room but I called down and one was brought up within an hour. Heed the warnings in the other postings regarding the in-room refreshments. There's apparently some kind of light-sensor that can tell if you even lift a candy-bar up out of the drawer. There were individual temperature controls; one room worked well in heating & cooling but the other did not with the cooling not working well. The windows will open slightly from the bottom allowing some outside air in. Our room was on the 35'th floor facing roughly south. We couldn't really see anything noteworthy but it was nice to be up high enough to not be boxed in by surrounding buildings. The only issue during the stay was housekeeping. On the third day our rooms were cleaned but there were no towels available (hence the first call to the front desk manager). On the fourth day our room was not cleaned at all and again there were no towels (the second un-returned call to the manager). I found the housekeeper in the hallway and she told me that she had no linens of any kind and everyone was complaining to her. She said she had informed her manager and recommend I do likewise to try to get some towels (no one answered the phone at Househeeping and I went to the concierge desk and they reluctantly helped us get two towels.) I would only recommend this hotel if you absolutely must be at 44'th & Broadway. The location is excellent and within walking distance of most of the theatres and other Times Square attractions. That alone is the only justification for the room-rate at this property. The accomodations are ordinary and service not consistent with a property of this cost and advertised class.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: aim81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over New Year and absolutely loved the place. The rooms are really large with massive windows to look out over Times Square. We were shocked as to how quiet the room was and we were never disturbed by noise in the street or hotel. The location is just prefect if you want to be right in the centre of things â€“ 1 minute walk to Times Square! We would definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: LivingForTravel
Reviews.Content: My husband, our two kids and I just spent Christmas Eve at the Millennium Hotel. I found a deal about a month ago, so the price is not bad. In my reservation, I requested to have a room on the highest floor available, we got a room on the 51st floor. The view was amazing, I could see Empire State building laying in bed, seeing the lights go off on the Empire State Bldg. at midnight sharp was really something. Our room was at the corner, so there were some extra room by the door, perfect for stroller storage. The room itself was spacious enough for the four of us. Nothing short of my expectation. The toilet does run constantly like the other reviewer said, but I didn't hear the noise with the bathroom door closed at night. Staff wasn't very very warm, but one lady did gave my kids cookies on our way out. Overall it was a pleasant stay, and I'll definitely try to find a deal for New Year's Eve. Really can't find a better location than the heart of time square.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: NYCisGreat
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with an even better location! Walk just around the corner and your in the heart of Time Square. Me and my partner arrived there on Christmas Day and were upgraded from a standard room to an exucutive room with a flat screen tv and a great view from the 50th floor (52 floor building) looking out onto the Chrysler Building and down on to 6th Avenue. I dont have a bad word to write about this hotel as i had a fantastic time here and would strongly recommend it to all people looking to stay in the heart of this fabulous city!! This city really never sleeps!!

Reviews.Title: “Tired, expensive and not worth it”
Reviews.Author: sspurr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millennium just because we couldnt find hotels anywhere else just before Christmas. It started badly when I over heard the check-in supervisor tell desk clerks not to let anyone change rooms, not exactly a great customer service impression. The room itself was spacious, but the bed uncomfortable and the sheets were low quality - that felt like a nylon cotton mix and not what I would expect from a four star hotel. By morning my ezcema had flaired up for the first time in years. Neither the hair dryer or telephone worked in the room, and they couldnt/didnt do anything about it. The bathroom still had someone else's hairs all over it. The shower was good and the christmas tree in the lobby nice. However, all in all, just not a great experience for the price. This would be the last choice I would stay in in New York and I now know why they were the only hotel left with any rooms........

Reviews.Title: “New York Virgin, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: A_Bloody_Nice_Bloke
Reviews.Content: Well pior to our 25th Wedding Anniversary cruise, I decided to extend the hoilday by 3 days and visit New York. Whenever you visit somewhere new you always wish to stay in a location which is the centre and everything else revolves around it or is in close proximity. From this point of view The Millenium Broadway will not disappoint! Times Square lived up to and surpassed every expectation, a vibrant and restless hub on an ill at ease island that wrestles with numerous conflicts in recent history, yet glorifies in it's diversity. An ideal base to explore the tentacles of Manhatten however from reading a number of reviews I take it I didn't pay bottom $ for our room that was situtaed 40+ floors above terra firma and therefore being British (a race that doesn't complain) we experienced minor niggles: a. Suggest you don't use the Consigne service, little benefit, Tourist buses, you pay the commission to teh desk, they give you a voucher to buy a ticket from the buses office. What's all that about? b. Broadway tickets are top $ and they are not available until after 2:00pm on the day of the performance. Why not just go to the discount ticket office? c. Staff are keen to clean your rooms after 9:30 am, why? d. On the day of checking out which has to be done before noon why do they deactivate your access card prior to 8:00am when you are denied access to their modest gym? Don't get me wrong, a satisfactory hotel within the location however , like many others I have visited throughout the world I think they do trade on this. In conclusion would I recommend this to first time travelllers to NYC? Yes Would I return to this hotel? No, NYC is a small place and once you have had the benefit of your first visit you would trade down and get to know NYC more initimately.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: beccx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millenium Broadway back in August this year. It was our first time in New York and this hotel helped to make our trip into one which we will never forget. We had a room on the 42nd floor with an amazing view out onto the Chrylser Building. The room was very nice indeed, clean and modern. We ate breakfast in the hotel a number of times and although a little pricey the food was very good indeed. We also drank in the bar on a number of occasions and really enjoyed the cocktails. The location of the hotel can't be faulted, right on Times Square -the perfect location for our first time in New York. When we go back to New York I think we'd like to stay in a different area so maybe wouldn't stay here again but I would highly recommend the Millenium to anyone wanting to stay in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Dated drama in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Bondgirl70
Reviews.Content: Having grown up in NY, friends, business acquaintances and relatives always ask me if I can recommend a good hotel in the Big Apple. While I haven't had the pleasure of staying in all that many as a "tourist" I have stayed in a number over the years for business events, late work hours or special family visits, so that I wouldn't have to leave the city for my home in the suburbs. On occasion I've been pleasantly surprised at the stylish oasis available in a very gritty city. Some have been hip and well serviced, (W Hotels) and some have seen better days but still maintain their grand dame demeanor (the Waldorf). However, some are so incredibly bad, that it saddens me to think how people get ripped off because its all they can afford. In November, I had to stay overnite to attend a company event. While the event went well and was serviced by professionals, the hotel has seen better days. The good news is that everyone I dealt with, at the front desk, bellman, and waitstaff, were all kind and did their best to make me happy. The room however and the meeting rooms were trashed. Apparently this older hotel has been renovated recently and the room did look somewhat modern, but for over $350 a nite, there was no excuse for foul body smell that permeated the room, the hair caught in the tub, or the cheap linens on the bed. The bed was the most horrible I've seen in ANY hotel, hard, with linens that didn't fit or blankets that looked like it was a leftover from a bad 1970's movie. The furniture was chipped and the curtains looked torn. After being in Canada only last week for a vacation and having a great experience staying in a Sofitel Hotel, the Millenium was a major letdown in the city I love.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: Voudre
Reviews.Content: Would reccomend this hotel if you want to be in the midst of the Time Square area and are seeking a clean, modern, safe facility and, most importantly, a high rise city view - it has up to 50+ flrs w/views facing all directions. The rooms were clean, fixtures & furnishings were modern & in relatively good condition. Room service food was very, very good- everything arrived hot, too. Only problem with it was that it stops at 11:30pm. The staff were friendly & helpful. There's not much going on when you enter- 1 small shop & 1 restaurant but the interior is spacious & NY chic. The structure is longer than it is wide - it ran the entire length of 1 city block. Its exterior is nondescript & one can easily pass it by & not realize its the entrance to a large hotel. The hotel is on West 44th street which is a narrow, slightly dingy side street off Times Square but its safe and literally just a few feet from the bustle & high traffic of the Square. I felt safe walking back alone at night plus there was always a bevy of well-dressed , courteous, gentlemen staff built like linebackers monitoring the entrance. Also there was always an alert, attentive valet outside. I stayed in a double, non-smoking room on the 31st flr facing south. I would recomnend a higher flr for a better view. The fitness center was OK, just a a little too tight in space, w/ only the most basic amenities- 1 refreshment vending machine, 3 tvs overhead the treadmills & 1 flr to ceiling window w/not agreat view. Overall ,this was a good hotel. PS. I consider this a 3 star establishment & would look hard for a low rate as paying anything above $180 for this hotel would be highway robbery. I went through PRICELINE.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but nothing spectacular.”
Reviews.Author: Kimmer1
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at this hotel for 4 nights (Nov. 19-22) using a discounted rate through Travelzoo. We paid $159 for 3 nights with the last night costing I think $299. Obviously at this time of year during the week of Thanksgiving, the rates are going to be higher than usual. We had a "superior" room with a king sized bed on the 39th floor (room 3904) which was "ok". The superior rooms are supposed to be newly renovated, on higher floors, and with more of a view, I guess, than their standard rooms. I couldn't really tell that the room was newly renovated. The furnishings looked ok, but the color scheme and decor didn't look very updated. The carpet also didn't appear to me to be very new. The "view" was so-so (see pictures). We had a partial view of Times Square and a "full view" of some building under construction across the street. From the pictures on their website, I was expecting a flat panel tv set. However, we just had an average set in our room. Also, if you like coffee, you're on your own. I guess you could order room service, but there is no coffee maker in the room. Checkout is a 12:00 and you can try to request a late checkout by calling the front desk. They allowed us to check out at 1:00 pm. This was nice since we were going to try to go see the Macy's Thanksgiving Day parade. We went to the parade and ended up coming back to the hotel during the middle of it since it started to rain. We were able to partially open the windows in our room to see a somewhat obstructed view of the parade as it passed by. I wouldn't recommend this particular room though specifically for viewing the parade. There are much better views at other hotels along the parade route. As for breakfast, I would recommend the Pigalle cafe which is located nearby at 790 8th ave [----]. The food was good and reasonably priced. We never tried the restaurant in the hotel lobby as the prices looked too expensive ($9 per egg, as opposed to $2 per egg at Pigalle). As for other restaurants, there were so many places to choose from that we didn't know where to begin. We asked the concierge for recommendations for nearby restaurants, and we went to one of his picks for Chinese. Bad choice. I can't remember the name now, but it was horrible! There is supposed to be a good barbecue restaurant right there on the same street as the hotel, but being from the south, we wanted to try something different. We also ended up going to Lombardi's pizzeria on Spring St (need to take subway), just for the history and experience. It was not too bad, but not outstanding. Overall, I would give this hotel a 3 star rating (or maybe a 3.5). We stayed at the Broadway Crowne Plaza the last time we stayed in New York, and I thought it was much nicer. The rates were too inflated for the Crowne at this time of year, so we opted for the deal we got at the Millennium. It was decent, centrally located, and relatively quiet., but it was not spectacular or luxurious in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: quindad
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an impressive stay at this hotel. Hotel prices, in NYC, are notoriously steep during the Fall and Holiday season, so we weren`t hopeful about finding anything decent for under $200. Imagine our surprise to find Travelzoo offering this hotel with an upgrade to a superior room for a remarkable $159. The same room through the hotel website and through various so called "discount" travel sites was $399. Needless to say, we jumped at this opportunity and couldn`t have been happier with the results. We arrived in the beautiful marble, art deco lobby 4 hours before check in time, but the efficient and friendly front desk staff had a room ready for us. The elevator literally whisked us up to our room on the 49th floor. We gasped when we entered to find a corner room with floor to ceiling windows (meeting at the corner) with drop dead gorgeous views of midtown, Times Square and the Hudson River. There was 3rd window, as well, with equally stunning views. As if that weren`t enough, the room and bath were beautiful, immaculately maintained, and tastefully decorated with subtle Asian touches and provocative lighting. There was a flat screened TV, coffee maker, iron, ironing board, daily newspaper, abundant towels and bath amenities and a minibar. The king bed was firm and extrememly comfortable and everything was very quiet.....not a bit of street noise. Our request for bathrobes had someone from housekeeping knocking on our door, with 2 luxurious robes, within 5 minutes of the request. All the staff here is amiable and helpful. We met friends who were staying at a nearby, well known, but shabby hotel at nearly twice what we paid. We sensed their envy when they stopped by to visit. This was an exceptional hotel experience....not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “A typical four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jedasa
Reviews.Content: Millennium Broadway is a typical four star hotel. The lobby and location is excellent (50 meters from Times Square). The rooms are very good and clean. The service is ok. We can strongly recommend this hotel for travellers who are looking for a good stay at a great location.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay at Millennium”
Reviews.Author: Readeo
Reviews.Content: Very nice room, great location to Times-Square & theaters and yet quiet. Excellent service. Room service expensive and steak overcooked. Room and bath were very nice; a fabulous value for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “The Millennium is the Cream of the Crop, definitely stay here”
Reviews.Author: smartie3838
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the Millennium. The staff was pleasant and extremely helpful. The hotel was so clean, the room was beautiful and also extremely clean. I will stay here every time I visit New York City. My boyfriend and I had a lovely experience and will definitely be returning. If your going to NYC this is the hotel you want to stay at. Although we were only there for one night, I didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Millennium”
Reviews.Author: OntheRoad_Warriors
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millennium during fashion week, unintentionally. Once we got into the Times Square area all of the roads leading to the hotel were blocked and we had to walk two blocks with our luggage to the hotel. However, once we got inside we were very pleased. We stayed in a superior room near the top of the hotel and everything was very clean and neat, from the bathroom to the bed. We ate at the hotel restaurant for dinner and were pleased by the excellent food and great service. They even through in a free serving of shrimp cocktail. The hotel is walking distance to the shopping and nightlife in Times Square. Itâ€™s also a quick subway ride to Soho. Iâ€™m definitely a picky traveler and the Millennium met my needs. I will stay there on my next trip to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: Artie_Stevens
Reviews.Content: When I booked the hotel I was concerned about the price, but you pay to be somewhere like Times Square and at the end of the day this hotel was great value and great location. Right at Times Square, right in the heart of Broadway, right in the Midtown of the most exciting city I have ever been in. The service was absolutely first class and I loved the friendliness of even the bell staff. Once they realised we were Aussies it was always "G'day", and we felt right at home. The room was fabulous, great view of the Chrysler building from the 30th floor. Would recommend this to anyone coming to New York City.

Reviews.Title: “location. location. location”
Reviews.Author: nailparlour
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd stay at the millennium. Didn't get off to a good start, our room was dingy and smelt of stale smoke. We got relocated to the 50th floor which was a corner suite, this included complimentary bottle of wine and fruit basket. The view was just awesome. Used the concerige to book a broadway show and felt that their commission was extremely high. Fantastic little restaurant across the street. Really convenient to Times Square, Port Authortiy.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: NMarie
Reviews.Content: I booked through Hotwire for a decent - for NYC - $220. If you're seeing a show or just want to live up the chaos of Midtown, the Times Square location is ideal. We are more neighborhood dwellers and spent most of our time on the Upper East Side and around Central Park. Still, our location worked. The subway was easily accessible and cabs, of course, are abundant. When we returned every night, the streets around the hotel were still really alive which we loved, but a person worried about noise should take note. The rooms were average and a bit outdated, but clean and comfortable. It gives the impression of a tour group hotel - basic, but accomodating. The fitness facility was outstanding and the staff friendly and very helpful. Overall, if you're looking for a place to sleep, book it. If you're looking for luxury, look to Central Park South.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: GRAVY23
Reviews.Content: Just returned from weekend in NYC (th-sun) and loved our stay at Broadway Millenium. Booked travelzoo King superior and that is what I got. A King room on 36th floor overlooking Times square. The views were great and the room was updated and cleaned daily. Bed was firm but comfortable and bathroom was nice and clean. Local TV reception was a problem, but cable were channels clear. Did not use any service or eat in Hotel, but all staff we encountered were helpful. Great location just off of Times Square and close to many good places to eat. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice!”
Reviews.Author: jbintexas
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Millennium Broadway for a long weekend in late Sept. We booked a $279 per night Club level rate thru Travelzoo. It included access to the club level for breakfast and happy hour which was well worth it. Best: Location was perfect for times square, subway, theaters. restaurants. Room was renovated with asian theme, flat screen tv, free internet access, and corner room on 40th floor. Club access was perfect. Breakfast buffet had many choices and happy hour had snacks and free beer & wine. Late checkout with no problems. Worst: Housekeeping always forgot something each day - hand towels, coffee for coffemaker( call front desk to have it delivered), toilet paper, etc.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: roggi
Reviews.Content: Have been to NYC previously and this is the best location for exploring the ciy. The Room was very spacious with a seperate dressing area leading to a decent sized bathroom ( much bigger than the Waldorf), large comfy bed ( a little on the fim side) beware the mini bar, it automatically charges as soon as you lift a product, even if you don't use it. Only grumble was we wanted to hit the city as soon as possible and it took a while to get our luggage, concierge insisted on bringing it to our room even though we wanted to carry it our selves. All in all a great base from which to explore. Did not use the hotel bar or restaurant as lots of restaurants & bars located nearby, head in the opposite direction to times square for fantastic food at realistic prices.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for price...location is fabulous”
Reviews.Author: AmelieG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for on night during the summer and it was very nice. The hotel room and the bathroom were quite spacious. Bathroom was marble and granite. The bed comforter was a nice, soft down type. The location was perfect being about 200 steps from Time Square. My one complaint is that there was an odd odor to the room. It had a chemical/cleaning solution/new plastic type of smell that burned my nose. I don't know if this is a problem with every room and if I were staying for more than one night I would have asked to change rooms. The odor did not bother my husband at all. All in all, a very good stay and I would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Millennium was ok”
Reviews.Author: burke140
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the premiere tower which has it's own check in/out desk and seperate elevators. The room was nice but smaller then what we expected. The bed was an oversized double or a queen when we expected a king. The desk staff was great, though, and staying in the premiere tower gave us a free daily cocktail hour from 5-7. The location was great being close to times square yet just far enough not to be in all the madness.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: fairybasslet
Reviews.Content: Warm welcome but unfortunately we had two room changes - first as we had two single beds (we had requested two queens), not quite enough space for a family of 4 (3 year old and 8.5 month old). Then we were given a gorgeous, newly renovated room but unfortunately it wasn't big enough for both a cot and a rollaway bed for our kids. Finally we got a slightly more worn room but with plenty of space for us all. After that the only complaint was that my husband had quite a bit of trouble with the internet access but aside from that everything was great - fantastic location just off Times Square, and the front desk staff totally fawned over our kids. Oh, and one other thing, we managed to leave quite a few important belongings in the hotel and there was no problem at all getting the stuff shipped to us - very efficient and professional as you would expect.

Reviews.Title: “Beware. Give you wrong kind of bed and smoking room.”
Reviews.Author: ThichDiChoi
Reviews.Content: Very bad service from front desk when we specifically booked for a non smoke, king size bed. We arrived around noon and they said the room is not ready and asked us to comeback later around 4:00 PM. We confirmed again for the non-smoke room with king size bed and they said no problem. When we came back at 6:00 PM they told us there is no more king size bed and insist that we take the queen since they have no more king bed. The queen bed room are heavily smell with smoke. They switch us to another room with two twin size bed but we still smell the cigarates. They sent us an air cleaner machine but the equipment did not work and all broken. The person who install it did not know what to do. He told us the room used to be smoking room. They told us that is the only things they can do. I booked for 4 nights and decide to check out the 2nd day to Doubletree Suite in Timesquare. Much better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price, but....”
Reviews.Author: rockies
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Aug 25 & 26 after booking through TravelZoo for $179 per night. The hotel is in a great location and I was very satisfied with the room and bathroom ( plenty of room for 2 people), but the hotel seems to subscribe to the "buyer beware" theory. Their website states that the rooms have coffee makers - none in sight. I also went to 3 different floors for ice - none of the ice machines worked, leaving you to call guest services and throw out a tip for a bucket of ice. The TV reception was spotty at best. Had a great time, and would return for the same price. If you are a piano bar fan, definitely check out Don't Tell Mamma on 46th Street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Highly Recommend.”
Reviews.Author: StephenB916
Reviews.Content: The Millennium Broadway Hotel in New York is a Very Nice Hotel. Location is Perfect, 1/2 block from Times Square, Easy walking distance to Radio City, Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Central Park, Etc. The hotel staff were nice. My room (1 king bed) was spacious and the hotel in general was very clean. The bathroom was marble tile throughout. The view from my room was the Chrysler building (very nice). There were a couple of things I wish were better (No Refrig./Coffee Maker in Room and the Shower Pressure was Low.) But other than that, the hotel is great. I would highly recommend to friends and family and will definitely stay again. One note, on the phone, I requested a king bed smoking room, when I arrived, they originally had me in a non- smoking room with 2 twin beds (who would ever want a room with 2 twin beds?). She was able to get me the King room I requested, but I could see this as a possible problem.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to like - Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lynz001
Reviews.Content: 4 nights in Club room in premier section of hotel. I am a very light sleeper and this is the quietest place I have every stayed. We were on 17th floor. The room had queen bed very comfy, large TV, coffee stuff, couch and chair table, fax machine(did not need) and really nice bathroom with separate shower and tub. Breakfast was included with lots of choice. During the day you can stop for coffee, soft drinks, cookies and use of internet during the day. From 5-7 every evening you can have beer/wine, and snacks, no wait and no line ups and nice cozy lounge with big flat screen tv with new stuff on. At night we came home to turned down bed with chocolates on pillow. The hotel provided nice extra touches - robes, tooth brush, umbrella, safe (worked great). Only problem we encountered was the toilet kept making sound and needed adjusting. The subway lines were all in walking distance and the hotel was close to many sights. We were there for 4 days and used subway 2 of those days. We were hardly ever in the room except to sleep and change. We really enjoyed the pre-theatre drinks in the lounge. We got a great rate on travelzoo. Only negative comments on this board are usually in the other section of hotel. If you can get a room on premier side you will not be dissapointed. This is a great hotel for first time visit. Not you usual everyday hotel has special touches and new age look. We enjoyed very much.

Reviews.Title: “millenium broadway hotel disaster”
Reviews.Author: dutchy 1943
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 night here in Aug. The location was its only plus point. We got a stinky previously smoked in non smoking room,incl. ashtrays,burnmarks on the dirty comforter, .Not all towels are replaced in the morning. 5 VERY importent messages plus 3 also important messages were not given to us. To give this hotel a 4 star rating is a joke. Do not try to talk to personel as they are all overworked and underpaid and couldn't care less judging from their attitude. Except the doormen whom were very helpful and cheery. Check your options before booking this one.

Reviews.Title: “Sanctuary amidst the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: ReadingUK
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from our honeymoon in New York and we had a very pleasant and easy stay at the Millennium Broadway. Not sure if coincidence or deliberate but they were previously notified that it was our honeymoon and we got a room with a king-sized bed. There was plenty of space in the bedroom with room to spare for 2 arm chairs, a coffe table, large desk and a huge TV. The bathroom was ample size, the generous granite surface around the sink very useful for all our tools of vanity. We were on the corner or the 28th floor and the view was great, especially at night with all the lighting from Times Square and adjacent buildings. The staff were always very courteous and polite, particularly the concierge desk who were ever ready to assist us in our many questions about where to go and what to do and how to get there! The location was perfect for us as we intended to go all over Manhattan but wanted a central base. It became a sanctuary for our tired feet and ever expanding waiste lines, the room providing a peaceful retreat from the buzz on the streets. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment here but we had a drink in the bar and it was very relaxing, lights dimmed with chilled music being piped around the room. Without hesitation, we would recommend this hotel to anyone looking at central Manhattan as a location and would gladly go back there again for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Weekend-Golfer
Reviews.Content: My mother and brother stayed this hotel, but it was very disappointing experience. Although they reserved twin bed room in well advance, they were forced to stay one night at a queen bed room!!! So, they asked again and again hotel staff to add an additional bed to that room, but no response from hotel until midnight!!!! I do not recommend to stay this hotel. If you are forced to stay here, be sure to check-in early or reconfirm your reservation in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: WTBROWN
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed in the Millenium Broadway. Both times we found the rooms excellent, large, well air-conditioned and very clean. The bathroom is a nice size, again very clean, tastefully decorated throughout. The service staff did a great job making up the rooms each day. The location is brilliant - literally 2 minutes walk to Times Square, and as a result, we only needed 3 cab rides in a 5 day visit. Its so central you can walk anywhere. Also the access to the rooms is great - 5 express elevators, superfast. The rooms are also very quiet, and the 'blackout' curtains eliminate any chance of any light seeping though from the 'Great White Way'. My only minor points were that we were charged $8 dollars for taking items from the minibar, when we didn't. I wasn't going to get into an argument about $8 when every thing else was so good, but its just a minor niggle. Also our check-in took a little long, but - it was worth waiting for. I heartily recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the broadway area of New York - its top class. W.Brown

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Tropicmd
Reviews.Content: You know, there's something to be said for customer service; which is sorely lacking these days. And it's that lack that prompted me to give 4 stars to the Millenium Broadway instead of 5. I booked a 2 night stay about three weeks ahead of time through [--]. The promotion got me a superior room with king bed. When we arrived at the hotel, we were put into a room with a single queen bed. I called the front desk and they offered to change the room, so we go downstairs from the 36th floor to get the new door card. The second room on the 38th floor not only had a single queen too, but the room reeked of cigarette smoke. Despite the fact that there were signs all over the 38th floor stating that it was designated a non-smoking floor. We called the front desk again and this time they sent up a doorman with a third door key. 3rd time is the charm, right down the hall...finally, a king size bed and a clean non-stinking room. Other than that, the room was quiet for NY city, clean and had great A/C. Plus great views! And the location is fantastic; right at Times Square. All in all, I would stay here again, but there really was no excuse for not having a king bed room available upon our arrival. Especially since we arrived 3 hours after check in time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, fantastic views, fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: citybreakernyc
Reviews.Content: The Millenium Broadway has to be the best choice for a trip to New York. The hotel is located just off Broadway and our room, on the 32nd floor, had the most wonderful views overlooking Times Square. We never needed to use public transport as you can walk everywhere from the hotel but, if you need a cab, the ultra-friendly and efficient concierge will make one appear before your very eyes! I really want to go back to this fantastic city and, when I do, I will definitely be looking up the Millenium Broadway.

Reviews.Title: “location yes......but no 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: lanrod
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent for the hotel. Right in Times Square. Here are some of the issues I had with it this past weekend (7/27 - 7/29/2006. The internet, which is 10.95 per day only worked for 1/2 hour before it went down. I, not the hotel had to get on the phone with technical support to figure out the problem. Come to find out the link went down on my side of the hotel and they didnt have any idea when it would be back up. Hence, no more internet. Issue #2......I called at 9:45pm for room service to order breakfast for the next morning and they said they'd have to call me back because they were taking dinner orders???? I feel this was very unproffessional and someone could have atleast took my order. I ended up calling back at 11pm and finally got someone to assist me. Lastly, The hotel fire alarm went off at 6:15am on my last day, and they asked us to evacuate the building. The alarm wasnt loud enought in my room and we didnt know about the evacuation til the firemen arrived and went over the loud speaker. Times Sq is so congested, you'd be better off at a hotel in either SoHo, Greenwich Village or Uptown near Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experince”
Reviews.Author: TieDy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a thoroughly pleasant stay in nyc. We stayed in the Premier tower. We were fortunate to be able to go up to our rooms before noon. What a treat! The air conditioning was quiet and the room was bright. The room itself had a nice living area with chaise and leather chair. The bathroom was sizeable with a separate tub and shower and plenty of space on granite counter top for toiletries. The towels were thick and soft. The bathroom door was nice and solid. (Our only issue was a slightly musty shower curtain. We called housekeeping who apologized and brought a new curtain up within 10 minutes.) We slept well as the bed was comfortable and the room quite sound-proof. Included is a beautiful continental breakfast on the mezzanine level (hard-boiled eggs, cheeses, meats, melon, berries, juices, coffee, and pastries). Tea at midday and cocktails in the evening is also included. Such a nice spot for a break from seeing the sights or shopping. I would not hesitate to recommend the Millenium to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great but room was looking a little tired in places”
Reviews.Author: Ferryjumper
Reviews.Content: Great location, really great staff, only minor negative comment is that our room was starting to look a little tired.

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly quiet”
Reviews.Author: hwalk
Reviews.Content: all i ever want in new york is a quiet room and internet access. the millenium delivered both easily, despite my fears (fixed line internet - not wireless, and there are definitely some guests who look like they're in NY to party, not do business). But i had a good stay at a fair price (for NY).

Reviews.Title: “Millennium Broadway to the rescue!!”
Reviews.Author: linjudy
Reviews.Content: I had to make an emergency business trip to NYC this week. For some reason, it was EXTREMELY difficult to find a hotel on the day I had to be there. The only rooms that were available were either at 1-star hotels (too scary), or 3-4 star hotels that were charging $600-700 a night for what I know to be tiny closet like rooms. Somehow, my corporate travel agent found a room for $369/night at the Millenium Broadway. I know that might sound like a lot, but trust me, on this particular night, it's CHEAP! I've never stayed at this hotel before, but upon arriving on a red-eye, found the room to be clean, very quiet, very large (by NY standards), and with a great bed. As a bonus, I have a nice view of the Empire State building. The internet connection is only $10, works very fast, and room service was prompt. In short, there's really NOTHING more a business traveller can ask for of a mid-town hotel. I really applaud the Millenium for not gauging travellers just because they can, like all the other NYC hotels seem to do, and charge 2-3x their normal rate just because the city is full. This is a great hotel with great business practice. I will now make it a point to stay at the Millenium even when there's good availability in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Millenium”
Reviews.Author: jimdi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Millenium Broadway, June 16-18. This hotel is in a great location, right across the street from Virgil's Barbecue and next to the Hudson Theater. This is the 3rd time I have stayed at this hotel and each time it gets better. The staff at the hotel went out of their way to make our stay a wonder experience. We had a room on the 50th floor with a great view of Times Square. Everyone was extremely helpful and courteous, and helped make our vacation great. They recommended an Italian restaurant called Carmine's - excellent food with huge portions. The room was newly renovated with comfortable beds (beautiful headboard), huge windows, new carpet, great TV, and, yes, there is a coffee maker in the room. The next time we are in New York City, we will definitely stay at the Millenium again.

Reviews.Title: “Some definite problems here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A comfortable room, but huge problems with the billing. This was a corporate trip, paid for by someone else. They tried to charge me instead, informed me that they needed a credit card authorisation faxed to them to bill the booking party. It took them the better part of a day to get it right and they tried billing me again. Having just been booked back in, I'm now in exactly the same position: having to do their reservation work for them. The man I spoke with simply kept parroting "We have to follow procedures", over and over. Also, their "business centre" is a computer next to the elevator on an upper floor. There's no privacy at all. After this trip, I won't be staying there again. It's a pity, because the Millennium in Minneapolis is a wonderful hotel. Oh, and for $329 per night, a coffee maker in the room would be nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $”
Reviews.Author: SnugglyC
Reviews.Content: The lobby gave me claustrophobia, it's long, narrow and black granite. Our room was not ready when we arrived (1:30 p.m.) but we were able to leave our bags with the hotel. The room was small but had 2 double beds as requested. The reason we stayed here is because the Marriott Marquis was sold out and we wanted to stay in Times Square. The NY Marriott Marquis was so much bigger, brighter etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: WanderingLondon
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel for the Memorial Day weekend (26-29 May, 3 nights) via Priceline at a $150 bid. The location of the hotel cannot be beaten if you want to be in the middle of things. It is yards from Times Square. Unfortunately the crowds there are an inevitable fact of life, particularly if you just need the closest subway station. But it is also easy to go in the other direction to 6th or even 5th Avenue to avoid this, and there are plenty of sights and shops in that direction. We arrived very late (about 12.30 am) because of a delayed flight. The hotel was still expecting us and there was no hassle. Originally, the hotel had allocated our rooms on different floors, but one was quickly moved so that we could be on the same (non-smoking) floor. The rooms are a perfectly adequate size for an NYC hotel. (Compared to the Hudson, for example, they are positively palatial.) Everything worked, including the air conditioning which was easy to control. Some of the furniture - particularly a bedside table - was worn and rickety, but that was the only real downside. Bathroom toiletries were basic, but usable. Housekeeping was cheerful and friendly, and perfectly happy to work around our schedule. A 2 pm late checkout was free of additional charge. Unfortunately, the hotel deactivated our keys early despite this having been arranged, which involved a trip back to reception for each room to have the keys reactivated. And the hotel wanted to see photo ID, which was ironic because it was locked in the safe in the room. But a signature also sufficed. We were offered a hotel car to JFK at $59 including tolls and tip, which I think is competitive with a taxi, as taxi trips are metered not flat rate in this direction - and the hotel car was more comfortable than a taxi. So that was a pleasant end to the trip. I would definitely be happy to be allocated this hotel again. If booking directly, my loyalty is still to the hotel at the United Nations Plaza (now run by the same chain) because of the hardware there - the size of the rooms, their location and outlook, and the facilities. But for a Priceline stay, this was decent value, and it was good to be right in the middle of the Times Square area for a change.

Reviews.Title: “Serene, great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What I look for in a New York hotel is a retreat from the noise and stress of the streets at a reasonable price. I also want an understated, comfortable, and luxurious environment. The Millennium Broadway fullfils this mission for me. I haved stayed in the main tower and the Premier wing and both are terrific. I prefer the views and light in the main tower, but the upgrades such as the cocktail hour compensate. The important assets of a stay at this hotel are that it is very clean, the climate control is quiet and effective, the beds are comfortable, and the decor is refined and soothing. The service is efficient, friendly and unobtrusive. This hotel is a far better value than some competitors such as the DoubleTree Metropolitan. Also, the location is unbeatable., central to everything. I booked my stay last minute for Memorial Day through Expedia and paid on average under $200 a night. A terrific value.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at Millenium Hotel Memorial Day Weekend 2006”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to NYC Memorial Day weekend. We stayed at the Millenium Hotel on the 42nd floor and had an incredible view of Times Square. The room was clean and appeared to have been recently renovated. The size of the room was small but my sister and I did not care as we did not spend much time in the room. The hotel was convenient to shopping and restaurants, walking distance to Times Square, Rockefellar Center, Macy's and Central Park. (Central Park is a jaunt but I like to walk) We ate at the Irish Pub on the backside of the hotel which was nice and had a variety of food. I would recommend making reservations if you wish to eat at Carmine's which is a fine Italian Restaurant within walking distance. We tried to eat there but there was a 21/2 hour wait. We ended up eating at a fine italian restaurant on the same block as the hotel and it was very good. Sorry cannot remember the name.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We decided to go Christmas shopping in New York and booked 3 nights at this hotel. When we arrived we were told their were no smoking rooms available (which pleased me, but not the wife as she smokes 20 a day) Anyway after a little moan, as we had requested one when we booked, they found us a smoking room and to our surprise, it was a junior suite at no extra cost! The location was fantastic, right on Times Square. The only fault was the price of the drinks in the bar! But other than that, I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: CostaMesa_CASandal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 6 nights, traveling by myself from Calif for the first time to NYC. My intention was to see several broadway shows so wanted to stay in Times Square. I chose this hotel because of the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor and I was not disappointed! I stayed on the 39th floor. My room was fine with a king size bed. Though I could hear the sirens from the street when I was awake, the noise in Times Square was not loud enough to keep me from sleeping. The bed was very comfortable, the service at the hotel was perfect! Room service, housekeeping, the check in/out desk, doorman, and the concierge were all so nice, professional, and unbelievable helpful and efficient. And, the location was absolutely perfect, central to everything you want to do and see in NYC. I will definitely return to this hotel along with seeing more broadway shows!

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only thing”
Reviews.Author: Norfolktravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our American holiday. We chose this hotel as a special end to the holiday - what a disappointment! The man on Reception for check-in was very brusque - he wouldn't let me ask any questions, he kept telling me to wait. At all the other hotels we had stayed on our trip, the Bell Boys had offered to take our bags - here we were just ignored, and we took our bags to our rooms ourselves. When we checked out we left our bags in the Store Room until later - it seemed like we were causing them extra work to do this, and they still expected a tip! When we left they just gave us our bags, they didn't offer to take them outside to the limousines. It took 2 days and 3 phone calls to get a TV control sent to the room - without it we couldn't operate the TV. The toilet in one of the rooms overflowed - this also took several phone calls before they did anything. The sink in our bathroom was badly cracked - you had to be very careful because you could have cut yourself. The rooms were small and definitely not 4 star standard. The location is just on Times Square - this is a good thing because it lets you get out of the hotel into a nice area quickly. We definitely wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You're only paying for the great location.”
Reviews.Author: lhs624
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night through Priceline ($165/night). The location was great b.c we were seeing a Broadway show but that's the only reason they can charge as much as they do. Our room was small but not terribly so. The carpet was shabby and there was a cigarette hole in one of the curtains. The bathroom tile needs updating or a really good cleaning as there was mildew stains in the corners of the bathtub/shower. It was only for one night so it was fine but I wouldn't have wanted to stay there for much longer.

Reviews.Title: “Location Can't Be Beat”
Reviews.Author: Wiseguy1
Reviews.Content: I have zero complaints for this hotel. Zip. Nada. Everything about it exceeded my expectations with more ease than walking. First of all, check in was quick as a cricket. The very friendly receptionist got us a room right away. I asked for a high floor...because I love high views...and boom! In a matter of minutes I am riding the elevator up to the 49th floor. Even better, this hotel had a perfect view of Times Square and all the Broadway action. The lobby is very attractive and the rooms are much larger than most New York hotel rooms. All the staff instantaneously attended to our needs every time. But the best part is the location. This hotel is perfectly located because it is right smack in the middle of West Midtown and right next to Times Square...a stone's throw from almost every subway line in the system (Times Square station)...yet not directly IN Times Square (on 44th St between 6th and 7th/Broadway) like the Marriot Marquis or Crowne Plaza, so there is almost no Broadway noise to keep you awake all night. Couldn't ask for any better than that. A cool feature of this hotel is the elevator ride. There are five elevators serving 52 floors...that's one elevator serving every ten floors...yet I NEVER ONCE waited more than 30 seconds for it to arrive. The Marriot Marquis can't say that. This is because the elevators at the Millenium Broadway are rockets. They go so fast that you feel like you're being hijacked...especially when you're on a high foor. Every time you get off your ears will be popping. You can feel the wind blowing in your face as the elevator car descends or ascends. The elevators are a thrill ride. But don't be worried.. they are just quick and perfectly safe. Don't stay at the Marriot Marquis and spend your whole day in the greatest city in the world waiting for an elevator. This hotel is a must-stay. Period.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LGDC
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. Stayed here for the weekend - the service was excellent and this location was great for everyone in our group to walk to all the Broadway plays we had tickets for. I also found a great rate on Travelzoo.

Reviews.Title: “Millinieum Broadway”
Reviews.Author: fkhaven
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 3 night stay at the Millinieum Broadway Hotel in NYC. We were there from May 6-9th. We got the room on Priceline so we got a great deal. From the previous reviews I had read I asked for a renovated room. We got there early so we couldn't check in yet. They held our bags at no charge. When we got back at 4:30 the room was ready however I had requested a king size bed and had gotten two twins. I asked them to see if they had a King size and they made a change for us. We had two rooms so they had to change them both but there was no problem. They were very accomodating. We were put on the 33rd floor in a corner room with a nice view. The room was not renovated yet but I was happy to forego that for the King bed. The room size was plenty big with a nice size closet and a very large bathroom. There was an in room safe, hair dryer and ironing board. The room needed to be updated but it was clean. We slept with a window open every night. You could hear some noise of the city but not enough to keep you awake. This hotel is convenient to everything in Times Square and the Theater District. We walked everywhere and there is a subway entrance 2 blocks away. On W 44th St between 7th and 8th there is a pizza place called John's. It was excellent. Also, several of the restaurants offer specials that are reasonable before theatre.

Reviews.Title: “had a really good time!”
Reviews.Author: HollisGal
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed one night on the Saturday before Easter through a Priceline bid. We were lucky to get a room on one of the upper floors which afforded us a beautiful view, although somewhat obstructed, of Bryant Park. The location was perfect: close to everything, but not on 42nd Street or one of the avenues where pedestrian traffic is a nightmare. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MissVW
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Easter weekend. Got a room on the 32nd Floor overlooking Times Sq. We could hear street noises in our room, but it didn't bother us. Might bother others. We did have to close all the drapes tightly b/c the bright lights did fill up our room! There were a few things I noticed. The walls had some scuff marks here & there. There was something smeared on the bathroom door (what, I don't want to know) and it wasn't cleaned off all weekend. Little bit of mold & mildew in the shower. There was something icky stuck here and there on the curtains & someone had pulled the drapery stick off and left it on the windowsill. The desk chair was kind of beaten up also. Not to mention, the maid took our washcloths and never replaced them. So the room wasn't as spotless as I expected it to be for some of the prices listed. But because we got a nice deal on Travelzoo ($179 per night) and the location was excellent, I would recommend this hotel. The staff were very helpful and friendly, especially the doormen & bellhops. I enjoyed my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: annemb3899
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Millenium last weekend. We had a very nice room on the 47th floor where we had views of Times Square, Gramacy Park, the Hudson River, etc. This room had been renovated and the furniture, rugs, etc. looked new. The service, room and location (just a few steps from Times Square) were all very good. Enjoyed it and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Easter in New York”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at this hotel. The staff were great and my teenage daughter even enjoyed the experience. I have been to N.Y. on several occasions but this is the least amount-$179.00 per night , got it on Travel zoo (-)--- that I have ever paid. It wasn't as posh as the Marriott Marquis but the location was just as good, the bathroom and room were a fair size for ny rooms and as I mentioned earlier you can't beat the price. The room was clean and tidy. If you are looking for the "real looking" fake designer purses the best place to go is Battery park near the World Trade Centre site. The purses sold by the venders on Times Square are the really "fake" fake purses as my daughter named them. We also took the Grey Line Comprehensive Tour of N.Y. It lasted about 8 hours and we found it very informative. One tip--for lunch order the vegetarian meal as that is Mexican. We also went to see Rent which was wonderful! We also went to Canal Street in Chinatown but we really didn't see the charm of it. It was so crowded and again, as my daughter stated, they had the "fake" fake purses and wallets. The trip was great and we can't wait to go again.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic stay at Millennium Broadway”
Reviews.Author: Liz54ar
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at The Millennium Broadway. We were upgraded to a Premium room on the 46th floor with views over Times Square as we were celebrateing our Silver Wedding. The room was lovely, newly decorated and clean. The super king sized bed was very comfortable. The staff were excellent and very helpfull. The location is perfect for all the sights of New York, restaurants and the theatre. We would definately stay there again. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel on 18th March, the day after st patricks day. City is very cold with an icy wind at this time of year, so if you are going at this time take warms jackets and plenty of hats and gloves. Hotel was very nice and we asked to get our room changed from a double to a twin which they done no problem at all. The only downside of that was that we are on the 21st floor, which didnt give a view of times square, as previously our room number would have been on the 39th floor. However, room was nice and cleaned every day with new towels. I would recommend this hotel as it has an excellent location, a hop skip and jump from Times square, so it saves on taxis etc to get round the city. Found a good place for breakfast on Times Square at the Europa Cafe - $7 for 2 coffees and 2 breakfasts - cant beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not the greatest hotel to stay at. Rooms were small and old looking. Airconditioner was only pumping warm air as the hotel still had it set to winter weather. Windows didn't open properly to let fresh (?) air in, in place of the a/c. Nice bathroom but fixtures weren't all working. Only real + was the staff. They were fantastic in all respects.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 4 nights in march and was very pleased with the hotel. the reception staff were very prompt and polite. the concierge staff knew all about the area and could answer any questions. our room was on the 31st floor with a huge floor to ceiling window which looked over times square, at first i was a bit worried this would be too noisey with all the traffic below but that did not bother us at all. the hotel is in an excellant location. our room was cleaned everyday, the hotel has a gym and does not charge for your saftey deposit box in the room. we stored our luggage away for the last day before we had to catch our flight with no problem. new york city is fantastic, we did all the major sights and had an excellent time. most sights are within walking distance (15-20 mins walk from empire state, 20mins central park)or the bell boys will get a taxi for you to reach statue of liberty, and places a bit further away. overall an excellent stay and would definatly choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastUSAWanderer
Reviews.Content: Great location, but service was unexceptional. The hotel was booked and there was only one person checking guests in, so there was a line. My room request (low floor please) was met with rudeness but was eventually made available. There was nothing special about this property. I wouldn't pick it again.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a renovated room!”
Reviews.Author: bouncerville
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Millennium Broadway in February. Our room was very dirty and worn. The wear and tear of the room was so bad that it looked like a room you would expect to see in a hotel that caters to the college spring break crowd. The carpet was stained and worn, the walls were dirty and scuffed, the bedcover was stained and the closet light was broken and hanging from a cord. The bathroom was also extremely dirty. Every bit of the grout between the 1 X 1 tiles on the bathroom floor was blackish-green and crusty and the grout in the shower looked the same. After staying in this room for one night, we went to the front desk and asked if they had a newer or remodeled room. They put us in an updated room, which was better. Still not worth the expensive rates.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Millenium Broadway”
Reviews.Author: karenmargaret
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have just spent a fabulous 6 days in Newyork. After reading mixed reviews about the Millenium Broadway hotel I was really pleased with the service and the room. The location is excellent just next door to Times Square. Will definetly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent who has recently returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. This is an exceptional hotel with a staff to match. The doormen are always ready to help and the bellmen are first rate.......comparable to the best hotels I have stayed in. After a recent hospital stay I had special needs on this trip which were attended to so efficiently and with such kindness. Check-in is a breeze since as soon as one arrives at the desk, one of several desk clerks are ready to help. We were in our room in ten minutes from the time we entered from the street. The lobby is grand in the deco style with tons of polished black marble and a sweeping staircase. Fresh flower arrangements and huge mythologically inspired paintings were stunning and the many elevators are ALWAYS available and the fastest I have ever been in. Maid service was excellent and unbotrusive and the rooms were extremely quiet with unbelieveable skyline views. The concierge desk was always helpful and of course Broadway/Times Square is just around the corner. Taxis were always available. Check-out was simple since a bill was presented at the room door on the morning of departure and I only needed to call the desk to let them know our departure time. A terrific choice for anyone staying in this greatest of cities. Tips: If you are driving, drop off your luggage and drive just across the Queensborough bridge (59th and 1st)to the guarded municipal enclosed deck (bear right after crossing the bridge and look for the signs). There is a subway station right there that will take you back to Times Square and the rate is $11 per day. For the best Italian food try Cascina (9th ave between 45th and 46th) just a few blocks from the hotel. For Greek, the best is Phylos in the East Village. Both are reasonable, exceptional and family owned. If you want to see a great night club drag show a la "Birdcage/Le Cage Aux Folle" you must go to "Lips" in the village. For any questions about this town, feel free to contact me. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: dudelookslikealady
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and 9 month old baby for a conference a couple weeks before christmas. The hotel lobby is really nice, the location is IDEAL- you can walk to 5th Ave, Times Square, Central Park, Macy's, short taxi ride to the Met. The room we got was really small; I think they just upgraded alot of the rooms, but I'm not sure if ours was one of them. We had a corner room, great view of times square, but the bed took up the whole room. THe bathroom was not the best (a little dirty, small, outdated) the closet was broken, and the microfridge was not working. For us, we were mostly out of the room sightseeing, so the room itself wasn't as important; location was. Would stay here again just for the location. Also the cheap ticket booth is right around the corner, and they definitely sell "sold-out" show tickets. Just buy single tickets- you won't sit together, but you probably don't talk to the person you're sitting with during the show anyway. You'll see shows that have been "sold-out" for months if you do it this way! Also, good place for kids since ToysRUs is right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Just About Perfect...”
Reviews.Author: DJTravelBoy
Reviews.Content: Great location and great rooms! I was very pleased with my stay of two nights via a nicely discounted Hotwire room reservation. $150/night plus big NYC taxes.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and Times Square location”
Reviews.Author: roberee
Reviews.Content: I was in NYC for a conference held at the Marriott Marquis but chose to stay here because it was cheaper. The hotel is tucked away on a side street within a few minutes walk to the main street of Times Square. The hotel has a very modern, minimalist lobby and the front desk staff were nice and professional. My room was on a high floor and had good views of Times Square. I had a king bed and it did take up most of the room. The pillows and sheets were comfortable but not luxurious. There was a small desk and a decent size tv. The washroom was clean albeit a little small. The hotel probably accomodates to business travelers more than any other crowd. It's a good value considering the location. If I wanted to stay in a busy area of NYC, I'd chose it again given the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!!”
Reviews.Author: cruisin-the-world
Reviews.Content: Having been to New York the last 4 yrs and stayed in great and really bad, i was nervous about this one. It was fabulous!! Not only are the rooms clean and a good size for New York, the views are good and the elevators are nice and fast!!The location is right off of Times Square and has 2 entrances for convenience. We were there during the big snowstorm and not only were the desk people very helpful but they did not take advantage of the situation and gouge us for having to stay an extra night. I would definitely recommend this to friends and will stay here again! A gem!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend and found the hotel very nice. The room we stayed in was good, clean and tidy. The hotel location though is great if your aiming to be near Times Square we were literally minutes from it. The location cant really be beat though The Marriot and The Crowne Plaza are also only a few minutes from it. I would go back to the Broadway but would also like to try some other hotels too. We went for a 5 day break and personally I think thats enough time to see all/most of the sights. Perhaps if you request it you may be able to get a room with a view of the square but im not sure if there is one? I have to say the Bellmen and the Concierge were the most helpful people in the hotel for directions and were really friendly. P.S. I know its obvious but dont use any other cab part from a yellow one or one that you can see the NYC Taxi and limousine commission medallions. JFK to the Manhattan/the Broadway it should be a $45 flat rate or a bit more if including tolls, It says so in the cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The dinner served in the restaurant on New Years Eve was the best I had in a long time and the service was top notch! The front desk staff is very helpful and we loved our room. I hear the Premier side of the hotel is even better so we will stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: kevie1985
