Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my time in New York and the Millennium Broadway was one of the reasons. The staff are friendly and helpful and the rooms are clean and a decent size. This hotel is in a great location you have got almost everything you need on your doorstep. Just half a block from time square and 42nd street around the corner you have got plenty of shops and places to eat. If you want to get away from the busy city then central park is only a 10 minute walk down time square. This is a good hotel with a great location and for that reason I would stay at the Millennium Broadway when I go back to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Will be looking elsewhere next time”
Reviews.Author: czarinalex
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here a few years ago and had a very pleasant stay. We live in the NYC area and occasionally will stay overnight after a night 'on the town'. Our recent stay at this hotel was disappointing. Our room reeked of smoke although it was on a non-smoking floor. Very average furnishings and rough scratchy sheets. The topper was when we realized in the morning that there was no coffee maker. When we complained to the front desk upon checking out, we were told that some rooms come with coffee makers and some you have to request them. Our other complaints were met with a shrug of the shoulders and an offer to talk to a manager. We declined and left. We'll look elsewhere on our next overnight trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: Redtraveloften
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful,excellent location(1/2 block from times square), staff friendly, room not very up to date and definately will not fit 5 people like some sites say. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, if you like Time Square, but...”
Reviews.Author: CBGWH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millennium Broadway over the holidays. Now keep in mind we were on "The Premier" side of the hotel so maybe that makes a difference. Maybe "Premier" means to them small rooms, so so service and inconsistant information. We were definately not impressed with this hotel (or their "Premier" side) and would not stay there again. Now maybe the main part of the hotel is much better but I still would not take my chances.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and my companion had a very pleasent stay at this hotel over Christmas. We were slightly concerned with the negative reviews but when we arrived all our concerns were gone, gone from mind, body and soul and we were ready to enjoy this fab city. New York was a fantastic experience for myself and my friend. We could relax in our enjoyment and knowing that we were coming back to the comfort of the hotel. We loved our comfy beds and excellent bathroom facilities and would have no hesitation in booking this wonderful hotel again. My friend who is disabled had the time of his life and comes from Longsight in Manchester, the sight of his little face everytime we entered the hotel room was priceless and we loved every minute! Thanks Millennium for our great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: JiminVA
Reviews.Content: Excellent location at Times Square, and a good, clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Christmas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I spent Christmas here ,the hotel was great, close to everything,we were on the 40th floor and could see everything. The rooms were clean and pretty, friendly helpful staff what more could you want? Be sure to try Virgil's BBQ across thew street better than Beale Street

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: pfp4000
Reviews.Content: I took my 82 year old mother, a close friend of hers, and my two sons (ages 8&12) to New York for 4 days the week before Christmas. After much research,I chose the Millennium and was very satisfied with our experience. The location is great, the rooms were on the 46th floor with great views, and the staff was very friendly. Our rooms averaged $349 per night, which by New York standards seemed in line with the location and service. I booked directly with the hotel and explained that the trip was for my mother's first trip to NYC, and they responded with adjoining rooms with great views. If you're planning several nights of theater and dinner, you can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, reasonably good location, secure too.”
Reviews.Author: Frequent-Traveler-PA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for Christmas Eve and Christmas. First, my flight got in early in the AM. They let me check into my room around 10 AM. The room is very nice and clean, nicely appointed decor and furniture. It includes high speed Internet access (requires an Ethernet connection). Far nicer than the Hilton hotels I have stayed at previously (perhaps the nicest hotel I have stayed in to date). This hotel has two entrances -- one on W. 44th St. and the other on W. 45th St. From 11 PM - 6 AM, only the W. 45th St. entrance is open (and, you have to show your room key to the security guard to get in). At any rate, I usually would exit using the 44th St. entrance -- it's right around the corner from the Swatch store on Broadway (about 1.5 blocks away from Times Square). (Also, there are some restaurants and a Cranberry Deli that are right next to the hotel.) I had no problem sleeping at the hotel. The guests were quiet. Also, the hotel is off Broadway and so it's naturally more quiet. The bed was comfortable, etc. Basic observations about the "Classic Room": 1) There is a closet with plenty of hangers, a full-sized mirror, iron, and ironing board. 2) There is a TV, dresser, workdesk, ottoman, bed, two chairs. 3) Several lamps in the room and overhead light. 4) While there are snacks that are "provided," you must pay for them if you eat them (and probably they are not cheap). 5) The temperature control and water flow of the shower is excellent. Other things about the hotel: 1) On the second floor of the hotel, there are about 7 computers with which you can access the Internet, use Microsoft Word, book car service, etc. Generally, one has to pay for the Internet/computer usage by the minute (you can use cash or a credit card). There is also an attached printer. 2) There is a fitness facility. 3) There is a nice gift shop. 4) There is a bell stand -- you can store your luggage before check-in time if your room is not ready. Also, if you want to check out "early" but leave your bags behind (and come back when you have your limo/shuttle take you to the airport), you can check it with the bellman. 5) There is a theatre desk with an agent that can assist you in getting tickets to Broadway plays. 6) There is a concierge. --------- Slight problems I experienced (why this hotel gets an 'above average' rating instead of excellent from me): 1) When I got into my room, it was absolutely baking. The heat was turned on *high*! It was at least 90 degrees F. However, I put the cooling system on and it was tolerable within a half hour. 2) When I retrieved my bag from the bell man, one of my bag's zippers (for a pocket) was open! I know that I didn't leave it zipped open like that.... Fortunately, nothing was missing. Not sure what happened though!

Reviews.Title: “Was not impressed”
Reviews.Author: strafel
Reviews.Content: I was booked to stay at this hotel with my wife and 9 year old daughter for 3 nights at a rate of $399.00 per night. Upon check in I was told they had a nice room for me on the 32nd floor. This floor was a Non-Smoking floor. When I openened the door the room smelled like a smoking lounge with a deodorizer coverup. It was unbearable. The condition of the room was unacceptable. See photos of the bathroom and condition of the room. When asked if they had another room, I was told they were sold out for the night. We also ordered room service the next morning. The food was cold, they did not bring the correct utensils etc. I made the decision to check out the next morning and was able to book another room online at the Waldorf for half the price. I would never stay here again. What I found out later is only part of the hotel was redone. I obviously was given a room on a floor that was not redone. When I complained to the manager the next morning. He made the concession to take $50.00 off the room rate. Take a look at the pictures and see what $349.00 a night buys you at this hotel. I would stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: noeleen-47
Reviews.Content: While visiting friends in New York we decided to stay one night in the Times Square District. Having booked at the last minute, not a lot of accomodation was available ( thanksgiving weekend). We finally decided on the Millenium Broadway at $421 per night. I must say it was worth every cent. The hotel is just 2 minutes walk to Times Square where all the buzz is. We arrived at 9am to leave in our bags and were able to check in immediately ( which was handled very nicely and efficently). The View from the room!!! We were on the 47th floor and had a view of Times Square, the ice skating in Bryant Park and the river to the right. If you want to be in the centre of things Theatres, Restaurants and Shops and dont mind paying a little extra this hotel is ideal. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, large hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millenium Broadway the night before Thanksgiving, yes, to see the Macy's Parade the next day. The check-in process went very smoothly, took about 5 minutes. The only trouble was getting to the lobby, which is on the 8th floor. We had a corner room with king bed and pull out sofa bed. Everything was clean and comfortable. We only had two complaints: one was the noise of the water system in the ceiling, which was a constant noisy motor type sound. And the other is the elevator system. When the hotel is crowded, which was the case here, the elevator system is terrible. There are 15 elevators, with about 6 of them reserved for only floors 1 - 28. The remaining 9 go to floors 1 - 45. Instead of an up/down button to call the elevator, they have a programmed keypad where you punch in the floor number you want to go to and it tells you which elevator to wait in front of. This system may work well for 5 - 10 riders at a time, but when you are trying to transport 30 or more people, it is crowded and slow. During the hour just after the parade ended, the line to catch the elevator was about 50 yrds long.

Reviews.Title: “3-star Hotel, NOT 4-star. Clean, adequate room. GREAT location if...”
Reviews.Author: villarancho
Reviews.Content: Got this room for $217 per night on Hotwire.com. They said is was a 4-star hotel, but I am in the process of disputing. This is a clean , adequate hotel. Well, mostly clean--read the other review below about the need for replacing carpet due to stains. But, it is CLEARLY not a 4-star hotel as advertised. The Marriott Marquis accross the street IS a 4-star hotel. This place reminds me of the Doubletree Metropolitan, where I have stayed previously in NY. Although, if you prefer a smaller hotel with fewer amenities over the mega-hotel with almost every amenity, then maybe the Millenium Broadway is for you. The business center is closed on weekends, and if you need the internet then you will have to use it in the lobby where it will cost you over $10 PER DAY. When I'm on vacation, I like to use the internet to check weather, make dinner reservations or see restaurant menus, buy tickets, check finances, etc. I brought my wireless laptop, but all for not! The room was TINY, even by NY standards (see attached pics). The good part about the hotel is the location. It is just a half a block from times square, and if you get the right room, you can actually see part of TS out of your window (see attached pics). Then, you can catch the subway at 42nd street, a good NY 2.5 blocks away, to get just about anywhere you needed to go. Beware that the location close to TS is both good AND bad. Good in the sense that if you need food, shopping, or entertainment, then you only have to walk about 5 minutes from you room. But, don't forget that NY is the city that never sleeps, and this is particularly true of TS. The hotel does recede from the street a bit, but be accustomed to noise well into midnight if your room overlooks the street, especially on the weekends. Restaurant at the MB is overpriced and understaffed. There are far to many place to eat around the hotel to waste your time here. If you get a chance, go to Carmine's on 44th (same as MB) for THE BEST Italian food ever. It is family style and a little expensive, but well worth it. Then, don't miss cheesecake at Lindy's. I don't like cheesecake, but Lindy's is the best ever. Take 7th and walk north about 15 block from the MB. Please feel free to email me about any questions, I love to talke travel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Showmetheworld
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Millenium Veterans Day weekend with my two sisters. The location was wonderful, walked mostly everywhere. The bell captain was unbelieveably nice and helpful. However, we did experience a problem with getting to our room. The room I requested, (Smoking, King with rollway) was not ready at 5:00 PM. We said okay then had a bite to eat in the lounge. (The lounge is quite expensive) At 6:30 PM we decided we needed to freshen up and change for our night on the town and still our room was not ready. The manager offered the fitness center to change in and it took 20 minutes to actually get a key to an actual room where we could shower and dress. We then took our bags to the bell captain. Upon returning at 11:30 PM, our room was finally ready. I could not believe the room was not ready as check in is 4:00 PM. Other than that problem, we found the ice machines not working on the 28th floor, nor did they work 2 floors above or below us, although they did send up a bucket of ice upon request. The room was very clean as was the bathroom and the furniture and carpet really do need to be upgraded. The bed and rollaway were very comfortable for the lttle time we actually spent in them. Overall, our stay was good with the exception of the inconvenience of our 1st night. Might stay again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in NYC”
Reviews.Author: novacc
Reviews.Content: Checked in and we were sent to the boutique part of the hotel - we had been upgraded. Although the boutique rooms offer no views, they are quiet and nicely decorated (modern). Bathroom was a good size with separate shower and tub. Very comfy bed. We also received complimentary lounge access with breakfast and evening snacks/drinks. Hotel's location could not be better. Monique at the check-in desk was great, as was all the staff we encountered (Mike, the bellman from Ireland). Would stay here again, and recommend to others. Only complaint on boutique side of the hotel is that there are no ice machines to be found anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great locvation”
Reviews.Author: DaveK3
Reviews.Content: Great location near Times Square. Adequate room, although the king size bed I requested turned into two doubles when I got to the room. Good view over west 44th towards Times Square. Windows that open! (but close them at night - Times Square is always noisy). Room was clean and comfortable but - as are all New York hotels - overpriced. Still, if you get the chance to visit the attached Hudson Theater, do so - it's a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Could try harder”
Reviews.Author: ItchyfeetOxford
Reviews.Content: Our stay got off to a good start, with efficient, welcoming front desk staff. Nice hotel, & room, just off Times Square. Although we were 30 floors up, we could still hear the traffic noise. So light sleepers should go higher. However, a minor problem, which should have been sorted quickly & efficiently, was very badly handled by the concierge, & turned into a crisis. We tried to get this matter settled when we checked out, but the woman on the front desk would have none of it. Both she and some of the concierge staff were very unhelpful, & could benefit from some lessons in customer care. I was very angry & disappointed, as I thought that in the U.S, the customer is always right! Not at this hotel obviously!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: caflygrl
Reviews.Content: I arrived to the hotel around 11am. Our room was not ready but they took care of the paperwork and let us store our bags while we walked around. The location was great - right in Times Square, 10 feet from the Toys R Us, and a short block away from the Shubert Theatre were we saw Spamalot. The hotel was nice and clean looking but my biggest gripe was the check in counter. There is a huge column right in the middle with 2 people on one side and 1 person on the other side to check people in. Guests came and they had no idea where to stand. I tried to form one line and stand right in front of the pole so I could see both sides of the desk. As more people came, they chose one side or the other and completely ignored that I was standing there. I was kind enough to point out to the man in front of me, who was standing to the right of the pole, that a lady on the left was available for check in. But then I got cut off by two old ladies on the left side and then a huge group of people went to stand on the right side! Frustrated, I moved to the right side where the group of people noticed that I was there first. My boyfriend had to stand on the left side but the two old ladies failed to notice we had been standing there and took the next available person. Everyone seemed confused trying to form their own line or split up into different lines. What a mess! The situation only seemed to worsen as later in the day, lots more people were checking in and were just milling about in huge clumps. All the hotel needed was to put some barriers in place to indicate one line and it would have been fine. My reservation was correct though I should have requested a higher floor as I was put on 17 which is the lowest floor for rooms (16 has a fitness center and other stuff). The room was a good size with a sitting area and king bed. The night tables were a bit odd as the one on my boyfriend's side appeared to have something hidden inside as it was locked on the front with a vent out of the top. Very strange... the room was sort of dark with just a couple lamps to light the room. The man who brought our bags was very nice and pointed out where everything was. The bathroom was probably the nicest part as it was done all in marble tile and the bathtub had one of those shower rods that curve out so the tub seems that much bigger. Also, the water temp and water pressure were good. The bed was a bit strange as there was no blanket. There was sheet for the mattress, a flat sheet, and then the customary cover. But no blanket! We found one in the closet but I was still cold. Most hotels have a blanket on the bed AND a blanket in the closet. I would have liked a coffee maker and some tea bags that even an $80 motel in rural Maine that I went to had, but this hotel had none. There was a strange tinking noise all night long (the fan I think) and the whole door seemed to shake whenever someone in the hall would close their door. I kept thinking someone was coming in. You couldn't hear the street noise at all though and the view was ok with a side view of Times Square. This is the 4th hotel I have stayed in NYC and I would rate it #3. Sofitel comes in #1 on my list with its plush down comforters and friendly staff. #2 would be the Hilton Times Square. The Millenium was better than my #4 choice, the Roosevelt, because of the nice sized rooms and bathrooms, the nice bellman, and the elevators that actually come. All in all, not a horrible experience but I had really hoped for something great as a handful of other reviewers have posted!!

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly reception staff”
Reviews.Author: MCELDUFF
Reviews.Content: Just back from a tour of the States, Chicago, Florida, Boston and New York. Had a great holiday with one exception - our choice of hotel in New York. Whilst the hotel is in an excellent location, the room was shoddy and the reception staff most UNHELPFUL. At check in I discovered they required a voucher from the internet company I booked the room with to state it was prepaid. I handed the man the pages I had printed off the internet and he said no that's not it. I can't check you in!! Eventually after surrendering my credit card e.t.c. they reluctantly checked me in after signing on the dotted line to pay again. I asked them to check with the American agency who had obviously booked the room with them. They refused. It is your problem not our problem. The next day I read the pages I handed in. It clearly stated it was a voucher. I went down to hand them in and complain. They told me again, so what it was my problem not theirs and how dare I complain!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience all the way around”
Reviews.Author: amybatt
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend at the Millennium Broadway in October. I have to say it was an almost flawless experience. Our room on the 42nd floor was spotless, quiet and comfortable. The service was exceptional, especially the bellman who went out of his way to ensure a two-twin room to this mother-daughter pair. "Premium" check-in messed up three times in assigning us to a pre-reserved twin room, before the bellman finally took us the the "non-Premium" part of the hotel, which is the only place they have twins at all. (Not sure what qualified me for Premium to begin with, as I booked at a AAA rate) My only complaint is that the cleaning staff starts cleaning at 8:30 and is not afraid to knock that early to get into your room. On vacation, I'm not normally up by 9:00, but the staff indicated that the Do Not Disturb would prevent them from knocking in. I'll repeat previous recommenations for breakfast and lunch at Cranberry Gourmet Deli, outside the 45th Street entrance. Breakfast for me one morning (OJ and French Toast) was $6. Lunch of pastrami and bottled water was $7. You can't beat the prices and the food was great. They also have gourmet type salads, pressed sandwiches and pastries. The location is excellent, entrances on W. 44th and W. 45th right off Times Square. This is perfect for a 5 minute walk back from the theaters in the area, yet the hotel is so darn quiet for such a central location. I'd go back in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent view, service, location....”
Reviews.Author: frqtvisitor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Sept. 23-25 for our anniversary. We arrived around noon and they checked us in immediately and upgraded us without asking to the 50th floor (52 floors total in the building), corner room suite. Miti was wonderful and very nice to us!! The view was spectacular! We had the Chrysler building to the left, the Empire State building in front and Times Square to the right with the Paramount building clock in full view. We could actually see the river too. The windows opened a few inches so we could hear the sounds from the street because when they were closed, you couldn't hardly hear anything except horns blowing faintly and a live band outside playing on times square for a short time. The windows were huge! We had very comfortable king size bed with a wonderful soft and luxurious blanket (in the closet with extra pillows). The bathroom was tasteful and all marble. We didn't hear any noises from the hallway. The hotel rooms and public areas are tastefully decorated, but, consider it to be masculine which my husband prefers over "flowery or overly bright". It has a soothing effect on the soul actually and made us relax. The continental breakfast was included in our package, and was delicious with fresh fruit (pineapple exceptionally sweet), croissants, cereals, pastries, and bagels along with juice and coffee. There was complimentary bottled water and coffee/tea in our room as well. A mini bar was there too but, we didn't use it. We did use the inroom safe and iron. The staff was very nice and go out of the way to make your stay a pleasant one. The location couldn't have been better for our needs. After we checked out, they held our luggage in a locked room while we finished our shopping before our departure. The only negative experience we had in the hotel, was with a guest and not the staff, and that was the rudeness of the Iberia Airline waitress that refused to stand in line (even though she was only 2nd in line after us) on being seated for breakfast. The hostess actually apologized on her behalf for her bad behavior on cutting in line. The hostess didn't have to do that since it wasn't her fault but, that goes to show how courteous the staff really is!! We travel quite frequently due to family in Europe and stayed at many hotels, and we really enjoyed this hotel and would come back!

Reviews.Title: “Location is the seller here!”
Reviews.Author: BoogRock
Reviews.Content: THE LOCATION is SUPERB! You are a stone's throw away from the action at Times Square, but far enough away that the noise is NOT an issue (don't listen to reviews that say it is -- this is the quietest Times Square Hotel I've ever stayed in, and we were on the 17th floor on a Saturday night with 2 young children who slept soundly through the night). If you have small children, you should know that this hotel is the closest one to Toys R Us and that wonderful giant ferris wheel. THE ROOMS are inconsistent. We were there with a large group, and although our room was wonderful and looked as if it was recently updated, some of the rooms of other family members weren't as good. Our room had beautiful floor-to-ceiling windows, a super-comfortable king bed and a HUGE bathroom. THE LOBBY is contemporary, masculine, and very European-like but, in my opinion, way too stark, cold and uninviting. I prefer a warmer lobby with lots of furniture. THE EMPLOYEES are very friendly (great bellmen), but a bit intolerant of special requests. If you get a good rate it is worth a try for the location and the floor-to-ceiling windows in the guest rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, ok service”
Reviews.Author: d-the-man
Reviews.Content: Now I've never been to NYC before, but I've seen enough TV and heard enough stories to know that it's busy, dirty and people tend to be short and rude. I think this is true throughout the city - you just have to accept that the service will probably be below the level you are accustomed to. This holds true for the Millennium - the service in my opinion was simply okay. Staff gets the job done for you, but don't expect the 4-star smiles and pleasantries. God forbid you hit a bump in the road that requires a talk with management, because I don't think you are going to get what you want. Thankfully our arrangements were smooth sailing. The rooms at the Millennium are quite nice. They are up to par for a 4-star. New and recently renovated, nice decorations, tile and marbled bathroom of decent size, decent hotel bed nicely decorated with throw pillows. However, as the 10 Best NY book says, they are compact. There is just enough room in there to move between chairs, bed and bathroom. Overall it was a nice room and I liked it. The location is of course excellent if you are in the city to see the sites and be close to Times Square. It's literally stone's throws from TS and it takes less than 2 minutes to walk there. There is of course ample dinning and shopping opportunities within steps. In my opinion you can't beat the location. I do have one complaint about the Millennium, and that is the door slamming. We had a room at the end of the hall which was adjacent to two others, all three of which had doors that would slam pretty loud if you just let them go. If you are a light sleeper like I am it will wake you up. I tried to sleep-in a couple of times just to be woken by the door slamming of the adjacent rooms by house keeping and who knows what staff. The doors don't just slam once, but many times. So just when you start drifting off to sleep another one will come along in a timely manner to pull you right back out of your slumber. Hotel staff could at least take the extra 2 seconds to close the door quietly, especially if they so 'do not disturb' signs hanging on near by doors. Bottom line: Nice rooms, but kind of small. Just okay service...hey, it's New York, what do you expect!?

Reviews.Title: “Next time, we'll stay elsewhere...”
Reviews.Author: neelie64
Reviews.Content: We just spent a long weekend at the Millenium at the end of August, 2005. There were 5 couples. All of us traveled to NYC to see a Yankees game and the sites. 6 out of 10 in our group had never been to NYC before so we had our travel agent pick a hotel based on location. This hotel fit the bill, being a block from Times Square, etc. Upon checking in at the hotel, we began to think that we made a mistake. The people at the reception desk were down right rude! The female staff person--who will remain nameless here--was downright "SNARKY!" As several others have posted, our rooms were not ready, however, they took imprints of our credit cards and asked that we sign off on them. We were given a AAA rate of $199 by our travel agent, but the hotel told us that the rate was $229. We then called our travel agent on our cell phone and had her speak directly with the hotel manager. Needless to say, the hotel would not honor the AAA rate. We were given "complimentary" continental breakfast for our two day stay. (Which amounts to $19.75 per person for coffee, bagels, muffins and orange juice -- no thanks, I'll go to the deli across the street and purchase a reasonably priced breakfast! An egg at the hotel restaurant was $9--that's just for one egg, nothing to accompany it!) Needless to say this whole check in disaster took about 1 hour to rectify! Not exactly the way I wanted to spend my time in NYC. The manager never even apologized for the wait/inconvenience. We were told to wait in the seating area in the front of the hotel. With it's broken down couches, lack of ambience, and several other groups of people either waiting for rooms or cars to take them to the airport, etc., it was decided that two of us would stay behind while the hotel tried to figure out a room rate for us. Everyone else started enjoying their time in NYC. Upon getting our room assignments, one couple in our group was given a complimentary upgrade! They were put in a business room on the 6th floor. Three other couples were put on the 46th floor and the last on the 47th floor. We has asked to be put on the same floor, however, the hotel told us that they were unable to do so! We are planning on returning to NYC in December to see the Christmas decorations, shopping, show, etc. We will not be staying at the Millenium! Best of luck to all with their travel plans!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: sethandliz
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night at this hotel in early September. We booked it through Hotwire and weren't sure what to expect. We were very pleasantly surprised. The location is awesome!! It is just half a block away from Times Square and therefore in walking distance of a ton of action. We didn't have a view of anything (just a big building) but that was actually okay because it wasn't as noisy as a room with a view would have been. We travelled with our 18 month old and they supplied a Pack & Play and brought it up to the room fairly quickly. I noiced it was a big hotel for flight crews - I assume that just means it's considered an affordable hotel. The rooms were pretty nice for a NYC hotel - your standard decor, a very big bathroom, lots of channels, and you could actually open the windows a few inches for fresh air. I would recommend this for anyone looking for decent, comfortable accommodations in a hot location. If you are looking for more luxury, then maybe you should try somewhere like the W. We would return to the Millenium again!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the first timers!”
Reviews.Author: Sun75
Reviews.Content: After participating in an international conference in Chicago, I flew to NY and spent two nights in Millennium Broadway in July of 2005. I found the Hotel in internet and chose it based on a few comments in tripadvisor.com pages. I paid $ 255 for a single room per night. (just accommodation) I directly booked through the Hotel. Concierge deserves all the compliments. They are so helpful as regards restaurant and location information. In my opinion, especially the two ladies at the concierge upgrade the image of the Hotel. I hope the Hotel Management is aware of this! They are giving a remarkable help with the information. (Note: I did not buy theatre tickets through them.) On the other hand, the Reception is sending mix messages depending on whom you speak to! I came to the Hotel at about 11.30. The receptionist told me that my room was not ready and I should wait until 16.30! As you can guess it was a very long time. He told me to check the room status in every half an hour! Of course, this was why I came to NY; to check the status of my hotel room in every half an hour during the day! He told me they had 750 rooms! Frankly speaking, he seemed to me ignorant and careless, sort of a recorded tape. As you can guess it was not a very warm welcome in the July heat of NY. He gave me a hard time. And I thought no way. Hence, I shifted to another receptionist. She was polite and helpful. But it did not make a huge prompt change in my case. I have been told there were other waiting guests who arrived at 06.30! So after making my complaints, I left my luggage at the Hotel and left for the city. However, apparently she upgraded me and gave me a corner room at the 45th floor. Room and bath room were spacious and clean. Very big bed and an impressive view of the city. Elevators were quick. Many people in and out. Busy inside traffic. Lobby and breakfast room are pretty small. But that is ok, because we do not come to NY to spend time inside. But I would not say no for more space at the both sections. For the breakfast I paid $ 32 a day. So I was amazed when I read in tripadvisor.com pages that someone paid just $ 20 for the breakfast. What a huge difference! When I was leaving the Hotel, I asked a cab for the airport. The luggage guy (porter) told me I could use the Hotel's cars (with driver) instead of a cab by paying $ 60 (with his terms "tip and everything included".) I was in hurry and said ok. The driver told me in our way to the airport $ 60 was not covering tip. I said him what the porter told me. So he did not insist. Just in case, keep in your mind. The location is great, if you want to be at the "heart" of everything, meaning Times Square. I thought the location is remarkable especially for the first timers. But in my view, one may try some other hotels for later occasions. Sometimes the hotel seemed to me like a â€œhuman factoryâ€�. Next time, I would not say no for a smaller hotel with more character.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time at Millenium”
Reviews.Author: lwing18
Reviews.Content: This was our second time, family of four. We had two rooms. Each time we stayed two nights. I think this hotel is great value. Clean, good location (if you like times square), friendly. Rooms are nice size. Bathrooms, also nice sized, with showers that work well. As stated in another review, deli across the street, Cranberries, is very good. It is nice getting breakfast for 4, for less than $20.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: mia64
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from the Millenium Broadway Hotel in New York. If you visit New York and you want to have all the good things within the reach of a couple of tired feet: this is the place to be. The hotel is practically on Time Square, where you can find all you need: subway, taxi, Grey Line hop-on-hop-off busses, theaters, THSK booth to get the theater tickets, restaurants of all kinds, Central Park at a 20 min walk, all together. You have to love people, because there are lots of them around Time Square. Beside the superb location, the hotel is excellent: clean, spacious rooms and bathrooms, nice and friendly people, no "NY-rudeness" (sorry, folks, but you even beat Parissiens). We'll certainly be back there.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews on various web sites about this hotel, I did not have very high expectations. I was pleasantly surprised!! The hotel was clean, neatly decorated, staff at the front desk and the conciege desk were very helpful and friendly (especially Tom - Concierge). A disappointment was the bed size. I had booked a room with 2 double beds and their beds are actually oversized twins. Worked out well for us but keep in mind if you need a large bed. We had 2 issues that were resolved within 15-20 minutes of our call to the front desk. The location was fabulous!!! Overall, for this price range it was a good experience and I would go stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,Convenient,and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in NYC at the Millenium Broadway. We arrived early in the morning after a redeye out of L.A. and they did their best to get us into a room by 11AM. We requested a newer room as the hotel is being refurbished and on a high floor. They gave us both,with a great view on the 46th floor. I found the staff to be very helpful and polite and answered all our questions. The rooms were new and clean and a nice flat screen TV. Noise was never a problem and we never heard the people in the next rooms. Elevators were quick and we never had to wait more then 30 seconds. The gym was well equipped and clean, I used it three times over the week and never saw more then 3 or 4 other people in there. Never ate at the hotel as there are so many other places close by,and a great little place called the Cranberry Gourmet Deli right across the street was fantastic for breakfast or any other snacks or quick lunches you might want. Location of the hotel is 1/2 block away from Times Square. I would highly recommend this hotel and look forward to another visit

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary to Remember”
Reviews.Author: CruisingGeorgieGirl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from an anniversary-weekend getaway at the Millenium Broadway. This hotel is perfectly situated 1/2 block east of Time Square. It is in the heart of NYC, but there isn't the crush of tourists in front of the hotel. We made our reservation via phone with the Millenium and were pleased to be offered a rate of $199/night, which is much lower than the $259 we've seen on-line. I called the hotel directly that evening to get details and make some room requests. As soon as the person on the phone, who turned-out to be the overnight manager, learned that it was our anniversary, he went all-out to get us the best room possible. He upgraded our room and we were given a 10 AM check-in to a superior corner room on the 48th floor. It was spectacular. The view was great, and the room was beautiful. The beds are at-least as good as those at Westin, and the decor is very soothing (see photos). We were concerned that the elevators would take forever, being on an upper floor. However, we found that they were almost psychic in their opening as soon as you entered the elevator lobby. Once on an elevator, it took-off like a rocket. I had also called ahead to the concierge to get some good restaurant suggestions. Philip set-us-up with a reservation at San Domenico on Central Park South, making sure to discuss with the manager that it was a special evening and that we were "VIPs" (his idea...not mine). We arrived to be given a beautiful table in an elegant, upscale Northern Italian restaurant. His recommendation was spot-on for a romantic dinner, and we were treated to an outrageous "Panna Cotta" custard for dessert because of the occasion. The concierge also gave us good recommendations for more casual dining, and provided us with a great theater discount packet, helping us avoid the lines at TKTS for discount seats. I found this to be an elegant hotel without being snobbish. The room...great! The staff was friendly, knowledgable and accessible. I would return without hesitation, and recommend without reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 7/2-7/6 $150/night via biddingfortravel Hotel Report: This was our first trip as a family to NYC (husband is a Queens NY native, but hasn't been back in 16yrs). Great location, right off Times square. A few hiccups at checkin (room wasn't ready so they waived the fee for a rollaway and moved us to a larger room 3603). Some minor issues in the room (tub stopper was broken, so our 4yr old couldn't take a bath and the dial was missing from the A/C unit, but we didn't need to adjust the temp). All in all, a great hotel and we'd stay here again. Comfortable King bed, quiet A/C unit, can open windows slightly to get the NY sound from Times Square. Impressive Fitness Center: several Life Fitness weight machines, 2 treadmills, 2 step climbers, 2 ellipticals, a rowing machine, free weights, lockers and a shower and bathroom. The corner is very busy with Toys R Us, so we used the entrance on 45th, next to Starbucks. Trip Report: We found plenty of things to keep our 4yr old occupied. We walked to Central Park (about 20blocks) via 7th ave and ended up at Columbus Circle. We walked around the park and stumbled upon Victoria Gardens. Spent hours there going on all the rides (over and over again). Took the E train to Queens to visit family, and back into the city without any hassles. The subway system was overwhelming at first, but easy to understand once you looked at the Transit map. Took the #1 train to Canal Street (be in the first 5 cars, that station only has room for the first 5 cars). Crossed the street and starting looking for the Louis Vuitton and Coach bags. They aren't displayed, you have to ask, then they'll take you into the backroom or downstairs. Negotiate!!! Took the subway to the Staten Island Ferry for a free view of the Statue of Liberty (ferry is free) and the Brooklyn Bridge. You have to exit the Ferry once you get across, but like most everyone else, you just walk around the terminal and get right back on for the round trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Skillz231
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at the Millenium and my experience was excellent. I announced it was my 30th birthday and they upgraded me to the 46th floor. I opened the curtain to my room and was immediately immersed in the lights of Times Square. It was a wonderful view. The concierge was very knowledgeable about getting around the city. The only downside was the outrageous parking rate for valet. They charged $45.00 for a 24 hr time period. I don't know if this a standard price for a hotel in the city but other than that, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fault”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three city trip to the US. Our first stay was at the Millenium Broadway in New York. We thought the hotel was in a perfect location and the staff were very friendly. Terence on reception was great and very helpful. Our room was very good and we were pleased to find tea and coffee making facilities which are rare in US hotels. As a base to explore New York I think it is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a long red eye flight I was greeted by a very friendly check-in staff member who upgraded me to a premium room on floor 49 The view was superb- to the right Times Square- dead ahead The Empire State Building-to the left The Chrysler Building. The room was spacious and very nicely decorated. Great room service menu The real glory of the hotel is however its vacation. Right in the heart of Broadway-so much so that two doors down Denzel Washington was playing Julius Ceaser and was out every night doing a meet and greet. This hotel is a little on the pricey side but having stayed in cheaper hotels in Manhatten you really do get what you pay for. Take my advice- stay at the Millenium Broadway

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Samol
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights at the start of our America holiday. Chose the hotel mainly for its location - and we were not disappointed! It's right next to Times Square, and every evening we could here a busker playing very soothing pan pipes! Our room was on level 42 with not much of a view, but that wasn't what we came for. The decor looked a bit tired, and the advertised minibar looked as though it had recently been (untidily) removed. Large room, large bed, large bathroom. Didn't use the small restaurant which seemed very expensive with breakfast at $23 - the Times Deli across the street was much cheaper and definitely gave us a 'local' flavour. When we left the doorman offered a limo instead of a taxi - a great way to leave and only $5 more! The hotel seems to be used a lot by airline staff, and we would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and friendly reception staff.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I prefer the concierge tower at this property where they have seperate checkin area and reception/cocktail lounge area. The rooms were quite large with great views. My room had a seperate sitting area and foyer. The bathroom was huge as well as the closet. The floor to ceiling windows with views of Times Square were worth the extra money. The concierge tower rooms also include a continental breakfast with cocktail hour in the evenings, free newspapers and computer/internet stations in private lounge. I thought the rooms were more attractive than the Marriott Marquis and without the endless walking to get to the rooms and waiting for elevators that you find at the Marquis.

Reviews.Title: “A great second stay”
Reviews.Author: crsdmale
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Millenium. When we arrived, we were advised that the Millenium was overbooked, so we were upgraded to the Premier at no additional costs. Like our first stay, the staff was very friendly and the room was spotless. In addition, it is in a great location less than a block from Times Square and within walking distance of most theaters and a good number of restaurants. Whenever we return to NY, this will be the first place we check.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not 4 star in our opinion”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 31 March - 5 April 2005. The room was ok (31st floor) with a view towards the Chrysler Building. It was not one which had recently been refurbished and there was an unusal noise that you heard very regularly although not sure if it was the elevators or the plumbing ?? There were also no tea/coffee facilities in the room - not uncommon in NYC apparently. I stay in a lot of European hotels and would say this one was 3 star at most. Location is excellent which is why we really chose this hotel. We didn't use the restaurant as there were so many within 2 blocks to chose from. Was disappointed with the theatre ticket desk which can get you tickets.... if you want to pay double the face value - be warned. Would stay here again for the location but will probably try another hotel off Times Square first.

Reviews.Title: “pay more and stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: filmgeek
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night while our apartment was being painted. Overall a decent hotel in a convenient location. The staff was not very helpful or nice and the first room they gave us was awful. We landed in a king with nice views, bathroom could be better though. I think it's probably worth it to pay a little more and stay at a nicer hotel, since this hotel is not cheap and does not have many amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millenium with two friends of mine for my birthday and I decided to write a review because they were so helpful when we were booking a room. We had a great time all around. The hotel is in a GREAT location, right off of Times Square as I am sure you can tell from many other reviews. The Times Square/42nd Street Subway Station was right around the corner which connected to almost every line (there is a shuttle to Grand Central Station which connects you with the 6). We really only faced two problems when we got there...first of all, we were put in the wrong room, it had one bed when we needed two doubles, but as soon as we called them they had someone waiting for us at our new room with keys and everything. Also, the next room we went into had a moldy smell. We called housekeeping and it took them a little bit to come and when he did he was very friendly and told us that it was water damage and to call and request a room change. However, we knew the hotel was booked full, we had our luggage everywhere, we were only staying for two nights and knew we wouldn't spend much time in the room, so we just decided to try to air out the room. It worked alright, we quickly couldn't smell it anymore. But I wouldn't worry too much if you decide to stay here, I think it was just this room that had the smell. The first room we were put in smelled fine. Other then that it was great. All staff was very friendly although it did seem like a hotel more aimed to businessmen. I defintely would recommend it though, we had LOTS of fun. Also, one more bit of advice, make sure you ask when booking if you receive free continental breakfast. We did not, however there was a little deli across the street which had cheap breakfast (at least for NYC).

Reviews.Title: “don't do it”
Reviews.Author: gymchick
Reviews.Content: Problems started at check in by being told they were out of rooms that would hold 3 people. I was told all they had left was rooms with 2 twin beds and they could only book in 2 people by New york Law. It was me with my 2 children so we had to have a room for 3 which is what I had booked 6 weeks in advance and I had an e-mailed confirmation from the reservations dept. After insisting they find a room, the manager finally came out and said he would try to get a room with king and roll-a-way cleaned. We were stuck spending two hours of our first night in NYC sitting in the lobby waiting for our room. After a couple of trips back to the front desk, and some civil complaining, they say, well it's still not clean, they will have go ahead and give me another room. I say, why couldn't I have that room in the first place? No good answer, just a roll of the eyes from the front desk clerk. Just happy to get to the room, I gave it up for that night. The next morning I asked for the hotel's director just to relay how shabby the check-in treatment was. I was at no time during any of this hostile or rude to anyone. His basic answer was "unfortunately we cannot guarantee the type of room you are getting and all we had left when you arrived, (7:00 p.m.) were twin beds. What did they think I was going to do with one of my kids? My husband travels 14 days of the month and usually stays in chains such as Comfort Inn. We wanted something more special for this trip. This hotel bragged to be a 4 star when I made reservation. Our experience was that the service is far superior at a 1 star chain. The shower leaked all into the bathroom floor and the toilet was always clogging. The doorman is almost never around. We waited 45 min and 3 phone calls plus a trip down to the front desk to get the bellman to come for our luggage (we had alot) when we checked out. Even with all this, we had a great time. I cannot say enough good things about the concierge desk. THEY WERE GREAT. The hotel is in a great location, just off Times Square and easy to get anywhere from there. We also had a great view from our room on the 41st floor. It was our first visit to NYC and we loved it, but we would never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Millennium was great”
Reviews.Author: Hukergirl
Reviews.Content: I just returned last night after 3 days in NYC, staying at the Millennium Broadway (Mar 25-28). My college daughter and I had a great weekend shopping and going to shows. We arrived around noon at the hotel, but no rooms were available. They kept our luggage while we walked around Times Square and ate lunch at Chevy's (Mexican). We returned around 3:30 and were given a corner room on the 46th floor, recently renovated we were told. We had two twin beds, which were almost full-size. The bathroom was roomy and clean. Mattresses were comfortable, with 4 pillows on each bed. The shower was hot and water pressure was fine. We got helpful service from the consierge each time we asked (although go in person; the phone is ALWAYS busy. We did not eat in the hotel, but it looked good. We got very helpful service from the front desk, the doormen, the bellman, and in the gift shop. I don't have a bad word to say about anyone! This hotel is just half a block away from Broadway and Times Square. The majority of the theatres are on 44th and 45th Streets, so walking is easy. We also ate barbeque at Virgil's right across the street. We had reservations for 5:00 Saturday night and the place was packed when we arrived 10 minutes early. We had to wait 15-20 minutes for our table, but we were waited on quickly and food was excellent. Up 44th another block, we ate at Olly's Noodle Shop, for basic Chinese. Another night we ate at Sophia's for Italian. For breakfast, we ate on 44th (away from Times Square) at the Red Flame Diner. Nothing fancy, but good for either breakfast or lunch. I would definitely return to this hotel. It's within walking distance of the theatres, the ticket outlet is one block away, and so is the subway. Everything you need is right here!

Reviews.Title: “MILLENIUM BROADWAY WAS THE BEST NYC HOTEL EXPERIENCE WE HAVE HAD!”
Reviews.Author: helper1
Reviews.Content: FANTASTIC STAY - I proposed to my wife in our window overlooking Times Square after seeing Phantom of the Opera!! We stayed on the 50th floor in a corner room that overlooked times square. The guy at the front desk who checked us in was very nice and from MA, so we got to talking and he ended up upgrading us for FREE to a deluxe room!!! MTV and the center of Timesquare were right below us, You could even see the river from that high! Fantastic room and views from two sides since we were on the corner of the building. Very high class hotel. Surprised it was a 4 star. The place and the people were first class. I paid $105 a night though hotwire!! May 28- June 1 2003 Since then we have stayed at the Crowne plaza times square - Hotwire $112 a night, and the Hilton in Midtown central- Priceline $101 a night. Neither of these hotels compared to the experience we had at the Millenium. Also you really cannot beat the location if you want to be in the heart of the city. Do not let the high maintanence snobs here scare you away. The Millenium was an awesome hotel with absolutely one of the best locations in Manhattan! Sometimes I think people in these reviews are just out to bash places regardless.

Reviews.Title: “Half-eaten leftover food, lousy front desk”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife found half-eaten leftover food in the room upon check-in. We asked for a non-smoking room and it reeked of cigarette smoke. Front-desk staff stonewalled us about changing rooms until 3 pm the next day, Even after speaking with the manager about the unacceptable room they gave us. Why stay at a hotel this dirty and without any reasonable response for a change in room?

Reviews.Title: “Great location; not so great room”
Reviews.Author: KB&PC
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend in November 2004; a fleeting visit where we arrived on Friday and left Sunday night. You won't be able to check in until about 4pm but they will take your luggage and store it until then. Really good location and all the downstairs public areas are stunning. The room was a big disappointment though. The decor was shabby; lights didn't work and the bathroom looked like it needed an overhaul. The grouting was black with mildew and some of the tiles had been knocked off. The view from the room (overlooked part of Times Square) made up for some of it but it was still disappointing. The staff at the hotel were brilliant and couldn't do enough to help; we were directed to a good place for breakfast; given maps and anything else we asked for. We did write an email when we returned saying how disappointed we were and the hotel wrote a lovely letter back explaining that they were sorry for our experience and that currently they were renovating some rooms and offered us a free upgrade for next time.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: maryk1968
Reviews.Content: WOnderful service, WOnderful hotel!!! Very impressed. My husband arrived early and we had booked on Hotwire so we weren't sure what to expect. FIrst he was told we had full beds I believe. He asked if a queen was available....THey checked and told him to leave luggage come back later in the day. At check in time he returned and they put him into the newly renovated annex (gorgeous!!!) and I believe we had a king sized bed. ROom was SO nice!! We loved it. View was okay...we were on 7th floor so we couldn't see much!! It was in a great location!!! Staff was very helpful!! Great afternoon happy hour and morning breakfasts!!! Drinks and hors d'ourves superb!!! We will stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and my fiance stayed at the millennium broadway from 11th-15th Feb for my 21st birthday. We arrived and checked in straight away to a lovely room on the 18th floor with excellent views of times square and the crysler building. The room was spotless, only fault we could find was that the mini bar was out of service! We didn't eat in the restaurant although we did have room service one night - great value for money and delicious food (especially the NYC cheesecake!) This hotel is in an excellent location - 2 seconds from Times Square and about a 5-10 minute walk from Rockerfeller Centre and 5th ave, not too far to walk with all our shopping bags! For great food nearby try the new Italian restaurant called Bond 21 right next door or Virgils BBQ grill opposite the hotel for some really authentic american cheap food! The staff were extremely heplful - conceirge pointed us in the right direction for anywhere we wanted to go and a lovely doorman called Jack dealt with our cases and organised a car to the airport on the last day which allowed us to enjoy out last few hours in NYC wihtout anything else to worry about. We'd definately recommend getting a car through the hotel to the airport, much more comfortable than the yellow cabs, the driver was really chatty ant it only cost $50 inc toll. When we return to NYC we will definatley be staying at the Millennium Broadway!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful room, great location!”
Reviews.Author: altadesigns
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights at this beautiful modern hotel in a great location. My corner room had views of the Chrysler Building and Times Square and was spacious, comfortable and clean. I thought the service was wonderful. I'm surprised that other reviewers didn't like this place - there were five rooms of us, and we all had wonderful experiences here. I'd highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Broadway star”
Reviews.Author: oddcouple1
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a 5 hour drive and the front desk clerk said "you were supposed to check in on Tuesday"- no, we were booked Thurs-Sun and this was Thursday, 2/24- good thing I had printed my confirmation from Hotwire. So after about a half hour, he came back and said we were all set for our "one-night stay" which we had booked and paid for as 3 nights!! We finally got to our room. There is no coffee maker. No room service menu. No mini-fridge or mini-bar. The cabinet that used to be the minibar was not usable. There was trash from prior guests under the bed. The bathroom countertop was not clean. The grout around the bathtub tiles was black with mildew, and the shower head was coming out of the wall. There was a card on the ice bucket that said to call room service and they would bring you ice. Wrong. I called and room service told me to go find the ice machine. Also, make sure you don't let them put a "hold" on a credit card that you plan to use unless you have a huge credit line. The location was unbeatable, steps from Times Square. When we checked out, I told them about the unsatisfactory condition of our room, and the clerk told me that they were in the process of "renovations." I'm just glad I only paid $120 per night on Hotwire. This is NOT a 4-star hotel as many sites say it is.

Reviews.Title: “So Rude!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SK2004
Reviews.Content: we arrived at 10.45 pm after a five hour flight. we had prepaid our room but they had no record of our reservation for three nights. The staff were VERY rude to us (yes Terrence I mean YOU!) and the offered us one night to move to a "sister hotel" near the UN. I asked if all guests for the evening had checked in (I cheated, I heard 2 other staff commenting that there were 12 rooms still empty) and Terrence said no. PURE lies! This was a very special surprise trip my fiance had booked for us and we really did not need the hassle, he had chosen the location for sentimental reasons and we didn't want to move. After 15 minutes of getting nowhere we agreed to bring our HUGE bags out to the minus 15 degrees snow on the ground footpath. We were left to hail a taxi ourselves and gave up, booked into the crummy best western beside the back door for the night and were treated like kings. We booked the Park Lane Helmsley on hotels the next day and loved it. There is no way on earth I would ever step inside the door of the Milennium Broadway again!

Reviews.Title: “A delightful stay!”
Reviews.Author: RevLou
Reviews.Content: Our experience here began with a potential probelm at check-in, but evolved into a very pleasant stay! When we first arrived at 3PM, we were told that our room would not be ready for one hour. We did our check-in paperwork, left our bags with the bell staff and went for a walk. (I would recommend in the future that the front desk have a special line for those who are asked to return as opposed to having to wait a second time on a general line.) When we came back exactly one hour later, the room was ready. We had a very comfortable non-smoking corner room with a king bed on the 33rd floor. The room was above-average in size, coupled with a very spacious bathroom and a great bath/shower. Our windows boasted gorgeous views of Times Sqaure and Broadway! (The hotel restaurant served only an OK breakfast, but we did not come to NYC to eat in the hotel!) Our experiences with the entire staff - the front desk, the bell staff, the maid who took care of our room, and the concierge - were first-rate. All of the staff we dealt with were friendly and extremely helpful! The hotel's location was central to the best that Midtown has to offer. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER,NEVER, AGAIN IN LIFE!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I went to New York City to celebrate the marriage of one of my girlfriends. When we arrived at the hotel at about 11 p.m. from the airport, our room had been sold, although our room had been paid for at least a month in advance. I wondered if the reason they sold the room was b/c we booked on priceline, but there were about 10-15 other people who were waiting to be taken to hotels by the airport b/c their rooms had been sold also. The "manager" was very rude and matter of fact. She told us that this was normal practice in NYC and that she would find us a room after she had placed the people who arrived before we did. One of the attendants found us a room at a 4 star hotel in Manhattan, but the manager was unwilling to pay for it. At about 0300 in the a.m. we were finally taken to a hotel by the airport at the expense of Millenium. The next day we were brought back to the hotel and the real manager was somewhat apologetic, but seemed bothered that we were complaining about being bused back and forth between hotels. It was 5 of us in the group and he said that we would have to pay extra for the fifth person(can you believe that!) After heated debate on both sides, he upgraded our room to a suite which for the most part was nice. The hotel itself was nice but the staff and their practices were garbage!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: profwho88
Reviews.Content: Was a little worried given some of the reviews, but really had a great stay at this hotel. The room was great, it was very quiet in my room, and no problems at all were encountered during the stay. Because it was raining, they loaned me an umbrella at the front desk. Superb location for all that I needed to do on my business trip. There is a deli across the street which was great for quick meals. I ordered Domino's Pizza for some of my dinners and it was delivered to the hotel and to the room (the concierge made the delivery person call up before delivery, good for security thanks!) All in all, extremely pleased with the hotel and I will DEFINITELY return. Good job, thanks! (I was on floor 39 by the way.)

Reviews.Title: “Far better than The Plaza or waldorf”
Reviews.Author: sxysadie
Reviews.Content: I felt compelled to write a review after reading all the negative ones on this site, were you guys staying somewhere else?! Bit of trouble checking in when it turned out our travel agent had not confirmed our booking, this was dealt with smoothly and efficiently and even though the hotel was not to blame they upgraded us to a tower room. having stayed at the waldorf Astoria and The Plaza I can honestly say this room was the best I have stayed in in New york. There were huge floor to ceiling windows, a corner sofa AND seperate seating area. The bed was huge with lovely fresh linens and the whole rrom was very chic and sleek. There was a large wardrobe and seperate dressing area. The bathroom was HUGE with seperate shower and bath and was marble and glass, very sophisticated. Because we were in a tower room we were able to go for free cocktails and canapes every afternoon in the lounge. The staff were so friendly, confirming restaurant reservations and lending us umbrellas. The location is excellent and its the beat hotel experience i've ever had in New York. The Waldorf and the Plaza are simply trading on their names and the goodwill of existing customers, there is no way these hotels are 5* but the Millenium Broadway was simply fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great view BUT very small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to New York and stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. We paid 100 per night, room only, which I feel was a bit expensive for what we got. As first time visitors to New York, we were generally happy with the hotel but felt we could have got better value for money. Our room was on the 36th floor, on a corner. The view was fantastic. I'm not sure if the view would have been so good from any of the lower floors as the surrounding buildings are all very tall (obviously!). The room itself was clean, but the furniture had seen better days and could do with being updated. It was also a really small room, although the large floor to ceiling windows did give the illusion of space. The bathroom was poorly lit, with a small bath but the shower was excellent. Maid service cleaned the room and replaced towels daily if required, and there was also a hairdryer and iron/ironing board in our room. The location is a great central point for exploring, and it is a very busy area of the city. It can be noisy until late in the evenings though, which can be loud even through the double glazed windows. The area has limited restuarants other than big commercial companies like Planet Hollywood and TGI Fridays - we had to go a bit further to get more traditional, better value restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in February of 2004. We had a corner room and it was fantastic. Huge bed, big marble bathroom. The room was clean and we couldn't fault it. The hotel staff were very helpful, and the doorman were absolutely brilliant. When we go back we will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A couple of problems but worth staying at.”
Reviews.Author: Traveller113
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel. I have visited it twice and would strobgly recomend it. The location is the best, 20 second walk to times square which is brilliant for things like eating the cinema Virgin Mega store and of course most of teh theatre's. Not to mention a great Toys R Us. The first time I stayed was better than the second. Room 2107. Amazing view and nice room. The second time i was on the 42 floor and felt slightly out of it and the room was not quite as nice as teh other one. Also sadly the check in service was appauling the second time. Ruined the first day the girl was so rude. We complained and they gave a free meal in there fairly expensive hotel. I also complained when I got home as even though the meal was nice we felt upset about teh check in as she was really really rude. Anyway next time we go back they are upgrading us to a suite! I would still really recomend this hotel though but do advise if you have any problems with the hotel to ask to talk to the manager straight away.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel from Experienced NY traveller”
Reviews.Author: DM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good for many reasons. I have lived in NY and stayed in many NY hotels through the years including the Millenium broadway (not premiere)... 1. Great location...right at Times Square 2. Security was in the lobby every evening checking room keys 3. Rooms are nicely sized and clean 4. Bathrooms are very nice, clean and large 5. Price is right...I have gotten this hotel twice on priceline for $100 a night. The rack rate is usually about $200 and pretty reasonable for the quality and location. Hint...If you are looking for a nice and clean hotel for a little less money, try the Beacon Hotel, upper west side (I think on 75th and Broadway). Big rooms, clean, and fridge in the room etc...Hidden gem

Reviews.Title: “Great Time At The Milennium”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our annual Christmas shopping trip to New York City. We stayed at the Millennium Hotel Broadway thru priceline. Having worked in New York City and having stayed overnight at many hotels ranging from the Waldorf to the Plaza and in between, we were very pleased with the Millennium Hotel Broadway. First of all the location is ideal. Step outside the hotel and Time Square is to your right. To you left, you are within walking distance of the Diamond District, Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center, Saks, etc. Check-in was easy and efficient. Our room was on the 41st floor with a beautiful view (especially at night). The room was large and very clean. We used room service for breakfast each morning. Room service personnel were very nice. The food was very good. The lounge cozy. The lounge staff was friendly and efficient. Check-out went very smooth. The doormen were great. We had a really great experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It leaves a lot to be desired!”
Reviews.Author: Guestess
Reviews.Content: Our party reserved 5 rooms and there were quite a lot of problems. The location is fantastic, however too many problems existed to recommend this place. Upon check in, there was a used tray from room service on the floor outside one of our rooms.... and it was still on the floor the following afternoon-Yuck! The front desk couldn't tell us if our breakfasts were, or were not included in the price of the rooms. (They wanted $19 for a continental breakfast which was often bare and it took a half an hour to get an order of toast.) The rooms didn't have adequate lighting to read and the coffee included with the in-room machines were 2 measely single packs. Find a place where you can be treated like a guest, rather than an inmate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Broadway theater but that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend at the Millenium Boradway (11/19-21). The location is superb for theater-goers but other than that, there is nothing special about it. We had a reservation at the Millenium Premier next door but despite our long-standing reservation, the only available King room was on the third floor in smoking. So, we agreed to stay at the regular Millenium Broadway next door. Even though we were on a "renovated floor", the room was lackluster at best, although not too small. It was as if they tried to renovate but ran out of money so only some things got done. We were on the 47th floor and the urban view was incredible. I was also a bit concerned about the nonexistent security in the lobbby, anyone can just stroll right in and get in the elevators. I usually stay at the Le Parker Meridien and that is where I will be going back to from now on. The rooms arec very clean and modern, all hotel guests must show room keys when entering the hotel, and the location is prime, not nearly as crowded and crazy as Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in New York City!!!”
Reviews.Author: claudius1950
Reviews.Content: We read about THE MILLENNIUM BROADWAY on your site. We tend to be wary of New York hotels, as unless you pay a fancy price,you often get nasty surprises. We have been in some really rum ones in past visits. Weird people in the lobby, strangers skulking in corridors, and distressing noises from next door! We decided to try the M.Broadway in mid October 2004. We were there for a week,and was a real FIND. The location is BRILLIANT. The room on the 45th floor was great. Coffee in the king size bed in the morning, looking out over TIMES SQUARE through the floor to ceiling windows. What a treat. The room was quite big enough, and the bathroom fine. Piles of towels, and heaps of pillows. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, when we asked for a kingsize bed after the first night. They moved all our stuff whilst we were out. The restaurant CHARLOTTE is good,and service prompt. Criticisms...the carpets need replacing or cleaning, both in the rooms and passages. But considering the price we paid,it was a bargain. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and first rate service”
Reviews.Author: Doon
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 days, loved location, facillities excellent and staff very friendly and helpful. Strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, horrible room, stolen property”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a GREAT location. It's located in the middle of Times Square and is very convenient. Unfortunately, the rooms are HORRRIBLE. They are very small (not a surprise for NY). The bathroom was very dirty with mildew in the grout and peeling tiles. Moreover, we were in a non-smoking room but it still smelled of smoke. To top everything off, we accidentally left some jewerly outside of the safe and when we returned, it was GONE. The hotel refused to compensate us stating that they provided in-room safes. All in all, the hotel is in a great location however that's about it. I would NEVER stay at this hotel again, even with the great rate. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “December 2003”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in Dec 2003 for 4 nights,we really enjoyed it and the location was great. All the hotel staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Use at your own risk.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great location. However, the room has much to be desired. The bathroom has mold, faucets spray water when you turn them on, and were never properly cleaned by housekeeping. There were no face cloths or hand towels to use. We found partially used bars of soap from previous guests still there when we arrived. Duvets are polyester, and have no covers. Lamps are broken, and lightbulbs are burnt out. Generally, the service and hotel quality are poor and do not justify the cost at present. With much upgrading this could be a fabulous hotel. In the meantime, I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fair hotel”
Reviews.Author: M & C been there
Reviews.Content: Our visit to the Millenium Broadway was mixed. The location is great, the Hotel itself needs some work. We had to change rooms because the bed in our first room was worn out and tilted to one side. In the second room, the bed didn't lean, but wasn't much better than the first. The decor of the room was very much on par with the Howard Johnsons Motor Lodge on 8th Ave (dimly lit flourescent bulbs, an open front cut-out in the top dresser draw for the TV cable hook up, cheap bedding, etc), but was disappointing for a Millenium Hotel. The bulb was out in one of the bedside lamps, important in a room with little light. We were never given a key for the mini-bar in either room. The worst part, however, was returning to the room and discovering door to the room slightly ajar....not locked at all. To get into the room, all we had to do was "push". After a quick perusal, we realized that nothing was taken or even examined...the housekeeper, most likely, had forgotten to "pull the door shut" to insure that it was locked. In New York and Times Square that is unacceptable There are better properties to stay in and around Time Square.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I planned an entire trip around my ticket to "Chicago" on Sept. 5 and my stay at the Millenium was an added bonus. I arrived at the hotel around 1 pm and was given a room on the 26th floor. When I asked for an upper level room, Tony at the front desk (handsome and polite young man!) obliged and told me to come back at 4pm for my room. I left my bag with the bellhop and went shopping. I returned after 4pm and was quickly given my room key to my room on the 45th floor. Lovely! Room was large by NYC standards and so was the bathroom. Yes, the hotel still seems to be going under renovation as indicated by the hotel letter on the desk, but it was great. Great view, nice clean room, and great service. Room had TV, desk, chair, and two sitting chairs, large closet with ironing board and iron and safe, and bathroom was somewhat dated in appearance, but had plenty of counterspace and a hair dryer (someone previously mentioned no hair dryer, but there was one in this room). Windows do open slightly to the outside world and the windows make up the entire facing world out -- lots of light into the room. Furnishings, although in need of replacement sometime in the future, are still modern in appearance. Two phones in the room as well as high speed internet also available.
