Beds are comfortable as is room temperature. No mini bar in my room due to hotel renovations, but letter stated I could request goods be sent to room. Hotel has a theatre desk and a restaurant, neither of which I utilized, but did see others using. As a woman traveling by myself, I felt completely safe in this neighborhood and in this hotel. Security was ever present and they were actively asking people if they were staying at the hotel, checking in, etc. I definitely would consider staying here again mostly because of the fabulous service I received.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: planetclaire
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in July and were very impressed. Our bathroom was enormous, it included a bath tub and a separate shower that was one of the biggest I've ever seen in a hotel! The bed was king-size and extremely comfortable and we had a partial view of Times Square from our room. Although it was just steps away from some of New York's top attractions, the street noise was just a distant murmer. Overall, a fantastic hotel. You can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Visitors Beware”
Reviews.Author: mrbear
Reviews.Content: Had a nice stay at the Millennium Broadway at the end of February 2004. On a subsequent visit in July, could not believe the change in the property. Travelling with my aunt, who requires a handicapped room, we found both rooms in dreadful condition...dirty, tiles falling from the walls, water in the shower which would not drain properly and very tired looking furniture. The handicapped room was very poorly designed, and certainly did not make accessability any easier. Management was told repeatedly about the problems, but did not take any action to correct them. Also, be forewarned, the upper rooms at the hotel are undergoing a much-needed renovation. This was an extremely disappointing visit given my earlier experience. Amazing location, but pay a bit more money and stay at another hotel in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JulieCAtlanta_GA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millenium in June of '04 and loved it. The room was very spacious, the location was great, they checked room cards before allowing people into the elevator area to keep out non-guests. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millenium Broadway in late 2003, I would like to tell you that we were very pleased with our stay. This hotel is centrally located, near ABC television right near Good Morning America is filmed, which was kind of neat!! (typical tourist)!!! It is a metropolitan delight, the lobby is meticulously decortated modern, and the front desk personnel were courteous and down to earth. We were also on the 18th floor and our room was clean and modern and actually opted to spend most of our stay in the room to enjoy the movies on TV.!!! imagine in NY to stay in your room..... The gym is great and the highlight is Charlotte's bar and restaurant, they have delicious and hearty buffets as well as a tasty menu. The bar is also accented by jazz music and munchies. For us I would call this hotel a standard + hotel, we had a very good rate and left feeling like we accomplished what we came for. I highly reccommend it to people looking for quality, but not a ritz type. You will feel very refreshed.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An all round great experience. All the staff we came into contact with where very helpful and polite. We were given a room on the 41st floor looking across to the Chrysler Building and down onto Bryant Park. Whilst the furntiture is a little worn, the room was a good size and has huge windows and a big bathroom with shower over the bath. The air conditioning was effective and quiet. Being on 44th Street, it's well place for the first time tourist (as we were) who wants both the gallerys and Central Park to the north and the shopping and nightlife south of midtown.

Reviews.Title: “This is an exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: cathdav
Reviews.Content: The service, from the singing doorman to the front desk clerks, to the bellman was wonderful. It is an eclectic hotel in a great location. The rooms are roomy and it was a very enjoyable stay during the last week in May.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Millenium Broadway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Millenium Broadway for 5 nights and had wonderful service from all the staff. They attended to all our requests with the utmost of care. Would highly recomend this hotel, it is also in an excellent postion.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: travelismymiddename
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millenium May 23-25,'04 in room 1818. It was a corner room with a decent view. The location of this hotel is excellent since it is within walking distance to many places. Upon check-in we were greeted by a very friendly staff. They provided us with great information about the hotel and all it had to offer. Great Bell staff also. The room was standard and was a nice size, especially for NYC. It was very clean as was the bathroom. The bathroom was standard in design, no marble floors,one sink,glass shower,and had basic amenities. The room has an iron and ironing board and there was a hair dryer in the bathroom. Maid service was very good. We did not try the restaurant at the hotel since we had reservations at Nobu, which by the way was very good. They have a gift shop, gym, theater/concierge desk and require that you show your room key if you enter the hotel after a certain time for security purposes. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a good clean property, close to where the action is. If you are looking for upscale then this is NOT the place for you. For upscale, try the Ritz Carlton or the St. Regis instead. I would stay here again. We paid $152 through Priceline and would stay here again. They made no mention of Priceline at check-in which was very professional in my opinion. Thanks to the great staff at the Millenium for a being so kind and friendly. We'll be back!!!
